title: Disappointing Dimsum
review: We chose Minghin for dimsum because reviews were stellar. Unfortunately, it did NOT live up to the hype. The dimsum was ‚Äúokay‚Äù - fine but far from wow - and the service was lacking overall. The restaurant itself was tired and dingy. Go elsewhere.

title: Delicious and filling
review: Hot tea is always the way to start an evening of good food. Won ton soup was also hot and the pork was tasty. Liked the coating on the shrimp in the walnut shrimp. Shredded pork with udon noodles was good. The place is large and we were seated in an ample booth. The menu had many offerings we would have liked to try.

title: Order pizza
review: Cuisine? $300 of food picked up for a family get together on trip to Chicago. The best I can say is ehhh. Nothing and I mean nothing was memorable. And there were a couple of that was a mistake. I had such high expectations reading the reviews. I now wish we had ordered pizzas instead

title: favorite dimsum!!
review: came here with family and some big expectations from other friends who recommended this place. it did not disappoint!!!! everything was soooo good. if we hadn't been tied up we would have come back for dinner!! by the time we left, there was a huge line of people waiting for their number to be called so we had gotten there at a good time. this place is going to be a regular stop for me from now on

title: Good dim sum and the restaurant was not a hole in the wall
review: Highly recommend the dim sum. Comes out nice and fresh. I like the concept that the food is made to order and not sitting on a cart. Ordered several items on the dim sum menu as well as the lunch menu. The ribs could be better but they were still decent. Everything else was great

title: Chinese in Chicago's Chinatown
review: We arrived at MingHin on a Friday around 8:30 pm without a reservation. Our wait was only 15 minutes for a table. This location of MingHim did not have outdoor seating. The waiter was very helplful with our order, so we did not have to use the pad to place our order. For the two of us, we ordered 4 dim sum dishes and one order of steamed vegetables and enjoyed all of the food. We probably should have ordered one more dim sum. Food came quickly and was very hot. The wine was not of great quality. Compared to the NYC area, this was a $$ place, not $$$. It was nice that the majority of diners were Asian. We would return to MingHin on our next trip to Chicago.

title: In search of the Best of Oriental Cusine.
review: I have a dear friend who I connected with early on because of our love for Oriental Food... particularly Hot and Sour Soup! I know, odd pairing right??? We have traveled and sampled Oriental Food far and wide on every opportunity that we can. Our latest adventure was into the famed China Town District of Chicago. The area came highly touted and didn't disappoint. Our recent trip was a little over two hours from our homes in Wisconsin to MingHin Cuisine on Archer Avenue, in Chicago. We read dozens of positive reviews before coming and were prepared to expect excellence! We started with a lovely cucumber salad, potstickers and seafood hot and sour soup. WOW!!! The cucumber salad was amazing and the flavors of the dressing was steeped in garlic and wonderfully flavored oil. The potstickers were perfectly formed and steamed, stuffed with a savory sausage. The sauces were amazing! The sea food hot and sour soup was the finest. The broth was rich in flavor, but as we explored each ingredient in the soup the flavors burst forward onto the pallet! The taste was extraordinary by any standards.Our entrees included crispy fish, onions and green peppers in a red sweet and spicy sauce - not unlike sweet and sour. This was delicious. We also ordered a combination fried rice, with beef, chicken and pork, as well as an order of shrimp with garlic lobster sauce. Both of these dishes we were able to add vegetables or our choice - a very nice option for those who love to enhance their favorite dishes with specific veggies! We truly appreciate that flexibility of a chef and kitchen with their recipes! All in all, this was the finest of dining experiences and we will return with guests as soon as our schedule allows. Bravo, MingHin Cuisine!!!

title: Great Chinese Restaurant
review: Have been ordering take-out from one of our favorite local restaurants for months, so getting back there to eat in was great. Service is efficient, food is delicious as were some well mixed gin martinis. Reasonable pricing with high-quality food is a great combination for your dining consideration. Check it out!

title: Dimsum place in Chicago
review: Quick serving, friendly stuff, delicious food, good pricing - everything I like. This was my 2nd time. I think this time food was better.

title: Good Dimsum but a bit expensive
review: Good dimsum but a lit too expensive.  Small is $4.45, Medium $4.95, Large $5.45 and Special is $7.25.  There are plenty of selections.  The place is nicely decorated.  Service was good.  Food is authentiic Chinese dimsum.

title: Good food. I ate at their E Ohio Street location.
review: Wide variety of choices on the menu and willing to go off script for a special request. As a vegetarian, I wanted Kung Pao Tofu, no problem said the waiter and the result was delicious. My companions had a variety of dishes and enjoyed them...More

title: Good food
review: We were a table of seven of us on vacation and we booked a table ahead of time. I was glad to arrive early because in a matter of minutes , the place got packed. It can get very loud in there. The service was...More

title: Best Chinese I have had in
review: Best Chinese I have had in Chicago.    The setting is great views of the park and high rises.  Pork rolls can‚Äôt be beat.  Pot stickers plentiful and delicious. I had the salt and pepper soft shells and was very happy with meal.  Large portions, very...More

title: Great Chinese for Variety and Price
review: This is a classic Chinatown-type restaurant that has a massive menu, but delivers.  Good sized portions at great prices.  Food was tasty.  Lots to bring home afterwards.  Recommend the salt & pepper fish.

title: A Sunday lunch not far from our hotel.
review: Barbecued pork with udon noodles was delicious. Caesar had oxtail with onions and white rice. We ordered 3 pork bake buns.

title: Delicious Asian cuisine
review: Delicious Asian cuisine for lunch! We enjoyed the orange chicken, green beans, a noodle dish, veggie fried rice, plus some dumplings that are all repeats!

title: Great food
review: Love it. The amazing variety of food was great! I ordered to much and took alot with me because I was full! The service was good, everyone helpful, and the tea they bring at the beginning was delicious!

title: Went to three locations of
review: Went to three locations of MingHin. The menu are exactly the same, great variety of Chinese food, authentic dim sum you can‚Äôt miss. The one on downtown is always full and has the best service. The ones at chinatown and the other near airport have...More

title: Ok
review: Still looking for gourmet Chinese in this town; MH's processed chicken with bland sauce (despite pieces of ginger) doesn't cut it, though the eggplant in the udon dish was perfectly cooked to melt in your mouth (noodles too greasy). Average potstickers. The Michelin recommendation is...More

title: A little factory-like
review: We spent an evening in Chinatown with friends, checking-out various places. Our friend had made a dinner reservation at MingHin, having read about it. We had an average experience.The food was a mixed bag. The menu featured a very wide range of choices, most of which were familiar Chinese-American classics. Portion sizes were very large and easy to share. Flavors were okay, but unremarkable; it was not better than most other Chinese places we have tried. A couple of items were disappointing, especially the egg rolls, which were greasy and soft rather than crunchy.The establishment had a factor-like atmosphere. It's a huge establishment with lots of tables on two levels. Large trays of food were constantly whizzing by. Staff took orders on tablets. Service was entirely functional, rather than personal--basically, "what do you want so I can type it into my iPad," without any follow-up visits as to how everything tasted, etc. It got the job done, but you can get equally good food and a better atmosphere and service at other establishments.I would not refuse to return, but would also look elsewhere on my next visit to the area.

title: Great Dim Sum
review: Great Dim Sum, really enjoyed all the food. It is clearly popular by the amount of people going there. Also, very cheap considering what you get. Will be back next time in the area!

title: Too tired of a location.
review: I was really disappointed last visit. The staff rushed us and the food too greasy. The egg rolls were a sack of grease. We really hoped for a traditional" Chinatown" experience. The place needs a face lift. We noticed some of the furniture held together with scotch tape. Just not good.

title: Great food. Excellent serve
review: Great food. Excellent serve and quick. If you like family style service this is the place to go in Chinatown.

title: Great Dim Sum, lots of locals...
review: Great Dim Sum. Huge portions if you order from regular menu. Well seasoned Took water taxi to Chinatown from Downtown.

title: Good dim sum but not the best
review: Little disappointed in the dim sum because others had ranked it so highly. Served daily from 9-4, you order off a dim sum menu (not brought around on carts). Thought some of the dishes were better than others. Biggest disappointment was the potstickers, which were greasy and oily. Did like the beef spare rib and the sponge cake for dessert.Very reasonably priced and two can eat here for less than $30. Got here the Friday morning after Thanksgiving around 11 and got right in. By the time we left at noon, the line was almost out the door, so if coming on a weekend, may want to get here early. Located in the Chinatown mall on the far Southwest side of the mall.

title: Great place for Dimsum both eat in & to go!
review: It‚Äôs very pleasant & satisfying for the quality of food, the service. Great place to have Dimsum, various of delicious food. I ordered delivery it‚Äôs much faster than I expected. Thank you for your excellent service !!! Highly recommended & would love to be back!

title: Good place for dim sum
review: my friends wanted to eat dim sum and according to the reviews, this was the best place to get dim sum in Chicago. The restaurant was extremely large and spacious and can accommodate many large crowds.We were given both a menu and tablet but weren't really explained what was going on - we asked and were explained how to order and how to select the options we wanted. The portions are like tapas so you can get as many or little number of plates as you like - the dim sum and other items were good while the chinese noodles were terrible

title: Very good dim sum and great dinner menu
review: Very good dim sum and dinner menu also have lots oif varieties. Great service and prompt. Howerver, it is very busy during lunch time particularly on weekends, may ave 45 to 60 minutes waiting. The BBQ dishes are fantastic.

title: Modern twist on authentic Chinese
review: Food was delicious, portions a little small so no leftovers. Food was very very hot when served!! Everone was very polite!

title: BAD BAD BAD
review: I will never return! The food looks great, but tastes absolutely AWFUL! It all had a very potent, indescribable taste. Perhaps like fish? Oysters? What ever oil it is that they cook their food in is disgusting. Everything came out at random times, not together...More

title: Good Place for Chinese Treats
review: Good restaurant, the taste was different than what we are used to, but the food was definitely well prepared and many Locals eating there, so that supplement any of my opinions... They could have the entrance a little more appealing and cleaned... Buen Provecho!!

title: Awesome chinese restaurant
review: Best dumplings! very big place so no need to wait for long, very good authentic chinese dishes. Dumplings were amazing!

title: Impressed

title: OK food. Service was great
review: I took my family on a long weekend 2 Chicago. We visited Chinatown. We wanted some Dim Sum. Service was excellent. The food was average.

title: Surprisingly good

review: Had dinner here with the family. We must of ordered over 12 different dishes, between dim sum, appetizers, soups and mains. Some where good and some were flavorless and greasy. None where excellent. Not a bad place, especially for dim sum. The staff is attentive...More

title: Best of Chicago
review: My son and I went here on a recommendation. We were not disappointed. Easy ordering, Wonton, skewers and rangoons are fresh hot and fast. Food was very fresh, very reasonably priced and the place is clean and classy. Our server was polite and hustled to...More

title: Authentic dim sum
review: Situated at Chinatown this restaurant serves up authentic dim sum. Great tasting and good portions. Price is mid to high dependent what is being ordered. Service is quick and descent.

review: I think we should all address cleanness in our restaurant reviews. The table showed rag marks all over it and the bathroom was not up to par. Some might say we have high exceptions for a clean eatery place but this is not for us.

review: We had the dim-sum for lunch and most of the food we ordered were good except for their fish congee. It was bland.

review: I was in a hurry to the airport and only took a quick take away. The food was good and nicely packed. While waiting I noticed that the restaurant looked nice inside and the service was friendly.

title: Dim sum? Dim yum.
review: The food here was wonderful! It had a lot of fast service and tasty food. I loved the meat dishes a lot. Service was quick and easy although located in a secluded spot, it was very crowded but nonetheless had good service

title: Great Chinese food
review: Open from 8am to 2am 365 days a year   Excellent food.   Service good and fairly clean.   Hong Kong lobster yummy

review: We went o visit MingHin Cuisine before the Robert Plant concert. It was very close to Millennium Park and the concert venue. The service was  very attentive and the food excellent. I highly recommend stopping in when near the park.

title: Dim Sum
review: As soon as we got our rental car I knew where we were driving to first, Chinatown  for Dim Sum. Everything was delicious except for the Pork Sui Mai, which was bland... no taste.

title: Outstanding Dim Sum
review: Pop'd in for a late night snack/meal on the small side and had an assortment of Dim Sum. Speedy service, excellent food and reasonably priced. Despite their recent expansion to having opened more locations, the quality's still there.

title: Delicious Dim Sum
review: Very Nice restaurant, clean and the DIM sum was fresh.   The wait staff could be more helpful when ordering but they once ordered, they were very efficient and attentive.

title: It was good
review: This place was originally from chinatown. And it got famous, anf has many branches now. This one is recently opened. Nice place for dimsum. Dimsum stuffed with shrimp is nice and fish fried rice was tasty

title: Dim Sum Delight

title: Excellent dimsum
review: Came in early before the lunch crowd arrived. We were given some nuts while waiting. We ordered some dimsum, which were really delicious. Service was also good.

title: Excellent
review: The food was excellent.  large portions.  The green tea was nice. Customer service was good. Relatively timely

title: Excellent!

review: The food was good and plentiful.  The vegetables were cooked the right amount to still have some crunch to them. The sauces were tasty.  The egg rolls had good flavor. Overall a good experience.

title: Better than expected

title: Awesome

review: This place has a very good variety of foods. I had the spicy beef and noodle soup and the Mongolian beef. Fast service and hot food. Place is small but room for 50 people. And it's open late!!!

title: Great place for a family to enjoy dim sum!

title: Good Food and Good services
review: We took the water taxi from Michigan Avenue to Chinatown. We ordered shrimp Dim Sum and chicken buns. The food was delicious. The services were excellent. The decorations were beautiful.

title: Fun night out
review: This was a fun spot, something different to do. The food was really good and it was fun to order with on a tablet instead of with a paper menu. Portion sizes were very large, service was very nice.

title: Real Chinese cuisine in what looks like a real Chinese location
review: in MingHin they manage to mix the Chinese gastronomy with the western taste. ambiance is nice. good service. favored by local Chinese people (goes to show authenticity). prices are moderately reasonable.

title: Dont miss this

title: Very good!!
review: We all loved this restaurant!  The food was fresh, warm and amazing!  The service was outstanding and I loved the large dinner table with the big lazy susan!

title: Very good Chinese dimsum and dinner
review: Traditional Cantonese food. As a Chinese, I'd say some food here are better than in China. If you want to try real Chinese food, here is the one.  Shrimp dumplings, baked BBQ pork Bao, BBQ ducks, beef chow fun, boneless salty chicken, and more items.

title: Really disappointed
review: For a restaraunt that had such good reviews, think the meal was  something that might be  found in a third tier midwestern town,  not Chicago.

title: Late evening dinner.
review: We ventured out for a Chinatown meaL The servers were friendly. The food was delicious. Go with a big appetite in order to sample many choices from a big menu.

title: Delicious dim sum!
review: Service was good.  Had our table ready.  We tried several dim sum dishes. Har gow.  Siu mai.  Naw mai fan.  White rice noodles.  Egg tarts.  All were tasty.

review: We stopped for lunch. The waiters were not interested. We received food in price meal one dish at a time.  They forgot one dish.  The food did not taste good.

title: All I can say is WOW!!!
review: We went here for Dim Sum on a Saturday morning. We made reservations and they had a place waiting for us. The Dim Sum menu is a checklist of pictures and you just mark what you want and how many. Everything we had was so...More

title: Authentic Cantonese dishes

title: Dim Sum, some of the best

title: Great Chinese Food
review: We loved the food! I first visited with a friend last August and have taken my whole family back several times. The food is very fresh and tastefully seasoned. The wait staff is friendly and very helpful when ordering.

title: Sunday visit
review: Different restaurant/cousin to visit. Cheap food despite the fancy furniture. Chinatown located restaurant.

title: Delicious
review: The restaurant is in a non-descript strip mall, easy to miss.  However, the place is spacious, the food is great and the service is attentive.  Will be back!

title: Good service and flavorful food
review: The food was very flavorful, the portion was huge. Quite a few adventurous menu options.  Fitting decor. Good and fast service too.

title: Amazingly great food!

title: Pretty Authentic
review: This is a pretty authentic restaurant, with some authentic chinese options. I've had anything from chicken feet to a sweet tofu soup for breakfast there, and anything in between. I really enjoy their egg tarts. The atmosphere is good and the food is tasty.

title: Lunch
review: Wonderful place. Quality food. Nice price. Honest. Try the shrimp dumplings and the saketini. Wonderful combination.

title: Lunch for Three for Dim Sum

title: Incredible dim sum, incredible prices, fast service, clean, a true winner

title: Dim Yum!!!

title: Great Dim Sum restaurant, fair prices!

title: Not what I expected, but in a good way

title: Favorite Dimsum/Yamcha place in Chicago
review: Minghin has the Chinatown location and the Lake Shore East location right above Millennium Park. Combined, I probably visited Minghin two dozen times last year. It's my favorite Chinese especially dimsum place in all of Chicago.

title: About As Good As You'll Find On This Side Of The Pacific Ocean

title: Decent Chinese Food
review: I have eaten there several times on different trips. The food, in general, is good but some dishes are only fair compared to other authentic Chinese restaurants. I recently went for a family banquet and the management was all confused about a previously personally arranged...More

title: good dim sum, no carts, big traditional place
review: they get crowded, Chinatown seems to be more crowded then it did years ago.  Many restaurants, but not many serving dim sum.  Even though they don't have the carts, they still draw big crowds to the place in the mall.  service is good.  estimated wait...More

title: Authentic Chinese Food
review: Not your typical Chinese restaurant, this is the real thing!! They bring out the whole fish. It's a little weird but good!

title: Great delivery!
review: I always order in chinese while travelling, and find it can vary quite widely.   MingHin, however, is among the best.  Very easy to order online, very affordable, quick delivery and really good food.    This is a place I will definitely order from again!

title: Very clean restaurant
review: Many of the Chinese restaurants are not very clean, but this is very nice.  Servers are friendly and they all spoke English well.  Instead of picking up from a cart, we ordered from the menu and they were served.  I have been to several other...More

title: Traveler
review: The was surprisingly very good. I say this because I wasn't sure what to expect from Chicago Chinese dim sum. It very nice to find a very good dim sum restaurant with esquisite Chinese cuisine flavors in Chicago. Great job.

title: Good Dim Sum

title: New Chinese

title: Dim sum heaven
review: Chicago is lucky to have that restaurant!!! The steam bbq pork buns are the bomb, sui-mais are on point etc...if you enjoy dim sum MingHin is a must, period.

title: Great food, good service and clean place
review: MingHin is a great restaurant, excellent food, very authentic with great flavors. The service is outstanding and the place is very clean. It feels great to go there and enjoy the great food!

title: Good place for dim sum
review: Chinatown is very interesting in Chicago - a bit out of the main city hub and a very intimate community. It was really nice to go out for dim sum on the weekend, it is very good Chinese comfort food.

title: Nothing special
review: I do not knot how this restaurant could be 200+ from 7000+ in chicago... we had dim sums, lobster nad beef brocolli but all food was disappointing. I've to China many times and this is a parody of chinese food... :(

title: Sticky rice was fishy!
review: 4 of us went here for lunch, the udon noodles and rice noodles were awesome, the sticky rice was VERY fishy...... but maybe it's supposed to be?

title: Great dimsum
review: This is the best restaurant dimsum I've tried. The line was so long that even we came there in a rainy day, we waited for 40 minutes to be served. However, it's worth waiting there, I love coming there once I come back Chicago.

title: Wow! Great Chinese Food
review: I have been so unhappy as all Chinese food was starting to taste like Panda Express. This was some great food. Four of us visiting Chicago wanted Chinese while in town and we found Resturant on TripAdvisor. Way to go!.

title: Fresh
review: Stopped in with gf and grandmother for a late lunch. If u want authentic Chinese then go hear. Recommend the chicken legs chow mein and crab Rangoon. Would go back when in town.

title: Dim sum supreme
review: A definite go to place for dim sum but be sure to make a reservation and aim to get there early (11ish) or its a zoo to get seated.  Everything is fresh and quick to the table.  BBQ pork buns particularly amazing

title: Upscale surroundings with affordable good Chinese food
review: I was pleasantly surprised with this Chinese restaurant downtown. Really good, affordable food in an upscale atmosphere (compared to Chinatown restaurants). Excellent dim sum and main dishes. A little hard to find but worth it.

title: Authentic Chinese food
review: The food here is not like what is served at suburban Chinese buffets! Everything our party of four ordered was all new to me. Very good! The place was packed but service was excellent and quick. The majority of patrons were Chinese, which speaks well...More

title: Best DimSum in Chicago
review: Minghin Cuisine presents a uniquely upscale yet more-than-reasonably priced Sunday DimSum in the heart of Chicago's Chinatown. This restaurant is in the Chinatown mall on Archer Avenue, walking distance from the elevated train. Within the mall area, there is ample paid parking via City parking...More

title: Not for vegetarians
review: I must stay that I expected more of this place. The food was ok, even ok plus. Nothing special though. The restaurant itself is very simple and not sparkling clean. The most difficult it was to find what to eat for us vegetarians. Even shrimp...More

title: grd9141
review: A great place to eat lunch and enjoy some good food. Great service and very helpful in explaining the food.

title: Lunchtime in Chinatown

title: Great dim sum
review: Wanted to try a dim sum place.  Liked the fact you ordered off a menu so you could know what you were getting.  We are adventurous but like to see what we are eating!  Ordered about 7/8 dim sum plates for family of 4 and...More

title: Don't be fooled by the outside!

title: Average food but relatively hygienic in Chinatown
review: Been here a couple of times although I arrived in Chicago a month ago. A friend of mine claimed that this might be the most hygienic one in Chinatown. I would definitely recommend going, but it is definitely not the one with best flavour.

title: Surprisingly good Chinese food
review: It was right on a prominent spot in China Town, and one could see the signage from a distance especially in the evening when the neon-light board was switch on.   We went there for dinner with a group of 17. We arrived a bit late...More

title: Fast and friendly service and tasty food
review: Dined here solo the night before Chicago marathon. Despite a huge party of around 6 tables of 6 diners also eating the food came pretty quickly and was very tasty. Good portions and I was offed extra rice had I wanted it- just what I...More

title: Dim Sum Hot Spot

title: Dim sum as good as we've had

review: Although it's a full menu restaurant, we came here for a late lunch of dim sun (served from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm).  We started with very good hot and sour soup full of delicious veggies and tofu.  It was not the usual sour, though....More

title: Fell (way) short of expectationa

title: It was hot in there
review: We were there on Sunday afternoon in the HEAT of July. The line moved super quick but the interior never cooled. The food and service were good. Great and easy dim sum experience.

title: Food just ok.   Service extremely slow.
review: Food was just ok.   Our service was really slow.   Had to ask several times about delay in getting our food.    Won't be returning.

title: Fun place good food

title: One of the best Chinese meals I've ever had
review: Had not been to Chinatown in many years and friends recommended this restaurant. Our experience was fantastic. Not only was the quality of the food superb, but the service and attention from the staff was really good. I must return next time I visit Chicago.

title: Great authentic food
review: The entrance to the restaurant does not look good, but do  not judge book by the cover ! It is very nice modern interior. The service and food were great!!! If you  like authentic Chinese food, this restaurant has some to offer !   The dishes...More

title: Go HERE for dim sum!

title: Dinner for 2 after arriving from UK
review: Food was OK but not spectacular, staff were friendly and very attentive and this would be a good value for money restaurant

title: Maybe it is our lack of dim sum experience....
review: But we did not think it was that great compared to the dim sum we had in Boston's Chinatown. The service was pretty non-existant, but the server did tell us a few things not to get - not sure if it was wise to follow...More

title: Great food
review: Meal was greAt ! It is a bit of a wait but it is worth it .  Good service for a reasonable price . The BBQ pork turn overs were my absolute favorite !

title: Cantonese
review: Voice navigation got us there. Its amazing how easy it is to get there. Parking is $2.00 an hour. If you understand Dim sum i recommend it. Otherwise F.Y.I. 1 order from the very Large picture menu will feed 2. I love all Cantonese...if you...More

title: Perfect. Just perfect.

title: Great food

title: Good food

title: Good Food and Friendly Server, But...

title: Make a reservation
review: Great place in Chinatown for Dim sum. The service was good and fast. We had a business lunch which and the service was not inhibitive to the discussion. Food quality, quantity, and taste were very good.

title: Big & slow

title: Ok place
review: Ok place. Seated us on time of reservation. Friendly staff. Plenty of space. Quick service. Average tasting dim sum. Having said that, the place was packed with smiling customers.

title: Excellent Chinese Food
review: We visited this restaurant based on online reviews and was extremely surprised with the authenticity of the food. The dimsums were superb and reminded me of the best Chinese restaurants in Singapore. Food was reasonably priced considering Chicago is expensive. Shall recommend strongly.

title: Excellent Dim Sum

title: Very Good Dim Sum Dishes

title: Good food, nice decor and smell delicious

title: Consider other options

title: Authentic Chinese food

title: Delicious gem!

title: Fantastic Chinese Food!!!
review: What a great experience. The food was fabulous. the jasmine tea was superb. And the waiter we had was perfect - so polite and attentive. This is my new "go to" spot for Chinatown in Chicago. Wow!

title: Good dim sum fix
review: Have been here 3-4 times and have never been disappointed. The food and service is great. No carts, just pictures and short descriptions of the dishes to put checks next to. The seaweed rolls were a big hit with our group.

title: Excellent Dim Sum

title: Not the Usual Rice Bowl

title: Very busy restaurant
review: My husband made reservations, so we could take the seats, or so many people was waiting. Taste is good, but not the best. They don't bring DimSum on the wagon. We order by the menu.

title: MingHin Cuisine on Benton, Not Chinatown

title: No luck Peking Duck.
review: Still looking for a place that rivals Phoenix for Peking Duck. This isn't the place. The shrimp with walnuts was very good. Haphazard team approach service. Wouldn't return.

title: Spectacular dumplings/potstickers!
review: We got the dumplings as an appetizer and didn't think anything of them, but when they arrived we were shocked by the quantity (6 large dumplings) and the taste (spectacular!). I also had the ox tail soup which was also amazing

title: 100% CHINESE FOOD.

title: Very Good Food, but no Dim Sum?!

title: Fantastic dim sum!

title: Yummy tummy
review: If ever your in the mood for dimsum this is the place to be... MingHin cuisine in china town vis the red line. Great food, nice staff opens at 9am and reasonable price.

title: Go hungry, leave happy!

title: Great Dim Sum

title: Great Dim Sum, Decent Service, Not the cleanest place

review: When the tripe comes with not a tiny whiff of that offal taste you know the cooks know what they are doing. The turnip cake was a little different from the usual but the rest of the dm sum was done very well. Had the...More

title: Thumb up for banquet food!

title: Nice place

title: It was alright....
review: We chose to eat at this restaurant because of all the good reviews.  We tried about 10 dishes and none of them were fantastic.  Most everything we tried was average.  The shrimp rolls were the best thing we had.  We had 5 people and everyone...More

title: Best Cantonese style dim sum in Chicago
review: Best place to get Cantonese style dim sum in Chicago.  Food is authentic and good.  The restaurant is tastefully decorated and clean.  Recommend!

title: Bueno

title: Authentic Dim Sum in Chicago's Chinatown....

title: Worth the trip
review: Wanted to get to Chintatown in Chicago and finally made time.  Wanted some good dim sum.  This place did not disappoint!  Service was quick and food was excellent.  As close to being in China that I have had in USA.  Take the time to go!

title: Classy sit down place in heart of Chicago Chinatown
review: Have come here several times with colleagues and friends. Indeed a nice sit down place with plenty of delicacies. Recommend the bbq pork bun for starters.the chicken feet and short rib with pepper sauce is also good.

title: Loved the Dim Sum!
review: I went with family and the dim sum was so good! There was much more served compared to other places and it's such a nice environment. Definitely recommend anyone to go to try this place out if they're in Chicago!

title: Good dim sum, good price

title: Not the best Chinese food
review: I chose this restaurant because of Tripadvisor,  The technique of cooking was good but the ingredients were sub-standard.  The seafood had no taste.  The fried chicken we ordered was very dry and without any chicken taste. If the ingredients were fresh, I am sure it...More

title: Weekday fresh dim sum
review: Stop by after a trade show at McCormick, surprise to see at 130 pm on a weekday this place is busy serving dim sum with lots of local patrons. Picture menu easy to order and service is quick. Large restaurant with paid city parking meter....More

title: Like Dim Sum? This is the place to go.
review: Dim Sums are well prepared. Service is fast. This is 1 of good place to eat dim sums in Chicago Chinatown. The other dim sum place in Chinatown is Dolo Restaurant, 2222 S Archer Ave, Chicago, IL 60616.

title: Great Chinese Food & Cheap Price
review: Very cool & great Chinese restaurant when in Chinatown! Cheap prices as well, I highly recommend checking them out if you are near by.

title: Decent food at bargain prices
review: This Chinatown restaurant was bustling on a Saturday night.  The interior is clean and inviting, and the picture menu looks appealing.  I am a fan of genuine Chinese food.  However, the dishes at this restaurant only approximate the true flavors and quality of real Chinese...More

title: Great dim sum
review: excellent dim sum. not Americanized food. great taste as in hong kong. try also the congee. inexpensive as well.

title: Good dim sum, not so good dinner
review: I had a great experience at dim sum. Good food and service. I can't say the same at dinner on a Sunday night. Loud. Plates clanking and crashing, hurried service. Plastic table cloth. May go back for dim sum, but never for dinner.

title: Dim sum in Chicago Chinatown.

title: Unique dim sum
review: This restaurant is very clean and nicely decorated. We liked that it has some unique dim sum items added to the usual ones. We liked one dim sum pastry with corn.

title: Won't go Back
review: Maybe I just have an uneducated, Americanized palate, but I was extremely underwhelmed by almost everything. The regular pot-stickers were "out" so the manager suggested we order the dim-sum fried pot-stickers, which were very flavorful and actually pretty large. But they were also 2x the...More

title: Marvelous
review: My dreams came true. I use to live in London for two years. And I use to eat chinese 4 times a week. (I'm not a chinese person:) after London I tried several places in Turkey, in NY, in Miami but this is the best...More

title: Very, Very Good
review: The front pages of the menu were not enticing but further back we found familiar dishes. It was delicious. Best fried rice ever.

title: Bright, busy, and tasty

title: Great Dim Sum

title: Good dim sum
review: This restaurant offers good and authentic dim sum. Not great ambiance but ok in the Chinatown sort of way. Service is ok.

review: My bestie in Portland introduced me to Dim Sum. In Portland it is everywhere...not so much in the Midwest. MingHin had INCREDIBLE pork/shrimp shumei! The best I have ever had actually! Well worth the trip to Chicago's Chinatown! Service is slow...but still so worth it!

review: There is only one drawback to this impressive immersion into Dim Sum.  That is really not the fault of the place, but trying to find a place to park is almost impossible.  Once you are past this daunting hurdle, the wait for a table is...More

title: Good service and dim sum
review: Went here for dim sum one early Friday. It was not busy but very good service and very good dim sum. Plain and simple! Yumyum

title: best dimsum
review: This is definitely my favorite Chinese restaurant in Chicago.  My family and I came here on a Sunday morning for Dimsum and the place was packed (as expected).  We ordered the salted egg yolk bun, the Macau style crispy pork belly, shrimp Crepe,  Siu mail,...More

title: Best Dim Sum!
review: My mother and I visited the MingHin this weekend. We ordered the duck, spareribs, Chinese broccoli, Rice Noodles with Beef, and Mango Pudding. All were excellent choices at this great restaurant. I would highly recommend taking a swing through Chinatown to experience this restaurant!

title: Loved the dim sum!
review: We really enjoyed our lunch here. Ordered tons of dumplings, buns, etc and paid very little if we compare how much food we ordered.   Service was fast and good. We also felt we were eating at the right place, as many Chinese families were eating...More

title: Great dim sum
review: Came here for dim sum before we left Chicago, it was great that they are open early. We ordered small assortment of dim sum (shrimp dumpling, bean curd roll, congee and shrimp rolls). All fresh and made to order. In a way it's better than...More

title: Nice Place for a Casual Lunch/Dinner
review: MingHis is probably the busiest restaurant in Chicago Chinatown right now. It is big, clean, and well decorated restaurant in Chinese Restaurant standards. I have visited this place at least 5 times. Their Dim-Sums are nice but not the best. The price is reasonable. When...More

title: not a professional restaurant providing dim sum menu
review: We went there for trying their dim sum. The restaurant has very good interior design, but the dining experience was not good. First of all, the whole restaurant was hot like no air conditioning. Asked for it but no way to make it cool. Also,...More

title: Great Dim Sum
review: We came here because of the excellent reviews and we were happy with our experience. The dim sum arrived quick and hot. The service was quick and polite. The only thing I didn't like was the Macau-style pork belly just tasted...off. Everything else was great...More

title: Our 2nd Dim Sum Experience
review: I was very excited to be able to check out Dim Sum in Chinatown this last weekend.  We began our day at Phoenix, which was very good.(and had an incredible view of the skyline.)  We made reservations for lunch here ... and I'm glad we...More

title: Dim Sum Yum
review: We came here as our last stop before leaving Chicago for home.  The wait for Saturday afternoon for 2 people was not too bad.  I think we waited like 15 minutes.  We've never been here before so when we were finally seated we were given...More

title: Ummmmm..........., yummy!
review: This was a great place we happened upon for my birthday dinner. Very clean!  The menu was extensive, exotic, and affordable. We ordered a few appetizers; chicken on a stick, egg rolls, lamb on a stick....all delicious. My husband ordered the beef chow me in,...More

title: Nice Restaurant!
review: We had dinner there one night and was completely satisfied so we came back the next day for their dim sum!  Very good!  But not the traditional push cart dim sum!  But quality and quantity was very good!

title: Arguably my best cantonese meal ever!
review: We went as a party of six. Little did we understand our waiters, or have they understood us! We chose using pictures of the food. Which was simply great, and also of great value. Highly recommended!

title: Best Dim Sum
review: Wow - from 8am on they have a great selection of dim sum - everything we had was super tasty: baked BBQ pork buns; short rid with honey sauce; vegetable crepe; pan-fried green chive cake. Would recommend highly. Full menu starts at 10am!

title: MingHin has ruined all other dim sum for me- the best!
review: I'm so happy that we chose MingHin- the dim sum is so good we went twice in three days.  Everything is perfectly prepared, nothing is too sweet or spicy or salty.  The service is decent.  I liked ordering off a menu instead of carts as...More

title: Very good dim sum
review: It is Hong Kong style so not too spicy. Excellent selection very freshly made. When we were there the place was full of Chinese families, always a good sign. And if you like dim sum for breakfast (as I do) the place opens at 8AM.

title: Not my cup of tea
review: We came here thinking it was traditional dim sum, where they just bring you food to see if you want it, but we had to order ourselves. It was very difficult, and we learned that just because it says fish, it still probably has sausage...More

title: Delicious
review: Very good Chinese food in china town square. Lemon chicken a must, fried rice so good. Great experience. Staff not so friendly but the service was fast and food was good

title: Upscale Chinese restaurant with reasonable price
review: As Chinese restaurants go this is one you can take your business clients as well as those you want to impress. It reminds me of upscale restaurants in Hong Kong and China. The decor is chic with excellent lighting and layout. The restaurant is quite...More

title: Dim sum heaven
review: Having lived in California, this Chicago joint won't disappoint you. Nicely decorated interior, clean tables, adequate staffs, and super yummy food.  I will return. Tips: it's hard to find parking , take CTA train instead

title: Good first-time dimsum experience despite the Mother's Day rush
review: Fully aware that restaurants would be busy on this occasion, we waited patiently to get a table.  While waiting, we perused the dimsum menu displayed in pictures wherein we focused on steamed items.  This was also the first time my friends would have dimsum for...More

title: My fault
review: I am going to be very honest. My experience at this restaurant was mixed.  Service was OUTSTANDING, every single member of the staff that we had contact with greeted us with a smile, maybe 5 or 6 different persons asked us if we needed something,...More

title: HoHumm
review: Went to MingHin last Saturday at 2:30 PM. Sadly not impressed. Beef balls were terrible. Many dishes tasted remarkably similar. Sticky rice smelled like fish. Custard in phyllo dough was greasy. Pot stickers were average. Rice pancake was slimey. There was no strainer for the...More

title: Hooray for chicken feet!  Dim sum yum
review: This is my second time coming to MingHin.  One of my favorite things is that if you give them your selections when you sit down, you're pretty much guaranteed food in the first 5min.  Some of my faves: Chicken feet (duh, see title of review)...More

title: Dim Sum for breakfast
review: Must Have: -Pork Belly  -Creamy Egg Yolk Bun -Egg Custard  I have looked up chinese food from grubhub and ordered a couple of times from Minghin for dinner. However, I was originally intrigued of their dim sum selections. So finally this Saturday we made time...More

title: Best DimSum
review: I've had DimSum in a couple of Chinese restaurants and while I think it's fun I wasn't too excited when my friends picked DimSum to mark a special occasion. Until I saw the place and ate the food. It is really great! Fantastic. The staff...More

title: Really good dim sum
review: We went there with our adult daughter for dim sum early on a Sunday afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed it.  While we needed to wait a bit (and the waiting time seemed to get longer as we were waiting), it wasn't too long.  The dim sum...More

title: Great place for dim sum especially if you're not Chinese
review: This is a place in Chinatown that seems to have made a special effort to be welcoming for those that don't speak Chinese - almost all the staff make a point of saying hello, the place is clean and nicely decorated with a beautiful collection...More

title: decent choice
review: Can't say it's the best dim sum place I've been to, but is a decent one with good environment. It's in a convenient location in China Town, easy parking (with restaurant sponsored parking ticket).

title: Expected better for Chicago
review: During a recent trip to Chicago my husband and I decided to hit Chinatown for dim sum. Back when we lived in Chicago, Three Happiness was *the* place to go, but after reading some reviews, we decided to try MingHin, primarily because they take reservations...More

title: should try
review: Food quality is great but with high price relative to the served quantity.  The restaurant has discount price in weekday before 3:30pm.  If you don't care the cost, you won't feel regret to eat here.

title: Poor Service Can Ruin Good Food--Bait & Switch
review: I work with a number of Chinese women who highly recommended MingHin. In fact, two of them took me to lunch there. I so enjoyed the food that I wanted to take my family for the Dim Sum dining experience. I went on-line, looked at...More

title: Nice restaurant, try it
review: It is a really nice restaurant. Probably it is the biggest restaurant in Chinatown. It is spacious, and its atmosphere is really good. Also, you should try dim sum if you got here, it is great.

title: Very good Zao Cha (Chinese brunch)
review: Delicious Cantonese food. I personally like the shrimp and the chicken. Also there is porridge (different flavors, all quite decent). Remember to try the beef with bones.

title: Authentic and delicious food!
review: While vacationing in Chicago, we were eating a lot of heavy food (Pizza, hot dogs, steak)! Our last night we wanted something a little lighter. While I'm not sure if Chicago is known for its Chinese food, I was very impressed with this restaurant. I...More

title: Great Place to Try New Things
review: A friend who lives in Chinatown recommended trying this place and I was very pleased. I went for their dimsum offerings with a friend.  She knew the offers better than I did, so she did the ordering.  There were many things that sounded familiar to...More

title: Ancient Chinese Secret
review: This little gem but large inside is not easy to find. And somedays its packed primarily with locals. The service is fast and good and always with a smile. The menu is vast and has everything but you have pictures to guide you. The crab...More

title: Delicious Dim Sum
review: Delicious Dim Sum. Attentive service. Attractive decore and very clean restaurant. Stingy with soy sauce- no hot pepper flake oil available-siracha only.

title: Great food in Chinatown
review: Went to this restaurant with a large party and had two private rooms in back. The food was incredible with a variety of tasty Chinese dishes. The vegetables were fresh and meats flavored and seasoned exceptionally well. Coming from New York City where we eat...More

title: Superb Chinese Cusine
review: An excellent meal. True Chinese food in the USA! Good service, excellent atmosphere and food that was fantastic. We had Chicken Corn Soup, absolutley delicious! Their Duck was superb, mouthwateringly so!!! Their General Tso's Chicken was flavor some and perfect! My wife has a delicate...More

title: Father's Day Dim Sum
review: We went to MingHin for Dim Sum on Fathers day, Let me tell you, thank goodness we had made a reservation a few days prior. IT WAS PACKED SOLID! We arrived on time for our reservation and still waited over 30 mintues. That is my...More

title: Delicious DimSum
review: On a recent trip to Chicago we ate at the Phoenix Restaurant.  We knew there was better Dim Sum for a more reasonable price in Chinatown so we ate at MingHin the next day.  We were not disappointed.  Although we had to wait about 45...More

title: Best dim sums in town!
review: A great variety of dim sum - ideal for a good value lunch or dinner.   Fast and friendly service make this a great experience.

title: Nothing is Ordinary at MingHin
review: Know these things: 1-lots of parking but not enough for this popular place! Circle neighborhood  2-enter walking mall off Princeton ( and Archer) 3-fabulous updated menu and fish, tofu and vegetarian selections were as great as duck, pork, beef, chicken and seafood  4-many small and...More

title: Excellent Chinese food in Chicago. Reasonable price.
review: We were a group from Thailand visiting Chicago. After many times of disappointment in the Thai food there we then looked for a good place for Chinese food. This one is located in the China Town and recommended by one of our friends. We were...More

title: Fun Place/ Discovery
review: This was our first time here, certainly not the last.  Everything was delish.  Service was good, not great, but good.  Super variety, excellent flavours.  The only two negatives were... 1.  All food arrived cool/not hot and 2.  Waitress forgot to put in an order for...More

title: NEVER will I eat here
review: A business partner warmly recommended this place.  I experienced something there that I will never forget.  We never got past our cup of tea and immediately evacuated.  You can check the Chicago Health Department's records on this place for more information.

title: Great pork and shrimp sui mai!
review: We went for dim sum and were not disappointed.   Fried vegetable rolls were flavorful, if a bit too oily and barbecue pork buns was encased in airy bread. Sui mai was by far the best. Service was fine and quick.

title: Pretty good Dim Sum
review: Its busy, the service is not that great or friendly, but the food is AMAZING.  We went on a Sunday around noon and it was pretty busy, but as soon as I saw the place packed with Chinese people, I knew the food was going...More

title: A must go-to for dim sum
review: My daughter had been here before and recommended this restaurant for dim sum.  We all loved it!  Though there was a wait to be seated, it went fairly quickly.  The waiter was great.  He spoke English and was very attentive.  This is not a dim...More

title: Excellent Food with a Diverse Menu
review: We were two couples on a rainy Friday night...one couple much more experienced with "real" Chinese food.  For appetizers we had the deep fried stuffed crab claws, which were just ok, and we had the dried scallop and yellow chive soup, which was expensive, but...More

title: Overrated
review: Food was just OK, service was terrible. We went on a Sunday afternoon so it was quite busy, spent 20 minutes waiting for someone to serve us (or explain how to order), before I grabbed someone and had to somehow figure out what I wanted...More

title: not sure why it's so popular
review: we went for sunday morning dim sum and overall the experience was less than stellar.  between the five of us we ordered fifteen different types of dim sum and overall i thought the food was incredibly average, certainly not worth the accolades it has on...More

title: Delicious late night dim sum!
review: My first time in Chicago had to do with the fact that my sister took a job there. Therefore, me and my folks had to help move and settle in. We went into the Chinatown part of Chicago to do some exploring on a Thursday...More

title: Good Chinese
review: We went here for a family dinner. The food was good the service was typical for Chinatown. The restaurant was clean compared to a lot I have been to. Make sure you read the menu before you go this is not Chop Suey and Egg...More

title: Good Dim Sum
review: We went to this place after its recent expansion into two store fronts on the ground floor. It also has an upstairs space, making the restaurant one of the largest in Chinatown. The Dim Sum here is very good and compares well to many family...More

title: Great New Place In Chinatown Square
review: My son was in town and we wanted to get dim sum with him.   We were going to go to one of our old haunts, when we noticed that a new place had replaced China Chef and Mountain 'something' (2 bigger store fronts.   From the...More

title: Nice place for dim sum
review: We had lunch in this restaurant with a Chinese host, so it was pretty easy to choose the dishes. We ordered several plates to share:  -dim sum *** - deep fried crab roll ** - roasted duck **** - dumplings *** - beef ball ***...More

title: One more superb addition to Chicago's Chinatown
review: Minghin has the atmosphere of a more upscale restaurant (more space between tables, higher level of decor and appointments). Its prices are reasonable - a notch above the cheapest Chinatown establishments, but still a bargain. The wide ranging menu has some very authentic dishes as...More

title: Excellent dim sum that nearly match Hong Kong quality
review: The dim sum here is very good and nearly match Hong Kong quality. The service is efficient and friendly, not the type you normally get from most Chinatown restaurants.  We used to go to other Chinatown restaurants for lunch and dinner. This is now our...More

title: Big, new, and good, with lots and lots of choices.
review: Our friend who is a young woman from Taiwan loves this place. It reminds both her and us of newish, upward-striving restaurants we have visited in China. They have dim sum--not from carts, but from an extensive menu. They also have lots and lots of...More

title: Hard to beat
review: Not many restaurants are open Christmas day, but MingHin was.  There were 6 of us, with reservations at 4:30 PM.  The restaurant was crowded downstairs, but we were promptly seated in the upstairs dining area.   MingHin "specializes" in Cantonese cuisine, and especially fresh seafood.  We...More

title: Great Atmosphere
review: Neighborhood and family friendly pizza and burger place - but bigger and better than you might think.  The food is very good as are the prices.

title: Watch the sneaky menu prices
review: I ordered a special for the price on the pizza page and did not look at the other page. On the other page were different prices and I paid $10 more than what was on the pizza page. Disappointing and deceptive!! The waiter even admitted...that they have had this problem before. Fix it!More

title: Great spot, great pizza
review: First of all, this is an adorable place! I love the look and the vibe of the restaurant. Throw in the holiday decorations and it‚Äôs even better. But of course, the taste and quality of the food is most important. Connie‚Äôs didn‚Äôt disappoint. Great salad,...pizza and cannoli‚Äôs. Service was great too. Our waiter was prompt and courteous, not intrusive. A short drive from Michigan Avenue but it‚Äôs definitely worth it.More

title: Pleasent surprise
review: A little off the beaten path but worth it. Our waitress, Jill, was excellent. She was very attentive and answered all our questions. Extensive menu. All items we ordered were very good. Xmas decorations very extensive. Will return.

title: Fantastic
review: Really good pizza. Fresh, baked to perfection, and simply satisfying.  I had the wood burning oven thin crust and craved it for the rest of the time in Chicago.  Well done.

title: Our favorite Chicago pizza joint!
review: Deep dish gets all the attention in Chicago from the out-of-towners (which we are) but not everyone is a fan. Connie's offers multiple options for pizza but their thin crust is our favorite. It's thin without being burnt and crispy, and their topping options please...everyone at the table. Buffalo wings at Connie's are also great and their house/family salad is perfect to start with.More

title: Best pizza I've ever had
review: I got done in at Taste of Chicago. Their crust is sublime and this is the best pizza I've had in my life so far. Now, I'm craving!!!!

title: Pizza Lovers
review: The restaurant is large enough for a celebration, the light setting is just right to read your menu and see your food.  The Pizza is delicious.  Have it your way.  Thin crust, deep dish, medium crust, etc.  Price is reasonable and the servie is great....Summer time you may chose to dine outsind.  Free large parking lot as well.More

title: Nice Stop
review: After attending a memorial service, we needed a place to relax and enjoy. Connie‚Äôs fit the bill nicely.  This place is a steady hand and response well to couples, small groups and special events.  Food had been consistent over the years.  When our daughter was...young, we went after every track & swim meets.  Very consistent and good!More

title: Great deep dish pizza
review: Enjoyed eating the deep dish pizza and the wood fired. The deep dish is a very thick corn meal type crust loaded with plenty of cheese. It‚Äôs good but I would say giodarnos is step above.

title: Homestyle cooking
review: After having been on the road for a couple of weeks and eating out in restaurants, Connie's felt like we were eating a home cooked meal at someone's house (or our own). Liked it so much that we came back the next night as well,...More

title: Yum!
review: Beautiful place with friendly people and the best mozzarella sticks ever! The pizza was also excellent.

title: The real deal !
review: Visiting from UK. We were recommended this place by our Uber driver. We each ordered a pizzerella - an individual 7‚Äù pizza.  I had 4 cheese deep dish, my husband chose a jalape√±o and red pepper topping. They were both Divine !! Best pizza I‚Äôve...More

title: Great deep dish pizza
review: Ordered the meat lovers deep dish. Very flavorful. Good amount of cheese and toppings with a crisp crust.

title: Love it!!
review: My fianc√© and I got the cheesy bread, fettucine, and a salad. We loved it! Great atmosphere and friendly service.

title: Great Pizza Night with Friends
review: I do not live that far from Connie's, but this was my first visit in years. One of my friends never had their pizza, and we decided to have a Girl's Night on a Saturday. The parking lot gets very crowded. I had to drive...More

title: My 4th Chicago visit
review: I have been going to Connie‚Äôs since I was in 4th grade in the early 70‚Äôs. Our teacher thought it was a good idea to take us to the original location on 26th street after the Shed Aquarium field trip and I fell in love...More

title: Good pizza, fast delivery
review: Very good Chicago Pizza.   I did find it odd that on their Deep Dish they had the cheese on top instead of the sauce, but it was still a good pie.   The Italian sausage topping was to die for.

title: Good, but Not my style
review: It was the first time I tried the deep Chicago pizza, sausage sauce. It was good, but not my style. I still prefer the Italian pizza. I wouldn‚Äôt say I‚Äôd refuse to eat it again, but I‚Äôll keep it a under a low priority, so...More

title: Great Deep Dish
review: Connie's is in a old factory they still have a lot of the gears and belts etc still intact. Doesn't hurt that the deep dish pizza is outstanding

title: Best Pizza in the world
review: I love the place by itself, but the pizzas, OMG out of this world and I have to say Im not a cheese lover, this is the only place where I can easily eat every item of their menu...perfect to go in a romantic mood...More

title: DEEP DISH PEPPERONI
review: I love the Archer location of Connie's.  I am a city person so you must put that into context.  There are some folks who don't necessarily like cities, but I do! With that in mind, I would recommend the salads, they have a number of...More

title: Very yummy pizza
review: We have tried the other Chicago style pizza places and wanted something different.  Connie‚Äôs is a great addition to the list!   There was a party of 8 of us on a Saturday night.  Service was pretty decent.   Started with cheese garlic bread, which was awesome....More

title: Lunch before traveling
review: After visiting the IMTS 2018 we decided to try some original Chicago style pizza. It was a very good experience. My Wife Judy had the Pepperoni, and I had an Italian Pannini... everything was wonderful. We will be back!

title: Fast delivery/hot food
review: I had just returned on a Sunday night from a 4 week trip.  I was too tired to prepare a meal after traveling for 6 hours, so I gave Connies Pizza a chance.    It was late (after 9:30 pm when I finally decided to call)...More

title: Lolapalooza!
review: They had a spot at Lolapalooza and the slice was delicious! Actually ate it two days in a row!! Will have to go to their location next time in Chicago!

title: Delicious pizza in warehouse feel
review: This is an iconic Chicago institution and a favorite after attending Southside White Sox baseball game. Been around a LONG time, housed in building that feels like it's an old warehouse, brick walls and tall tall ceilings. LONG wait at times so be prepared. You...More

title: Awesome!!
review: Service was ok but pizza was great. Had a deep dish and a thin. The thin was the same depth as the deep dish! Really impressed.

title: Fabulous!
review: I actually ate here twice it was so amazing! Great appetizers on Friday and Satuday Pizza. Loved both. Calamari was very good and the fried neatballs were grest. The bread... oh the bread.. just say yes!!! We had thin AND deep dish pizza and both...More

title: Good Chicago Pan Pizza
review: Wanted to stop somewhere on our way to Midway and this got good reviews. Crowd seemed to be all locals, so that's a good sign. Very nice staff. Ordered spinach dip and deep dish pizza. Very pleased with both. Not sure I'd say it's the...More

title: My favorite
review: One of my favorite pizza places to visit.  Love the middle weight pizza and their stuffed pizza.  Connies has a great sauce and tasty dough and when you put them 2 together you get perfection.   Their sandwiches are very good as well.

title: Great service
review: Went to Connie's first time with a conference group. Good deep dish pizza with tons of cheese; better still was the service after everyone left and only myself and a friend were left to figure out our Uber tired. Gen was the front host and...More

title: Most Delicious
review: JMJ I think this was one of THE Best pizzas I've ever had, and I've had quite a few in my day!  The freshness of all the ingredients is what I think made it stand out so.  It was the perfect temperature for eating also....More

title: Good Monday Night Pizza
review: Try the special offers on a Monday night. It is good value and a decent pizza, especially the deep pan.

title: Good pizza
review: The pizza is good. Better than most but pizza is pretty much pizza. The crust however is better than most. It isn't doughy tasting or totally bland, which is the case at most places. Overall a good meal!

title: Love the spinach dip & Italian beef!
review: Stopped here for lunch and had the spinach dip appetizer and the Italian beef sandwich.  The food was excellent and the service was fast & friendly. Nice atmosphere (looks like an old factory refurbished).  I would definitely go back (and try their pizza next time).

title: Best Dining Experience in Years
review: Went for lunch with friends who are local and ended up staying all afternoon catching up.  Shared a large deep dish half veggie half meat.  Both sections were excellent and truly the best deep dish pizza I've had since the '80's.  Salad was fresh ingredients...More

title: Loved the decor and the pizza
review: My cousin brought us here for lunch while we were visiting in Chicago. Hubby and I wanted to try the deep dish pizza while we were in the city. This restaurant is charming with an interior looking like a refurbished factory. Lots of interesting items...More

title: Best Deep Dish Pizza I have Ever had
review: Absolutely loved the pizza. Coming from Utah we don't have anything that even compares to this. Loved this place. Service was a little lacking but I can understand when our waitress was waiting on our group of 20. Would come back in a heartbeat.

title: A Bridgeport Staple
review: I've been coming to Connie's for close to 50 years going back to when they were on 26th street and i am never let down. They have a variety of menu options and i have never been turned down for slight modifications. Save room for...More

title: Great restaurant in a dodgy neighborhood
review: First off, they claim to be the originators of the deep dish pizza. True or not, they do make a nice pie. We had the linguine with broccoli and shrimp special as well, and that was pretty good - so garlicky and buttery/creamy. Even though...More

title: Amazing pizza
review: Connie's Pizza is one of my visit pizza places of the city. There deep dish is a must try, I usually get the meat lovers and the super and they are delicious , the pizza is super filling. They have a nice parking lot and...More

title: Amazing Pizza
review: This was my first visit to Connie's.  Both of my kids have visited while on a band trip.  They cater to large parties.  The place is HUGE.  The d√©cor is eclectic and really cool.  Great atmosphere.  I was on a girls' weekend with 3 friends...More

title: Nice Deep dish in a pleasant alfresco dining area!
review: The service was good, the wait was long for a 'pie' but it was a delish pie! the views outside were lovely! cost was higher than I expected but not unreasonable.

title: Damn.
review: Great food. Great prices. Love the mozzarella wedges. The cannoli is to die for. Quickly located off the expressway.

title: Average Pizza
review: My friend & I didn't want much to eat so we thought pizza would be good.  We went to Connie's & ordered a BBQ chicken pizza which I've had in other places many, many times.  It was thin crust, which is what we wanted.  It...More

title: ....TRANCENDENT PIZZA/ITALIAN EXPERIENCE ON THE "SOUT" SIDE.....
review: Connie's on Archer is first choice when touring out-of-town guests the Chicago way. The unique building, safe enclosed parking, nicely spaced seating all demonstrate South Side attitude.  Our recent visit didn't disappoint.  Our semi-surly waitress displayed the perfect personification of the locale, as multiple courses...More

title: Neighborhood pizza
review: This is a clean, great atmosphere pizza place in Chicago s Bridgeport neighborhood.  The restaurant offers appetizers that change weekly, salads, pasta dishes and pizza.   They are know for their own style of pizza crust and sauce.  I visited them during the week for a...More

title: A Chicago Icon
review: Connie's is a must if you are from Chicago. If you are visiting, then it is a definite MUST DO!  Cheesy garlic bread to start, sampler plate with delicious wings, calamari and mozzarella triangles is a nice way to start. The buffalo wings are hot!...More

title: Great Pizza
review: Another great Chicago pizza place that is worth a visit if you are in the area.  Nice place to have a few drinks and enjoy a good meal.

title: Great place for a large group
review: We met a large group for lunch on the weekend.  We were seated right away, and well taken care of.  The pizza was quite good.  The cheese and sauce complemented each other well, and the crust was very tasty.  Be sure to bring your appetite.

title: Nice place for large groups
review: We had a large group of at least 25. They had us preorder our food since we knew we were going. The Connie's vans picked us up at our hotel & took us back. Can't beat that. Cool environment. Pizza, lasagna, etc. good bread!Our server was great!

title: Something other
review: For lunch, we wanted a Italian Beef sandwich and fries. Trying to find a place close by that had decent Italian beef's. Connie's pizza came to the table, so we took a trip to place an order. I was a little surprised at the taste of the sandwich. It was tasty and delicious, I didn't think that it would be as good as it was, I will stop by again to try something else from there menu. I have had their Pizza many of times and was pleased!!!

title: Great place definitely Worth to go
review: Great place, wings are great. Piazza takes about 40minutes but definitely Worth the time. The restaurant got a great theme.

title: Awsome
review: Connie's Pizza is awsome.  Attended after a trip to the Shedd aquarium.  Well worth the trip.  The pizza is awsome well worth the wait. Would  go back again if we were in the city.

title: Great Atmosphere
review: Had a deep dish pizza with their special sausage. Very tasty. Nicely cooked. The atmosphere and decorations were a great attribute to this fine establishment. I will be suggesting this place to my friends.

title: Large groups beware
review: In many past visits I have enjoyed the food and service, but not last night. I was with a group of ten. My wife and I wanted a separate check. We were warned they could only reduce it to 3 separate checks for the group. When the bill came, it seemed to include everyone. We thought that terribly inconvenient, because some wanted to pay by credit, debit, or cash. First Connie's said we could figure it ourselves and leave our estimated amount. My wife, once a waitress herself, complained bitterly. They then said they would break it down for each. It took them at least 30 minutes! What could have been a pleasant evening became very frustrating for everyone. Any inconvenience to the staff of writing separate checks was passed to the customer. As a large group we never had this problem in the past, but not last night.. High points for food, poor points for service. Beware if you are a large group.

title: pizza...yum
review: great thin crust...highly recommend italian beef and giardiniera pizza! great and fast service. We will be back.

title: Near McCormick place
review: Went after the boat/rv show on Saturday afternoon..We started with loaded cheese fries as an appetizer and then ordered a large sausage pan pizza had a few cocktails hubby had an IPA and I had an old fashioned the drink I had was awful could not finish it.The service was very good as well as the pizza was fantastic...had plenty left for the next day. My granddaughter had the kids fettuccine Alfredo and they gave her a free soda and sundae with her meal I thought it was a good deal and she left happy and satisfied....would return again if in the area.

title: TG for veggies
review: Part of very large group that had pre-ordered pizza. I was not eating it so ordered a beef sandwich. Truthfully, I was very disappointed with the beef as it was very dry and had to ask for au jus to moisten the bread to eat the beef. saving grace was the vegetables that were served with the meal - excellent! Crisp and seasoned well. Our server was excellent, Maria...with 26 at the table she did an great job.

title: Great Pizza and other Italian Fare
review: This restaurant has been a special place for me to bring out-of-town visitors to sample Chicago style pizza.  It also is our go-to place for our family for dining out and for delivery if we prefer.  I love the chopped salad with the house dressing....More

title: Awesome Eats!!
review: Great atmosphere, great food for a decent price and friendly service. Lots of old pictures of folks in Chicago to look at while you wait for your food!

title: Horrible "pizza" and bad ranch dressing that gave us food poisoning.
review: That is not deep dish pizza.  That is mediocre bread with cheese and a few toppings thrown on top.  The Mango Sangria is mango flavored sugar water with a tiny bit of alcohol tossed in, and the ranch dressing they gave us with our sampler...More

title: A great place for family sit down deep dish
review: My local friend brought me here because it's her favorite deep dish pizza place.  It's a nice family style place and the pizza was really good.  The pizza from here also fared better the next day than Pequod‚Äôs Pizza. I'd give the fresh pizza 4...More

title: We Hit a Home Run on Our First Chicago Pizza Swing!
review: We are staying in Chinatown but wanted a real Chicago pizza experience for our first dinner here. We scored! We had the Margherita pizza and the spinach and ardachoke dip and loved every single bite. If you're lucky enough to get Alfonso as your server,...More

title: Excellent Pizza
review: Went on our first night and thought it was great pizza and after a few more days of eating pizza throughout Chicago we never found a better one!!  The service was quick and the pizza wonderful. The highlight was the pizza sauce, it was perfect.

title: Why so delicious?!?
review: The pizza was amazing.  I've only had better pizza on one occasion (Italy).  The cheese to sauce ratio was just perfection.  My s.o. has been talking about this place since we started dating and he did not exaggerate.  It was the best! :-) You should...More

title: Chicago Pizza
review: This was my families first introduction to deep dish Chicago Pizza and I am so glad that I chose this place ! We ordered the Italian beef which was so substantial , that a small was plenty for three adults and one child (saving room...More

title: Great food
review: We went for lunch and had their deep dish pizza. It was delicious! They give you some bread to start with and it is also very good! The service was also great!

title: Visited twice during my stay in Chicago
review: I was looking for a place outside of the city with a nice menu selection and I stumbled upon Connie's Pizza. On my first visit, I wasn't in the mood for pizza so I had the ld Neighborhood Italian Beef. Good sandwich with the perfect...More

title: Great traditional pizza in Bridgeport
review: Connie's Pizza offers excellent middleweight pizza in a wonderfully refurbished space made to look as if it was from a long ago era.    Both of Connie's sausage and pepperoni pizzas are excellent.  Adding veggies such as mushrooms and onions just make the pizzas even yummier....More

title: Ok
review: I was at lunch this Sunday evening and decided on Connies Pizzeria in Bridgeport. I liked that there were not that many people, it was not that noisy, calm atmosphere. They also had the patio open but I decided on dinning indoors.   Nice clean place,...More

title: Connies is loosing thier edge
review: I have been wanting to bring my family to Connie's for some time now.  We went Sunday night.  They were busy and put us in an area that was usually used for parties the lower level.  It was 80 degrees, and so loud it was...More

title: Missing Connies Everyday!
review: I am a former Bridgeport resident & always ordered delivery from Connie's.  Connie's is an icon in Bridgeport & appreciate their presence.  They have wonderful pizza & pasta dishes in generous portions.  Can't ask for anything more.

title: This is the Famous Chicago Pizza
review: We always go here for pizza,at its best. Service is usually perfect. This time we had a good server but she didn't quite match up with ones from past,but okay,she tried. Atmosphere is cool in a masterfully done restoration of an old factory. Serving sizes...More

title: Great pizza
review: So you're heading home from an afternoon Sox game or a day at McCormick Place, Connie's in Bridgeport is a great place to stop.  The deep dish pizza is really good, one of the best.  The cheesy garlic bread makes for a great appetizer, especially...More

title: Good Deep dish
review: We came here with a large group of kids and had pizza and salad, which were all very good.  Nice atmosphere.  We had a very large private area and attentive staff.  This was a great choice for pleasing both kids and parents!

title: It's all about the Pizza!
review: While visiting Chicago, was  invited for a dinner here with friends. .  Started with bruschetta , which was very flavorful, and the fried calamari, which we all agreed was some of the best we'd ever had.light , crispy and flavorful. We then opted for salad...More

title: Great Pizza!
review: Connie's is amazing! I went here before a White Sox game with my aunt, grandma, and sister and we ordered the cheesy garlic bread for the appetizer. The cheesy garlic bread is a must have! After the appetizer we got some deep dish pizza which...More

title: Great place
review: We love stopping in Connie's Friday nights after a long work week.  The food is excellent.  The staff is always friendly and the price is always right.

title: Father's 70th Birthday
review: Plenty of space so your comfortable great food service and worth the wait when they are busy. Also after a Sox game we go to Connie's and have a great meal with our family or friends then back to Joliet well  worth it !!

title: Fantastic pizza & service
review: I ate here with my girlfriend and it is without doubt the best pizza we have ever eaten. The crust is yummy, lashings of fillings on the pizza with the service prompt and friendly. The atmosphere is really cool with lots of bits and bobs...More

title: Large and Wonderful Atmosphere
review: We loved the atmosphere of this place.  It has a large warehouse sorta feel to it.  Yet everywhere you turn there are nice touches that make your time here enjoyable.  We had the Garlic cheese bread (awesome), the antipasto salad (great), the House Special Pan...More

title: Pizza, pizza!
review: Hectic Friday night resulted in somewhat lengthy waiting time and some mixup with orders. But the manager resolved the problems to our satisfaction, and the rest of the night went smoothly. Pizza was next to perfect, really enjoyable. Service friendly, but slow. This is a...More

title: Yummy
review: This was one of our dinner stops on a bus trip to Chicago.  Wasn't excited about going to a pizza place but this was not the average pizza place.  It was very large and quite accommodating for our group of 39.  Salad served first  in...More

title: Service Exceeded Expectations
review: Don't judge a book by it's cover. This place from the outside doesn't look like much but the service was outstanding, the deep dish pizza was pretty good and at the end of our meal Edgar made arrangements for us to take their shuttle back...More

title: Average Food & Disgusting Restroom
review: I had not been to Connie's Pizza in such a long time so I was looking forward to my visit. I ordered fried eggplant w/pasta which I wasn't thrilled when it arrived. It was oily, too acid, and lacked flavor. The restroom was so filthy,...More

title: Really Good!
review: Very good deep dish for the bridgeport neighborhood.  They have really speedy delivery and that deep dish crust is amazing.  Also reasonably priced

title: Big, but average.
review: Marvellous building, have never been in such a large Pizzeria.  Bit disappointed with the service and actually the quality of the food, my son was sick, we were only charged for the adults (even though my dinner went back as I was looking after my...More

title: Great restaurant; great pizza
review: Had meeting in downtown Chicago; decided to be adventurous and take the L to Connie's Pizza on Archer to get our Chicago deep dish pizza--found a fun time and good food. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. Though we went for pizza, there are...More

title: Great Pizza
