review: This is probably the only pizza place in Chicago that accepts reservations. We had a party of nine, four of which were small children. It wasn't like we could wait and hour to get a table. We made reservations for nine at 6 PM. We...More

title: Best Pizza!
review: We really like Connie's Pizza.  The ambiance is very pleasant and relaxed.  The staff are friendly and attentive.  The food is wonderful.  If you like deep dish Chicago style pizza, you need to try Connie's!  But, all of the food is quite good.  From the...More

title: My first Chicago Deep Dish Pizza
review: I was invited to Connie's for a team dinner.  Because this was a team dinner, our menu was pre-set. I did not get a chance to review the menu, but if you're going for pizza, this pizza was great.  The sauce was sweet, not my...More

title: Soooooo Good!
review: This pizza is unreal and sooo yummy. Service was good, Credit cards accepted with delivery. Tried the deep dish and stuffed pizza

title: connies is the best
review: Atmosphere and best deep dish pizza in Chicago.  Better than is is impossible.  Service is fast and good. Place is cute and comfortable.  You must come here.  We went to one near Chinatown in old factory building.  Really heavenly.

title: EXCELLENT PIZZA!!!
review: This was my first visit to Chicago and Connie's came recommended as THE place to try an authentic Chicago deep dish pizza. I have had NY pizza and I was excited to finally have a voice in the age long debate between the two. Connie's...More

title: Great food!
review: The food is fantastic. I would recommend the middle weight pizza. The staff is very polite and accommodating. Reservations are recommended for large groups, though, or you might be waiting for a while.

title: Great pizza
review: Visiting Chicago, we wanted Chicago pizza. Tried another big name Chicago pizza place and were extremely disappointed. Connie's had a menu in our hotel room, so we decided to get it delivered. We got a meat lovers 26th St. style, garlic bread and mini cannolis....More

title: Family place
review: The place is full of families. Fun decor.  The meat lovers pizza is really good. If you're looking for good pizza this is a good choice.

title: good pizza
review: This location was easy to find.  It's large enough that we didn't have any wait time to get a table.  We had a wood fired margherita pizza ($9.99) and a meat lovers deep dish pizza ($27.00).  Both were very good.

title: Great Sausage and Onion Pizza
review: I don't really like onions but the sausage and onion pizza here is just fantastic. The classic deep dish Chicago pizza is to die for here. The restaurant has very courteous staff and great mint candy at the entrance.

title: Great
review: Carried bands from 4 high schools on 6 charter buses there. Not only did we have great service but the pizza was fantastic. We were in and out in an hour and 15 minutes. That is amazing for approximately 250 people. Great job and great...More

title: Exceptional  Taste and value !
review: Start with an antipasto salad . Really good  Italian deli meats extra good. Home made warm bread with dipping olive oil and Parmesan cheese,' Main course middle weight Connie special pizza  w/spinach,sausage,mushrooms...that was my order....

title: Connie's Rocks!
review: Our first time to a Connie's Pizza joint was a huge hit for my wife and I.  The design of the restaurant was fantastic.  The wait staff excellent!  Each food selection was also done perfectly pleasing us!  Our sald was excellent, our appetizer fantastic, and...More

title: Food is delicious but,
review: I was at Connie Pizza in Bridgeport on December 30, 2014 with my good friend. Connie Pizza has been one of my favorite places, but tonite the service sucked. It was pretty busy for a Tuesday nite, and I am not mad that we hate...More

title: Not the best, but in select company
review: Not the best, but at least in my top 5. It wasn't that crowded as we got there early, but service was still a little spotty.  Pizza crust was a little too crispy and sauce a bit on the sweet side.  Compared to what they...More

title: NOT just pizza!  Delicious Italian food and great atmosphere!
review: We were referred here by our front desk staff- they told us that Connie's would even pick us up!  They did (after we called a second time- they forgot about us!) and we were pleasantly surprised by the location.  Although it's near the interstate and...More

title: Great Pizza and Apps!!!!
review: Is there a bad place to get pizza in Chi-Town??? If so, I have not found it. Connie's Pizza is great!!! Went with family and friends and had a great time and great food. Nothing like a deep dish pizza!!! Our waiter gave us a...More

title: Authentic Chicago Pizza at a great price!
review: The pizza here is absolutely fantastic. We found this restaurant on a whim, as Lou Malnati's and Chicago Pizza Company were both packed and had very long waits. No wait for this one, and the prices were incredibly reasonable. We ate the deep dish pizza,...More

title: Great Chicago Pizza!
review: We took our youth group to Chicago for a mission trip and wanted to give them an authentic Chicago pizza experience. On the Fourth of July, we attempted this feat. The pizza place we initially wanted to take them was packed, so we continued to...More

title: Best Pizza in Chicago
review: Connie's Pizza is the best. We've been there many times and are never disappointed. The service is always friendly and attentive.  Especially Edgar, the manager.  Would recommend this pizza to anyone. We go there anytime we are nearby.

title: deep dish for everyone
review: visited the place with family and indeed the restaurant may seem dull from the outside, but the inside was amazing! well-decorated and huge place too!  we ordered the classic deep dish pizza and desserts were in big servings too.  the food tastes great and was...More

title: Good pizza
review: I stopped here on the way to a White Sox game with my kids.  The wait was a little long but the pizza was really good and the service was also very good. The deep dish is fantastic.

title: Good place for families
review: Good place before White Sox games or  going to McCormick Place. Good Italian food. Pizza comes in  different types of crusts.

title: good
review: I ordered a deep dish, isn't the deep dish I normally get, but it was worth the visit. you should give it a shot.  Think pizza in florida is no good compared to this...

title: First time, loved it!
review: We ate here because it was close to our hotel. Will definitely be back! The staff was friendly, the food was amazing and the atmosphere incredible! We had the pizza, burgers and brownie! All fantastic!

title: True 'Chicago pizza' experience
review: Connie's -- particularly at this original Bridgeport neighborhood location -- is one of the best local food experiences you can have. The pizzas come thin, stuffed, deep dish (recommended), etc. and are unlike other sometimes more publicized pies (i.e. Gino's, Giordano's, Uno, Due, etc.). While...More

title: extra good  !
review: very goooood !  Like this  place a lot !  antipasta salad also great....fresh baked bread  with good dipping oil and parmesian cheese.  Finish off with an order of outstanding  cannoli for dessert ... amen .

title: Beautiful location
review: Great location in Bridgeport. Food is amazing. Every visit I feel like I'm away from the city. Very clean, and safe environment .Hostess was not friendly, seemed unhappy and distracted. We dined on a Tuesday evening, not crowded. Asked the waiter about seasonal wines per...More

title: The best deal for local pre-event dining.
review: First visit here.  Connie's offers a shuttle to the United Center (and other local venues) at no charge so we thought we'd utilize the service before a recent Hawks game.  Food at the UC is obscenely expensive and parking would be $25 or so.  Dining...More

title: Best Calamari
review: We went to Connie's, the new one on Clark and had a great time, server was very knowledgeable and helpful.  The restaurant had only been open for a couple weeks and wasn't that busy, we were there at 4pm (understandable).  We ordered the fried calamari...More

title: Pizza in Chinatown
review: Connie's! Our favorite place for cheap, Italian family style dinner in the heart of Chinatown on Archer Avenue. The portions are large, and the ambiance truly Chicago, set in a rehabbed factory site. The deep dish pizza was excellent, and the penne with meat sauce...More

title: Not the Connie's I remember
review: Connie's just opened a place in Glen Ellyn, Il. When I worked in the Chicago Loop, we would always order from Connie's for office occasions. The pizzas were great. The new place, not so great. The pan and thin were soft, soggy, tripping with tomato...More

title: Save yourself for real Chicago Pizza
review: The Connie's located at Navy Pier makes their pizzas in advance and keeps them under a warming lamp so they are not very fresh or good. Save yourself for better choices in Chicago pizza. It's worth the wait at a regular restaurant. Prices are very...More

title: good food at a reasonable price
review: The menu is changing, but the pasta is good. Chicken masala and chicken vesuvio are both good.The flatbread pizza is the best choice of the pizza types. The wait staff is very friendly. It is near downtown and has free parking!

title: Really great Pizza !  Pleasant atmosphere ..
review: Really good Food and service !  It's laid out in a replica of an old Industrial Building.  Quite Unique !  Good experience ...

title: stuffed pizza
review: We had the stuffed with the sauce on the outside. Sausage was tasty and the mushrooms were fresh, not from the can. An excellent pizza! My daughter had the grilled chicken sandwich which looked great and she said it was, too. Service was good and...More

title: Proper Chicago Pizza
review: Very very good food loads of toppings and very big don't order extra you won't need it !!! There will be leftovers for lunch the next day ! Service was very good food ready when they said !

title: Only cheese on a pizza should be gooey--not the dough
review: My caption says it all. The waiter was really kind and offered to bring me another slice; you know it's bad when you decline more pizza.

title: Deep Dish Pizza Chicago Style
review: Although this place was a little ways away from our hotel it was worth the trip. The staff was very attentive, the facility was huge and the food hit the spot. A great place to take 150 of your closest friends.

title: Great food.  Free shuttle to sox game!
review: We ate here before watching a Sox game.  We ordered the middleweight crust pizza. We loved it.  Didn't try anything else but everything looked very good. We parked at Connie's for free. They drove us on a shuttle to the game. They were there promptly...More

title: A great place to eat, if you have a little extra time.
review: While killing time before the Sox game, my boyfriend and I decided to eat pizza. We found Connie's and decided to try it out. It is a beautiful dining atmosphere and the bread beforehand is fantastic. It took 35 minutes to get our pizza, but...More

title: Great Pizza & Delivery, but takes an hour
review: Pizza is always great and i know they have more than just pizza. Only down side is you need to factor that delivery is an hour from the order if it's a dinner order.

title: Really great pizza
review: connies signature pizza is outstanding !  We had it with sausage and mushrooms which we loved...  the resturant  is a reto-style industrial theme. It's very cool !

title: Great Middleweight Pizzas
review: Not being a native Chicagoan, I haven't been able to get my arms completely around Chicago-style pizza (and I have been trying for over 30 years).  However, Connie's is the best that I have had.  Their middleweight sausage pizza with hot giardineria is my personal...More

title: Stuffed Pizza was good
review: Ordered a small stuffed pizza. Did not expect it to take an hour for delivery but it was worth the wait. Could only eat one of the four slices so heated up the leftovers and that was good as well. Definitely will try this again...More

title: Good Pizza, excellent service
review: Stopped by this saturday in between white sox game and Bob seger concert at United Center.  We sat in the bar area and watched the remainder of the Blackhawk game.  Our bartender/server name was Eric and he just did an outstanding job.  I have been...More

title: their pizza was excellent
review: this was my first time at this establishment and i liked the ambiance, it sure feels like the old grandmas kitchen. the staff are great and very attentive and the food are excellent, too bad i did not get our waitress name she is Hispanic...More

title: The best pizza in Chicago!
review: Better than Uno's and Giordano's (and I love those two as well!). The atmosphere in the southside restaurant is cozy and friendly.  If I am hosting out of towners, this is my first choice for Chicago style 'za!!!

title: Great pizza
review: Ordered again from Connie's since we liked it so much last month. It was again very tasty! Service was quite fast, especially since we had it delivered.

title: Great pizza
review: I took my girl to connies and she wont stay stay quite about how good it is, which it is, the pizza is great and it taste better if u take someone that u care about, home run inn is minor league compared to connies

title: Best Pizza in Chicago!!!!
review: Connie's pizza has been around for a while now and that cause the pizza is delicious. I ve been to many places already and have tried alot of pizza but Connie's is still #1. I ve been to the "best" pizza joints int he Chi...More

title: More than just another pizza place
review: Pizza is so unique in Chicago - all shapes and sizes, thin, thick or stuff.  With establishments in all parts of the city, take out or dine in but to enjoy a place for not just the food but also the surroundings - this place...More

title: Great Surroundings
review: Connies Pizza is right on the edge of Chinatown in Chicago which was a bit puzzling to me but I digress! We were thinking of using this restaurant for a rehearsal dinner so we went to check it out. It would be a great place...More

title: Excellent pizza with great service
review: In my search for Chicago's best pizza, I came across Connie's.  While it did not get my best vote, I would recommend eating here.  The pizza was tasty and the service was definitely friendly.  The atmosphere was fun and casual.

title: Come Here Every Time I'm in Chicago
review: My husband is from Chicago and every time we fly in, my in-laws take us to Connie's on the first night.  I LOVE IT.  The pizza is exactly how I like my pizza: delicious crust, good sauce, chewy cheese...  the best is just sausage and...More

title: Pricey Wine
review: I and a group of coworkers have been going to Connies as a group for quite some time.  The big problem of late is that the restaurant, which is basically a neighborhood pizza place, charges downtown prices for their wine, and every item on the...More

title: Deep Dish!
review: I have been coming here for years and the pizza is always good.  I am a big fan of their deep dish pizza.  They also have the best garlic dressing.  This place is also great for large family get-together's and the service is consistently good.

title: Fantastic Food
review: We had the chance to eat here and then take their van to the Bears Game at Soldier Stadium, yes its free with your meal!!  The food is absolutely amazing, their pizza is by far some of the best that I've ever had.  They also...More

title: Go before or after a sox game
review: If you want a real Chicago experience go to white sox game, we need the support. This pizza is great. I am sure you have seen connies in other places, but if you go to the original it is much better. The have parking and...More

title: Great Pizza
review: They will even come to the hotel and pick you up for an awesome dining experience. There were so many things to choose from on the menu.

title: Great, over $50 for 4
review: Great food and atmosphere. Decorated beautifully, and pretty good service. Pricey, bill was almost 60 for one pizza and an appitizer. Really just for pizza, but don't get me wrong great pizza.

title: AMAZING PIZZA!
review: Connie's Pizza has been a family favorite for many years. Every special occasion can be celebrated here. The house bread is really good, but be sure to save space for the pizza. Make sure to try the Deep Dish pizza!!

title: Great food and service
review: Our experience was not a typical visit. I was a chaperone on my son's eighth grade class trip to Chicago and we had arranged with Connie's to open early and make us breakfast which included amazing breakfast pizza. May I just say the food was...More

title: Awesome Italian and pizza with plenty of parking
review: We used to live in Chicago, and we were regulars here. We recently went back while on vacation there, and it was just as good as ever. This is a place we always take our families, because the food is top-notch, there's plenty of parking,...More

title: So GOOD!
review: Liked everything. Food was great, service was great and it's a nice looking place.

title: A Southside Tradition: Great Chicago Style Pizza without the Tourists
review: Connie's, on the edge of Chinatown, doesn't make a lot of travel itineraries,  They have franchises in the suburbs, O'Hare, and at most of the sports venues in town.  The little known secret?  The pizza at the original location excels.  Everything you want in deep...More

title: FOOD!
review: Great place to eat, drink and laugh.. Italian food it their fare.  The pizza (deep dish) is my favorite. I also have their family salad...(when with the family) Great outside with music in the summer months..

title: Delicious!!
review: The inside of the restaurant is very nice although in the winter it can be chilly in spots (the waiters are always willing to move you around if needed). We go here every couple of months. The pizza is yummy and their loaded cheese fries...More

title: Pizza at it's best!!
review: Anyone that wants to sample true Chicago pizza needs to try Connie's Pizza!!  The atmosphere is fun, the food is amazing, and prices are reasonable.  Although not located on the beaten path of most Chicago tourist trips, it is more than worth the time to...More

title: Consistent quality and not just for pizza!
review: I've been eating Connie's Pizza for decades and I can't imagine being unable to savor their middleweight pizzas.  I eat in the dining room at least once every other month.  While the pizza might be the restaurant's foundation, there are other items on the menu...More

title: Expensive
review: I remember the old/orginal Connies, loved it there.  Since they enlarge, its not quite the same.  Do not care for there pizza.  There hot bread they serve on the table is great, can just eat that with the oil and cheese and I would be...More

title: Great for Large Groups!
review: This was the location for the end of season celebration for my middle-schooler's sports team.  We had children from 5 - 13 as well as parents and grandparents.   When we made our reservation the manager suggested that we go with a package rather than order...More

title: Best pizza in the world
review: I love Chicago-style pizza, and Connie's is the BEST.  My teens are not big pizza-eaters, but even they agreed it was the best pizza they'd ever had.  Location is not far from Comiskey Park, and they even have a shuttle from the restaurant to the...More

title: Big, Spacious Restaurant with Plenty of Italian Ambiance
review: We were all very pleased with our House Salads & Pizza. I got an individual small for myself because none of the other 4 people with me were interested in a Veggie Pizza ,26th St Style (sans sauce on top). It was a good size...More

title: overpriced, decent pasta, good Caesar salad
review: overpriced, decent pasta, good Caesar salad

title: A big resturant in an odd location. However, staff was friendly, food came out pretty fast and the food itself was...
review: A big resturant in an odd location. However, staff was friendly, food came out pretty fast and the food itself was fair. As a tourist tried their deep dish pizza and calzone, which were satisfactory.

title: This was pretty good.
review: This was pretty good.

title: Great middleweight pizza...
review: Great middleweight pizza and salads but pricey

title: Great ambiance and service.
review: Great ambiance and service.

title: Great pizza and accompaniments, in a neat atmosphere.
review: Great pizza and accompaniments, in a neat atmosphere.

title: I love the break sticks...
review: I love the break sticks & fries! ...pizza is always so discusting no matter where its from.

title: Yum Yum
review: it was very busy night but we were seated pretty fast . Ithink tbey forgot ourtable though but I called onestaff and they were pretty on it.The food was delicious Pho brisket the bowl was huge probably better to share with 2/3 people . The taro and mango bubble teas were delicious . Everybody went to bed satisfied! :)

title: Watch out for service charge added onto bill
review: My son and I ate at this restaurant the previous year, 2020, when nobody was out and about and we really enjoyed the food, so we decided to come back since we were in Chicago again this summer (2021).We were seated inside since the outdoor seating was closed. On this particular night, we were also one of the last customers to be served. There was a very large table next to us with kids running around. The service was fine, but I think our waiter was a little preoccupied with closing down and cleanup--fair enough.When my husband arrived to join us the next day, we again ate at this restaurant. This time, we were seated outside, as it was earlier in the evening. Our service was good and the food was good. Our son couldn't contain his delight at all of the choices of bubble tea on the menu. When our bill arrived, my husband pointed out that a service charge had been added onto the bill. I had not noticed this the previous night because we paid quickly so that they could close the registers.I am definitely not opposed to a service charge being added onto the bill, but if people don't notice (like me) and then add a tip onto the entire amount, it ends up being quite a lot. You decide if you want to tip more.

title: Best fruit smoothies!
review: Visiting Chicago and we found this great restaurant. The sweet and sour chicken was outstanding. The fruit smoothies were the best I have ever had. There have a window outside the restaurant where you can but just tea and smoothies. Tried 4 different flavors over a few days,I would highly recommend for dinner or just a smoothie!

title: Happy tummies
review: My family that lives in Chicago eat here frequently, and now we know why!  Vast menu, fast service and delicious food ... everything to make someone happy!  The boba tea selections were amazing!

title: Excellent dinner with friends!
review: Food is excellent, prompt seating, and a festive meal with friends. Great time, we ordered Chicken Pad Thai and Beef Fried Rice. Large servings. If you want wine, bring your own. A yearly holiday gathering at Joy Yee!

title: Great bubble tea and Shabu Shabu
review: There are 2 Joy Yee Restaurants in this plaza and I think people are getting confused on their reviews. The Joy Yee Plus at 2159 S China Place has the bubble teas, ice cream and hot pots. The other one is Joy Yee Noodle at 2139 S China Place with the noodles and smoothies.We enjoy the Shabu Shabu (Japanese Hot Pot) at Joy Yee Plus. The prices are reasonable and quality of food is good. Servers are real attentive. Of course when we order the hot pot, we did not save room for dessert and had to come back several times to try their desserts. The bubble waffle ice cream or Hong Kong style eggettes are delicious. The portion is generous and very filling for one person. The bubble tea is good but the selection is smaller than Joy Yee Noodle. They have some smoothies but the emphasis is on tea at Joy Yee Plus. I did enjoy the Cheese Green Tea.

title: Delicious Food
review: We visited our daughter and her boyfriend in Chicago. We always try different restaurants when we visit. Joy Yee's Noodle Shop was highly recommended by friends for Chinese food. It was very busy. The restaurant is not fancy. Service was great. We ordered the Viet. Egg Rolls, Beef Brisket Udon noodles, Veg Fried Rice, Orange Chicken, Honey Pepper Short Ribs and Chinese Broccoli in Garlic Sauce. The egg rolls were ok but everything else was delicious. The price was good and we had lots of leftovers. We would return for sure.

title: Delicious Bone Marrow Soup @ Joy Yee
review: My sister in law wanted us to try Joy Yee @ Chinatown, Chicago. It serves Pan Asian Cuisine. We tried the Vietnamese spring roll(has always been my favorite), spare ribs, string beans with pork & salted fish & Bone marrow soup( ‚Äú bulalo‚Äù for pinoys). The soup was served in a humongous bowl and was so delicious! Not greasy at all. The cartilage was so tender you can easily chow down on it! Well seasoned & so light in flavor! We all shared it. They have a long menu list. There was a long list of smoothies made from every fruit you can imagine. It is the most popular item sold. It seems every client that comes in orders it. We had frozen durian & green tea smoothies. Table beside us ordered pho soup, family size. It was served in a huge bowl that it looked like you had a swimming pool bowl of soup in the center of your small table!Every order was served large!We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch specially the bone marrow soup. Parking is challenging in the area.

title: Great smoothies
review: Joy Yee has the best smoothies in Chinatown.  The line is long but worth the wait.  Their prices are higher but they load more ingredients in their drinks.

title: Outstanding Selection
review: I took the family on a long weekend to Chicago. We wanted a snack & found this gem. Outstanding variety of baked goods. My kids thought they were the best they‚Äôd every had

title: Nightmare customer service
review: Terrible customer service. Staff is rude, manager is rude. They treat their customers with no respect. Most tasteless Chinese food ever. If it wasn‚Äôt for their drinks no one would even come here. Pretty garbage and disappointing. Save your money and go somewhere else to...More

title: Over Joy with their Bubble Tea at Joy Yee Plus
review: I'm amazed with the number of bubble tea selections from both Joy Yee and Joy Yee Plus noodle shops located in the heart of the new Chinatown.  Also, their signature Joy Yee bottles are huge let alone the delicious bubble tea they put inside.  Besides...More

title: Hidden Gem, Large Portions
review: The prices were decent and its a lively atmosphere. Servers are friendly and efficient. Portions are quite large and the menu is massive.

title: Yum & HUGE portions
review: Huge menu, HUGE portions.  The individual soup could feed 5.  Good service and clean.  The drinks are amazing!

title: Three-time dinners
review: The quality and the amount of food, the atmosphere, and the hospitality are all worthy of gold medals.

title: Perfect for people that are scared to try new foods.
review: Food was quick, attentive staff and the place was clean. I got the pad Thai lunch combo. All of it was only okay and lacked the spectrum of flavors and textures that I associate with hot (only warm) and sour soup, spring roll and pad...More

title: Bubble Tea Heaven!
review: So, so many flavors and combinations to choose from and I bet they're all delicious.  One of my favorites is Red Bean with Coconut Freeze which has large tapioca pearls in it - yum!  These are large servings and are very filling, a bit much...More

title: Amazing food!!! Huge portions!
review: They have a huge menu of food and drinks. I asked for a little bit of pineapple in my fried rice, and I got this (see picture)! Great food, best service I have ever experienced in my life. They also have vegan options!

title: Best Chinese Food
review: All the restaurants nearby had a very long waiting list but Joy Yee Noodle did not. They were very kind and have alot of space for everyone to eat! Their prices are very afforable and their portions are very generous! The food was delicious and...More

title: Tea treat
review: We picked up bubble tea after a visit to Ping Tom Memorial Park.  I was slightly overwhelmed by all the choices, but the kids were pleased with the non-tea options.  They were split on the tapioca, but the adults did enjoy the bubbles. It was...More

title: OVERRATED
review: Not real Asian cuisine, just Asian flavored food.  With that said, many dishes are tasty, and the portions are certainly ample.  However,  they are now becoming over priced for what you get (used to be a bargain spot). The smoothy and bubble tea lines are...More

title: Delish!
review: They made my Pad Thai in no time and it was one of the best Thai dishes that I have had in a long while.

title: Top notch every time
review: Every time I have come here it has been the absolute best food. We drove down from Madison, WI just for the day to eat their food. Their bubble tea is the best thing you will taste all day, but their food is definitely not...More

title: Family
review: Maybe it was cold but there wasn‚Äôt to many customers and we were seated right away, upstairs.   There was about 13 of us.  The service was decent and the food was pretty good.  The food came out faster than I expected.  The place was pretty...More

title: Great value, food, and staff.
review: The food is served very nicely with large portions. The serving style definitely has a bit of a modern flair. The seating is simple but comfortable. The restaurant was clean, the staff was friendly and the food was excellent. The portion size is significant for...More

title: Such an amazing variety of fruit teas I wanted to try them all.
review: The portions were large and the service was wonderful. I came for the lunch special and enjoyed an amazing fruit tea.

title: Great Bubble Tea
review: They've got food as well, but I typically go to Joyee for the bubble tea. Its easy to get to from the red line if you're taking mass transit.

title: Joy Yee Restaurant
review: The restaurant and food was Awesome!! A huge variety of food and drinks to choose from. Very large portions.  I will definitely recommend it and you  get to  visit China Town at the same time.

title: Really good environment
review: The drinks and food are very fresh, in the middle of Chinatown with makes you feel in other country, the staff are very nice.

title: Restaurant of Choice in Chinatown!
review: This place is packed every time I go so as the saying goes "if the local's like it, then it must be good right",  I have to agree. I have never had a bad meal here..  You get so much food for the price that...More

title: Best Chinese I've Ever Had!
review: Literally the best Chinese I've ever had! The dumpling soup was out of this world! You had spilt the small portion with someone else. Crab ragoons were amazing! Beef Fun Chow, the best!

title: Excellent food, moderate price
review: We went to Joy Yee Noodles because it looked attractive. We ordered beef and broccoli, beef noodle soup with wantons, and barbecued eel, which was excellent. The serves were so big that we took some extras home, The service, as with the food, was excellent....More

title: So fun, So Yum!
review: We took a boat taxi to China Town and as we rounded the corner from the dock and park, there was Joy Yee's noodle shop.  We went in for drinks, yet it smelled so good we got appetizers too.  I tried an Avocado with tapioca...More

title: Going to need to go back
review: We've never been to Japan before, but I can imagine that we would see a place that looks just like this in one of the more modern areas. Not traditional but definitely authentic. We tried the teriyaki beef with rice, popcorn chicken, eel, and pork...More

title: Two Days in a Row!
review: We were in Chicago for 3 Days and decided to branch out to one of their ethnic neighborhoods. Chinatown won and so did Joy Yee‚Äôs! I loved it so much that we went back the next day! They had the best hot and sour soup...More

title: Chicken meal tasted like strong fish
review: This is always our go-to when we‚Äôre in Chicago and I have also highly recommend it to friends. However after our visit last weekend we will not go back. We ordered chicken Pad Thai as one of our choices and it was very fishy tasting!...More

title: Joy Yee, Chinese Noodle, smoothies, bubble tea
review: Leaving Chicago, had an hour to kill before arriving at airport. Looking for a place with easy parking and not far out of the city.  My Son suggested Joy Lee in Chinatown about 10 minutes out of downtown. There was a line that moved fast....More

title: Amazing food and drinks!!!
review: Came here with a friend, we had the Shabu Shabu.. They bring out a bowl (your choice) of broth to cook your own food at your table. And your choice of meat, tofu, seafood and veggies to cook.. We ordered a combo with beef, lamb,...More

title: Food was mediocre
review: Best part of the restaurant are the frozen drinks. Food was mediocre, it was served 10 minutes after we ordered (as if it was already cooked and waiting to be served). Water was already sitting on the table and ice was melted, it was so...More

title: Chinatown‚Äôs Most Popular Smoothies
review: Ate at Joy Yee‚Äôs in Chinatown yesterday for lunch. My wife and I split a Thai Basil with Shrimp and Calamari. The place was busy but not crowded. The food was well prepared and served quickly. The calamari was just right. They also have a...More

title: Wonderful smoothies
review: Great variety of food and beverages.  The strawberry kiwi smoothie  with mango poppers was so refreshing.   A great find!

title: Excellent bubble tea!
review: We ate Korean chicken next door and popped in here for a coconut/pineapple bubble tea. I t was delicious and served in a nice re- usable cup.

title: Milk Tea
review: First timers here - I had the Green Milk Tea and my wife had the brown sugar milk tea with tapioca. Now, she wasn't impressed with the tapioca due to the consistency, though the last wasn't bad. I really Iiked it, but my wife was...More

title: Decent Asian food
review: A bit too salty food, but good. They have many dishes to choose from. The portion is huuuge. Love the bubble teas.

title: Satisfying chinese food
review: We had  a great time with the food and the prompt service of the staff. The food was by way excellent from other buffet restaurants we had tasted. Food were cooked just right and tasty. The place was a casual dining but can be packed...More

title: Excellent chinese food
review: Excellent service and excellent taste of chinese cuisine. Absolute try is the eel fried rice. Absolutely recommended. Great tasting Taro Milk Tea too

title: Great place for dinner
review: Spring rolls and chicken chow mein were amazing.  We lucked out and arrived just as a group of people left so we didn't have to wait at all.  Staff was attentive.  Price was reasonable.

title: Great place to eat.
review: It was our first time here and was a great surprise. The food was delicious and the portions are huge.  The service is not the best, but they serve fast.

title: Fantastic!
review: We ate at Joy Yee 2 times during our stay in Chicago. Once with a large group. The food and the prices are great. Would definitely recommend!

title: Great food
review: I went with a group of people and we had food from ordinary (fried rice) to the exotic (cuddle fish) and everyone enjoyed the food. Saying it was the best they ever had. The frozen drinks are delicious, you have to try one.

title: 1st time in Chinatown
review: Great meal in Chinatown.  The smoothies are a must!  We tried a number of entrees and none disappointed.  The staff was great and helpful....although they should have warned us that we ordered way too much food.  Everything tasted great!

title: Awesome bubble tea!!!
review: First visit & we‚Äôre definitely going back. On my- the options for flavors is amazing and the finished product was way more yummy than imagined. I got jasmine bubble tea, kids got mango, strawberry and hubby got taro. Ice cream flavors we got were mango...More

title: Hidden Treasure
review: Wow what an unexpected surprise!! The food was wonderful and the fruit smoothies were excellent!! Prices very reasonable!! Be prepared to eat, they give you plenty!!

title: GREAT FOOD and outstanding value for money
review: Joy Yee was one of our favourite restaurants during our time there. I must have visited this place or ordered from it around 8 times during the 3 weeks I was in Chicago. This place has great food and some of the best boba tea...More

title: Yum-O-Licious Bubble Tea
review: Right in the heart of China Town in Chicago, I went with my daughter to Joy Ye Noodle Shop for what was supposed to be one of the best Bubble Tea places in the city.  Well, it was! Very tasty tea... very refreshing.  I'll be...More

title: Incredible food and hidden treasure!
review: My little cousin found this place while visiting Chicago from Texas and opened my eye's to it. Loved the drinks and food so much I took even more family out to eat there again!

title: Superb shabu shabu!
review: It's hard to get shabu shabu as good as what I had when I lived in Japan but Joy Yee hit the spot!  The portions were huge, the veggies were fresh and the prices were excellent!  Only $25 for the two of us and we...More

title: Huge Servings, but taste of food was disappointing; just go for the drinks
review: Had high hopes for Chitown Chinatown food (having lived out and visited SF Bay Area)...and a lot of locals recommended Joy See's.  Kind of a let down taste wise for many of the dishes.   I'd skip this place for the food, just get the drinks.

title: What's not to like
review: I visited this restaurant with friends from out of town who don't get this kind of food where they live but who are familiar with the food. One of them ordered eight dishes for all five of us and we could not have been more...More

title: Delicious drinks
review: What a great little surprise when you get to china town, it was so refreshing in a nice sunny day we tried couple of different ones like mango freeze with strawberry topping which was the best surprise popping in your mouth  I highly recommend this...More

title: Slow and horrible service
review: The service was really slow and it was terrible. I ordered two chocolate freezes and the waiter came out with one. Then I asked for the second one and it took them forever to bring it out. Also, I was waiting FOREVER for them to...More

title: Lousy Smoothies - - -  No Longer Good
review: We have been patronizing JOY YEE since they opened, their meals are still very  good but we will be searching for a new source for smoothies.  Had a  Pineapple Coconut and it was worst one I ever had. Watery and tasteless and no fresh fruit....More

title: End the meal with a tapioca tea!!
review: One of the busier restaurants in Chicago's Chinatown. Simple seating and atmosphere but that's where simplicity ends. Parking is a pain, public transportation is highly recommended.  Although their food is tasty and well made, you need a good 10 minutes to go through the entire...More

title: Bubble tea destination!
review: We have never ordered food here because this is our bubble tea stop!! Simply delicious! The tapioca balls are house made and fresh. The fruit combinations in the bubble tea are just delicious! We had raspberry, mango, and blueberry mixed bubble tea! We would definitely...More

title: Too many choices
review: As soon as we walked up, I  was overwhelmed by all the different choices to choose from. I really liked the concept and the beverage, but my favorite was the packaging.  I wouldn't buy one again unless someone helped me with ordering.

title: Great place for lunch in Chinatown
review: We had a delicious lunch with only a short wait, very busy, but efficient.  The menu is very big, and it took a bit of time to go through. Everything we ordered was hot and very good.  There is also a very extensive list of...More

title: Great Beverages!
review: We just have beverages at this place:  bubble tea and smoothies from the take out window. I tried the milk bubble tea, just because I heard it was good, having no clue what the "bubbles" were. Well, I soon found out they look like blueberries...More

title: Amazing Smoothies
review: I loved the smoothie that I got there. It was fresh and it looked delicious. I got a strawberry smoothie with strawberry bobo balls. It was absolutely, hands down, the best smoothie I have ever had!

title: Good cheap eats with wide range of Asian foods
review: Chicago features several Joy Yee Noodles, including two in the newer part of Chinatown on S. China Place. Good cheap eats for a range of Asian foods -- Chinese, Vietnamese, Malay, etc. -- and drinks (boba teas, fruit drinks, etc.) in an informal setting with...More

title: I'll take the rest to go!
review: Fast fresh hot and so good.  Menu is overwhelming, but after you decipher it and order you will not be disappointed. Get ready for leftovers also, as the portions are XXXL

title: Awesome lunch!
review: Awesome lunch! The Spicy Thai Beef Salad was delicious. There were several vegetarian options, which my daughter really appreciated. The portions were huge and nicely plated. Server was friendly and the food arrived in a timely manner.

title: Awesome Smoothies!
review: I guess these are called bubble teas, but we enjoyed the fresh fruit smoothies - banana, coconut, custard, large ball tapioca.  Lots and lots of choices, so many we had to go back a few times during our trip.

title: Delish with huge portions
review: Late lunch on a sunny Sunday. Only had to wait 5 minutes for table for our party of 4. Decor bright and simple. The menu is giant and mind boggling. Figuring out the prices was a little tricky but it made it more fun. We...More

title: Lunch
review: Great Asian cuisine,  good serving,  reasonable price, authentic food. Delicious.  It would be nice if the are in every corner,  one is the best place to eat.

title: Smoothly Heaven & Other Delights
review: Wow! They have the largest selection of fresh fruit smoothies with every topping imaginable. Topping galore, add-on's that make the decisions even more difficult. The smoothies are matched by the wonderful selections of food, fast & friendly service and the atmosphere in China town makes...More

title: Early lunch was great time!
review: Very nice place w very courteous service.  We really enjoyed the orange chicken, huge bubble tea'esque menu, and the wonderful Malaysian spicy green bean dish took us back to our China travels!   Overall a delicious experience!

title: Good frozen juices and food
review: First time there and will return if in Chinatown. Nice welcome for the Manager - we have been served quickly. Attentive service we appreciated that. The juices are really good and what to say about the food but its a loot and really tasty. Fresh...More

title: Absolutely amazing!
review: This was my second visit to this wonderful place and it was just as a amazing as the first! I got the Korean beef over rice and it was delicious! I would recommend sharing most of their food unless you have some place to store...More

title: A Little Overrated
review: This place is good, but I think it is a little overrated. It is the most popular restaurant in Chinatown because it is the most American-Chinese restaurant there. It's all good food, and they have great options, and good bubble teas, but there are better...More

title: √Ä great discovery in Chicago's Chinatown!
review: Our hotel's front desk recommended this noodle restaurant which was close by. The place was crowded on this Saturday evening but we didn't have to wait to be seated. We were put in front of a well diversified menu, and we ordered two plates. The...More

title: Great Food!
review: Large portion, to feed 4 people. Been here a few times, and it has always been good. Authentic chinesse food, lots of sea food options. Great natural fruit smoothies.

title: Quick, great food and fruit drinks
review: Sometimes service is average but the food makes up for it always. Honey peppered short ribs are a fave

title: Large portions but flavors nothing special
review: This place was very busy around 2PM on Sunday afternoon. Nonetheless I was quickly seated, and service was overall excellent. There is a massive bubble tea menu and I would probably return to sample other flavors. The black tea wintermelon flavor I got was ok...More

title: Can't wait to go back
review: We were sat right away at 11:30 but there was a line when we were leaving. The food was amazing, I got the cube been rice bowl while my two friends ate the sweet and sour chicken. The portion sizes were pretty big you could...More

title: Good Smoothies and Bubble Tea
review: Joy Yee has the best smoothies and bubble tea in Chinatown.  They have a huge drink menu and use fresh ingredients, lots of fruit choices.  My favorite is the Mango Freeze and second would be the Taro Red Bean Freeze.  The line is long but...More

title: Top 3 All Time Favorite spots in my life.
review: I've visited this chain 3 times total and 2 different locations.  I've never had anything better as far as Asain cuisine.  The Mongolian Beef over rice,  Korean Beef stone bowl and the Chicken Thai Basil over fried rice are all will be hard for me...More

title: Good food! Great bubble drinks!

title: Great bubble tea
review: This place had an amazing assortment of bubble tea. It's hard to choose. The food was good. Been coming here for years and it hasn't disappointed me yet.

title: Delicious Chinese Food

title: Very delicious!
review: Varieties of Asian food. The service was quick. Less than 3 minutes after sitting down, a server has come up and asked for your order. Food was good and fresh. The dumpling tasted almost similar with those found in restaurants in Hong Kong. Good value,...More

title: Shabulicious!

title: Always A Great Taste
review: I've never been disappointed at eating here so many dishes time choose from always a great dish.  The place dies get really busy on weekends so plan your trip here.  Bubble tea selection is awesome too.

title: Experimental Tea and Pork Chops Asian Style:
review: Flavor of Food was quite Tasty: The Shrimp needed a little Help: The Service was Fast and The place was Constantly Busy! A lot of Staff to Meet The Needs of The Customer! Great Place to have s Mid Evening Snack! This meal was a...More

title: Nice place for noodles
review: I can't remember exactly what we ordered, noodles in broth with vegis and chicken and a mango drink with tapioca balls. Serving was large enough for two and very tasty. Fast service. I would eat here again.

title: Bubble Tea Review Only

title: Drink order only

title: Enjoy Tinley Park location more.
review: Long wait for food, unsure if my wife's order was filled correctly. Very busy place in a  good location.

title: Fresh and delicious
review: The very best Chinese food in the city. Fresh, authentic and good service. Large portions and reasonably priced. Extensive menu. For some reason their Evanston location is not very good but this original Chinatown location is Fantastic!

title: A quick & easy place to get Chinese take out
review: This place is always crowded with long lines waiting for a table.  We needed a quick & easy take out dinner. Our order was ready in 20 mins.  We ordered the Singaporean-style fried rice noodles, beef-satay chow fun, and chicken & pineapple fried rice.  There...More

title: If you are already in Chinatown why eat here?
review: If you are already in Chinatown why would you want to eat at the McDonald's of Asian food? I eat at their Evanston location because there's no other good asian restaurants in the area. But within Chinatown, go explore and try authentic Chinese restaurants instead...More

title: Nice lunch, better bubble tea!
review: I have been to Joy Yee a number of times and have yet to be let down. I particularly like their salted fish fried rice. At times the food could be a little too oily however. I like their bubble tea the best especially the...More

title: Nice place if you're not hungry
review: Went here on a Friday night.  A $5 Uber ride from Chicago Hilton (many of the Chinatown restaurants are in the same general area.). From the window, the sight of families dipping their vegetables and beef into a bubbling broth appealed to us, so we...More

title: Going downhill
review: I always go to Joy Yee every time I visit Chicago, unfortunately the quality is going downhill with every visit, especially after they moved to this bigger place several years ago. This time around I ordered the pineapple fried rice. It was so so, but...More

title: Consistently Good!

title: Excellent Hot Pot
review: It was a very cold Chicago day, so a friend from Shanghai suggested we go for Hot Pot which I had never had before. Everything was excellent, we shared the combination beef hot pot, more than enough for two people. Make sure you try the...More

title: Cool and Refreshing

title: Love this place!!
review: They have a fantastic menu of Asian Fusion food.  Plenty of choices on drinks.  Menu has pictures so even if one is not familiar with the appearance of the dish, at least there is a picture to go by. My family had visited this place...More

title: Love this place in Chinatown!
review: The restaurant is very big and open and the decor is fun with bright yellow chairs and white tables. There are so many things on the menu that the menu itself is huge! We ordered a variety of things including the orange tofu for our...More

title: amazing food, big portions
review: The food is great best orange chicken.  The amount they give you is large.  They have quick service.  The smoothies are great

title: Stuffed but Oh so good.
review: Joy Yee is one busy place you'll understand why.  The menu is huge with so many good choices, you can eat the pictures.  The noodle soup is what most are after, but the rice and noodle dishes are also excellent.  Try the Mango Avocado Soft...More

title: Menu is huge
review: The menu offers a wide variety of options, but there are so many choices it is very difficult to determine what to order. The lemon shrimp was good, but it came with a mayonnaise based lemon sauce which was heavy and needed some soy sauce...More

title: Great food and service
review: In the heart of Chinatown, really great shabu shabu restaurant. The beef and scallops were fresh and served with your choice of broth. I loved the variety of fresh vegetables and the price for all of this was very reasonable.

title: Great tea/smoothies
review: If you're looking for a good Chinese tea or fruit smoothie, you must go to Joy Yee's.  There is no question about the freshness because they serve so many drinks that they have to keep fresh fruit in stock.

title: BEWARE: Servings are HUGE
review: Overwhelming menu (got everything) and you want everything you want to eat.  So you start ordering some beef, chicken, appetizer, fried rice.  Let's just say the fried rice container was the same length as our table. The noodle dish is big enough to feed a...More

title: Best for Bubble Tea
review: The food here is average but there is a large menu with lots of pictures.  This is a good place to take friends when you can't decide what kind of Chinese to eat and who are not as adventurous in their consumption of Chinese food....More

title: Bubble tea
review: Yum yum!  We had the mango milk bubble tea!  The best one we have ever had!  The tapioca pearls were great!  Chewy but not slimy!  And the flavor was bold and fresh.  Just great!  Everyone seemed to be ordering the bubble tea.

title: Milk tea
review: Like their milk tea w/ tapioca. But little bit pricey compare to Chinatown in Flashing, New York. And sometimes the line is so long to wait for more than 15 mins.

title: First Visit
review: A friend wanted to take us to a restaurant in Chinatown but it was closed. He recommended this one. It was very good. We were seated right away and given menus. It is a BIG menu so I went with the standard meal. The order...More

title: After 20 years I am done
review: I have been going here since the 90's and today was the last time.  Order Just chicken Pad Thai and it was horrible!  They raised there prices and now put tons of cabbage into it.  I took one bite and it was sooo spicy.  Won't...More

title: My first visit
review: My oldest daughter took me her for a lunch date the food was great, the service was good and the prices were better than most. my favorite new spot to eat

title: An experience!
review: I don't usually give 5 star reviews unless I am truly impressed, Joy Yee earned it's 5 star review. The service was not impressive, we waited to give our order and to get our check, but the refills came quick and the staff were friendly....More

title: Really unique
review: This is a great place for having noodles with multiple option. The hot pot is really good. They also have some unique drinks. They do not serve alcohol. Service is fast and efficient. Portions are generous.

title: Chinatown and Navy Pier trip
review: This is the 4th Joy Yee restaurant we visited. The food is great and those fruit freeze that my kids love to ordered was awesome. The fruits were really fresh. There were a lot of foods selection, seafood, beef, pork, chicken and vegetables. You can...More

title: Bubble Tea Drinks is only reason people go here
review: been to this restaturant many times, due to friends/family who wanted bubble tea........ drinks,,,about $ 5... lots of sugar.... many variety... almost a meal itself......my guess is reason every goes here............... food..... very average....... price is on par with other chinese food.......they have great looking/attractive...More

title: Yummy Yummy!
review: My kids chose to eat here while walking around Chinatown because it was so bright. It wasn't busy when we got there but shortly after sitting down it started filling up. My boys chose what smoothies they wanted and tried their first boba and were...More

title: GREAT PLACE !
review: I was in Chicago end of October for a convention at McCormick Place. We found this nice restaurant in Chinatown - a 10 minutes walk. Clean restaurant, nice colours, very inviting. It was so good we went 2 days in a row. Big portions, small...More

title: love this place
review: I love the food here. I have been here a few times now. I like the stone bowls. But all the food is good.

title: Very good, portions, taste and price!
review: I was there twice, very good food,big portions, amazing tapioca smoothies, definitely will come back! Even though the service sometimes can be not so attentive, but u can bear with that.

title: First Visit!
review: I did research on this place and its very popular for their drinks, now I see why! A big size for your money, and tons of flavors to choose from!

title: Smoothie and Thai Food
review: First time going to this place and their smoothies (strawberry bananas, mango pineapple and mango peach) as well as the shrimp pad Thai and chicken fried rice were amazing. The place is very clean and the service was okay but the restaurant was full. Overall a great place right in the heart of china town

title: Huge Menu...Almost Too Much!
review: If you haven't been to Joy Yee's, then you're missing out. You have to go at least once. They have a gigantic pan-Asian menu. They have Japanese, Korean, and mainly Chinese food etc. etc. In addition to that, they have a ginormous smoothie menu. There are so many flavors to choose from, it's just overwhelming! The only issue I have is that, for the smoothies, some of them contain milk, which I'm unfortunately allergic too. I asked them if they can substitute that using soy milk, but they didn't have any. I know a LOT of Asian people who are lactose intolerant as well, so I was surprised that they didn't have soy milk. There was a coffee freeze that I wanted to try, but I couldn't get it because it had milk :(

title: I went twice in one week!
review: The food was great. I went generic and got the chicken pad thai, which was delicious and I had enough leftovers for two more meals. The staff was very friendly and accommodating......and I was with my one year old and two other one year olds and their moms. The best part about this place and why I went back is their smoothies, frozen drinks. My son and I LOVE them. Fresh fruit, ice blended....and you can add pearls or do all sorts of combinations of favors. The menu for these drinks is quite extensive. My favorite is coconut, banana and pineapple. I'm craving it just typing it! And they have a side window if you want to walk up and just order the drinks and not go inside the restaurant. Love this place!

title: bustling with energy
review: From the sidewalk, this restaurant provided a great deal of interest from the people and food inside. The all glass walls allows for easy viewing. We had to give it a try while we were wandering around Chinatown. The service was attentive, competent, and friendly. The fruit smoothies were delicious, and the food was beautifully presented and tasted like very good Chinese food. The menu had Asian recipes from Korea, Vietnam, Thailand, and many other places. Someone nearby ordered the Whole Red Snapper - it was upright on plate. That was weird looking...I couldn't have eaten that, but my shrimp and pork chop rice meal was tasty.

title: have a bubble tea, skip the food
review: the choices in bubble tea for strolling around Chinatown are fabulous. be aware that they are always busy and it is noisy. it was difficult to order. the night we were there, everyone's tea was being blended with ice, no matter what.the food wasn't great, quite bland and tasted like Asian from the mall. eat there if you have to. it did look cleaner than most of the other places in Chinatown.

title: Best place ever!!!
review: The best Chinese place in Chinatown! The best food, serving portions & best of all - their bubble tea! They have a huge selection of dishes to choose from. The bubble teas are made with real fruit- absolutely the best drinks! Love Joy Yee's!

title: So glad we found it
review: New to the area and didn't know where to start in Chinatown, and so glad we found this place! Modern, clean, amazing fast service and fantastic flavors! We will be going back for sure.

title: Kid Friendly
review: We always eat here when the kids are with (16 year old and 8 year old). The little one loves the beef dumplings and the sweet and sour chicken (which really, how hard is that to mess up). The love the bubble teas (smoothies), and aren't very adventurous, but always good. (Usually watermelon, or mango). I like that they will split it into two cups as they are too big for the 8 year old to finish. I love the mango fried rice. But honestly, everything we have is good. Very casual atmosphere which is why it's so great for kids. Well worth the stop.

title: Great food - Endless drink choices
review: The drink menu is a little intimating - 4 pages of choices but all were great!  My favorite the Strawberry with the strawberry popping bobbas.  Food was great as well.  Easy parking also.  A must try if visiting Chicago China Town, you won't be disappointed

title: Must try the bubble tea here
review: The bubble tea choices are endless. We got strawberry and strawberry banana. Both were very good. Had dinner here and ordered tomato beef, pad thai, thai basil fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, teriyaki chicken and spicy green beans. all were good. portions are big so we didn't finish even with 7 people. we'll be coming back again next time we are in chinatown.

title: The best restaurant in China Town
review: Joy Yee's is a destination restaurant in China Town with several other locations scattered throughout the city. Every time we go to Chicago , Joy Yee's is on our list of places we must go. First of all, they are known for their bubble teas....More

title: Refreshing bubble tea
review: After our dimsum brunch, we walked to Joy Yee and ordered different flavors of milk bubble tea: mango, papaya and green tea.  All tasted yummy and refreshing after a hot day.  And almost everybody around Chinatown were sipping a tall glass of Joy Yee cold...More

title: Made my day!
review: All staff was friendly, we ordered 2 dishes and an app and were so full we could hardly walk out. Portions are quite large! food was delicious! And the mango tapioca drink was terrific (gf said it was just like the drink from home in...More

title: Shabu shabu is great
review: We ordered two shabu shabu, one seafood and one beef (fei niu). Both are very good. The seafood is pretty fresh from frozen. The octopus legs on a stick is really good too! Their milk teas were taste, I tried taro milk tea and my...More

title: Decent shabu-shabu in Chicago's Chinatown
review: Shabu-shabu is a Japanese hot pot meal that is very enjoyable - cooked at the table, adding various meats, vegetables, seafood and noodles to a boiling broth. Having eaten it in a number of places in Japan, and in California cities with major Japanese populations,...More

title: Seafood Tonkotsu Ramen
review: The seafood ramen soup can be a warm comfort food on a cold February day.  The soup has right amount of spice and served piping hot. The portion is generous and the service is quick and friendly. On a previous visit, I have tried the...More

title: Love this place!
review: Always eat here whenever I am in Chicago.  Love their food and desserts.  The wait is long at time, but it's worth it!

title: worth the trip to Chicago just for this
review: Bustling, Asian fusion diner located in the heart of Chinatown Square.  Bright cheerful decor and extraordinarily popular with Chinese and non-Chinese alike.  We had the excellent jumbo Vietnamese noodle soup (pho) bowl which they say serves 4-6, but it's more like 6-8.  Shrimp tempura was...More

title: Love me some Joy Yee!!
review: Though I am a super picky eater and not at all adventurous when it comes to food, I agreed to go here to satisfy my family's desire for more unusual fare. Didn't expect it to become my fave place to eat in Chicago!! I wish...More

title: Quick and delicious meal
review: This is my third visit and I plan to keep going back! It is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago that is affordable. We are always seated quickly even on a weekend and the food comes out quickly too. The entrees are huge so...More

title: Classic
review: Not a bad pit stop for having assorted Asian cuisine and relaxing with refreshing bubble tea.   The bubble tea here never disappoints. Sizes are significant, and I'd like to think they use real fruit. My friends and I usually frequent Joy Yee's more for the...More

title: Quick service and huge variety
review: Our family goes to eat here about every 2 to 3 months.  Their menu is probably the biggest menu I've ever seen so variety is not a problem.  We do tend to order the same food though just because I know the kids will eat...More

title: Good Eats in Chinatown
review: The noodles were wonderful and enough for two.   Wife had something with ox tails and I had a curry Pad Thai ... awesome Great smoothies!!! Completed the trip with a water taxi ride back to Mich Ave ... very good outing indeed.

title: Big Portions and Great Drinks

title: This is a family tradition! Every time we come to Chicago, we eat here!
review: I really enjoy the food here. Lots of people get bubble tea here, but personally I think they make it too sweet. But I don't come for that! I come for the variety of good food. We always get different plates, but we always order...More

title: Worth trying.
review: Been to this and Naperville location. Reliably good. Some dishes are favorites including Salt and Pepper tofu Japanese-style, Malaysian fish, Szechuan green beans, and mango chicken. The smoothies are very good and large. I don't like their asparagus as it is cut to thick and...More

title: Bubble Tea Center
review: Lunch was an uncrowded affair in this eating place in the Chinatown Mall. We have been here many times with friends for the eclectic variety of dishes offered, and for the reasonable prices. The food we ordered was more starchy than usual, but the wait...More

title: Joy Yee Experience
review: The resturant is located in Chinatown Square in Chicago. The resturant provides an expansive food selection. The selection is awesome. The food is excellent. I would eat here again anytime. I would recommend this resturant if you want a wide variety of food selection, great...More

title: Great place for a someone who doesn't like Asian food

title: So many choices!

title: must visit

The Bubble teas which are juice combinations with tapioca balls incuded are made from fresh ingredients and truly outstanding.  The atmospherenis loud...More

title: Terrible quality

title: Something for everyone

title: Great place to eat!
review: This is a must stop for us while in Chicago. The service is fast, food is excellent and so are the prices! We came mid afternoon this time and got a seat by the window. It was nice to I relook the street while enjoying...our entrees.More

title: Excellent Dim sum
review: The shrimp dim sum and salt and pepper eggplant were awesome!  Could have just made tjat my dinner! Service was quick and food fresh.

title: Delicious dim sum
review: My 14 y.o. son and I stayed at the Jasline Hotel and decided to walk around Chinatown to check it out. We felt like having dim sum, so after looking up reviews, we found Triple Crown, which was VERY close to our hotel. We came...on a weekday and were seated right away. We were seated next to the window and had a great view of the community center.  We marked what we wanted on the paper menu and the waiter came and confirmed our order. I think there was maybe one item that was not available that day. In any case, the food was made fresh and delivered to our table when it was ready. I was really impressed with the quality and the freshness. All of the dim sum dishes we ordered were tasty and when the bill was totaled, we were able to see what items we ordered (in English and Chinese) and how much each item cost. I really liked the receipts being so user-friendly. In many Chinese restaurants, everything is hand tallied with Chinese writing and you don't know what anything means (unless you are able to read Chinese). The total bill was surprisingly less than what I had anticipated, so I was very pleased.  I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely go again the next time I am in Chicago.More

title: Good Chinese food!
review: We ate there twice and the waitress recognized us the second time we ate.  We saw the Original Triple Crown restaurant just a short distance away but didn't go there because the Triple Crown we ate at was so good.

title: Excellent food!
review: This place is great! Very reasonable prices for dim sum and everything was absolutely delicious! I will totally come back!

title: Shrimp rolls heaven
review: Ordered a lot - their signature dumplings, the shrimp and chive dumpling, shanghai soup dumpling and the shrimp rolls and their kungpao chicken and egg rolls we had a very satisfying dinner.   It is a holiday weekend, Saturday and we thought 4:30pm would be early...enough‚Ä¶we had to wait for 15 minutes to get seated but when we left - there was a long line of people waiting to get in.   We ordered shrimp rolls for take out too üëç.More

title: Great dim sum
review: I have visited the restaurant several times over the years and it is my GO TO place in Chicago. They make the dim sum from scratch, so it is never overdone.

title: Excellent dimsum!
review: Braised chicken feet was the best we've had although scallop & shrimp dumplings, chive & shrimp dumplings, and congee were also very good. Bathroom was fairly clean and service was quick. Reasonable prices.

title: Tried to clone my credit card
review: Food was good, however when paying, they asked for PIN number, which of course I did not give, Then found out later that they had tried to use it on line for Chinese retailer

title: best Dim Sum so far
review: I stopped by here at night and it was great. Lots of options and easy menu. Service was ok, but when food arrived I was very happy. Good seafood great buns. Would love to visit again next time im in Chicago.

title: Excellent
review: We ordered many different things...everything was nothing short of excellent.  My son tried things he has never tried before (which is a feat) and he loved everything.

title: Good dinner

title: Had it all

title: Good Dim Sum
review: Had Dim Sum for lunch. Expansive menu, very reasonable prices, efficient service.  Overall a good experience, the eggplant dish and the BBQ pork buns were especially delicious.

title: Dim Sum

title: Great Place to come and have dim sum
review: Great Place to come and have dim sum.  You order from a picture menu which helps you with what you are ordering so all dishes arrive to your table hot not sitting around.  Reasonably priced about 15 bucks for generous portions each

title: Dim sum
review: After Chinese New year parade had to have dim sum. Good variety, great quality and tasty. Great service and quite inexpensive. Recommended.

title: We had a good lunch here
review: A girls weekend with no agenda and we decided to stroll around China town and grab lunch. It was hard to pick a restaurant- some looked dirty, others had no customers and some had dishes too exotic for us. We decided that Triple Crown would...More

title: Excellent, authentic dim sum
review: The food was awesome! As good as in Chinatown New York City! Mostly Asian customers; traditional big round tables- so much fun to get all kinds of dishes, put them on the lazy Susan and share family style. Finger licking good! Definitely will be back...More

title: Good Dim Sum place
review: We're looking for the dim sum place in Chinatown and we saw this one which closed to the parking lot. It's good choice with fresh and tasty dishes. The price was better than we expected it.

title: Good food and huge portions too!
review: Definitely plan to return to the Triple Crown again.  Excellent tasting food.  Loved the lemon chicken.  I would go back just for that dish.  We can't find it as good from the typical Chinese take out near home.  And we have tried a few hoping...More

title: Very affordable
review: Came here on a Friday night with a few friends while visiting Chicago. We had a dim sum dinner. Very affordable for a group. The shrimp and corn dumpling was my favorite, the shrimp and chives not so much. The custard bun was very sweet-...More

title: Excellent dim sum
review: Lively dim sum place. Like all dim sum in any Chinatown, be assertive and ask for things, especially the dumplings. TIP: BE WILLING TO SIT WITH OTHERS AND YOU'LL GET IN ASAP! Here, the server advised us to order certain dim sum to ensure we...More

title: A nice, affordable eat
review: Worth the visit and the food was alright. Would visit again. The dumplins were the best of the lot, just dont ask to use their toilet.

title: They say you always remember the food at your wedding...
review: Triple Crown catered our wedding and 2 years later this is still the best Chinese food/wedding food that any of our guests and us have ever had!! Spencer Ng created a menu that was diverse yet agreeable for all 200 of our guests.  A lot...More

title: Chinese food in Chinatown
review: I truly like their dim sum menu (served also for dinner) and the rest of the menu. Portions are huge

title: First Disappointing Chinatown Meal

title: Good Food, decent service
review: We arrived well past the lunch hour, but service was super slow.  Maybe due to us being in a corner instead of on the open main floor.  Regardless.  Took a long time to get water, refills, food, etc.  Food was spectacular though!  Honestly some of...More

title: Excellent food, mediocre service!
review: I was visiting my cousins in Chicago and they took me to TCR for dinner because of the delicious food. The food was indeed tasty, and of good quality. The orange chicken was excellent and my favorite dish was the shrimp and chives dumplings!  However,...More

title: Best ‚ÄúYum Cha ‚Äú in town!
review: Very tasty dim sum- complete with the moving carts through the restaurant during weekends so you can order by pointing to your favorite items. Have enjoyed this tradition in many cities- Triple Crown is among the most authentic! Yum!

title: A mixed opinion
review: The dim sum is excellent. Stop there. The other dishes are ordinary, and portions are far too large.   This is a highly rated venue. What does this say about the quality of Chinese food in Chicago.

title: Authentic Chinese
review: Really neat place. Definately felt authentic. Lots of locals dining there. Food was good. It was a neat experience

title: Great food, nice view of Chinatown Gate
review: We visit Chinatown annually in the summer. Of all of our meals over the last several years, this was the best.  Clean, comfortable restaurant (good A/C on a 100 degree day!). Dim sum menu was very easy to navigate and understand so that we didn't...More

title: Devoid of all flavor
review: You know really good dim sum? The kind where you bite into the dumpling and you get an explosion of juice and flavor? Well, you won't find that here. The dim sum here is utter crap: sticky, dry and no flavor whatsoever. Maybe I am...More

title: Traditional Chinatown Dim Sum (and all that entails)
review: Totally hit the spot for our dim sum craving.  Triple Crown is a traditional dim sum parlor (reminds me of China Pearl back home in Boston) with a variety of carts, but they also will take orders for specific items.  This helps with a big...More

title: Chinatown late night!
review: So nice to have late night options when craving Chinese,in most cities Chinese restaurants are the first to end their business day leaving Chinese food lovers frustrated and hungry! So that being said even mediocre Chinese food is good when available this late at night,this...More

title: Great food!

title: Dim Sum Feast

title: Wandering The China Road

title: Ask for help if you are unfamiliar! Be ready to try new things.

title: A Cultural Experience for Us!

title: LOTS of options, choose this one first!
review: Dim sum here is great. They have a traditional full menu as well. Menu is accessible for both, and value is great across the board. Recommend going in a group to enjoy the full experience. One of my go to spot in Chinatown.

title: Good dinner

title: Great for groups!
review: I fell I love with the green beans here. The dim sum is also fantastic. A great place to gather with grooms family style for a very affordable price. Fun experience for the kids also.

title: Look elsewhere

title: Entertaining a Guest
review: Let me start by saying we went there at an off time.  2:30 PM.  Egg Drop soup would have been very good if it was warm.  After sending it back, it was only 1 degree warmer.  Pu Pu platter appetizer nothing special at all.  Seafood...More

title: Wow, what a great experience!

title: Great Experience!

title: Food is cheap but not up to standard

title: Solid Chinese Restaurant
review: Every time we come to Chicago, we try to make an effort to come here.  It does not disappoint.  Food is good, service is efficient and friendly.

title: So-so

title: Dim Sum
review: Came here and had a lovely Sunday Dim Sum meal with friends. All the food came out quickly and together which was nice. The service was not good with tea refills though which we didn't care for. Overall it was a great experience for a...More

title: Was good, fast service
review: The waitstaff were efficient, friendly and helpful. The food was brought out in a very timely manner. We each enjoyed our meals. For some it was our second time and a first. We will definitely come again.

title: A good choice among the many Chinatown has to offer

title: Happy with our choice in Chinatown!

title: Great Chinese food in Chicago

title: Grandkids summer visit 2017

title: Not bad
review: The popular spot in China Town. Had trouble communicating with waitress, but food was good. Even my children enjoyed it. Hot tea didn't have any flavor though.

I'm in love with your restaurant and your food!!! My also recommendation to try - Golden duck- it's just simply great!!!!!...More

title: Great experience!

title: Good Food, Questionable Service

title: Crowded and Popular Dim-Sum Place - Validates Parking

title: Great food needs better customer service
review: Great food! Service is not as friendly and not bilingual (English). The food is fresh. Done at ordering. Need friendly customer service and more bilingual staff. Most only speak Chinese.

title: Wonderful Dim Sum!!

title: Excellent food and drink
review: Went here with my family and had excellent dim sum and drinks.  Will definitely come back again!  The buns and General Tsao with the Lucky Buddha beer is a winner.

title: lots of food - not a lot of smiles!
review: We went here looking for traditional dim sum and some proper Chinese food.  We hadn't booked - just headed for Chinatown and picked a place at random so it was good that we were sat down immediately at a window seat - to be fair,...More

title: New favorite dim sum

title: Lunch specials run until 3
review: My niece and I went to the art institute and then here for a late lunch to take in a bit of culture.  Took an UBER for about $5.  Since it was a cooler day the .50 pot of tea tasted good upon arrival.  You...More

title: 'Chinese food in abundance'

title: Enjoyed the Dim Sum

title: Disappointed
review: We recently lunched at Triple Crown.  While the service was good, the food was just so-so.   We ordered from the dim sum, lunch, and dinner menus.  The dim sum items were the tastiest and freshest. The other dishes were rather gloppy and tasteless.     We won't...More

title: A real nice online order
review: On estimate time of delivery ! Still warm, Food was nice like it should be ! Tasted real good ! A total yes !

title: Fast and friendly

title: Great Dim Sum and Noodles
review: I went late afternoon on a Monday. You order off a dim sum menu with pictures and they make everything fresh. The different dishes were very good to excellent. I also had the Triple Crown special crispy fried thin noodles with seafood, which was fantastic....More

title: Dim Sum
review: Stopped in here on a whim.  The atmosphere was friendly, the food was great.  The servers were very helpful as we tried to decide which options to try.  We loved everything!

title: Chinatown in Chicago
