title: Deliciious Dim Sum But Sanitary Concerns
review: Located on the second second floor, the restaurant is hugh. This was our first visit in four years. We had nine people in our party and did not have to wait. We enjoyed their Dim Sum because of the tasty choices and the large number...More

title: An evening in Chinatown
review: For someone coming from Toronto, we found the food and service exceeding our expectations. This is definitely a spot we would visit when we are back in the city.

title: Very interesting lunch experience....
review: I was at this restaurant with a group of folks from a university with which I volunteer.  We were in Chicago for a conference.  There were several of us and a couple of folks had some food allergies/intolerances.  The wait staff at the Triple Crown...More

title: Dim sum for breakfast
review: I was a bit skeptical about going to a dim sum restaurant for breakfast, especially since I was going by myself. My previous experience of dim sum had involved wait staff pushing little trays with various offerings, and I was concerned there would be too...More

title: Very tasty
review: Dined solo here on tasty dum sum as starters and stir fried prawns for main. Good portion sizes and free hot green tea.

title: Chinatown
review: The restaurant is located on the 2nd floor of the building. Hidden & don't miss it. Dim sun & small plates appropriate for sharing.  Lunch menu has pictures with familiar selections.  Affordable & comfortable. Food comes out hot, perfectly prepared & presented

title: Dim Sum Deluxe!
review: Wonderful dim sum traditionally prepared and served.  With all of the dim sum places available in Chinatown it is hard to decide where to go.  This one was recommended to me and I found it highly enjoyable as well as reasonably priced.

title: Great Food.....
review: My wife and I walked from the Hyatt to Chinatown for dinner and found the Triple Crown Restaurant to be a pleasant surprise. Enjoyed the soft shell crab and clam soup. The walk was an easy 30 minute walk to Chinatown. Plenty to of meals...More

title: Disappointed

title: Good food, terrible service (food=5 stars, service=1 star, average is 3 stars)
review: I am not a dim sum expert. In fact I've only had it twice - both times at this restaurant (but 8 years apart). My teenage sons, friend, and I went to Triple Crown after a day of Chicago sightseeing. We waited about 10 minutes...More

title: A new experience for us - our worst dim sum ever had...

title: Delightful dim sum

title: Authentic and delicious
review: Had shrimp dumplings, fried sticky rice and fried curry octopus. All very authentic tastes and good.

title: Dim Sum at its best!
review: We decided to change our to go place in Chinatown and tried this one , and glad we did! Dim Sum carts fill your eyes and appetite as you can choose which plate to order, with the option of a la carte also. We tried...More

title: Aweful service, terrible food!
review: The reviews were all pretty good, so we thought we would venture out to Chinatown for dinner while on our visit to Chicago.  It was a little later (8:30) in the evening, on Sunday, but the place still had a good crowd.  We had two...More

title: Great Dim Sum!
review: We really enjoyed Dim Sum for lunch here - the picture menu made all the difference (having had Dim Sum other places and not knowing what we were getting!)   Our kids (5 & 7) enjoyed what we ordered as well and tried everything! We had...More

title: Best Dim Sum in Chinatown
review: Triple Crown has the best dim sum in Chinatown (although I think the best in the city is Furama in Uptown). Triple Crown's menu is quite extensive with standard dim sum prices. The service was prompt and the atmosphere comparable to many of the restaurants....More

title: Looks better than is
review: This looks like a classier Chinese joint in china town, from outside has menu and two floors. go inside and nice waiting area, clean with lights and u go up stairs to give name and sit/eat. Not as large as u think. Has neat chair...More

title: Authentic food, cooked to perfection.
review: This restaurant is first class. the food is outlandishly good, and honestly not that expensive. You get these huge plates of food, so be prepared to take some home, or share. The staff is wonderful, the service fast. This is a must stop every time...More

title: dim sum and more
review: We ordered a few dim sum, noodle, seafood dishes and congee. Everything exceeded my expectations! Authentic food and great service. Food came out really quickly too. Next time in Chicago, I would definitely come back here again.

title: Big restaurant with large selection
review: Dim Sum and all your Chinese favorites are here for your dining pleasure. It's located on the 2nd floor. The large windows offer great views of Chinatown while you eat. Service was fast and friendly. The food was tasty and served in big portions.

title: Mixed bag
review: Went on a Sunday at 2pm, the place was about half full.  You have the option of eating from the carts or ordering from the picture menu. Service was excellent, most employees spoke good English. The food we got from the carts must have been...More

title: Generous portions

title: Over All Very Good Chinese Food
review: This place looks like it hasn't changed in decades, because it has not. The place is outdated and does not have great ambiance which is okay with me because I am here for the great food coming out of the kitchen. They make soups with...More

title: Dim sum and then some
review: We visited on a Sunday and there were dim sum carts aplenty going around! It has many tables, but is also very popular as there aren't too many restaurants in Chinatown. We ordered off the menu and enjoyed what we had. We were able to...More

title: What a fun meal in Chinatown
review: A true Dim Sum experience where each dish is brought out in bamboo steamers and placed on the lazy susan table top.  The half duck was also perfect and full of flavor.  An extensive and almost intimidating menu but each item was perfectly cooked and...More

title: disgusting!
review: the food here is terrible! you ask for some sweet and sour chicken, and the chicken comes so sweet that it looks like a desert. the cleaning is terrible, the crabs stays beside the bathrooms. terrible waitress too. i won't come back here.

title: Dim Sum all day
review: I was looking to get Dim Sum while in Chicago and came across this place.  I have to say the food was very average,  The taste was OK, but nothing exciting.    The servers were wonderful and attentive.  You sit down with a sheet of paper...More

title: Christmas Delight!
review: Had a most delicious lunch at Triple Crown on Christmas Day.  Started off with three types of Dim Sum, each of which was so tasty!  Then had two types of lobster as our main entree, and again each was delicious!! We also had pulled noodles...More

title: Tasty Dim Sum

title: Solid dim sum
review: This was good solid dim sum.  They had a wide menu but were missing a few dishes we normally would have gotten.   The servers bring the dishes around frequently.  But we did order half our dishes as they had a limited selection. The sticky rice...More

title: Go for the Dim Sum!

title: Genuine Chinese Experience

title: Average food. Nice service
review: Nothing fancy. But not bad.  Price was above average because they tried to be gourmet. If you look closely, you'll notice that they cook cheap food very well.

title: OK for dim sum

title: So good

title: Family Dinner
review: Outstanding service, really good food, three people $ 50 plus doggy bag, lots of people that I like. No drinks just tea. Highly recommend for a family gathering.

title: Summing up Dim Sum

title: Great food
review: Always come here. One of my favorite restaurant in Chinatown. Good food, great service! I highly recommend this place!

title: Fantastic meal
review: This was a terrific meal....we ordered 9 dim sum, a mix of dumplings, pork buns, sesame balls,  eggplant, and other things. Plus fried rice and Chinese broccoli  for 4 of us, ended up with leftovers. Best Chinese  food since we were in China. Fresh and...More

title: Not great but not terrible

title: Food second only to Shanghai itself
review: Some of the best chinese food in chicago. I've been to china several time and this food is very authentic. The menu is almost too big to grasp. Staff speak very little english (which ads to the atmosphere), but are very friendly.

title: Consistently good and great view

title: Very good dim sum in Chinatown

title: Awesome dim sum
review: Great dim sum for the family, and very reasonably priced.  There were 10 of us, and they got us right in.  The waitress didn't speak English so well, so communication was an issue, but it was easily overcome.  She couldn't have been more accommodating.  We...More

title: Horrible customer service

title: A Must in Chicago Chinatown

title: Best Chinese Meal I have ever had
review: Our group of 8 had a reservation and they were excited to greet us.  They seated us at a round table which was perfect.  Drinks were good and reasonably priced.  Our group ordered several entrees and shared, it was way too much food, but all...More

title: Good sober, amazing when drunk

title: Best Dim Sum in china town!
review: My husband and I live in Michigan but frequent the city every weekend . Triple crown is our absolute favorite. When we have visitors in the city we make sure to always take them to China town to experience dim sum ! Very fast, reasonably...More

title: Great Dim Sum at a Good Price

title: Great price and great service
review: First visit after being referred by the locals. Great service and portions exceeded my expectations. Very reasonable prices and the food was high quality. We would definitely visit again. The view was nice too.

title: Best din sum outside of HongKong
review: Wonderful flavorful small bits of fabulous!  Sweet, savory, fried, steamed, all tasty and hot right from the cart.  Even a picture menu if you need.  Quick service...lines out the door but waits are only 10-15 minutes!  Go "yum cha" and enjoy.

title: If I go to Chinatown I dine at Triple Crown

title: Christmas dinner!

title: Massive Portions!!! Excellent Chinese & Dim Sum

title: Great Dim Sum
review: We enjoy Dim Sum often and the Triple Crown was right up there with New York and San Francisco  Chinatown style Dim Sum. The quality of ingredients was very good and they were always hot, which is sometimes not the case if they have been...More

title: Maybe it was an off day

title: Great Dim Sum
review: The food was great, lots of variety, nice setting. I would go back when back in Chicago. We had sticky rice, eggplant and various dumplings with shrimp and pork and a sweet water chestnut. It was all very good. The servers were nice. It is...More

title: Maybe not our day?

title: It's the same thing as back home...

title: Great Dim Sum
review: I was sight seeing in Chinatown & decided to stop by & grabbed lunch. This restaurant is located upstairs & it's a banquet style venue. The food is very good but I especially loved the dim sum. Very hot & fresh even though it was...More

title: Great Lunch
review: Stopped in for lunch with a colleague while working a show at McCormick. We absolutely loved it. Very attentive staff. Great food. Tried about 10 different little plates. All fantastic.

title: Cilantro/Lemongrass City!

title: You'll leave wanting more

title: Great Dim Sum !!
review: Excellent food located in Chinatown, Chicago!  Clean, great service and fresh food.   Will visit this establishment again!

title: Foods and prices are great, but extremely unfriendly service

title: awesome

title: Very good

title: Triple Fun

title: delicious Dim Sum!
review: Our first stop on the Chicago Food Planet Chinatown tour.  Learned about dim sum and how to order.  Tasted delicious small portions of several different dim sum...amazing flavors! Can't wait to go back!

title: I must have gone on a bad day...

title: Good Food and Service
review: I was extremely hungry and wanted to eat I got my wish at Triple Crown. The service was very good and the food was out of this world. I have told others about this place and I will be going back there again.

title: Good food, bad service

title: A great dining experience for our first Chinatown visit

review: I ate dinner there four times on the roll and loved the Dim Sum, the Lobsters Specials and the good service the staff offered. Next time I go to Chicago I will certainly make reservations again!

review: Delicious food, great service, reasonable prices...we had some Dim Sum, soup, and several main dishes (Moo Shu Pork and one other dish, both great) all for less than $50...would go back in a heartbeat!  A very pleasant experience...

title: The best sim dum ever
review: The best Sim Dum I have ever eaten. High quality very clean and great service.The pepper steak and rice noodles, still have me drooling.

title: Disappointment

title: Best dim sum

title: Dim sum
review: The food was excellent. I love dim sum! The place was clean, popular, and the food choices were abundant.

title: Good Food.
review: Very good food.  Great service and reasonable prices.  Lots to choose from.

title: DIM SUM -Great food and great value

title: Great Atmosphere
review: The food & service didn't quite match the beauty of Triple Crown, but we'd still go back.

title: Excellent

review: The food was way too salty.   We liked the hot and sour soup and, especially, the pot stickers.  The scallion pancakes were a disappointment; not as good as years ago; need more scallions.  The service was very friendly and efficient.

title: Fernando‚Äôs service

Fernando was overall the highlight of my trip experience wise and I will be back next year to hopefully see him again.More

title: Le Chateau at moon palace grand
review: Le Chateau last night was spectacular. The chef Francisco created a one of a kind dining experience. With Erick looking after every need this could not have been a better experience. The wow factor has set a new bar for what a great dinning experience...is.More

title: Eduardo was our bartender
review: Eduardo was our bartender and an amazing person!  He‚Äôs going to school to learn English and further his career.  He willingly took the time to help us with the Spanish translations while working on his English.  He made excellent drink suggestions and truly made our...evening above and beyond!  Thank you for a wonderful experience that made our vacation so much more than expected!!!  Until next time!!!!  Cheers - Sharon & Blake ;)More

title: Fabulous food and wonderful kind service!
review: Servers are very attentive, sweet, and kind every time we come.   The food is excellent. One dish better than the next.  In particular, best rice cakes I have EVER had. Highly recommend this restaurant in Chinatown.More

title: Wonderful Chinese Food
review: This is delicious Chinese food. The General Tsao is AMAZING! The Xhiolo bao is delicious and the people are so sweet and kind!! We had a wheelchair and they brought out a ramp and put it out so we could come in and dine. So...kind. We‚Äôll be back! It was a fantastic experience.More

title: Best place for breakfast at The Moon Palace
review: If you are staying at the Moon Palace, Cancun you must go to El Manglar Restaurant for your breakfast. Antonio de Jesus Susana does the most perfect poached eggs, cooking them whilst you wait so that they are exactly right. He is always busy with...guests queueing up for his omelletes too but, although he must be nearly melting with the heat from his stove, he is always cheerful and joking with the guests....top chef..thank you.More

title: Outstanding Chinese food in Chinatown
review: During a recent visit to Chicago we went with friends to Moon Palace in Chinatown. title: Delicious Peking Duck
review: Has been a while since I moved from Philly to Chicago. Couldn't find a restaurant with decent Peking Duck... I FOUND it! Absolutely delicious. Now I just need to find a restaurant that makes snails in black bean sauce.

title: Restaurant and Poolside Staff Review
review: The restaurant's at the Moon Palace that I've experienced were excellent.The reason being is not just the food but the staff most of them were doing there best serving me and my family and I want to give them  recognition for a job well done....They are: Jerome - Waiter, Kieron - Outside Waiter, Odain, Omar, Carlin, Sabrina, Tamara, Rosie - Bar/Lobby and last but not least, Wade Wynter and his staff for making sure that our rooms were decent. Thank you, Perry & Diane.More

title: Try the Shrimp Wonton Soup!
review: The wait staff is attentive without being in your face. I will admit that the food wasn‚Äôt extraordinarily different than ‚Äútypical‚Äù Chinese food but it was tasty. The soup was rather delicious.

title: Delish Dim Sum!
review: Stopped in with my kids for lunch and ordered shrimp wonton soup, dumplings, fried rice and chicken, stirfry shrimp with egg and chives...everything was delishes! Service a was friendly and quick, restaurant was clean. Fantastic authentic Shanghai menus.

title: Fabulous food
review: The Moon Palace restaurant in Chinatown has been one of our favorite restaurants in Chinatown. The waitstaff are professional and the food is delicious. We ordered, egg rolls, beef and pea pods, sesame chicken, sweet and sour pork and pork fried rice.

title: Fresh and delicious!
review: My husband and I went to Chinatown for lunch.  We walked into the Moon Palace.  We were immediately seated. There were others in the restaurant, but it was not packed. The restaurant was clean, service was very good and the food was fresh and delicious...More

title: Excellent Real Chinese food
review: We have gotten dinner through GrubHub from Moon Palace twice recently. Food comes hot and faster than the estimated delivery time. The website is clear and easily understood, including information on what was ordered previously. The hot and sour soup is excellent. Prices are moderate....More

title: Amazing Fresh Food!
review: Ordered our two favorite dishes that we frequently get and have tried at numerous Chinese restaurants and these were by far the best tasting we've ever had!!!

title: Best Restaurant in Chinatown
review: The Moon Palace has absolutely the best food in Chinatown. On this trip, we had egg rolls, happy family, and tofu and vegetables. All were excellent. The location is very close to the CTA red line stop, which is a plus as well.

title: Very Good Chinese Food
review: I was looking for a good Chinese restaurant in China Town some 10 years ago and decided to try Moon Palace based on the positive reviews.  We go there about 6 times a year.  My family will not go anywhere else in China Town and...More

title: OK with reasonable prices

title: Authentic Chinese food
review: It's right near the red line station just inside Chinatown.  Food was delicious and service was excellent.  We had moo Shi pork and sesame chicken.  Would definitely go again.

title: Kung Pao rules!

title: Great options, good food.
review: Lots of great options here, value on par with Chinatown. Staff spoke great English if that's important to your dining experience. Highly recommend the Ma Pa Tofu and anything Kung Pao.

title: Keep Looking

title: Deliciousy traditional!

title: Great Lunch at one of our Favorite Restaurants

title: Great Food

title: Maybe not the most authentic but certainly delicious
review: Good ambience. We were seated straight away. Super fresh ingredients brought hot from the kitchen. Great servers, they were run off their feet but managed to remain friendly and smiling. Would definitely recommend it. Extensive menu and very reasonable prices.

title: What a Find!

title: Only place I go to.
review: I've been coming here for over a decade. When ever friends from out of town come in we go here. Love the food, prices and portions.

title: A wonderful place for dinner
review: My family and I went to Moon Palace for dinner one evening. The cuisine was amazing. There are various kinds of dumplings served for appetizers. The vegetarian eggrolls are delightful. I enjoyed the xiao long bao. Great dish. I highly recommend going to Moon Palace.

title: Amazing Food!

title: Amazing food

title: A nice dinner spot

title: Best of Chinatown

title: Came for Xiao Lon Bao
review: The dumpling were great.  We ordered the Peking Duck.  Some of the best we have had outside of Hong Kong. Probably the best we have had in China Town.  Lovely restaurant with great staff.

title: Huge portions
review: We came as a group of 6 adults and 5 children  They could handle us plus gave a group of Chinese people making a business presentation.  We were not certain  how big the portions would be do over ordered. Service was quick, good and food...More

title: Good food
review: We were having dinner with a visitor. The food was good and the portions big.   There was Chinese people eating there also, that means it is a good Chinese restaurant, isn't?

title: Dumpings (Xiao Lon Bao) and Noodles
review: Their soup dumplings (xiao lon bao) have been the reason my family and I return. The pork and vegetable filling is a great consistency - not too processed, not too chunky. We like the extra thin ginger and sauce that accompany the dumplings. The noodle...More

title: Come here for the steamed dumplings
review: I have been going to the Moon Palace for more than 20 years, even before it moved to its 22nd St. location. The place has changed a lot in the more than two decades since I first dropped in, having undergone an interior design upgrade...More

title: Greasy and salty

title: Terrible experience

title: Really good food and nice price too

title: A  very good Chinatown restaurant.
review: Several visits, all very pleasant and consistently good A notch above most Chinatown restaurants and inexpensive.

title: China Town Down
review: Restaurant was goods and a good value.   But nothing special.   Hoped things in China Town would have made the trip worth while.

title: Good Traditional Chinese Restaurant
review: Moon Palace is an above average restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown - not perhaps as interesting as the very best, but still well above average. They claim to be a Shanghai kitchen, but it seems to me to mix a few of the cuisines quite well....More

title: Good food, fresh ingredients good service.

title: Delicious & Family Friendlly

title: It's What You're Used to

title: Great buy in Chinatown

title: Obviously 2 Menus

title: Great Find!

title: Excellent!!
review: Had sweet and sour chicken, pot stickers, egg rolls and beef fried rice. The food was superb! Highly recommended and we will be back next time we're in Chicago.

title: New Years Eve dinner

title: Single parents birthday with a 4 & 5 year old
review: Everyone was kind to the single father with two kids. The food was good. The hot and sour soup was one of the best. The lo mein was ok. The kids were easy to please. General tso's was good. None of the food was commercially...More

title: Generic food to please Western tastes
review: This place rates highly in Trip Advisor, which is why we picked it for lunch.  However, compared to other restaurants in Chinatown, we found the food offerings to be only average, indistinguishable from any generic Chinese restaurant in any neighborhood. title: Very Good Chinese Food

title: mediocre Chinese restaurant
review: Went for a stroll in Chicago's china town with the wife and kids and wanted to have a local taste. Looked it up in trip advisor and saw it got good reviews so we decided to give it a try. The place is close to...More

title: Excellent Chinese food and good service.
review: Located adjacent to a local fire department.  Lots of Asians eating dinner family style when we arrived, a good sign.  We had appetizers, house specials and everything was delicious.  Service was prompt and attentive.

title: Enjoyed it again!
review: This was my second time visiting Moon Palace Restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown, and we went there specifically for the delicious food there. title: Chinatown in chicago

title: My quest for the best Chinese food
review: Chicago's China Town is one of the best. They must have 50 restaurants there. I've tried many during my life in Chicago so when I returned here I tried this new one. It was one of the best so far and I highly recommend it....More

title: Very good restaurant

title: I loved it...I miss good Chinese food!
review: We I live in Knoxville, Tn and we cant get good Chinese food to save our life. So we read the reviews on Trip advisor and this place got the best rating so we tried it. Yes it was the best we ate while in...More

title: Excellent food and great service
review: Delicious food and large portions. Plenty of food if you wanted to share and entree. The egg rolls were very good too. Service was great. Restaurant had nice atmosphere. Parking is free if you park in the lot on the corner. Beware of street parking....More

title: Glad we went!
review: Spring rolls were hot, fresh and tasty. The pan-fried pot stickers were the best I've ever had -- tender and juicy, not all dried out as they often are. My noodle soup with shrimp had a generous quantity of noodles and broth, and the shrimp...More

title: Great Chinese Food
review: On the first night of our trip to Chicago, we went over to China Town & ate at MOON PALACE!   The food was excellent!   The portions are large so you may want to share!    We loved the crab ragoons for appetizer!    We had Orange Peel...More

title: Classic Chinatown
review: Our go-to place for Chinese in Chicago's Chinatown, although we got take-out this time. Beef chow fun, moo Shu chicken, Singapore noodles, and cashew shrimp were all delicious. Rice was a tad skimpy but it was a minor point. Food was piping hot when we...More

title: Mid-day menu
review: The lunchtime menu was very extensive for such a thing and the food was very cheap and plentiful. The service was prompt and not in any way intrusive.The chef knows how to cook a variety of Eastern cuisine,not just Chinese.Recommended.

title: As good as reviewed.
review: Delicious!  Ambience and service were terrific!  I had the combo chow me in and general Tso's chicken. Fantastic! Based on reviews here, I walked from the trade show I was attending at McCormick Place. Worth the walk!

title: great place in chinatown
review: We walked here from McCormick Place down Cermack ave. Service was great. Food was quick. Prices were good. I love the sweet and sour soup. soooo good.

title: consistent excellence
review: We've tried a wide variety of entrees and appetizers and have never been disappointed.  Soups are thicker than many Asian restaurants and always very tasty.  This is one of my favorite spots for lunch or dinner, but its also great for a light meal -...More

title: A gem in Chinatown
review: Everything from the steamed dumplings to the egg rolls to the diced chicken prepped Shanghai style are fab to the max. Amazing food and location.

title: Warm, gracious, delicious, affordable Chinatown
review: Park and walk into wonderful Chicago Chinatown and enjoy perfect Chinese service and food.  Everything we enjoyed and all the tables around us were happy with the experience!

title: Good southern china food
review: genuine southern china food. delicious food and cosi atmosphere.  you should try their cold dishes and also seafoods.

title: One of my favorite Chicago restaurants
review: Years ago, a friend of mine who visits Chicago frequently, told me about Moon Palace in Chinatown. I went there 7 years ago and return to it every time I am in Chicago. The food is fantastic. Everything I have had is well prepared, fresh...More

title: Amazing food and service
review: I went here for dinner on a Friday night with my two friends. We had a reservation but the place was empty so it wasn't necessary. The food was great but the service was even better. We had a bottle of plum wine that was...More

title: Great Mandarin Food
review: As another reviewer mentioned, this place was clean with good friendly service. Their steamed pork dumplings are among the best in Chinatown and the only place we will eat Dan Dan Mein (noodles with spicy peanut sauce). Much better than the over-hyped Lao Sze Chuan.

title: Good Service
review: We are very fond of Asian food ,having traveled extensively throughout  the far east. After reading the reviews I felt we should try the Moon Palace.The food and service were very good and I felt the food was not outstanding ,but very good.We had the...More

title: Good food, good value
review: The place was clean, quiet, friendly service, food was very good (not excellent.) My husband and I ordered egg rolls and spring rolls, orange chicken, and pork fried rice.  We were satisfied with every single dish. The portions are good. They even validate your parking...More

title: Worth the trip to Chinatown
review: Have been to a number of restaurants in Chinatown and Moon Palace is our favorite.  None of the restaurants in Chinatown are known for their decor or ambiance and Moon Palace is no different.  Despite that its worth visiting for the food---we had pork with...More

title: Excellent Chinese food
review: I love this place, but its been a while since I've been there.   The wait staff is the picture of teamwork.  Our waitress was efficient and knowledgeable, but every time one of the wait staff passed our table, they filled water, or removed an empty...More

title: Go there
review: Moon Palace is a nice, small yet elegant restaurant.  We've been there twice, and the food has been wonderful.  Mongolian beef is tender and tasty.  The fried rice is excellent, as is the lo mein.  The crispy shanghai chicken is delicious, plus the sauce is...More

title: Yummy place in China Town
review: This was my first time to China Town. This restaurant was really close to all the happenings. Parking was tricky because there are so many people around. We went in for lunch, there was one other gentleman eating alone. It was peaceful and elegant. The...More

title: Great find
review: We have been going to China Town for many, many years but have just recently eaten twice at Moon Palace.  Tucked next to the fire station.  Eggplant was very tasty, not mushy and did not look like a "mystery" dish often served at other restaurants....More

title: Excellent!
review: The location was great, just down the street from the Chinatown parking lot and train stop.  Got validated parking in the restaurant.  The food was terrific.  Ordered simple wontons with kung pao chicken and it was delicious.  Tons of peppers and rice with it and...More

title: Great little Chinese Restaurant
review: I was in Chicago on business, and a local coworker took me to Chinatown for dinner.  This is his favorite restaurant in the area - he says he's been going there for 30+ years.  The restaurant is modernly decorated - evidently there was a fire...More

title: Reliably excellent
review: I have probably eaten at Moon Palace more than 1000 times over the last thirty years, and have never had a bad meal.  Their hot and sour soup is the best that I have ever had, and their dumplings are as good as the best...More

title: Good Food, Good Prices
review: This was one of the best places we've eaten in Chicago's Chinatown.  The food was above-average quality and prices were very reasonable, especially for lunch.  The hot-and-sour soup was marvelous on a cold day.  We had fried rice, orange chicken, cashew chicken, and shrimp and...More

title: Great Food, Excellent Value
review: In a town with ridiculous food prices, I really appreciated Moon Palace. I ate here 3 times for lunch while attending a conference at nearby McCormack Center. The first day I ordered sizzling rice soup for $7 and an order of potstickers for $6. Both...More

title: Great way to spend Christmas Day..
review: I think Moon Palace is probably one of the best restaurants in Chinatown.  Our family has the tradition of going to a Chinese Restaurant on Christmas Day. Over the years, we have tried different restaurants and always come back to Moon Palace.  The food is...More

title: Best in Chinatown
review: Moon Palace is by far the best restaurant in Chinatown and one of the best Chinese restaurants in all of Chicago. Everything I have tried on the menu has been excellent and I have been here many times. The Peking duck at Moon Palace is...More

title: A Must!!
review: We were not sure what to expect at this stop and we were thrilled to find a delicious & reasonably priced Chinese gem. It's been along time since we have a enjoyed an authentic Chinese meal this much! We made reservations that turned out to...More

title: Great restaurant
review: This Chinatown restaurant was easy to find, clean, and delicious!  The prices are very reasonable and the portions are very large.  I had the very spicy Orange Chicken, my husband  loved his Happy Family, our friend had Cashew Chicken, which was also great.  We also...More

title: Consistent Quality
review: I'm from Michigan, and visit Chicago often.   There are so many fine restaurants, I hate visiting the same place twice; but I'm having trouble not visiting this amazing bargain at ever visit.  I missed it when they closed for remodeling and am thrilled that its...More

title: Chinatown Treat
review: Enjoyed some Authentic Chinese food in Chinatown section of Chicago.  The Waitstaff was very friendly and the sizzling rice soup was great.  Quick walk to the Red line.

title: Nice surprise in Chinatown
review: I often avoid dining in Chinatown due to the bewildering number and variety of restaurants. My wife and I felt adventurous and picked Moon Palace at random for lunch and we were pleasantly surprised!  The service was fast and courteous. Interior was very clean and...More

title: Nice clean restaurant
review: The food was yummy a little pricey. We purchased orange chicken, shrimp and asparagus, shrimp toast, spring rolls, won ton soup (the small order was huge 8 dumplings), egg drop soup, and crab ragoon (not my favorite).

title: A Great Dinner Spot in Chinatown
review: Our friends suggested we try the Moon Palace because they recently discovered it. It was recommended to them by some Chinese friends. We had a wonderful dinner for four for $60.00 (excluding alcohol drinks). This fixed price deal was not on the menu. The meal...More

title: Attentive service, tasty treats, good location
review: With dozens of restaurants big and small within a four-block radius, competition is tough in Chicago's Chinatown.  Almost as tough as parking.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the Moon Palace's "Shanghai" specialties, but was pleasantly surprised.  Some Chinatown eateries are massive operations, others...More

title: the best crispy duck in the city of Chicago
review: Moon Palace is my favorite restaurant in Chinatown, Chicago.  I love the Peking Duck and the Crispy Duck- my favorite.  All their dishes are delicious and my family and friends have all been able to find their favorites there as well.   The atmosphere is nice...More

title: Yum!
review: Not being familiar with the restaurants in Chinatown, we were easily overwhelmed, but the Moon Palace was the right choice. My friend and I both had lunch, appetizer, and drinks for $30. The pork wontons were the best I've ever had and we've been talking...More

title: Fabulous food - especially the salt & pepper fish, which is one of my favorite dishes in the city.
review: Fabulous food - especially the salt & pepper fish, which is one of my favorite dishes in the city.

title: authentic and charming...right in the middle of china town
review: authentic and charming...right in the middle of china town

title: I adore this cute little...
review: I adore this cute little restaurant in Chinatown.  The staff is so attentive and very friendly.  I haven't eaten anything there I haven't liked.

title: Our favorite place in Chinatown for at least 20 years. Easy subsidized parking nearby, also near Red Line L stop...
review: Our favorite place in Chinatown for at least 20 years. Easy subsidized parking nearby, also near Red Line L stop. Really fresh seafood, great hot and sour soup, mixed clientele of Chinese and American patrons.

title: Shanghi noodle soup, delish!
review: Shanghi noodle soup, delish!

title: Just ok food. Beware of pricing.
review: The dumplings were just ok. The servers were friendly. BUT‚Ä¶ beware of pricing for all things other than the dumplings. The hot tea which is usually served free at most Chinese restaurants is priced at $12.00. That‚Äôs for a tiny teapot of very weak jasmine...tea.  And a small plate of side dish kimchi, which again is usually free at other places, is priced at $7.99 for a tiny plate. AND‚Ä¶ they DON‚ÄôT validate parking. We were really excited to try this place as we are at Chinatown often and have tried many of the places here, so we were VERY disappointed. :(More

title: Amazing lamb!
review: We both LOVED this place. Dumplings unlike any other we have had in our travels. The Lamb Kebabs are so amazing. I could not get enough of them. The flavor is to die for. All of the dumplings we tried from the lamb to the...beef, to the truffle. We‚Äôre out of this world. My partner is Asian and even he was raving about them as being better than his mom‚Äôs. We will for sure be back here the next time we visit Chicago. And the Asian markets it is attached to are fun as well.More

title: Excellent service, serve me warm water instead of ice water
review: The waitress knew the Chinese culture well enough to serve me hot water instead of ice wateÔºåI was really impressed by that As for the dumplings Ôºåtasty and juicy but the each dumpling‚Äôs size seemed a bit smaller compared to those I ate in Taiwan...or ChinaMore

title: Overpriced and Overrated
review: If you are travelling with a hungry family and are on a budget, avoid this overpriced restaurant. Initially my family was very excited about trying something new as we are from a small town and do not have a restaurant of this type in our...area. We reviewed the menu online and were a little apprehensive about trying something so different but decided that the staff at the restaurant would probably help us through the ordering process. When we arrived at the restaurant, we were led to our table right away and given waters. We were told to scan the QR code to access the menu. We told the waiter that we needed help ordering because we had never been to the restaurant. We asked him to make a recommendation. We aren‚Äôt sure if he didn‚Äôt speak English or just did not care because he again said that we could check the menu on the QR code but really said nothing further. We ordered an appetizer, the lamb kabobs and 3 orders of dumplings. The picture of the kabobs is very deceiving. A quarter or a ruler should also be included in the picture next to the kabobs to give people the real size of the portion. It was a perfect appetizer for a mouse‚Ä¶not for a hungry family of 4. After we received our food, we asked for silverware because we do not know how to use chopsticks‚Ä¶none were ever delivered. We tried getting the waiters attention several times, but he was no where to be found. We ended up using our fingers and awkwardly stabbing at the dumplings with our chopstick in attempts to skewer them. Our water glasses remained dry as they were never refilled. The final blow was receiving the bill. Over $100 for basically appetizer-sized portions?! Good thing Chi Chinese was right around the corner so we could have an actual meal. Avoid this overpriced place if you are hungry for an actual meal. You will not find it here.More

title: Satisfying early dinner
review: We went early around 5pm and it was a good thing otherwise we would need a reservation to get in.   Our waitress was very attentive and helpful - we had two dumplings - the shrimp with two other ingredients steamed and the lamb and dill...fried - we loved both but the fried version was better (each order is 12 pieces)  We also ordered the cucumber salad which my husband liked and beef kebabs - very tasty  We had sodas as well so our bill was $68.   Service was excellent.More

title: Delicious Tea and Dumplings
review: This gem was pleasing for a mom and her two sons (16 and 9).  The lamb kebabs were deliciously flavorful and my kids had two different t types of dumplings each prepared differently (steamed and pan friend). The jasmine tea was also delightful.

title: Good Dumplings
review: We were in the mood for dumplings and went here for take out since it‚Äôs the middle of a pandemic.  Good dumplings delivered in super fancy take-out  packaging. The 18 dumplings came in a large rectangular gift box, each in its own mold, perfect for...a dose of soy dipping sauce. No need to worry about spillage and getting your clothes or car soiled.  Dough was good, filling was good. A bit more expensive than typical dumplings though. We ordered the pork and cabbage, pork and leeks, pork shrimp and leeks dumplings steamed. We also ordered the lamb and carrots pan fried. All were good but I personally preferred the pork shrimp and leeks dumplings more. Would recommend to anyone in the mood for dumplings.More

title: Excellent dumpling place in Chinatown
review: Excellent place to eat dumplings in Chinatown, the food was great, a wide variety of dumplings, the place was beautiful and the personnel very friendly and helpful. We will come back for sure.

title: Dumplings were awesome. The
review: Dumplings were awesome. The veggie ones rocked. Clean, efficient, and delicious. Plan ahead. BYOB. Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

title: Great Dumplings
review: Dumplings for your hearts content.  Menu is an iPad and they are ready to help you select what is great.  Fast service

title: Delicious and Quick!!
review: I love trying dumpling places when I visit different cities. A quick google search had this place higgly rated, so our group of three went. We reserved a table electronically ahead of time, so it was nice to get in and be seated right away....More

title: Small Serious Dumplings  - In a Sea Of Asian Options in Chicago's Chinatown
review: For those of you whom are not aware, Chicago has a serious Chinatown. There are too many options, yet they are all bustling busy. This little place has very very great dumplings served hot and QUICK. Servers use Ipads to take your ordered table side,...More

title: Efficient place, good meal but no extraordinary culinary experience
review: We went here for a dinner. There was a little waiting time, but we got a table rather quickly. The place is well organised, very efficient. A bit like a conveyor-belt: you get fed, you get out. Dumplings were good though.

title: Little packets of happiness!
review: This bustling little place turns out some mighty fine dumplings. If I lived in Chicago, I'd be here every week so I could try each and every kind. If you love dumplings,  you gotta go!

title: Relaxed delicious dumplings
review: Ever since our trip to China last year I have been dreaming of delicious dumplings like the ones we had in several areas of China. We found this place to be almost as good as what we had experienced in China. The restaurant is small...More

title: Amazing....,
review: It was wonderful. We tried three different kinds of dumplings. Lamb/dill, chicken/coriander and beef/onion. We had some pan fried and steamed. All were amazing....we could have kept eating them. The pan fried were the best however. Service was very attentive and helpful. Can‚Äôt wait to...More

title: Black out with dumplings!
review: It‚Äôs located in Chinatown. The place is ‚Äúeasy‚Äù but clean and friendly! I went there only once but the dumplings are delicious! The portions are huge and there are many different kind of dumplings (lamb and coriander, shrimps, pork and pickled cabbage). My friends and...More

title: 6 Stars!
review: Simply delicious! Highly recommend ordering one order of each kind of dumpling (boiled, steemed, and pan fried--yes, you can eat 3 dozen dumplings if you believe in yourself!). We also ordered lamb skewers. The seasoning blend on the skewers was unlike any I've ever tired...More

title: Dumplings were amazing, manager not so much
review: The dumplings were everything I'd hoped for after moving back to the US from China. So good. Disappointed a lot of them would get stuck on the bamboo basket breaking the juices out before eating but they were still tasty. My disappointment and reason for...More

title: Heavenly dumplings
review: Absolutely delightful dumplings. Melt in your mouth lightness, with wide range of fillings and preparations, e.g. steamed, boiled, fried. Servers were helpful in pairing filling with proper preparation as well. Very affordable and BYOB. Very busy, so likely wait a while for table. Best dumplings...More

title: Loved it!
review: Lovely but small space, fantastic viewing of dumplings being made, and delicious dumplings!  The wait staff were very helpful in guiding us as to what to order. We thoroughly enjoyed this treat.  To top it off - a deluge of rain began just as we...More

title: good dumplings and service
review: We came in for early dinner, there was only another party there, so we were seated immediately. The waitress took our order when we were ready, the food came out very quickly. The lamb kebab was good for me, but a little bit spicy for...More

title: Great Dumplings in Chinatown
review: Great dumplings in Chinatown and very friendly staff.  We had the beef and green pepper steamed dumplings and lamb and dill pan fried dumplings.  Recommend trying them both ways.  FYI - it is BYOB

title: Go Here Now!
review: This is by far my favorite spot in Chinatown. So many dumpling possibilities and the service is always fast and friendly. It is BYO so stop for a bottle of sake in the neighboring strip mall!

title: Great dumplings, almost on par with Din Tai Fung
review: Came to this place with some friends who live near the area and are familiar with QXY and come here regularly. My friends knew I was looking for asian soup dumplings and told me this was the place to come and they had also been...More

title: Pretty good dumplings and experience!
review: I truly recommend this restaurant! Qing Xiang Yuan was a good Chinese surprise and would always come back. The dumplings and the  beef were extremely good! Try them out...

title: Excellent!!!
review: Great food and service. Preferred the beef and lamb and pork to the seafood dumplings. But everything overall is delicious. Cool to see the open kitchen and the team making the dumplings as well!

title: Boujee dumplings
review: Is that even possible for dumplings and boujee to be in the same sentence. Well this location is a boujee dumpling restaurant. Not a hole in a wall but a place that classes it up a bit.   The selection of dumplings are on point and...More

title: We were not disappointed.
review: Our family of 7 divided to stop in and we were not disappointed. We made reservations which. I recommend. We had the lamb and coriander , beef and onion, chicken wings, lamb skewers. All of this was delicious. Nikki was our server and was so...More

title: Yummy juicy dumplings!
review: A trendy and cozy place serves handmade to order, juicy and flavourful dumplings and they come in steamed, boiled or pan-fried to best suit your preferences. Give it a try if you're in Chinatown area, you won't regret!

title: Fantastic :)
review: Clean, modern decor with Asian influence, and a window where you can see the dumplings being made by hand in the kitchen.  The service was fast and friendly and the food was fantastic!  We had the chicken w/mushrooms, beef w/onion, and pork w/cabbage dumplings.  They...More

title: Amazing Soup Dumplings
review: I had an amazing time. Great atmosphere and amazing dumplings. No matter what you chose it will be great.

title: Amazing!
review: We went here after eating some dim sum at another restaurant in Chinatown.  Wish we would have come here FIRST! Seriously the flavors were incredible.  The texture of the dumplings - so tender.  And the burst of yummy broth - SO GOOD.  We didn't have...More

title: Chicago Chinatown Fine Dining
review: Clean, great service and amazingly tasty dumplings. Rivals any fine dining on our visits to China. Lamb dumplings in a coriander were our favorite. Sea weed and cucumber appetizers delicious. Light, creative dressing not spicy. Food was healthy, no unnecessary additives. Normally don‚Äôt eat so...More

title: Outstanding
review: Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings is simply outstanding. Contemporary decor, wonderful staff, and most of all, incredibly delicious dumplings with many many kinds to choose from. I couldn't be happier with this place.  We even tried a scallop and lotus flower dumpling. You can't go wrong...More

title: So many kinds of dumplings, plus traditional side dishes
review: How can you beat fresh steamy dumplings for lunch on a cold day? We loved the traditional pork and cabbage dumplings, but the leek, egg and shrimp dumplings were our favorite. We were so happy to be able to order traditional Chinese side dishes like...More

title: Light and airy....so fresh....so delicious
review: This was my third visit, and it seems like each time I go I discover a new dumpling to add to my growing "life list."  We had four people at the table and were warmly welcomed and had very fast service.  We ordered several different...More

title: Outstandingly delicate, flavorful dumplings
review: This is a delightful, aesthetically pleasing place to get a reality break from the hustle and bustle of Chinatown.  The casual setting is pleasant and the iPad based service unique.  The dumplings themselves are light and scrumptious morsels whether steamed or fried.  There are some...More

title: OK but that‚Äôs all
review: Where here for a lunch but wasn‚Äôt that impressed as all the reviews. The dumplings were good but I‚Äôve had better elsewhere.  The service was quick and correct.

title: Hot, Juicy Lamb & Cilantro Dumplings are a Must
review: The Lamb & Coriander soup dumplings were sooo delicious! The flavor was rich and full, and if you are a dumpling-lover, Qing Xiang Yuan is a must! I eat a lot of dumplings, and these were some of the best I've ever tasted. One order...More

title: Amazing
review: Wonderful dumplings.  We had the crab dumplings and they were delicious!  The only negative was that there was no sampler and when we ordered the dumplings, the order was always 12 dumplings so it was alot per order which kept us from ordering more types...More

title: Dim Sum to Die For!
review: A great place for dim sum!  There is a large variety to choose from, beef, chicken, seafood, lamb - available either boiled or fried - and made to order. Minimum order is 12 dumplings, which may seem like quite a bit. But they are so...More

title: Divine Dumplings
review: Delicious dumplings in a modern, contemporary yet traditional Chinese restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown. Great walk through the menu with the waiter as this was our first time here. He ask about our likes and made some great recommendations so much so that we ordered repeats!...More

title: Go hungry, leave happy!
review: Delicious dumplings prepared as you like them - a variety of combinations, so maybe skim the menu before you go. Bite-sized dumplings, so able to try several combos at the table. Steady and busy, tables turn at a good rate.

title: My favorite restaurant!
review: Out of all the restaurants that my family visited on our recent trip to Chicago, (even topping Chicago style pizza and Chicago style hot dogs) this was my favorite!  It‚Äôs a very short walk from the red line train.  I liked that there was a...More

title: Good but not great
review: Dumplings, pork and mushroom, were tasty but a little soggy. Cucumber salad was refreshing and lightly spiced.  Service was fast. Interior a bit cramped but scrupulously clean. Conveniently near the CTA and a few minutes walk from the water taxi.

title: Amazing dumplings!!
review: Family visit for lunch in Chinatown.  Qing Xiang Yuan is known for outstanding, handmade dumplings and it is a must-try for dumpling lovers.  Orders of dumplings come either steamed, boiled or fried and in orders of 12 or 18, so it‚Äôs best to come in...More

title: To Chicago Chinatown for dumplings
review: Picked out because stressed dumplings which is what I wanted. Modern blond seating with touch of up class in the restaurant. Went at 5 pm so no crowd. About 20 varieties of dumplings on the electronic tablet/menu along with another 20 more traditional non dumpling...More

title: Delicious juicy dumplings!
review: We ordered steamed, boiled, and fried juicy dumplings and love them all.  Great place to eat dumplings.

title: Fresh, yummy dumplings...
review: What a find! We love Chinese dumplings.  We tried the pork and mushroom as well as the pork and leek. They were both delicious. We had one boiled and one steamed.  I recommend having them steamed as we prefer that texture to boiling. Reservations are...More

title: Wasn't a dumpling fan, but I am now!
review: My wife kept telling about Qing Xiang Yuan Dumplings in Chicago's China Town, and I kept putting her off. But when I finally gave in and tried this small restaurant, I realized what a big mistake I had been making. The lamb dumplings were out...More

title: Yummy dumplings
review: My boyfriend and I stopped in for a quick bite, as we had never been to the China town area before. There were roughly 10 customers in the restaurant but it was a very somber/quiet environment , which isn't the typical vibe I shoot for...More

title: Hands down - no qualifiers - best dumplings in Chicago...perhaps on the planet
review: We came to Quing Xiang Yuan prompted by the local restaurant review show on CLTV, "Chicago's Loudest", not expecting our lives to be changed forever.  Although the menu is varied with offerings of barbeque kabobs and appetizers, the dumplings (steamed, fried or boiled) are the...More

title: Lovely restaurant, Yummy dumplings
review: This place is hard to find in Chinatown, but you'll be glad you searched. Many dumpling varieties. Pork, beef, shrimp, fish. Your order comes with 12 or 18 dumplings. They have other asian dishes

title: Great tasting dumplings
review: My mom‚Äôs side of the family is from an area of China that eats dumplings and flour based foods on a weekly basis. With that being said, I am pretty familiar with dumplings. The pork/leeks and chicken/mushroom dumplings were very good boiled and pan fried.

title: Pretty yummy
review: Wanted to try this place after seeing it on "Check Please" and really wanted to like it since I'm kind of in a rut of going to the same places in Chinatown. Our meal was kind of mixed. There were only two of us and...More

title: Family disappointment
review: We really wanted to love this place.  We saw the feature on ‚ÄúCheck, Please‚Äù, and our family was very excited to go.  We decided to go on a Sunday night - without a reservation.  This was our mistake.  We put our name in, and were...More

title: Dumplings as good as they get
review: Although the menu is limited -- if you don't like dumplings (or must be gluten free) this is probably not going to be a good choice - the quality of the dumplings is phenomenal. They have a huge selection of dumplings, steamed, boiled, or fried,...More

title: An Evening in Chinatown
review: A nice place for trying chines specialty of dumplings. Steamed dumplings are far better then fried once as the flavor of stuffing is preserved. Kim-chi is very good for accomplishment. The boiled dumplings were full of water and the stuffing was finely minced and we...More

title: Awesome dumplings
review: QXY has the best dumplings!  I ordered 12 dumplings and was basically full afterward, but they were so good that I ordered another 12 and ate half of them right there in the restaurant.  Can't wait to get back there next time I'm in Chicago.

title: DumplingLICIOUS
review: If you love all things DUMPLING, then this is your place. Every dish is made to order. So don't expect fast food. The tea service is authentic Chinese. Do try your dumplings with and without the sauces.

title: If you love dumplings, you should it here!
review: Great dumplings! You have to wait about 20 minutes for your food but it is worth it.  They do not sell alcohol, you have to bring your own bottle Great experience. I shall return...

title: Wonderful place for Dumplings
review: Went there at about lunch time on a Saturday and the wait was long, but after entering our name, we were kept updated by text as to when our table would become available.  Accordingly we were seated quickly when we returned upon notification.  Beautifully decorated...More

title: Good varieties handmade dumplings, but not great
review: First time trying this place. Maybe we had such great expectation, we're a bit disappointed. The handmade dumplings were good, but not as great as claimed. We ordered 4 different ones - 2 broiled and 2 steamed as recommended by the wait staff - shrimp,...More

title: Delicious!
review: My husbands coworkers said this place has the best dumplings in town. We were not disappointed. Be aware its BYOB. Worth a visit!

title: Outstanding dumplings!
review: This is one of those places it's worth the extra effort to locate.  Chinatown is cool, but not well-marked.  You can reserve seating online in this casual, simple spot.  The choice of dumplings is impressive and it is provided on a tablet for your selection....More

title: Hand made dumplings, but needs fine-tuning
review: So we went here with a large group, and I do give them bonus points for accommodating us. The place is pretty small. The dumplings were just OK in my opinion. The dumpling wrappers were excellent, but these are not true soup dumplings, they are...More

title: Authentically hand made
review: The story of this place is great, but putting that aside the dumplings here are great. Always go with the staffs recommendation of how the dumplings you order are prepared.   The choices are vast, try to venture out of your comfort zone on the ingredients...More

title: Pro tip: Save $$
review: Pro tip: Park in the newer Chinatown parking lot (the restaurant is directly in front of the lot) after the meal ask for the parking discount coupon so your parking is $2 instead of $10 w/o the discount.  The place is very nice, much better...More

title: Didn't even order.
review: Went there with wife, and a friend. Saw a T.V. program telling how wonderful this place was. Wass all set to really enjoy this place. Went in and was given some sort of electronic tablet for a menu, which wasn't quit user friendly, plus was...More

review: A friend recommended this place as the best dumplings in Chicago, so we were eager to try it.  To avoid waiting we booked a table and were there when they opened on a weekday.  You can see the dumplings being made by hand in the...More

title: The place to eat dumplings in Chicago
review: Not your typical Americanized China buffet. The restaurant is uber-modern and authentic. Relatively small dining room with constant stream of unfruitful customers, so be prepared to wait 20-30 min or more. Once seated, you are given a tablet with menu, which has some appetizers and...More

title: Best handmade dumplings!
review: This place was fantastic. The service was great and you can watch them make dumplings in the back. My daughter who is 6 couldn't get enough of this place, so we had to go back for a second time before our flight home. The skin...More

title: Scrumptious dumpling
review: Steamed lamb with dill amazing, and also the mackerel with coriander and pork with cabbage. Also excellent pickled cucumbers. A new waitress, but charming--slight confusion on one item, but the food came fast. Worth a trip.

title: Dumplings good but QXY could conduct business better
review: While I like QXY's dumplings, I do have issues with the way they conduct business. I did a takeout from the place for the second time. I called them an hour before pickup to confirm my online order went through and that I'd be there...More

title: Fantastic dumplings
review: Delicious and delicate dumplings many different flavors. Many different textures lovely tastes and Jason, our server, was fantastic made great recommendations. We can't wait to go back!

title: Tasty soup dumplings
review: Went for lunch on a Sunday, it was moderately busy and had to wait a few minutes for a table. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The waiter provided suggestions on how certain dumplings are best served (steamed vs boiled). We had the shrimp/pork/leek,...More

title: Good Veggie Dumplings
review: Ordered the veggie dumplings & they were good; prepared perfectly. The service there was nice & the staff very friendly.

title: Great dumplings, hard to find

title: The Wonderful Chinese restaurant
review: They have an amazing staff. The helped us take pics and, really cared about the customers. It is an excellent restaurant. Recommend if you have a family that is in need for great Chinese food!

title: Awesome egg roll
review: The egg roll were on point. Tradition chicago egg roll with peanut butter. Everything else was great too (beef and snow pea and chick with almonds and cashews)  but will come back for the egg roll!!!

title: Bad Experience
review: March 19, 2021...we have ordered from Emperors choice many times in the past with overall good results. Last night when we opened our order at home, my wife found a  Tylenol capsule in her food. Needless to say, she did not eat at all. I...have attempted to contact the restaurant to request a full refund, but there is no way to reach a manager as their mailbox is full. At the very least, we should be able to contact them via phone. Not going back unless this is taken care of.More

title: A cozy restaurant with good food and friendly service!
review: My wife and I had dinner in this restaurant! We were well served with friendly smiles from everyone that passed by our table! The food portion was fresh and hot, generous and tasty! While this is not one of those big restaurants in China town...we totally enjoyed our dining experience there!More

title: Not my favorite
review: Rainy night place empty. Took 6 minutes for server to come to table. Wanted us to order immediately. Ordered tea, that was highlight of meal. Won ton soup Luke warm dumplings had old taste shrimp were partially spoiled. Orange beef 90% breading little meat. Same...sauce as sweet and sour sauce no orange.  Portions very small, not like in pictures.  Salt and pepper seafood all breading little sea food. Tiny bowl of rice not really hot. At 8:15 large party of Asians came in, they were immediately served and their portions huge compared to ours. Food had average flavor.  Find another placeMore

title: Great Chinese food.
review: Welcoming and clean dining area. Large portions.  Crab Rangoon and Egg rolls were excellent.  Lomein very flavorful, good shrimp fried rice.  Beef and sauce in beef and broccoli was very good. So filling that we only ate half, will have for lunch tomorrow.

title: Lunch for Five
review: This restaurant was clean and the service very prompt and friendly. The food (Pepper and Salt Chicken, Baby Back Ribs and Chicken with Broccolli) was excellent.

title: Excellent Service
review: I had the shredded chicken, which I've been ordering for years, but this time my server was Rachel, and she was the best ever.  Empreror's choice is one of the better establishments in China Town and a is always a great  choice for Asian food.

title: A must visit
review: Can I say GOOD food...I have the general toS Chicken my friend had the orange‚Äîboth were over the top with flavor...he had some left over ‚ÄîI did not, although the portions were large.  Crab rangoons were Devine

title: excellent and very clean
review: this rest. is small and very clean and the staff is excellent.  every thing we order was very good and you had to take the rest home.  will go back...

title: Tasty and super fast service
review: Hey if you are around China town this is a MUST to go, always is full and need to wait between 20 or 30 minutes but is worthy, the quality is good, temperature of the plates perfect and real Chinese flavor. And is not expensive.

title: Very good find
review: I visited this restaurant with some of my business colleagues and it was a great gathering of business people from 5 different countries! We all loved the food & the service! Very reasonably priced too! Full marks from us!

title: Mainstay in Chicago
review: My favorite Chinese restaurant in Chicago. Consistently tasty! You can‚Äôt go wrong for great Chinese in Chicago.

title: Single experience and it was excellent!
review: Six of us arrived to the busy restaurant without reservations on a Saturday night and we were seated quickly. Service started slow, but then accelerated. Food was delicious and attractive. I will return again soon.

title: Sad choice
review: Slow service and food lacked flavor.  Never received the soup that was to come with the meal.  The rice was food, but the chicken for the General seemed microwaved.  The beef for the spicy orange was very bland.

title: Absolutely Best Cantonese in Chicago
review: Great deal on all inclusive lunch specials before 3pm.  Polite, courteous, good service. Food very fresh.  Pleasant ambience. A nice walk through Chinatown to get to location. Parking available; CTA 'L' stop nearby (Cermak); Water Taxi (12 min. walk).

title: Made us feel like Emperors
review: One of the most delicious, enjoyable meals I‚Äôve had in a long time.  Food was outstanding!  Especially liked the Soft Shell salt n pepper crab.  Super-generous portions.  Friendly efficient service.  Authentic vibe in the place with tourists, Chicago locals and Chinese community members sharing the...More

title: Good chinese food
review: We did not eat there, only bought fried rice for our supper at the hotel. The fried rice was delicious and tasted more refined than similar fried rice bought at other places. While waiting we noticed that the restaurant ambience was nice. The staff was...More

title: The Best...Better Than All The Rest
review: Been coming here for over 20 years. Hadn‚Äôt been in a few and visited again with my son. Was refurbished and updated interior- nice- but didnt come for the setting. Came back for the best chinese in chicago. Fresh, never greasy, always ample portions.

title: Absolutely delicious
review: We really enjoyed the beef and Kung pao chicken. Reminded me of our trip to China. The egg drop soup was very good and the crab Rangoons very crunchy.

title: Wonderful place

title: Excellent Birthday Dinner

title: Tardy to the party
review: Great lil restaurant for Chinese food, egg rolls were cold but the rest was hot as should be. We arrived at 930 and was told hurry hurry we close at 10pm. WOW anyhow we enjoyed

review: We decided to stop in Chinatown for a late lunch and discovered Emperor's Choice. Food was excellent. Restaurant was extremely clean. Service was excellent, friendly staff who were fluent in English which made everything perfect.

review: The food was very good and the service was fine, but I did notice that the large tables of Chinese native speakers did tend to get preferential treatment and service over the rest of us. None the less the food was good and it was...More

review: When going to Chinatown, we always go to Emperor's Choice. The food is delicious and service most accommodating. The menu is varied and on our many visits, most delicious. Moo Shoo Pork is a standout as are the steamed dumplings.

title: Excellent Choice
review: We were in town for a graduation at Great Lakes and took a trip here on a Sunday afternoon.  There are many choices in Chinatown but this one looked pretty good.  Our party of 4 each ordered different dishes and we were not disappointed.  Service...More

review: Hubby and I were looking for a good dinner place for our first time in Chinatown and after cross-referencing reviews, landed here. We were not disappointed! We got there at 6 and were just ahead of the dinner rush on a Monday evening. The menu...More

title: best chinese resraurant in chinatown
review: the place been in chinatown sine 1987 .best seafood and cantonese food ,fresh  ingredients , nice services .located in main street.

review: The eggrolls were good, but everything else was not what we were expecting in Chinatown. The food was more what I would have expected in a mall food court. I ordered the Orange Peel Chicken. It was very saucy and not at all spicy, even...More

review: Came here for dinner with the fam. The place is very clean and the staff was very attentive. My sister order egg rolls to start. They said they tasted fresh,  not oily. My mom loved them. I have to order a small bowl of won...More

title: Very nice
review: Stopped here after watching the Marathon. Very pleasant and good food. We got dishes to share. Plenty for all. Nice place in China Town.

review: A nice spot in Chicago's Chinatown.  The dining space appears to have been recently remodeled which is a nice touch compared to some of the dingier places nearby.  The service was prompt and friendly.  The food is not outstanding or to be raved about, but...More

title: Gloppy Sauces
review: Although the service was very pleasant, the food was quite average. The dishes were smothered in heavy sauces. Reasonably priced, but not the kind of food one would hope for in a Chinese neighborhood.

title: Consistent
review: The food here is of consistent quality over the years. I especially like any dish with whole fish or seafood. They do not advertise it in  English but they specialize in fish.  The service is good, hygiene relatively high, and the atmosphere semi-welcoming. Also, try...More

review: Its been a decade since Iast visited this establishment. And after a decades absence, the food was as good as I remember it from 10 years. They offer the usual choice of fare with a fair amount of authentic Chinese specialties. Its location is right...More

review: Ate here with my family of 4. My wife and I  tried some new things. Empress's beef, cantonese chicken. Our girls played it safe with sweet and sour chicken. Everything was great. You can definitely split one entre between two people.  Crab rangoon was best...More

review: This restaurant has a good service, the food is also good and the portions are really big. I decided to had lunch here, while I was visiting Chicago's Chinatown. It was a good experience.

title: Chinatown Find
review: Nice little storefront in Chinatown that has a huge menu and a good staff of servers, food is fresh, lots of regulars dining, and speedy kitchen. Stopped in for some of their huge portions and had a blast.

title: Yummy Moo Shu Pork!
review: Also had excellent green beans, very good pan fried wide noodles with lobster, and just OK fried rice...

title: Great food, authentic experience
review: The service was prompt and food excellent. We were eating quite early in the evening and over the course of our meal watched as the restaurant filled to capacity. The menu was varied and also had a large selection of vegetarian meals available. Great choice!

title: Good Food but lousy customer service
review: I like their food even though it is a bit overpriced.  But why I am unhappy with them is the owner's response to a complaint.    Yesterday, I got the wrong order.  The owner will not exchange the food nor will he give me a credit....More

title: No Taste
review: Went there for a late lunch. We ordered the chicken in black bean sauce and the shrimp and scallops. The scallops smelled fishy and the dish lacked flavor. The chicken was served in bowl of soupy sauce which also lacked flavor and had maybe 5...More

review: We love this restaurant and try to come here once a year or so.  The interior is starting to show its age, they need to put some money into freshening it up.  However, the food is excellent, fresh and reasonably priced.  The server helped me...More

review: An old Chinatown favorite in Chicago - the seafood is particularly good. The soft shell crabs are among the best in Chinatown, the Sichuan Peppercorn Seafood is spicy but not overwhelmingly so (this is not a true Sichuan kitchen, but more a Beijing-style restaurant). Service...More

review: Emperor's Choice was recommended to us by a local and they were on target.  This is a nice little restaurant in Chinatown and the food is excellent.  We especially loved the "special" oysters on the half shell with garlic and beans.  We live on the...More

review: Emperor‚Äôs Choice has the best food in China Town.  I love Chinese Food and have lived within a 10 minute carry-out time from China Town for 9 years, so I have pretty much tried them all.  My favorite dishes include true Classics-of-the-East like Spicy Salt...More

title: Reliable Chinese fare
review: We used to visit here a lot, but I heard it wasn't as good as it used to be. We tried it yesterday and were happy to learn it was still good.  We had delicious sweet sour soup.  I had Shanghai noodles (with a variety...More

title: Great Cookings
review: This was our second experience; first was Thanksgiving when we ordered a dinner for 16 takeout with wonderful results.  This time the two of us came for dinner.  The fish in garlic bean sauce was delightful.  The mushroom medley with bok choy was special.  Service...More

title: First visit to Chinatown's Emperor's Choice
review: We had lunch at EC on a Sunday. Arrived just after they opened about 11:30 am. We had shrimp and pea pods, and beef and pea pods. Shrimp was good size, and beef was very tender. A good visit. Priced right. I recommend stopping here...More

title: Consistently Good Cantonese Food
review: My wife and I have been here several times, and it has been very good to excellent every time.  Yesterday we wanted to try Go 4 Food, but it was closed on Tuesdays, so we returned to Emperor's Choice.  Decor is better than average for...More

title: Delicious food, Definitely impressed!
review: We have been eating Hot Pot for twenty years.  Happy Lamb was a wonderful experience, and the food was Delicious!   The ordering process was easy, and the wait staff were pleasant and efficient.  We found that the broth was a little bit salty for us,...and when I asked the manager about it the next day he said we could order it with no salt or less salt.  Again I was very impressed.  All of the meat, fish, and seafood were delicious and fresh. The broth was great quality and perfectly seasoned. There was great selection of vegetables and noodles and rice.  We were told dessert was also included.  You need to try Happy Lamb Hot Pot! You‚Äôll be glad you did!More

title: My feelings were sooooo hurt!
review: Happy Lamb WAS, by far, my favorite place to eat in Chicago! I came from Gary, Indiana almost twice per month to eat there! However, my nightmare began last night as my date noticed a roach crawling near my left shoulder. The waitress comped our...meal and was extremely apologetic. Nevertheless, I don't think that I can stomach eating there again. Up till now, it was outstanding.....We left and were quiet the entire ride back to NW Indiana.....I was so disappointed!More

title: Hotpot Heaven
review: Try this place if you've never tried hotpot before. They walk you through the ins and outs of hotpot dining. First they bring a pot filled with a scrumptious broth to the table and it bubbles away on the burner. Then you select proteins, greens,...and carbs for your first round - the beef and pork were thinly shaved slices rolled cigar-like. You put your food into the broth and let it cook - over time, the broth becomes more and more interesting as you take out and eat food and add more - mushrooms, bok choy etc. You can add a 2nd and 3rd round of food selections - mussels were excellent, as was the fish.  There was also a counter area offering a large selection of condiments and dipping sauces.   One price for all you can eat - but don't over order. They charge for food that is ordered and not eaten to prevent patrons from wasting food. No doggie bags.  Everything was spotlessly clean and the service is professional.  This is a great family experience and a wonderful way to introduce children (and adults) to fresh Chinese style food and culture beyond the traditional takeout container food.  Situated in the heart of Chinatown.More

title: Amazing Quality at an Insanely Low Cost
review: This was my first hotpot experience, and honestly one of my favorite meals in recent memory.  For those familiar, hotpot is a style of eating where your table has a pot of boiling spicy broth, and you order various raw meats and vegetables to dunk...into the broth (Korean BBQ but with broth instead of a grill).    The Happy Lamb does offer an ala-carte option, but if you're doing that at hotpot, you're doing it wrong.  Go for the "All You Cant Eat" option.  $30 per person (including tip, unless you want booze with your meal).    To start with you'll be given a menu with all of the various meat/veg options for you to check off what you want.  Go nuts, order a much as you think you can stomach.  Get ALL of the variety.  There is a decision to be made here though.  Be warned that there are no "sample-size" portions.  If you order the fatty beef, they're going to bring you a TON of it.  It's all you can eat, but they warn up front that if you leave more than 5oz of anything uneaten they'll weight it and charge you for it.  I'm a fat kit, I ordered probably 6 different meats and 10 different veggies, and still managed to put it all down plus more.  The first and most important selection though is your broth.  They have a basic bone broth, or a spicy, or a "half and half" option.  I went with this, but if I had it to do over again I'd just go all spicy.  It's not uncomfortable hot, and it's got so much flavor.    What makes this place so great is the quality.  For $30 all you can eat meat, you're not expecting the best meat possible.  But you'd be wrong.  Top-notch quality on everything.  I honestly don't know how they stay in business with those prices.    The stand outs for me were the fatty beef and the lamb.  Great quality, phenomenal flavor, and sliced so thing that it cooks with just a few seconds dunk in the broth.    When you're done having one of the best meals of your life, step outside and explore Chicago's beautiful China town.  So much flavor, so much culture, if you Chicago this is a MUST EAT.More

title: Best Hot Pot in Chicago
review: This restaurant is easily Best Hot Pot in Chicago. No wonder it received high reviews.  It is located in the old side of Chinatown. As we arrived, the staff were all friendly and helpful. The place is very clean and they follow physical distancing.  We...chose al a carte instead of all-you-can-eat. After we ordered, our waiter politely reminded that we ordered too much and we appreciated that.  All were excellent, especially thinly-cut meats, fish, baby octopus, lotus flower.More

title: Authentic Chinese Hot Pot
review: Very delicious Chinese hot pot. The raw meat and vegetables are very delicious. Meet eaters and vegetarians can all find their love. The service is good. The location is very convenient. title: Chinatown Gem

What a great bonus.Mine was $24 and I got my money's worth!  Fresh, delicious choices, friendly and helpful servers, and an abundance of food made us HAPPY CUSTOMERS! It was very busy even at 2pm, but we didn't wait long. Loved Chinatown in general!More

title: Authentic hot pot resto
