title: Great Hot Pot
review: We had the All You Can Eat Hot Pot for $23.99.  It was worth the price and we were  totally stuffed.  We chose the Best of Both World soup base so half original and half spicy, some food taste better not spicy and others need...the spicy broth. There are plenty of food items to chose and you can order as many times as you want. We were pleased with the quality of the food. Service was fair, not attentive and we hated to do this but we had to flag down a server every time we wanted to re-order more food.  Servers were still friendly.    The place does get busy and the wait can be over an hour.  They will take down your number and text you when your table is ready so you can walk around Chinatown.  There is an ice cream machine and snacks in the waiting area but we aimed to keep our bellies empty when we are craving Hot Pot.More

title: Best Hot Pot in Chicago
review: This is the best place for hot pot in Chicago.  The service and the quality of food is excellent.  The pride is average but for what you get, it's really worth it

title: Very good hot pot. Service "indifferent" if you don't speak Chinese
review: We had a very nice meal. The service was a little disinterested, Recommend the all you can eat menu and the spicy broth. The lamb and garlic beef were both outstanding. Tripe interesting as well. Seafood selections limited: Big head on shrimp tasty but always challenging to eat. Great selection of mushroom all highly recommended!

title: Fun Eating
review: We had a Groupon to Little Sheep or we would have never discovered it. We were impressed with the friendly wait staff and the comfortable decor. Now we will visit regularly. It's off the touristy beaten track in Chinatown and if you've never done hot pot before here's a few tips. Plan on a little more time than a usual dinner out. Sip your complimentary tea while you check off the items you want. Don't fall for the all you can eat. You will have all you can eat with the regular hot pot menu! The spicy broth is delicious but almost too much of a good thing. Spend the extra and get the combo which is both types of broth in a divided pot. Order the veggie platter which appears to be the entire leafy green section of your grocery, but cooks down and makes the soup very tasty. You only need one type of meat. We over ordered by selecting the lamb/beef and chicken. The platters are piled high with thinly shaved meat that cooks quickly. Noodles are a must. The wide are delicious. Mushrooms are worthwhile. You can order the dipping sauces for no charge and those are awesome for flavoring the soup in your bowl. We loved the garlic and the sesame. By the time you are satisfied you will hate to leave your beautiful broth behind.

title: A Must!!!
review: was one of the best meal ever! The meat and vegetables are really fresh! Just try to considering before order or you will end up with a lot of to go!

title: GREAT HOT POT in CHICAGO
review: Little Sheep really knows how to serve Hot Pot.   The presentation and quality of food was excellent and the staff was very attentive and professional.  It's located in a great location in the heart of Chicago Chinatown.

title: amazing food!
review: It was our first experience of hot pot, and we did not what to expect. In short: it was amazing! the restaurant is very clean, the food is amazing! you should try it! and the best: not expensive!

title: Another good hotpot restaurant in Chinatown
review: Although I have a slight preference for the hotpots at Mandarin Kitchen and Little Lamb, the Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot is almost at that level, and the prices are lower. The spicy broth is redolent with peppers but also with a rich array of other flavors, and the non-spicy one is very flavorful too. Unlike its competitors, who provide a range of dipping sauces on the house, here you order them at a slight charge. Little Lamb has a veritable buffet of mix-your-own dipping sauces. Still, with its low prices, rich broths, and good quality fresh meats, seafood, vegetables, and a wide array of noodle choices, this is a good choice for Chinese hot pot.

title: Delicious Ramen!
review: Strings is delicious. I recommend going early since the seats fill up everything. They do have a waiting area which is nice.

title: Christmas Family Dinner 2019
review: Very nice visit. Our server was patient & an attentive listener. We announced it was our 1st visit, so she covered the menu & items to avoid for those in our party with food allergies. The flavor was incredible. My favorite was the sriracha broccoli...appetizer. The entrees were tasty & the portions were great.More

title: Try the Hell Ramen for spicy...
review: I think this was my first ramen meal. The restaurant was right around the corner from where I was staying. In the spirit of trying new things, I risked level three heat. The taste made it worth it! It took me two pitchers of water...and a diet Coke to finish the bowl. I'd say level three is for those experienced in eating spicy food or (like myself) those willing to experiment.  The service was great. The lady who served me had the air of an owner. I could tell she had great pride in the establishment and rightly so.   I felt very at home here. It's a small space. It's great for people watching while dining alone.More

title: INCREDIBLE Ramen
review: Very good ramen place in chinatown chicago... everything we had was amazing. Prices were OK, a little higher than you would expect for the location but still reasonable. Very tasty and nice atmosphere!

Heads up--it is BYOB for alcoholic beverages (check their policy on size of drinks you can bring). Never heard of this at a restaurant. They do have soda and other non-alcoholic drinks.More

review: Average quality of ramen, broth was good. Wasabi string beans excellant. Service was decent. Prices were a little high. Definitely not authentic but good enough to go back. Serving size was big. Not a bad place to go if you want a change from chinease...More

title: Ramen to die for!!!!!
review: The most delicious ramen I have ever had.  Its cool to watch how they make everything from scratch.  This is NOT a takeout place, so come and enjoy the noodles. Their menu has such a cool explanation of the items and From what region in...More

title: Best Ramen!
review: My wife and I had lunch at Strings in China town and wow what a great meal. The flavorful broth , the creative ingredients, the helpful and knowledgeable waiters. I highly recommend stopping here for the best ramen around!

title: One of the best Ramen places in town!!
review: Excellent Ramen! The Kuro buta was perfect, and the sides of the lava egg and spicy shoots was a perfect accompaniment. We also tried the superhot Ramen (level 3) and although it was tasty, it was a trial to eat it :) Definitely one of...More

title: A good noodle bowl
review: Upscale noodle bowl restaurant--with pork, seafood, bean curd, mushroom, or tofu are some of the featured items.  This is a Japanese restaurant located in Chicago's chinatown. Portions are large.    Wait staff is very helpful to the initiates.  The menu helps somewhat with definitions.  Restaurant is...More

title: Pleasantly different
review: Went to the Lincoln Park location for a pre-theater meal.  Glad I did!  This is a very nice take on a late night college staple.  The noodles are made in house and well prepared.  The various broths,toppings and spice levels really take this stuff to...More

title: I will definitely be back...
review: My boyfriend and I went for dinner last night, and I am definitely planning on returning to try more dishes.  We both ordered the "Hell Ramen" Level 1 (out of 4, with 4 being the hottest).  I am usually disappointed with the level of heat...More

title: Excellent Noodles / Fun Joint
review: We heard so much about how good the Tonkatsu Broth was at Strings I was ready to be let down. It didn't disappoint. The pork broth is so rich and aromatic it blew me away. Until I tried the Miso Broth, which is even better....More

title: Didnt disappoint
review: Saw this place on Chicagos best and wanted to try the spicey ramen. The dish was very favorful and filling  just as remembered from Japan, but however it wasnt as good. But it was close so Ill be going back soon to try the other...More

title: Great ramen!
review: My husband and I have been wanting to try Strings because of the house-made noodles and it didn't disappoint!  From other reviews and pictures I saw online I knew it was a small place and could get very busy so we arrived just before noon...More

title: Good Ramen, sloooow service
review: I ranked this review "average" not based on the food but based on how long we had to wait for it. The ramen I had was fantastic, unfortunately my wife and I had to wait for over an hour for it to arrive (this is...More

title: Good Ramen, but I was expecting more
review: I haven't eat any Japanese Ramen for a long time, so it was good that I ate here for brunch. Ramen here isn't incredibly good compare with Ramen bars i went in New York and Vienna, but good service and dessert! If you ever stop...More

title: Amazing
review: My wife and I were staying downtown, but were craving some authentic Asian flavours. We had read about Strings on TA and ventured on the subway to find it. Luckily we made this decision.  The place is not large and was quite busy when we...More

title: Best noodles
review: I think Strings is a new-ish place, but it's got hands down the best ramen noodles I've had in Chicago! Handmade, good texture, and very chewy.  The typical 4 bases (tonkatsu, shio, shoyu, and miso) are offered here, each with a different Strings Ramen twist....More

title: New Ramen joint in China town
review: "Confusing menu", another review stated. Well...for a menu the size of a post card, confusing is not an adjective I would use. The menu is simple: Ramen, four types, a few toppings options, yakisoba, five toppings. The food is simple, but, great, the service excellent...More

title: Late night ramen !
review: My second time here and I always love the place ! Still unfamiliar with the menu but I always ask to explain to me and server were nice about it . Price is decent , I like the ambience . You can also try food...More

title: Hot noodles + no AC = unpleasant lunch
review: Overall, the noodles were very good but a bit expensive. My husband, 2 kids, and I had 3 bowls of ramen and a jar of "Stringria" to share and the bill came to $70 for lunch.  That was way more than I thought we would...More

title: Confusing Menu
review: Photos, photos next to the name of every dish in the menu, plus a more detailed description of it will help a lot especially bc you've decided to use names that are hard to pronounce. Priced a bit pricier than other reputable Japanese restaurants in...More

title: Best ramen I've had outside Japan
review: Truly delicious ramen. I tried the tonkotsu ramen and it was to die for.  I'll definitely be headed back on my next trip to Chicago.

title: Best Ramen in Chicago!
review: From the noodles made in house, to the 48hr boar broth to the waitstaff explaining Ramen...you can not get a a better or more delicious Ramen experience!

title: Ramen, YES!
review: Get the pork belly ramen. Believe me, it's worth it. The portions are huge and they have an assortment of Japanese sodas that are delicious.

title: Worth the Trip any Day of the Week
review: Depending on when you go oh, there may be a bit of a wait. But you quickly understand why there's a massive lazy Susan on the table.This place does not mess around with the quality or quantity. It's also an excellent option for The Adventurous taste bud.Whether a vegetarian or an omnivore, there's something for everyone. Service what is first-rate, rivaled by the quality of the food.Bring your appetite and cultural appreciation. And enjoy.

title: Not worth the wait
review: Good food, but not worth the two hour wait to be seated and 30 minutes to order. We were told 25 minutes when we arrived, so 2.5 hours was not fun. Restaurant was also extremely hot, so very grumpy by the time we were seated. Some dishes did start coming out quickly after ordering, but couldn't easily get water refills and after another hour we gave up on the last three dishes and left. We will try somewhere else next time.

title: Dim Sum ‚Äî A Tasty Sampling of Chinese Foods
review: Dim sum is always a high spot eating experience.  Lately the selections have expanded and are wonderful additions to the traditional offerings. I love to go with a group of people and order a wide variety of dishes to sample. Time to go again.....

title: Amazing food, atrocius service
review: The food is amazing, great quailty and flavour .But unfortunately the service is not good at all. Slow, quite rude and very distant and forgetful. We had a bad experience. I rescue the spectacular food.

title: Christmas lunch
review: We ordered the orange beef, sweet and sour chicken, General tso‚Äôs chicken and Mongolian beef. Everything was tasty. They were extreme busy being Christmas Day and our wait was about an hour. Make sure you give yourself time to enjoy the meal. Service is slow but we noticed that the Asians enjoy the company of the family while enjoying the food at a slow pace. Dim Sum was very popular during this time but not something we were interested in. We enjoyed our meal.

title: 1st time in Chicago Chinatown
review: We arrived in Chicago that day and my brother suggested going to China town for authentic Chinese. It's very close to the train station. Staff were friendly. Food was awesome, but the duck was a little too greasy for me. Reminded me of Chinatown in Liverpool,England.

title: Excellent and Authentic Chinese Food
review: Visited this restaurant while on Conference. The food and service at this restaurant is exceptional. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of authenticity of Chinese food here. Originally from NYC, I have traveled to areas of Hong Kong, London, Paris, Washington D.C., San Francisco, Richmond, Raleigh-Durham, Philadelphia, and Boston and often visit the Chinatowns there. The food here is comparable and in some cases better than these other places. The portions are well sized and excellently priced.

title: DO NOT GO HERE - it's disgusting
review: We were a party of 5 for lunch on a Wednesday afternoon. One part of the restaurant was semi-full ... all locals. It was our first time as we are from Texas. We were sitted within 5 minutes but waited 20 minutes before a server came over. Not a hello, how are you, nothing welcoming!!! As a matter of fact, we couldn't get one employee to smile. We were probably there for 1 1/2 hrs and not once did the server come over to see if we needed anything. That's why she got the offensive tip. The venue is so very dirty outside as it is inside. The windows looked like they've NEVER been cleaned. The women's restroom had two stalls (one was disgusting). If you're a germaphobic..do not come here. Food was good but couldn't stop thinking whether kitchen area passed health inspection. YUK! We picked this place because of Yelp reviews. Even tho it looked unkempt from the outside we thought the upstairs dining area would be different but it wasn't. Left this place thinking this is CHINATOWN??? Sad, so very sad.

title: Tasty entrees
review: We always enjoy the food at Phoenix. Prices are slightly higher but the quality and taste are better. The meal always include the house soup and sweet dessert soup. The staff is always friendly and attentive.

title: Good for Dim Sum
review: The food is very good. We should have ordered Dim Sum but only a lunch entree which did not come with rice or egg roll like we are used to back east. Also, we struggled because the dim sum menu was pictures and characters. It was a shame because it looked delicious.

title: Phoenix Chinese Restaurant, Chicago Chinatown July 2019
review: Wow!  Had the best Dim Sum ever. Great food, service, atmosphere and prices very reasonable. So much good food and so little time to try it all. The best.  Totally recommend.

title: Authentic so if you want chicken wings, egg fu young, and chow mein go somewhere else!
review: OK- I'm not Asian but pretty much everyone else sitting around on a Monday afternoon enjoying Dim Sum was.  I have been to China Town in San Francisco and visit the one in Boston on a regular basis.  When I discovered that my daughter's significant...More

title: Don't stop by this restaurant
review: We went to Chinatown and stopped by here for a late lunch.  It took about 5 minutes to be seated, followed by 10 minutes to have someone come to the table to welcome us despite the fact that we were the only guests.   They have...More

title: Excellent Dim Sum
review: This second floor restaurant in the heart of Chinatown is a great choice for dim sum. Served at lunch, the menu has around 50 items all at very low prices, $4.25 to $4.55. We tried 10 and all were very good. The crepes were great....More

title: Good dinner
review: We came here and had a great dinner.  Host is very friendly and gave us nice recommendations.  Food was delicious and good portions.  Only issue is the cleanliness of the bathrooms.

title: Phoenix Restaurant Chinatown
review: One of the larger dim sum palaces in Chinatown Chicago.  They have a wide variety of dim sum, soups and noodle dishes here.  The day we went was crowded and loaded with families around large tables.  You order from a picture menu with what you...More

title: Unpleasant experience
review: I was not impressed with the quality of the food offered.  The various types of Dim Sum I ordered were either tasteless or overly saturated in oil. I would say that this restaurant hardly lives up to its reported reputation.

title: Picture ordering!
review: Lunch at the Phoenix Restaurant is an opportunity to expand your horizons relating to Asian food.  You order by looking at the pictures.  Everything from appetizers to entrees.  It's time to throw caution to the wind and try something new.  Fun and delicious.

title: Tasty Dim Sum in a popular restaurant
review: We were 3 adults and a child and we all found several delicious options having decided on a Dim Sum breakfast! It was very crowded a mid-Saturday morning but service was pretty quick!  Chinese friends who have moved to Chicago recommended the place and we...More

title: Extremely disappointed not for non asians -  food was bland and inedible
review: My son and I ate here last week.  The restaurant was full of Asians happily eating their food.  Our food was so bland we went back to our hotel and ordered more food just to get a decent meal.  When speaking with an Asian friend...More

title: Great dim sum
review: It was very crowded on a Saturday morning. We waited a while to get our table but the queue was much longer after we were seated.   Good selection of dim sum. Most dishes did not disappoint. We ordered too much food and had to take...More

title: Outstanding!!
review: My fianc√© and I like to go to The Phoenix every year before we go to the Chinese Lunar New Year Parade, making it one of our yearly traditions. It is one of our favorite places in Chinatown and we frequent often.  The dim sum...More

title: Dim Sum fun
review: I‚Äôve been looking for a new dim sum hangout in Chicago. I‚Äôm a little disappointed that they don‚Äôt do carts, but I can‚Äôt complain about the food. The baked char sui buns were a delight with a light sweet crust. The egg custard tarts, were...More

title: so sad....
review: My teens and I love dim sum and find every opportunity to find 'the place' for it when in a big city, most recently San Fran and Washington DC Chinatown. I researched a ton when we were headed to Chicago. We were really excited to...More

title: Fantastic dim sum
review: Everything was delicious.  Stuffed eggplant, seafood dumplings, pork bbq buns, peppered beef ribs, bean paste and egg yolk buns.  Hard to stop eating!   They didn‚Äôt have our reservation but we were early enough (10am) to get a table. It was much busier when we left.

title: Nice Chinese Restaurant
review: We had a good dinner experience at this restaurant in Chinatown.  We went on a busy Saturday evening.  Seating was comfortable and our food tasted good.

title: No push cart for dim sum but very good
review: Went on a Sunday morning for dim sum expecting dim sum carts circulating the restaurant but I was told they don‚Äôt do that anymore. So we ordered from the pictorial menu.  Dim sum came in a timely manner. They did have the push carts but...More

title: a very good place to go for higher-end multi-course banquet style dinner options
review: We had a small family gathering for a nice higher-end dinner celebration on a non-busy week day. The food was fresh and well prepared. The service was very good. Overall, we had a great meal & good time.

title: Phoenix Dim Sum
review: This a great restaurant, right in Chinatown, for an early Saturday morning Dim Sum. The food was plentiful, dishes were very good, service well above average. As English they were very accommodating making sure not too much ordered and explained and answered our questions. This...More

title: Dim Sum at the Phoenix
review: The Dim Sum selection was large and very good. Service was good and was not too expensive to be able to taste a wide variety of dishes.

title: Phoenix restaurant visit
review: Ate Dim Sum lunch there, ordered many dishes of various dim sum. It was good, tasty. Prices $4-5 per dish.

title: Great variety and quality
review: Enjoyed a great meal with large variety. Everything was excellent. Service was pleasant and fast. Would recommend.

title: Dim Sum in Chicago China town
review: For those of you searching for dim sum in Chicago.. consider this place. It is always good. However, if you go on a Sunday you will wait for about 1 hour given its popularity. Once seated..enjoy the great food. The cost is about $50 per...More

title: Great  Restaurant in Chicago
review: Phoenix Asian restaurant in Chicago China town is a very good place to put on your list . The food is great and the price is good for Chicago. It is in a very good place and China town is a nice place to see....More

title: New management, a few upgrades, same great food!
review: Phoenix is known for its dim sum and the new management has maintained its high reputation.  Gone are the ubiquitous carts, you will need to order from the menu but anything you will want will be there.  The place is still crowded on weekends and...More

title: Disappointing Peking Duck
review: Have had their Peking Duck many times both in the restaurant and take out.  Haven't ordered it in several years.  We ordered take out.  First the duck skin was soggy.  Peking Duck is supposed to have crispy skin.  What we like best when ordered Peking...More

title: Great Dim Sum
review: I recently visited Chinatown while in Chicago and had a really nice dim sum lunch here. I had previously read reviews of places for lunch and this was one of two that I had bookmarked; I was not disappointed. The service and the food were...More

title: Best Dim Sum
review: One of our favorites in China Town  Always enjoy the Dim Sum   Go with our grandchildren who love it as well  Suggest you make reservation and avoid the line

title: Great Dim Sum
review: We arrived soon after the restaurant opened on a weekday so we had a seat by the window with a nice view of the city. It wasn‚Äôt long before it was quite busy. We enjoyed all our choices and the service was very good.  I...More

title: Where's my food?
review: All I can say is, where's my food? If you  ask for what you ordered after it never shows up the wait staff disappears and never returns.  Terrible service,  manager walks by stopped at every table but mine.  Lesson learned

title: Hit or miss depending on the dish
review: We came here two nights in a row and the dishes here can be a hit or miss. First night we had the stirred fried snow pea leaves with garlic and the beef short rib on a sizzling plate. Both of the dishes were delicious...More

title: Dim Sum Go-To Place!
review: The food selection on their Dim Sum menu is amazing, and the service is even better than the last time we came here.  This is a rock-solid, authentic place to go for dim sum in Chicago's Chinatown.  In the past, they would bring carts around...More

title: Some good and some just okay
review: The good: congee, steamed bbq pork bao, black bean spareribs.  Okay: chow fun, fried buns. Poor: calamari, fried sticky rice.   Good atmosphere; nice decor. I am comparing quality vs restaurants in Seattle, San Francisco, LA, Bangkok, Singapore and Hong Kong.

title: Best Dim Sum
review: Our go to Dim Sum place in Chicago  Always busy so make reservations  DimSum fresh family friendly  Salt and Pepper Shrimp one of my favorites

title: Not like it use to be
review: We have been there so many times and it is be very good but this last time was terrible.  After we were seated my grandson started to itch.  His mother didn't know why until she saw a tiny bug crawling on him.  She looked some...More

title: Dim sum
review: The restaurant English name remained but the Chinese name has since changed after the change in owners two years back. Initially the dim sum was bad but has since stabilized. Some items are quite good like the rice crepes while others are mediocre to bad....More

title: Five star food at a 3 star wait time!
review: Excellent food delivered at a nice pace...worth the wait.  Our only complaint was we wished they had been honest about the wait time. We were told 30-45 minutes.  It was actually 1 1/2 hours!  In a crowded lobby or sitting on the stairs.  Otherwise, tasty...More

title: Very good dim sum
review: Great customer service and excellent dim sum.  Host greeted us with a very warm welcome.  We had their Har Gao, Siu Mai, steam beef ball, beef tripe w/turnip, beef crepe, deep fried taro and pan fried turnip cake. Will be back for more dim sum!

title: Totally neat experience!
review: We really enjoyed this place!  I felt a little under dressed in shorts and a t shirt although most patrons were dressed this way....just that the atmosphere here seems a little more upscale.  We were a party of three and ordered the dim sum.  Our...More

title: Great Chinese Food
review: Good authentic Chinese food.  Nice people.  We ordered the family style appetizers main courses and desserts!  I love the red bean soup for dessert!!

title: Long queue
review: A nice restaurant for classic Cantonese food. Located on a busy street in Chinatown. Many people are waiting during peak time.

title: Terrible food and service
review: I thought eating at a Chinese restaurant in China town would be amazing. Not here. The chicken in the Mongolian chicken, general tsao's chicken, and chicken fried rice was rubbery and chewy. It had the same texture as shrimp :(. The dim sum was just...More

title: Dim Sum
review: I will be the first to admit I LOVE Chinese food and Dim Sum is my favorite. All the tidbits with different flavors and textures really do touch my heart. I will also admit that I have a certain standard when it comes to Chinese...More

title: High quality and cheap dim sum, terrible noodles dishes
review: Being of Asian descent and from Vancouver, Canada, I'm very picky about Asian food, and dim sum in particular. I have probably sampled the world's best dim sum in both Vancouver and Hong Kong so I know a thing or two about high quality dim...More

title: Lots of food for nice price
review: Huge menu, dishes served are equally big (maybe for my European standards). Dishes are tasty yet not too pronounced tastes in the shrimp dish I had. Would recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood.

title: Good Dim Sum
review: A recommendation from our niece who lives in Chicago. Good food, pretty cheap, for what you get, $45 for 5 of us, nobody left hungry.

title: First Rate Food, Third Rate Service
review: Lunch with 4 friends was a culinary delight with a wide array of flavors and dishes not seen at many places.  I especially enjoyed the dry cooked calamari, the eggplant stuffed with fried shrimp, and the noodle dishes.  The service was slow. We had to...More

title: Good food, but long wait and service was very slow!
review: I visited this property on Sunday, April 9th at 11:00am. We waited for about an hour and a half to be seated. The wait was very long.. I asked the hostess about 45 minutes after putting our name down to see how much longer our...More

title: Excellent Dim Sum in Chicago Chinatown
review: Prejudice disclosure.  I am devoted to Vancouver, British Columbia and Hong Kong Dim Sum.  That said, Phoenix Restaurant lives up to the taste and freshness of all of the above.  My deduction of one point is for service.  Not a memorable locale, but a very...More

title: Best choice for Chinese
review: Best Chinese ever.  Amazing menu of authentic food. Beautifully decorated,  very nice staff. Excellent Dim Sum.

title: Lovely crispy roast duck
review: Four of us dined at the Phoenix yesterday evening upon recommendation from an enthusiastic fan. My friends asked for pot stickers (good) and spring rolls (not so good) whilst we read the menu. We had half a roast duck (lovely crispy skin and moist meat),...More

title: Brunch Dim Sum
review: This place is always packed during Sunday Brunch but the restaurant is huge so usually they can accommodate a table relatively quickly.  Lots of different varieties to choose from.  It's always busy so the food is always fresh.

title: Wonderful Experience!
review: Three families-12 people. We called to make a reservation, but when we got there we were not on the list. However, they got us seated within 10 minutes. We were seated in private little room with a giant table that fit all of us perfectly!...More

title: "Dimsum with Friends"
review: My friends really want to try dimsum , so i brought them to this place in China Town coz they keep on telling me they want a legit one.Of course if you want a legit one where else you gonna go , China Town. The...More

title: Sunday Dim Sum
review: My first time trying dim sum.  Since first time, have no basis of comparison.  Went with friends who love this restaurant.  My friend did most of the ordering and i will say that everything we tried was very good.  They pace the food nicely so...More

title: Just ok
review: After battling traffic for what seemed forever,  I was a little disappointed.  First off,  there were no push carts. Service was very slow although larger tables were getting lots of attention.  I'm used to having a variety of sauces with dim sum, sadly there was...More

title: Authentic food
review: During walk through ChinaTown in Chicago, stumbled across this new restaurant, the Phoenix. Atmosphere was awesome (bright lights, tables galore) and the wait time was about 15 minutes. Food was delicious and wait staff very friendly and attentive. Would recommend this in highly!!

title: Dim sum
review: After a transition period with the new owners,  the dim sum has been good and very consistent. Usually crowded on weekdays as there is a 30% discount. The dim sum menu has lunch dishes on the reverse but no discount. They are good to very...More

title: Delicious shrimp with lobster sauce
review: I've been craving this for awhile and this place definitely got 5 stars. The shrimps where big and fresh, the sauce amazing.   √ìrdered some dim sum but the lobster sauce was my first choice and decided to finish it so I was too full for...More

title: Good tasty varieties
review: Enjoying dim sum in Chicago's Chinatown was a great way for a family gathering or a good start to the day. Nice dining room and offers a variety of dim sum dishes. We enjoyed the shrimp crepe, bbq pork crepe,  shrimp dumpling, chicken feet, turnip...More

title: Dim Sum
review: Excellent meal. Newly redecorated. No longer pushing the carts around. Bummer! Close to main entrance of Wentworth Ave. to the heart if Chicago's Chinatown.

title: Worth the trip!
review: When you walk in you will see that this place is very popular with the local Chinese people. There were many Chinese families here on Saturday morning. The dim sum was authentic, very tasty and inexpensive. It's hard to go wrong at about $4-$5 p...More

title: Great Dim Sum
review: If you and your family is looking for a place to eat Dim sum. This is the place for you. Good designing and great taste. I highly recommended it!!

title: Probably The Best Dim Sum In Chicago
review: We had guests in from out of town and they wanted Dim Sum, so - we made Sunday morning reservations at the Phoenix for a party of four at 10 am. 'am glad we made reservations, particularly as Sunday is a very busy day at...More

title: Nice Looking, but ...
review: We visited on an early Saturday evening and were seated by a window in the main dining room.  Very attractive restaurant compared to others in Chinatown, brightly lit and rather modern.  Clean restrooms too.  Noise level was quite low.  Fully stocked bar was available. Food...More

title: Always great Dim Sum
review: A family favorite -- even when our kids were very young, they enjoyed the variety of small plates (sauces on the side) as well as lots of attention from the servers. Food is always fresh.  Dim sum is brought out on carts on weekends but...More

title: Large group visit
review: I went with a rather large group set aside from the main dining area. The service was great and the food was good which is saying something since I'm not the biggest fan of Chinese food. My favorite thing was the ribs

title: Very Good Dim Sum
review: This restaurant is in the Chinatown area of Chicago, south of downtown.  It is accessible by EL train and in the summer by water.  It is classic dim sum with many small plates available.  The food is quite good.  The restaurant mainly caters to Chinese...More

title: Delicious Dim Sum & Dinner
review: The dim sum does not disappoint. Many selections & all tasty.  Dinner is just as delectable.  Food is fresh & delicious.  Nice presentation & good service. If having dim sum on the weekend, arrive early.

title: Coming back and disappointed
review: Came back for dim sum on Sunday and very disappointed.  The food is not good as it used to be any more.  Won't be back for sure!

title: Dim Sum classic
review: The space has been renovated but the excellent dim sum remains the same. Have been dining with Phoenix since 2001; still my favorite dim sum place in Chicago.

title: Very Good; A Few Issues
review: This is a very good restaurant, but there are a few issues. First, you order off a menu instead of from the cart; I prefer the traditional method. Service was terribly slow both to take our order and then to deliver it.  No one asked...More

title: Delicious!
review: We used to go to Three Happiness, but since it is closed, we asked for a recommendation and were directed to Phoenix. Wonderful experience. We were sat right away on a Saturday afternoon at a table by the window with a great view of the...More

title: Ok but not great
review: I had heard great things about this place but it didn't live up to its hype.  First of all, the service was substandard.  We had to aggressively seek a waiter (it seems no one was assigned to our table). a few times to get us...More

title: Bad Lunch
review: This is an update of my previous review.  After the change in ownership, the number of dim sum items available has decreased considerably and one has to order from a menu. The quality has also deteriorated. This time we did not order dim sum. We...More

title: The place to go for dim sum
review: Outstanding selection of dim sum at typically low prices. Clean and helpful staff. Located in Chinatown 2 blocks from the Red Line Chinatown stop.

title: Nothing special
review: Was not bad, just not really great. Noodle dish was very good. Curried baby octopus was gross. Everything else was edible at best. Service was ok, would have thought they would have asked about the octopus when on the plate were 2 octopus with a...More

title: Solid dim sum
review: I love the fact that you can get dim sum in the morning in Chicago Chinatown. Came to this place because they had a sign 30% off before 11 am so of course we had to try. Everything that we ordered were fresh and flavorful...More

title: Pleasant dining room...good dim sum
review: Pleasant dining room overlooking plaza.  Quiet on a weekday afternoon. Wider variety of dim sum before 4 PM...I got there to late for the bigger selection, so I had to choose from among some 30.  I only got to 5...all good.  Plenty of tea.

title: Tasty chinese food
review: We had a Chinese lauriat dinner at this restaurant. All the food that was served was good. We had the barbecue platter, pumpkin seafood soup, taiwanese pork, fried lobster, salt and pepper shrimp, fresh steamed fish, fried chicken and the vegetables with sliced ham. The...More

title: Enjoying A Beautiful Warm February Day in Chicago
review: Don't let the downstairs appearance deter you; the place is upstairs and very nice.  Phoenix decor is much improved with the remodeled dining room and everyone being dressy does helps to give it a premium feel.  You can either climb the stairs or take the...More

title: Great Service
review: My friends and I went to this restaurant. We never been to this restaurant and we want to try out. First, we came in and the employee was very friendly and communicated clearly and understanding what to order. I forgot what the employee name and...More

title: Under New management.  Avoid!
review: For years the Phoenix was a high quality restaurant with excellent dim sum.  It is under new management and has been slightly refurbished.  The dim sum is acceptable.  The main menu and its execution most of all execrable.  I have never tasted sloppier or more...More

title: Leaves you unfifilled
review: We had high expectations for this place based on other reviews.  If you have never had dim-sum and are simply wanting the dim-sum "cart" experience, then yes, it will do that trick.  But, if you have had great dim-sum before, you may not be exactly...More

title: Best Chinesse since I was in China
review: The date of this review is not accurate. It was actually 2012 when I was there and could not select that date thru the site options.  The food was fantastic! The most authentic I have had here in the states.  The service was excellent as...More

title: Bad,slow service ; average dim sum
review: Went for dim sum on a Saturday morning with family. Took elevator to second floor dinning room ...elevator was dirty and when look out the window it was disgusting ! Paper and dirt !! I should have known better and turned around. Got seated right...More

title: Excellent Beijing duck and dim sum
review: Beijing duck is probably my favorite food. I have it whenever possible on my travels.   It is excellent at Phoenix. I have had it here several times, and it is consistently delicious and well-served. A whole duck arrives at the table, and the server slices...More

title: Forgotten
review: My brother and sister in law took my husband and I to lunch upon my request, We made a reservation and took about 10 minutes to be seated but it was a Sunday so they were very busy. We were greeted and ordered water and...More

title: Not worth it
review: Service terrible, inability to describe menu. Did not bring water out. And worst of all they gave us different menus then what they gave chinease people, they diddnt give us specials menu. China town has much better to offer.

title: Excellent food and service
review: You have to go there on Mondays as their special is Peking Duck -2course for only $18.88.  Yummy  Dumplings excellent. Beef chow fun tender and just right smokey taste  Good vegetarian choices   I will be back

title: dim sum-tastic!
review: Our first morning in Chicago, and we headed here for brunch. At around 11.30, the place was already almost full ( and by the time we left the queue was down the stairs to the street!  A large range of excellent dim-sum!

title: Delicious Dim Sum served on carts
review: I bring visitors to Phoenix because it is one of the few restaurants left with dim sum carts. There is a good variety of dishes to choose from.  Ask for a table by the window and enjoy looking out at Chinatown Square. For dinner, check...More

title: Chicago Chinatown Hong Kong style food
review: We have been going to the Phoenix Restaurant for over 18 years for both dim sum and dinners. The restaurant serves authentic Hong Kong style Cantonese food and was the best in Chinatown. It has recently changed owners but still has the same head chef...More

title: Very good dimsum
review: Enormous variety, most of the dishes very good. Among the many dishes we ordered, we had five different kinds of dumplings, all of them delicious.  Service was fast and helpful. Well worth a visit.

title: Cart Service dim sum
review: My humus and is Chinese and we were visiting Chicago and wanted to check out Chinatown. We went to Phoenix for Sunday breakfast/brunch. Perfect start to the day.  We read the other reviews and went at 9:45 to avoid the wait. By the time we...More

title: If you want dim sum with carts, this is the place to go
review: For those of you who hate waiting, you need to come early. We had a table easily at 10:45 am. If it's later, then we usually go elsewhere because we hate waiting.  The carts are plentiful, and it's fun to see what you are picking....More

title: One of the Best
review: Happy we decided to dine here as we didn't know much about the restaurants in Chicago's Chinatown. We had soup, dim sum and split an entree that was prepared tableside and all of them were excellent!  Definitely would come back :)

title: Really good

title: wait is TOO LONG

title: Light and Bright with good food

title: Disappointing lunch

title: Still the best Classical Cantonese Food in the Midwest.

title: Clean Chinese Cantonese serving dim sum also
review: Located in Chicago Chinatown, this traditional restaurant is accessible by CTA. All dishes and dim sum are cooked to order and served hot. Thumbs up !!

title: Some yum

title: Very good Dim Sum, but get there early or make a reservation

title: Excellant vegetarian food!

title: If You Can't Make It To Hong Kong....

review: I love Chinese food and this place just made my Top 5 list for the country. The food was delicious, the venue was very scenic and the experience was pretty cool! I would highly recommend this place to others. I dined here with my wife...More

title: Dim sum
review: Good food, nice atmosphere. We went with a party of three and ordered Dim sum. The only thing I would not get again is the coconut jello, as it made my stomach upset.   Fried tarro is pretty awesome.

title: Taste just like home

title: Dim Sum
review: Great food! We had the opportunity to try several dishes. My husband's first experience with Dim Sum - he loved most of the dishes we tried.

title: Great Dim Sum place
review: A nice restaurant with very inviting decor and friendly, attentive staff. The food was good -in particular I liked the shrimp-chive dumplings, shrimp crepes, the red bean sesame balls, the lotus balls, taro cakes and turnip cakes. Had a great time!

title: Dim Sum Family restaurant

title: Impress out of towners

title: Nice Saturday Morning Dim Sum

title: Solid dim sum in Chicago Chinatown

title: One of China Towns Best
review: A very large popular China Town restaurant. Very good food, well prepared and large menu. Service also very good. A little more pricey than most but worth trying if you like to search for the best.

title: Best dim sum

title: Wonderful Dim Sum

title: Excellent Chinese food experience, shady neighborhood

title: Lives up to it's reputation
review: We were in China town for lunch and I had seen positive reviews for the Phoenix, so we decided to check it out.  Very reasonably priced and the Dim Sum was very good.

title: If this is Dim Sum, then . . .
review: I don't really care for it.  I know Phoenix has gotten excellent reviews and they are recommended in a couple of travel books, but, for me - nothing was that good.  So, I guess Dim Sum is not my thing.  The restaurant was so busy...More

title: Good Dim Sum

title: Dim Sum
review: We love to go there for Dim Sum but we did not have many choices from Dim Sum menu now since the renovation.

title: Phoenix looks great but service is different on Sundays

title: A taste of Toronto in Chicago!

title: Birthday dim sum

title: Good dim sum, other dishes ok
review: Numerous choices of good dim sum.  Carts during the day, more limited menu selection in the evening, but still a lot to choose from.  Other dishes ordinary, but some of the better dim sum we have had outside of Hong Kong.

title: Average at best
review: Every year we grab the kids and take a water taxi to Chinatown to wander around and ultimately check out a Chinese restaurant.  When we left The Phoenix my wife turned to me and said, I don't think I need to come to Chinatown again....More

title: Authentic Cantonese Seafood
review: Enjoyed a wonderful lunch with a steamed large mouth bass (kept live in restaurant) and Crab sauteed with Ginger and Onion.  Both were authentic and reminded me of Hong Kong.  Well worth the trip down to China Town if you are in Chicago.

title: Great dim sum and dinner menu

title: Dim Sum Lunch Really Hits the Spot
review: We went to Phoenix because Shui Wah, a popular dim sum restaurant that had been recommended to us had shut down. Phoenix is a little pricier than Shui Wah at $3.50-$5.00 per plate but is quite good for Chicago's standards (I've had better dim sum...More

title: Good dim sum
review: I have had better dim sum, but this was good enough. The shanghai dumplings (with soupy inside) were good as were the steamed bbq buns and the tofu. Several items were not as warm as I would prefer.

title: Highly variable
review: I have eaten here a number of times, and have had both outstanding meals and a couple that weren't very good.  I wish hat it was more consistent.

title: Sign Outside Says "Phoenix Dim Sum Restaurant" and it certainly is one
review: The sun raising and sets at The Phoenix on dim sum, now including evenings and there is enough interest to fill two large rooms at most times. The wait for a table can be long in prime time on weekends but generally well under an...More

title: As Close to Hong Kong Dim Sum as You Will Find

title: YOU CANNOT COME ONCE!!!
review: Look!  A few tips: 1. On a Saturday or Sunday, PLEASE go before say 10:30 AM in order to get a table and just ENJOY!!  Once the crowds start, the wait could reach more like 30-45 minutes!  We try to get there BEFORE 10AM and...More

title: Very good Dim Sum in a cleaner more upscale restaurant than typical, but be prepare to wait on weekends.

title: enjoyed their dim sum

title: Good Dim Sum in Chicago's Chinatown
review: Having had dim sum at Cai the previous day, we had high expectations. We found the menu to be a good selection, the food hot and enjoyable, good window view of the Chicago landscape, but the interior decor and cutlery could be improved.

title: Two visits in 2 years and both were great
review: Went for dim sum Obviously mafe fresh on premises Huge number of choices The only chinese restaurant you need in chicago Even won ton soup was full of flavor as were the wontons Friendly staff Great place overall

title: Good Dim-Sum in Chicago's Chinatown
review: While nothing beats authentic Dim-Sum in China, or San Francisco's Chinatown for that matter, The Phoenix Restaurant in Chicago is a good nearby alternative.

title: Dim Sum - Weekdays No Carts

title: Good but $$$$

title: Great Chinese food

title: Great food and lots of it!
review: Great Chinese food in the heart of Chinatown. Would go there again with friends or family. We took home lots of leftovers.

title: Average experience

title: one of chicago's better dim sum places
review: one of chicago's better dim sum places. When cart comes directly out of the kitchen the food is hot and fresh.  they have the basics and some good variety.  If you like dim sum this place will work for you.

title: first dim sum experience

title: Love the food!

title: Good Dim Sum, very slow food service

title: clean, good dim sum
review: This place is a staple if you are first time having Dim Sum, since the place is clean and easy to find, but if you are looking for Chinese dinner, then go to other place, this is overprice and not so good.

title: Consistent Good Food and Attentive Service
review: We have dined here many times and are always pleased with the diversity of selection, good cooking, and attentive service.  Now they are offering dim sum at dinner.

title: It's alright

title: Great Dim Sum
review: If visiting Chicago, I would recommend making it a point to plan a stop at the Phoenix Restaurant for Dim Sum. This was my first Dim Sum experience and I loved it! I only wish there were more than 2 of us to try more...More

title: Great Char Sui Pork Buns
review: The Char Sui Pork Buns go for U1.50 and they are great. The bun itself is light and fluffy and its stuffed with a slightly sweet pork filling. Defintely a must try when visiting Chinatown

title: delicious!!
review: My brother recommended this bakery because I was looking for bbq pork buns and mini mooncakes. omg!! so good!!! the quality was much better than what I could get locally from my home city. my mother liked it so much she got a bunch to...take back home to give to her friends. if I had a way to overnight a bunch of bakery goods to my daughters family I would have done so, its that good.More

title: Awesome Chinese bakery
review: Fresh and yummy Chinese bakery on Wentworth. Enjoyed an almond cookie, black bean donut and a cream cone. Wish I got there sooner to try the coconut cream cake. Bring cash because they don't take credit cards.

title: Excellent pastries!
review: Chiu Quon has a lovely selection of breads and pastries. Interesting fillings, like red bean and pork. Cash only.

title: Very Good Buns
review: We had a barbecue pork bun, a curry beef bun and a black sesame bun. All three were delicious although my favorite was the barbecue pork bun. We will be back next time we are in town.

title: Average
review: Billed as Chicago‚Äôs ‚Äúoldest traditional Chinese Bakery,‚Äù the flagship at 2253 South Wentworth Avenue an updated location with modern signage, Chiu Quon Bakery & Dim Sum has been serving residents of the Windy City since 1986.  Owned by Joyce Chiu and brother Matthew, their no-frills...approach to Pastries, Cakes, Buns and more having additionally entered Uptown with further expansion planned, it is from 7:00am until 8:00pm daily that guests are welcomed ‚Äì COVID-19 currently seeing extra safety measures implemented at a space that already appears quite clean.  Cash only then and now, with dining area currently closed but take-out sales faring well thanks to Chiu Quon's recent partnership with Facebook advertising, it is from over 100 daily items that diners must make choices, many of them identifiable to those familiar with Chinese Cuisine but others previously unseen.  Purporting to use ‚Äúthe finest Ingredients,‚Äù a dubious statement considering the low price point, it was at a cost of just under $17 that ten choices were bagged, a lack of seating finding the Taro Bun enjoyed on nearby church steps while Black Sesame baked similarly had an unpleasant gelatinous center as though it was undercooked.  Next sampling a refrigerated Walnut Bean Paste Cake, the Pastry on this as well as a ‚Äúmini‚Äù Moon Cake buttery around well-textured Filling, suffice it to say that arriving immediately after Egg Custard Tarts emerged from the oven was fortuitous ‚Äì both Hong Kong and Portuguese styles still jiggly with *better* largely a matter of personal taste.  Taking a chance or two before finishing familiar, Chiu Quon‚Äôs Sesame Pork Cookie undoubtedly an acquired taste, it seems hard to believe anyone might enjoy a ‚ÄúPeanut Rice Cake‚Äù that eats like sawdust in a flavorless Hostess Snoball, a far better taste and value offered by textbook Sesame Balls or golden Dough baked around subtly sweet Lotus Paste.More

title: Good Chines Bakery
review: I love their pork buns. I would rate them a five star only if they accepted credit card as a form of payment. They take cash only..

title: Pick up only
review: We have been going here for 10 years. During this covid19 time, no dining available at the place. We ordered the baked goods and took them home. There were others who called in and lots of bakery boxes and cakes were ready for pick up....Staff wore masks and kept customer lines with distancing. The buns are freshly baked. We often get egg tarts, BBQ pork buns, steamed rice and chicken wrapped in lotus leaves, and red bean paste buns. This is a cash only place.More

title: Get there early or you will be disappointed snce food go fast!
review: We arrived to the reatuarant in the late afternoon and most of what we would love to have sold out already! We did manage to get the sweet pork bun and it was very good!

title: Delicious cakes
review: The cakes and buns are very good.  Food is consistent.  I love their fruit tortes, the cake is light and moist, they use fruit filling mixed with whipped cream. The tortes are beautifully decorated with fruits and whipped cream; the whipped topping is perfect and...is not overly sweet.   The place is always busy and there is a queue.  If you don't know what you want you have to try to squeeze in and check out their display first before getting into the queue.More

title: Good Chinese bakery
review: I got into the bakery in the late afternoon,  several pastry containers were empty, looked like they were sold out, my daughter was very disappointed because of that. We were not sure how long those pastris could be stored, so we only bought enough for...More

title: Bakery
review: I had tried a few things very good and delicious places very clean. You get a variety of things in Chinatown

review: If you have 5 minutes and feel like want to spoil yourself, this is the placer. Try the almond cookies, super big almond muffin and the bun with pork! Uffff is just delicious!

title: Great food

review: The price you pay for traditional Chinese foods such as moon cakes and fortune cookies are usually extortionate, but here they are amazingly cheap. Portuguese egg tarts are delicious. This is a traditional Chinese bakery, it's open from 7:00 am to late.

title: Good quick bakery

review: We weren't sure what to order as this was our first time in a Chinese bakery. Everything looked fresh. We had the raisin bun and coconut w/sweet topping bun and we were very impressed!

title: Great Find in Chinatown
review: Our new favorite Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. Small place so make a reservation or order out. Tasty pan-fried dumplings and 100 spiced chicken. Owner Wendy will take care of you, making dishes to order and special dinner orders for large parties.

title: Superb Food and Restaurant!
review: Our group of 7 had dinner at Go 4 Food on October 9.  Wendy, the owner and chef, recommended to us the fresh Alaskan red king crab she had. The crab, prepared three ways - salt and pepper, Hong Kong Style and roe cooked fried...rice - was out of the world.  We also had the hot and sour seafood soup, french style tenderloin, steamed jumbo oysters with black bean sauce, eggplant in spicy sauce and salted yolk egg tofu.  All of the dishes were excellent.  What great food!  Go 4 Food deserves the ratings it has earned and exceeded our expectations.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  It is not your local Americanized Chinese restaurant.  It is great Chinese fusion food and the freshest seafood.  It is a small restaurant so be sure to make a reservation on weekends during peak hours.  Also, it is a BYO liquor restaurant.  Oh, the prices are very reasonable for the type and quality of food. Lastly, the service is very friendly starting with the owner. This is a must go restaurant in Chicago!More

title: "Check Please" participants may have been overly enthusiastic about this place.
review: We had lunch at Go 4 Food yesterday.  We chose the restaurant because it got rave reviews on the Chicago TV show, ‚ÄúCheck Please.‚Äù  The restaurant is small and is located on a very congested side street with little to no parking.  Their food is...really good. We tried the Manila Clams in Black Bean Sauce, Manila Clams in Garlic Sauce, whole Red Snapper, Salted Fish Fried Rice, Salted Egg Yolk Shrimp, and White Rice.  Everything was really tasty.  Three reasons why my review rating is not as high as it should be; the portions were too small, White Rice was not included with any of our dishes, and the server was adequate but rather sullen and indifferent.  Nothing friendly about him.  We had a pleasant enough experience here, but the "Check Please" participants may have been overly enthusiastic about this place.More

title: Great!
review: Terrific beef tenderloin dish and chicken dishes. Nothing fancy but great food. The crab dishes are too messy for the trouble. Tasty but hard to get at.

title: It's ALL about the food!
review: Was looking for an out of the way place in Chinatown with a slightly different approach to food preparation and a menu that wouldn't take a degree in culinary art to process. This place was awesome! Don't be fooled by it's outside appearance or decor....Quite simply this were the best Chinese food I've experienced in he last few years. Menu was simple yet inclusive, prices were quite reasonable, food was fresh and perfectly prepared with large portion sizes. On street parking a plus. Minor issues- this is not a place to dine if decor is critical to your experience- and the place is small- probably seating 30-40 patrons if they're friendly. If you don't try the green beans...you should be ashamed of yourself!More

title: Refined Cantonese cooking

title: Best Chinese Food

title: Excellent food

review: Ordered a delivery to my room when I was staying at the South Loop Hotel and was pleased with the experience. The food was very good but I was most happy with the fact they also included plastic ware and paper plates with the order....More

title: Great place to try
review: This is a cute little place to stop in and eat lunch.  The prices are very reasonable, cheap actually and the service is great!  It was authentic, clean and cheery place to eat.  Easy to find!

review: I have been to Go 4 Food twice, each time the food was ordered for me (by others). Everything I tried was excellent. I would suggest the special tofu.

title: Good food
review: As Asians living in the Midwest, we go to Chicago for our Asian food fix.  This restaurant got good reviews, so we decided to eat there over a holiday visit.  The waiter was efficient and very attentive.  My favorite was the whole steamed bass.  Though...More

title: Fast delivery, accurate order, but only average foor
review: This Chinatown restaurant was close to our hotel so we ordered in. The pot stickers were very doughy and there was no peanut sauce with the satay, but the food was okay. The service was very fast and friendly.

title: Fabulous Authentic Cantonese!!
review: I ordered in to my hotel because it was raining and driving in Chicago can be a chore with traffic and parking issues.   It arrived PIPING HOT and FRESH! WOW Fantastic! I will be going to their restaurant for lunch tomorrow before leaving!

title: It was super!
review: Walked there from McCormick Place and had the 100 beef for lunch...it was just perfect spicy plus tasted great.

title: Not your typical Chinatown Restaurant
review: Imaginative dishes, well prepared with fresh ingredients.  Because the dishes are not the usual "Column A/Column B" combination of protein with a mixture of stir-fried vegetables but instead are either just the named protein or just the named vegetable, you need to order with care....More

title: Imaginative Cantonese Cuisine
review: If you think of Cantonese cuisine as predictable, Go 4 Food will be a pleasant surprise. This is one of the most imaginative, original Cantonese-style restaurants in Chicago's Chinatown. Because it is out of the way, not on any of the main streets, many have...More

title: Amazing Salted Egg Crab
review: Tucked away on 23rd St off the old Chinatown main street, Go 4 Food sounds like a highly suspicious restaurant waiting to feed customers with overly sweet/salty Americanized Chinese fare. Honestly, what kind of name is Go 4 Food? Usually, I would not even consider...More

title: Fresh food
review: Had the garlic lobster, hot & sour soup, some vegetable dish (that's all i can remember about that), and spicy beef. lobster was fresh and cooked well. the soup was excellent, one of the best I've had in the city with the right amount of...More

title: Best Chinese food in town
review: This has been our go to place since its opened, I live half my life in chicago half in hong kong, so when I say this is good chinese food, this is good. The place is clean, server are polite and speak English, most importantly...More

title: This is the place for authentic Cantonese food
review: I lived in Hong Kong for 19 years, and I am always on the lookout for authentic Cantonese food in the Chicago area.  This place is one of our favorites.  If you want a modestly priced lunch, try the lunch specials for $5.  We like...More

title: Fabulous Cantonese!
review: My wife and I had lunch Labor Day.  Place is smallish, and not at all fancy, but the food is fabulous, and it is not expensive.  We had steamed oysters in garlic and onion sauce as an appetizer....heavenly!  We over ordered, knowing we would have...More

title: Excellent Chinese seafood at reasonable price.
review: This is a small place that maybe can hold 20 people at most, but the food was top notch quality. We had the fresh lobster for $23, the salt and pepper fried Japanese egg tofu and the French style beef tenderloin. Off the beaten path...More

title: Chinatown's Best- Excellent Cantonese off the Beaten Path
review: Just off Wentworth on 23rd street is an absolutely great little Chinese restaurant with great service and food to equal it.  Fresh seafood is the expletive here, but vegetarian, chicken and beef have their place.  We had an absolute feast ranging from starting with smelt,...More

title: I GOOGLED 'BEST SEAFOOD CHICAGO' ...THEN CHOSE GO 4 FOOD. YUM!
review: WE stayed in the River North Area, where there are a ton of restaurants. But I wanted seafood, and I wanted the best! It seemed to me that Go 4 Food was the right choice. And I was right. Plus, we took the El train,...More

title: Great Place:  Food, Service, Price
review: Our family of 6 had a wonderful lunch here on Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year),  We had 3 adults and 3 kids and everybody ate well.  The kids loved the Orange Chicken (so did the adults).  We ordered based on reviewers recommendations - Oysters,...More

title: Scrumptious!!
review: One day visiting my mom in Chinatown, she told us to try this restaurant. She said the owner of it is my former high school mate. I just had to go and visit. It was so nice to see Mary and her husband, Dennis. We...More

title: Fantastic Chinese Food
review: I can't recommend this restaurant highly enough.  This restaurant was recommended to me and my friends from someone who lives in Chinatown.  The service and food were excellent and the price was completely reasonable.  The food portions were large and tasted great while the service...More

title: The best restaurant in Chinatown!!!!
review: I work in the area and have had food from almost every restaurant in Chinatown.  I have to say this is hands down the best.  You can tell the moment you walk in the door that this place cares about thier patrons.  The food is...More

title: Huge portions, excellent taste.
review: This is located in the better area of Chicago‚Äôs Chinatown in my opinion.  The food was delicious.  We ordered seven different things and it all was really good.  Prices were reasonable. Portions were very big.  We could of split the meals.

title: I took some students from China here and they were so happy
review: The food reminded them of home. They were so torn wanting to order everything on the menu. What we ended up with was very good.

title: Not a place for good Chinese food
review: More like American style Si Chuan food. The owner showed off some celebrities on their menu but the taste was way below average.

title: Great Food
review: I just happened to walk into this place and sat down.  The service was friendly and the food delicious.  I was not brave enough to try some of the more authentic dishes, as intestines are not my fave.  The chicken dish I had was great...and the meal very reasonably priced.More

title: Great meal with good service
review: Had dinner prior to seeing the light show on Michigan Avenue. Wonderful meal with super tasty food.  We ate early so the place was not crowded. Place was full by the time we left due to people coming after the Bears game. Crispy mayonaise shrimp,...Szechuan green beans and triple chili chicken were all AWESOME.More

title: great food at affordable price
review: A Must for the Chinese Restaurant. There are so many dishes that attract your attention there and you should try them as many as you can.

title: Peppercorn on every bite
review: We had a luscious Dinner here.Line formed outdoor but smooth and welcoming host.Waiter helpful with menu choices.Be extra careful to order veggies with your dishes, otherwise tends to be greasy and lacking balance of protein & veggies.Specify kids order without spicy ingredients along the type...of sauce and veggies (funny mushrooms kind not a fave with our kid). Sapporo beer had a strong wheat flavor.Make sure your choice of tofu comes in  the texture you like - crispy vs soft/mushy.We recommend the hot pot with beef which is very spicy.More

title: Great szechuan and more!
review: My daughter took me to lunch as a treat, and what a treat it was!  We ordered the Chef's Special Dry Chili Chicken; Szechuan String Beans; and the Mapo Tofu.  All three were delicious.  Portions were very large so we also were able to enjoy...the "leftovers".More

title: Amazing, authentic Schezwan
review: Five of us had a late lunch.  We took the last table left.  We were some of the few non-asians in the place (a good sign).  We were given a free appetizer of Cabbage in chili oil, amazing!  We ordered a lot of different foods,...traditional and not.  Most of us are vegetarian and we had no problem finding food on the large menu.  The service was good, the food was fantastic, and all of us came out happy!More

title: great szechuan served until midnight
review: Just had a really fine dinner at Lao Sze Chuan with my daughter and a friend who were hitting town a bit after "regular" dinner hour. The lamb with cumin was especially amazing, as were the garlic green beans. And everything else (pork pot stickers,...dan dan noodles, hot dry chili chicken, free app of spicy cabbage salad) was delicious. Service was a little random feeling, but once we got our order in, it are out fast. Total for 3 people, with leftovers, was $67. Which isn't cheap, but seemed quite reasonable.If you like it spicy, this place will definitely tickle your taste buds! And they serve 'til midnight.More

title: Truly amazing food
review: Went on Saturday night. Our first visit to Chicago Chinatown. Everything we had was superb. The spicy cabbage they gave us as a free appetizer was out of this world and has my wife searching for the recipe online!  Very light and tasty spring rolls....More

title: Yummy spicy Szechuan food
review: If you want traditional, Lao Sze Chuan is the best place to go. The crab Rangoon are delicious, the peanut and cashew chicken will make your nose run (in a good way) and the spicy boiled beef takes me back to China! Take out is...More

title: Wow, truly authentic and incredibly delicious.
review: The menu is huge.  The food is terrific.  There is a tendency to be on the spicy side, however, they will warn you and will mellow or eliminate the spice all together if requested.

title: "The Best Chinese Restaurant in the USA"
review: It's true! Went here on the recommendation of a friend. Tommy, the host, was incredibly entertaining, and managed the wait line like a champ. The service was good. The food was perfect. Just be careful; portions are big, so be ready with an appetite!

title: Yummy spicy Szechuan food
review: If you want traditional, Lao Sze Chuan is the best place to go. The crab Rangoon are delicious, the peanut and cashew chicken will make your nose run (in a good way) and the spicy boiled beef takes me back to China!

title: Very Good, Very Spicy
review: Szechuan is my favourite Chinese cuisine and this place does it very well. Not for the faint of stomach because it is very spicy indeed! Extensive menu, reasonably priced.

title: Excellent food, extensive menu.
review: Wonderful experience.  Every dish was delicious.  Was happily surprised with the array of dishes on the menu.  Waitress was extremely helpful, explained in detail and her recommendations were the best.  Highly recommended!

title: Disgusting
review: From service to the food to the cleanliness of the restaurant itself - absolutely disgusting! We came for the chili chicken, their so-called famous recipe, only to find a standard spicy fried chicken still dripping with grease. That is to say, one of us did....More

title: Great Food, taste fresh
review: Great customer service, the people are friendly and courteous, open late, good fried rice. Beware: To go food container, only come in one size which is very large. portions that would be enough for two people. Food is made fresh and is piping hot. It...More

title: Chinese food in Chi town
review: Very good Chinese food in Chinatown, one of the closest to the real Chinese food. Some of the dishes are quite spicy but they specify the degree with a "pepper scale". The personnel is nice and rate quality-price is absolutely proper. Definitely a worthly lunch...More

title: Delicious!
review: We've eaten here a number of times and always enjoy it. Good food, friendly wait staff, decent prices. The Sze Chuan chicken rocks.

title: The Best Chinese Food in Town.
review: If you are a fan of Chinese food, no visit to Chicago is complete without a visit to this restaurant. Superb food, super fast and extremely friendly service.

title: Authentic Chinese Food

title: Not worth a trip to China Town, but try it if you like spicy food.

title: Great place for a shared family or business meal

title: Best chinese food i've had!
review: My  husband and I were not fans of Chinese food until we tried this place! It's best to go with a group so you can try a bunch of different dishes. They have a ton of options for vegetarians! Some of our favs are their...More

title: EXCELENT CHINESE FOOD AT EXCELENT PRICES

title: The most average Chinese food in America
review: We came here because of the awards  and critics reviews of the supposed greatness of the restaurant.  Sadly, we were disappointed. title: Authentic and good overall
review: We were a group of 4, 3 Chinese nationals and myself (Canadian).  We ordered: soup, dumplings, beef, pork, fish, shrimp, tofu, green vegetable, cucumber (too much for the 4 of us). Service and food were real good.  However, as I have noticed from other reviews,...More

title: Mediocre food and service
review: While my friend liked her vegetarian eggplant dish, my cashew shrimp had a cloying heavy sauce. I‚Äôve had much better frozen egg rolls. The hot and sour soup was tepid and oily. The shrimp was also tepid. Server not that knowledgeable or fluent in English...More

title: A very enjoyable experience
review: We visited this restaurant Saturday lunch time, and notice there was a large number of Asians eating. We were greeted by friendly staff and service was very good. The food we had was well spiced and very tasty dishes such as  spiced fried noodles with...More

title: AVOID. Awful, inauthentic reheated food, horrible service

title: Ignore the hype: give this a miss!

title: Authentic Szechuan food in Chinatown
review: Chinatown has a ton of great restaurants and I've eaten at Lao Sze Chuan three times.  The clientele are all Chinese, which is a good sign.  The food comes quickly.  The portions are enough for 2-4 to share.  Fair prices

title: Always good food
review: Went for lunch on a weekday...not busy. Ordered the garlic spinach and the house special sauteed spicy fish with cabbage. great meal for two. In and out quickly,

title: Serving Clients at its Best

title: Best Szechuan in Chicago
review: We love the authentic hot and spicy Szechuan dishes at Lao Sze Chuan. Excellent service in Chicago's Chinatown. Short walk from Chinatown stop on CTA's Red Line.

title: Very good food in Chinatown
review: This was a great find for lunch as we wandered around Chinatown.  The portions were large and very flavorful.  It was very busy but worth the wait.

title: Very friendly, excellent food

title: Satisfyingly spicy ...
review: ... Szechuan cuisine.  Don't be afraid to try something you have never had before.  On the other hand, one of the four of us had to wait almost a half hour for her food after the fouled up her order, then went "rope-a-dope" in an...More

title: Very good
review: Fast, friendly service in a clean and nicely decorated space. The food had great portion size well prepared and hot!

title: Stumble into a Gem
review: After a hard of convention meeting at McComrick Place, my roommate and I venture out by taxi near by to Chicago Chinatown. It was a short trip and cost only $6.00 to Cermack and S. Archer Avenue.  We explored both the old Chinatown and the...More

title: Amazing!
review: The food here is even better than the one on Michigan Ave. we were really glad to have stopped here before our flight later that night!

title: Overly salty mediocre Chinese meal
review: I had high hopes for authentic Sichuan food in a city as famous for its food as Chicago is. This place was not terrible, but not great either.  Located in Chinatown which is about 10 min drive from downtown Chicago, it is a small strip...More

title: Pretty good informal dining
review: Went there for a business lunch with several colleagues. Simple, informal dining area with really good food. There are also menu items that you don't find in your average North American Chinese restaurant. When you ask for something spicy, they don't pour on sriracha, or...More

title: Not as good as I imaged

review: Varied Chinese cuisine that was excellent overall. Many menu items. We had at least 6 dishes that satisfied everyone. Combined with superb service, this very crowded restaurant should have enough choices of different dishes to make everyone happy. This is my second trip here and...More

title: Amazing Food...Went twice.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Great tastes and presentation, great service. Best Schezwan food We have ever had. The signature chicken dish was particularly great, and we had a good lamb dish and house fried noodle dish as well. We will be returning every time we are in town.

title: Early lunch

title: Best Chinese in Chicago

title: The BEST
review: My husband who is an avid Chinese cuisine lover and I found this place on our search for the elusive "dry chili chicken".  We'd had it at another restaurant and have been craving it ever since and this was one of the only places we...More

title: Hot and Sour paradise

title: Worse than average_everything BUT dry&chicken
review: I was following some old recommendations of this place but it seems that the Michelin years are long over. After entering it looked as if I was bothering the chatting waiters with my presence and it took some time to acknowedge that they are there...More

title: Disappointed
review: We selected this restaurant based on the reviews.  I had the orange beef.  My son had a mixed vegetables dish, but there were pieces of chicken in it.  Somewhat disappointed.  Nothing special about the food.

title: Disappointing in many ways!
review: We were looking for a good Peiking duck restaurant and chose this restaurant based upon the favorable  notices posted in the window. We were mistaken.  The first difficulty was finding a server that speaks some English in order to ask questions about the menu. The...More

title: Loved it!
review: A friend took me on my first visit to Chinatown and to one of her favorite places there. The food was outstanding, the service terrific and the portions were enormous! Can't wait to get back!

title: Excellent Chinese Food as always.
review: Have always made it a point to visit this restaurant because of its consistently great food. The service is good and friendly.

title: Szechuan Food Done Right
review: What a surprise treat this was!  I walked through the log stretch of shops and restaurants. For some reason I kept walking even though some places had some amazing looking dishes prominently displayed. Thankfully Lao Sze was at the end and they had TripAdvisor and...More

title: Best Szechuan food in Chicago
review: Excellent place for good Szechuan food in Chicago , small restaurant but always busy and have to wait , friendly service , order anything and you are sure to like it .

title: Good spicy food
review: If you like spicy food, this is a place to go. They have many types of spicy food. The environment was good. The restaurant was quite clean. The service was quite fast. A good value restaurant

title: Terrific Szechuan
review: This is a terrific Szechuan restaurant that is very reasonably priced.  It is the original of the branch that is now located on Michigan Avenue.  Having been to both, I prefer this one for its authenticity and its pricing!

title: Great Dining Experience
review: Our son who lives in Chicago took us to this restaurant. We ordered several appetizers and entrees which we all shared and everything I tasted was amazing. Highlights included Tonys Chicken, garlic chicken and Kung Pao Chix. Can't wait to visit our son again soon...More

title: Very Good Sichuan
review: Ate here with my wife and step-daughter, who live in Chengdu & MianYang, Sichuan.  We ordered four dishes and shared. I loved them all and they rated a 4 but the stuff was quite authentic.  Even my Kung Pao Shrimp was not westernized much. Either...More

title: Authentic

title: Our destination restaurant in Chinatown

title: Great Chicagoland Sichuan
review: Having lived in East Asia for several years, Lao Sze Chuan cooks the best hot food that you can get in the area, and it's quite reasonably priced. Spicy Boiled Beef is a must.

title: Very Good But Not #1 in the US
review: On its front window under the restaurant's name is the line "The No. 1 Restaurant in the U.S."  Although the Peking Duck was outstanding, the rest our dishes were about average except for the whole fish which had a metallic taste to it.    The staff...More

title: Fiery yum
review: Chefs special dry chili chicken was amazingly spicy enough to make you sweat but not drink a gallon of milk while enjoying it. Paired well with a simple shrimp fried rice.

title: One of the best Chinese outside New York city
review: Great food, better quality ingredients than most any Chinese restaurant and great value too. They have spicy food but many options that aren't and a lot of items you don't normally see at most Chinese restaurants.  The House Beef on hot platter, Don Don noodles,...More

title: Great food at a popular restaurant...

title: Spicy and Delicious
