title: Disappointing
review: This was rated as one of the top 10 Chinese restaurants in the US but it ended up disappointing us more than impressing us.  The three chili chicken was greasy and not very tasty.  The sweet and sour chicken was good though.

title: Good but not authentic enough

title: Mixed feelings

title: Good Food - but the service was so-so

title: Not as good as it used to be, disappointed

title: No matter where you go Chinese is Chinese food!

review: Lao Sze Chuan is worth the wait.  Food is authentic and delicious.  Watch for the spicy indicator, some of the entrees are spicy hot.  Fish and vegetables were awesome and fresh. Try a few different entrees and share. Excellent

review: Great restaurant, on Michigan Avenue, with good food and very friendly staff. Be prepared to wait here (or book ahead if you can), as this is a very busy place.

title: Great

title: Omg
review: Incredible food!  Everything was very fresh.  Was especially surprised by the cabbage served as an appetizer - had to ask for more.

title: Favorite Chinese Restaurant in Chicago
review: Tony Hu, the owner, is the godfather of Chinese restaurants in Chicago.  He owns or used to own several restaurants, all with the moniker of "Lao __" in Chinatown.  He has now opened up a branch on Michigan Ave.  I have not been to that...More

title: One of the best places for Chinese food in Chicago
review: The food is spicy, however very authentic, colorful flavors, huge variety. The things to get are lemon shrimp (probably the best dish in the area), mongolian beef and szechuan green beans. Service is usually good.

title: Outstanding spicy Szechuan food and great service

title: Crispy chicken
review: I tried the dry spicy chicken, it was very good, just about managed to finish it but hardly touched the rice that came with it. Absolutely tasty ad delicious. Good courteous service... Will come back if I am on Chicago!!!

title: Sze Chuan food

title: A must try.
review: we almost didn't go because it didn't look like much from the outside, but you have to try it. It looks expensive but it's not, its very reasonable.

title: Good food
review: Busy place, service isnt the best however the food is good . Have been going for years . Stick with their specialties. Manager is hilarious

title: Great food, not so great service.

review: Went here with a group from China who were longing for authentic Chinese food. I think it came pretty close, if not exactly right. The Ma Po Tofu and the stir fried Chinese okra were great. Stir fried bamboo shoots with pork were also good.

title: Still one of the best in Chicago's Chinatown

title: Lost iPhone
review: Admittedly, I have no proof -- BUT! I left my iPhone on the table where we had lunch.  I missed it and returned a short time later, no phone to be found. I am confident an employee took it, but again, have no proof.

review: Please do yourself a favor and order the Shaking beef.  My girlfriend is from Taiwan and this is the only American Chinese restaurant that she can endorse.  If you love spicy food then this is your kind of place.

title: Good Food, Bad Hygiene.
review: This restaurant has above average food. Unfortunately, they did little to control their hygiene and service. If they want to retain their accolades, they should put more attention to their hygiene, atmosphere, and service. Great food is good, but it is not enough.

title: This is the restaurant for spicy food lovers!

review: Started out w good wonton soup Flavorful broth w veggies Then downhill Two shrimp dishes Large shrimp but mushy and not much taste Dumplings were average Friendly and good service

review: Food was good, but the service was not the best.  Waiters did not check up on us once and we had to constantly call them over when we needed assistance.

title: YUMMY Spicy Chinese
review: This is a great spot for authentic Chinese. Plenty of veg options and if you like it hot plenty of spicy dishes.  Big portions for a good price.

title: OK food
review: Somehow crowed during weekend. The food is not real Chinese cuisine but changed according to American flavor. However, I would not say it taste bad just because of that. It is still a ok place to go.

title: Spicy Sichuan cooking that punches a wallop

title: Don't even waste your time
review: The food is too spicy and the service is poor! The waiters and waitresses don't understand English and they are so rude! We asked for non spicy and we got a very spicy and unedible food! The place is cramped and so noisy!!

title: Just a totally perfect experience
review: Easy to find in the shopping village setting.only hard part was parking (there's a Chinatown lot, $2 for 3 hours with a validated stub). This will be a regular stop whenever we're through.More

title: Delicious entrees
review: The food is consistently good.  They added noodle soup to their menu and you can chose the ingredients - broth was delicious.  The interior has been nicely remodeled to look like a Hong Kong street.  The staff was very attentive and friendly.

title: Continues to be very good
review: One of Chinatown‚Äôs standbys for some years now, Ken Kee continues to offer a very high standard of Chinese cuisine.  It is like a good Hong Kong restaurant with a huge menu that encompasses Cantonese and Sichuan dishes. Most of the clientele is Chinese, always...a good sign.  The menu has many unusual dishes (example: fish maw with young pea tips). Very reasonable prices.More

title: Great Chinese Food
review: My family ate here after reading good reviews about it. It did not disappoint! We ordered several things that were each brought out as they were ready so everything was hot and fresh. We had the most amazing egg rolls first. They were so much...better than our average Chinese takeout place. I highly recommend them! We also had General Tso's chicken, a beef and noodle dish, and vegetable fried rice. It was all fantastic. We finished everything! Service was good. Restaurant was clean & easy to find and very close to the Red Line. I would definitely go back again.More

title: Good Chinese Food
review: Ken Kee has good Chinese food and I like it because they use more garlic.  The Sizzling Beef Tenderloin is good, beef is tender and flavorful.  Service is okay.

title: Authentic with reasonable prices
review: Summary: Decent food, decent price, indifferent service.  We ordered the Ken Kee Stir Fry and Orange Chicken to go with a Crab Rangoon appetizer. Service was slow with the restaurant half full on a Saturday at 5:30. We waited to place our order and get...water, but no one was rude or anything.  Food was ok, with some more authentic offerings, but I will keep exploring other options when I am in the area.More

title: Lovely Chinese food
review: On a recent trip to Chicago my mother-in-law wanted to eat Chinese food so we took a ride share to Chinatown, a place I had never been in Chicago. It was interesting. There is an entire mall with Asian gift shops, restaurants and groceries.   Ken...Kee is a small but lovely Chinese restaurant that is open all day and serves traditional food. Four of us ate until we were stuffed and we enjoyed everything from chicken to seafood to noodles (which were outstanding). It is small and the tables are fairly close together but it is still an outstanding dining experience for this type of cuisine.   Service was good but not excellent. Perhaps it was because they were so busy but overall this is a pleasant and interesting experience.More

title: Yummy!
review: We spontaneously stopped here and it was delicious! I will definitely return on my next trip to Chicago!

title: Poor service.
review: On April 7, 2019 around 6pm, my daughter and I came in and sat down. No one even acknowledge us. No menus or tea was brought to the table. Yet I noticed 3 other parties did the same thing as us and was brought menus...and tea. I will never go back again, the sad part is that we order there weekly but my husband usually just pick it up. I hope that our skin color did not a play a role in this, but I think it did. The other groups were, 1 White man dining alone, a group of 4 White ladies, and group of Asians.More

title: Just Average
review: Went here for lunch during our visit to China Town.  Service was non-attentive.  The noodles were good, but there was a small amount of vegetables on our vegetable dish.

title: My Go-To Place

title: Great authentic Chinese

review: we ordered 5 dishes, all of them have up to standard for the taste, and the service is ok, the staff is helpful, we have a good time there with our relatives

review: Huge portions. Authentic Hong Kong style. Better than other restaurants in neighborhood. I would come again if I was staying longer.

title: AUTHENTIC HONG KONG CUISINE

title: The Best!

title: great food

review: Walked into the place by chance, without even consulting TripAdvisor.  Very pleasantly surprised.  The food was delicious and the service was fast and helpful.  Especially enjoyed the baby clams with black bean sauce and the pea tips with garlic sauce.

review: We had lunch at this restaurant.  The food was not too bad but the service was terrible.  Twice I was asked "What?" when the waitress seemed to not understand what I was saying.   I wouldn't bother coming back to this restaurant or the area.

title: Green beans and sweet and sour sauce good
review: Good small place in Chinatown for authentic Chinese food. We had Kung Pai beef, green beans, crab ragoons and chicken fried chicken rice. All very fresh and good. I would return here.

title: Must try green beans
review: Such a great restaurant.  First, very bright and clean and quick service.  Ordered the crab Rangoon which was stuffed with a very tasty and creamy crab filling.  And the doping sauce was so good- a thinner version than I've ever had but so flavorful.  Also...More

title: Hong Kong style food.
review: This small restaurant serving Hong Kong style food for a long time in this Chicago Chinatown. You expect waiting during peak hours. Service is fast with foods sizzling hot. Will go again when in Chicago area.

title: China Town gem
review: Serves congee, Hongkong style.  Congee is a rice porridge dish which can incorporate fish, salted eggs,pork, exotic veggies/meat products. Love their fried smelts, spicy or with salt &hot pepper. Also go for the  pea tips in garlic sauce; recently tried their green beans w/ pork....More

title: Delicious and authentic
review: We happened upon this restaurant and what a gem it is. While the menu is pleasantly overwhelming to unrefined Chinese palette, we definitely both tried new foods that were wonderful. Yum!!!

title: Great Chinese Food and Ample Portions
review: If you want really good Chinese food and are on a budget this is the place to go.  My daughter now lives in Chicago and she took me and her sister to her favorite "student budget" restaurant.  I was delighted how clean the place was...More

title: Authentic/Fresh Chinese Food
review: I have visited Chicago on quite a few occasions, but this time I had the pleasure of venturing into China Town.  The entire area had many restaurants from which to choose, but I happened to find a gem in the middle.  The food at Ken...More

title: Good foodÔºåBig PortionÔºåNice Services
review: The Chinese dishes are genuine Hong Kong stuffÔºåGood portion to feed my western stomachÔºåthe maids are at least smiling when we orderedÔºånot rushing.

title: Yummy food and generous portion
review: Searching for chinese food we accidentaly checked into dis restaurant. We were bit confused abt what to order as we were new to their menu. Service was really bad but luckily food was yummilicious and even my lil daugher enjoyed their rice noodle.. It was...More

title: Consistently Good
review: We go to Ken Kee every time we visit the Chicago area which is about 3 times per year.  Consistently good quality food.  Recently remodeled, a very tightly packed restaurant.  We feed 6 people every time we go for about 70$.  Sometimes a little more,...More

review: This little Chinese restaurant excites me like no other in Washington DC.  After moved to DC I was very disappointed at the Chinatown's ethnic Chinese food. I thought I will check out the Chicago Chinatown to see if there is anything authentic.  The Chinatown here...More

title: Chow fun is the king.
review: If you ever have a taste of Cantonese wide pan friend noodle, get it here.  They can make it with, beef, chicken, shrimp or vegetables.  Hong Kong style peal milk tea is great too, I like the mango and also honey melon flavor.  I've eaten...More

title: Short stop in Chinatown
review: Driving through Chicago and wait to stop and eat Chinatown. Good place. Order 4 meals and had more than enough. Cook good. Shrimp was preferred, not over cooked.

title: fast and good value
review: Great authentic chinese food in Chicago's Chinatown.  The sweet and sour chicken is the standout dish for me.  You cant go wrong if you need something quick and that tastes good!

title: Been going for 10 years.  Amazing tastes always

title: Fast, fresh and friendly!
review: We enjoyed this cafe for lunch.  Modern, clean decor and extensive menu, hot tea and water delivered as soon as you are seated.  Combo fried rice, ginger fish and shrimp wontons all delicious.  Order mantou for dessert and enjoy!

title: Spicy, fast, and tasty

review: The food are great! We were order sake fish, pork chop with thousand island sauce, tofu. The best is pork chop. The sauce is really good. the service is not so bad, but certain waiter are a bit rude and can't speak English well.

title: Good home style chinese food
review: The wait was too long at our normal place, so my kids found Ken Kee. It had a lot of Chinese people in it, so we gave it a try. The menu is what I would call "home style". Seems like other reviews call it...More

review: My wife and I have been meaning to get back to Ken Kee.  We had not been there in a few years, mostly because of all the new places popping up in Chinatown (especially in the mall).   We had a late dinner that was very...More

review: cozy little restaurant.  food is good & authentic. visited twice during our 3-day trip to Chicago.  service was good.

title: Best Chinese food in chicago
review: Chicago‚Äôs China town has many great options for Chinese food. MCCB is the best I‚Äôve had yet. They had such an amazing authentic flavor & freshness of the food. The dumplings were the best I‚Äôve ever had.

title: Great Service, good meal
review: We dined here as a family and enjoyed the visit. Small authentic Chinese. Attentive staff. Limited drink menu. Good food.

title: Our new go-to in Chinatown
review: Delicious food with plenty of interesting Szechuan choices; good and reasonably-priced wine, modern/funky atmosphere (ie no red flocked wallpaper), friendly service.    Every dish we ordered for a table of 5 was great.  This restaurant is a wonderful find and we will try to return any...time we‚Äôre in the area.More

title: Amazing Chinese Food!
review: I was exploring the Chinatown with my cousin and we were searching for a nice Chinese restaurant. We found Mccb and It was in Michelin Guide! We were so excited from that moment and It turned out to be rƒ±ght!   We ordered Crispy Crab Rangoon...and I have to say It was awesome! Then we got Honey Black Pepper Steak and General Tso. It was so delicious!    I really want to come back to Chicago and visit again!More

title: By far my favorite!
review: This is the second time I have been here and it was nothing short of amazing. By far the best I be had. Try the rib eye with honey black pepper. It will make your mother cry!

title: Real Chinese food in Chicago's Chinatown
review: Despite our son living in Chicago for 10 years, we had never been to Chinatown.  We decided to go for dinner and the reviews for MCCB looked very promising.  We were not disappointed.  The food was fantastic and tasted nothing like the typical Chinese restaurants...that are geared toward American tastes.  Two appetizers and two entrees plus one dessert was plenty of food for 3 people.  They take a limited number of reservations on Saturday and given the crowd, we were glad we had one.  If you haven't had Chinese food in (any) Chinatown, we can recommend MCCB.More

title: Massive Apple Wood Charcoal Grill Lamb Chop
review: We were recommended to come here. Had no idea about the meaning of the restaurant name, but most importantly the food was indeed very delicious. Followed the couple on the next table, we ordered the Apple Wood Charcoal Grill lamb chop with "Numb Spicy" style....The serving was massive and the taste was delicious. The other dishes we ordered were tasty too.More

title: Perhaps our best Chinese food ever!
review: Despite living 90 miles from Chicago and visiting often, we had never been to Chicago's Chinatown.  After seeing a play at Steppenwolf, our son (who lived in Chicago for 10 years) suggested this restaurant based on Yelp reviews.  The reviews were right, it was great....Since he had read the entrees were huge, we only ordered 2 for 3 people along with 2 appetizers.  Everything was wonderful.  We especially enjoyed the "signature dry chili calamari" appetizer and "chong king style whole fish."  We had made a reservation for a Saturday night and that was a good idea because the place was packed. Our server was excellent and knowledgeable about the dishes.  This is real Chinese food, not what you get at a typical Chinese restaurant.  Highly recommended.More

title: Typical Chinese cuisine
review: I have eaten in Chinatown all my life so to impress me the food has to be absolutely delicious. After so many visits to the neighborhood the flavors all blend together. What will get a 1 star review will be slimy behavior, like the now...defunct "OK restaurant". My family told me they were charged $150 for a whole fish. If I was around I would have told them to walk out before ordering because nobody in their right mind would order a $150 whole fish unless it was at least 10 pounds.   Now that I have my background established I've had several of MCCB's dishes from  Caviar's takeout service. Pork fried rice, crab rangoon, honey black pepper bone in short rib rice (they're stingy about the meat for this dish), orange chicken (average).   The only dish that stood out for me is the honey black pepper chicken. Just think about the flavor profile and you won't be off the mark. You probably want to order right now too! If you're coming from my background I would strongly recommend that dish.More

title: authentic chinese
review: Noodles, Shrimp and cauliflower, spinach and garlic. We ordered too much and took quite a bit home. Nice generous servings. Next time I will get the shrimp and mango. It looked delicious and the cauliflower was difficult to manage.  I needed a steak knife.

title: Delicious
review: This is a must in Chinatown!!! The food is awesome so is the service.  We got General Tso and Orange chicken and veggie lo mien and it was all so good and the portions are HUGE!!!  8 of us were sharing and we had leftovers...More

title: Quit Reading Reviews and Just Go - Yum
review: Amazing restaurant in Chinatown with simple modern decor. Host/Waiter extremely friendly and accommodating. Service in general off-the charts. We are used to ordering from american Phonese Chinese restaurants and needed real help ordering. Szechuan wontons and cucumbers were our 2 appetizers, hot and cold -...More

title: Return visit at Mccb!
review: This is our third-fourth visit at this restaurant and it is always very good. This time there were 10 of us and we eat and eat until we could do no more!  The food was fresh and delicious. I love Chinese food, I have been...More

title: Delicious
review: I was staying across the street at the Jaslin and was recommended this restaurant. Trying to decide where to eat in Chinatown is a difficult task because of the numerous top notch food choices and MCCB did not disappoint. The place is small and quaint...More

title: Not your typical Chinese restaurant
review: Today was my third time eating at this Chicago Chinatown restaurant and it was my best experience here to date. I arrived  with a friend around 7 pm without a reservation. We were promptly greeted by a friendly wait staff who took my name and...More

title: Another fine meal
review: Mei and Team continue to deliver!  To start, went with my "go to" Dry Chili Fantail Shrimp.  I love spicy and this dish packs a punch.  The presentation, in the basket, is very unique.  On Mei's recommendation, I ordered the Sour Pickle Fish.  I was...More

title: GETTING SPICY
review: We really love spicy Sichuan food and this is one of our favorites in Chinatown Chicago. In fact, they were recently named to the 2019 Michelin Guide which is a great honor. The food here is simply delicious and authentic. I've traveled and worked in...More

title: Simply amazing flavors -- best Sichuan I've had
review: As soon as I walked in, the wall with the graffiti reminded me of the Sichuan restaurant I ate at in Beijing. The modern vibe was comfortable and the food was amazing-- the flavors are exquisite with the spice enhancing as opposed to overpowering the...More

title: Extensive menu

title: Don‚Äôt order ribs

review: We‚Äôve been trying all the restaurants in Chinatown and MCCB is no exception to the great restaurants found here. All the locals gather here for the food, fast friendly service & lively atmosphere. I especially like their soups having ordered two for our table. I‚Äôm...More

title: all good
review: had the grilled fish here, which was very legit and tasty. they also gave a microwavable box for leftovers.

title: Legit Sichuan food and good service
review: This BYOB mostly Sichuan but kind of Cantonese restaurant is fantastic. Highly recommend two different whole fish dishes - w/ Chinese Sour Pickle & w/ Spicy Szechuan Sauce. The spicy dumplings are also pretty great. If you're into funkier foods, the definitely give the white...More

title: Great Food!
review: Great Szechuan food at a decent price. The space is a bit cozy but that didn't really bother us. The service was very good. We needed help removing some of the bones from the whole fish we ordered (it was our first time hahaha) and...More

title: Another superb Sichuan Kitchen in Chinatown
review: MCCB (which stands for Modern China Cook Book), is one more addition to the high level, authentic Sichuan restaurants in Chinatown. I wish a genuine Hunan restaurant would open. Lao Hunan‚Äôs loss has not been replaced.  But MCCB is first rate. And there are fine...More

title: Nice music!Great food! Great service!
review: This is a new restaurant in Chinatown. They seem like doing Szechuan and Cantonese food. I try their Grilled fish with the numb spicy and Sand ginger fly chicken.Both are taste very authentic and and amazing.Also their staff are very friendly.         one of another cool...More

title: Better than most restaurants in Chinatown
review: Good wok flavor, good potion size. Friendly staff and modern, this is not your fathers chinatown restaurant. Get the honey black pepper beef short rib, so tasty.   At 6pm on Friday and there‚Äôs a line already.

title: Tasty indeed!
review: Delicious and cute! Decent portion size! 2 cups was more than enough for my 7 yo, 3 yo, and I. They have seating available for dine in. The staff is kind.

title: Hidden Gem in Chinatown
review: My friends and I just happened across this place and were not dissapointed. This is a quaint shop with very good rolled ice cream. I highly recommend stopping by here for some ice cream if you're in the area. And also take the time to watch them make it. It's a very interesting technique.More

title: Ice cream not just for scooping
review: Okay! The ice cream rolled is amazingly delicious! You have to hear me it's so creamy.  This ice cream is crazy good. The staff is so into being precise in the roll, cut and toppings it's so pretty. Look at my pictures it's so cool.

title: What a yummy find
review: Stopped by the kpop store on a quick visit and saw the sign for Thai ice cream and said what the heck.  Wowza I took one bite of my kids strawberry banana crepe cone and ran up and grabbed one for myself.  It had yogurt...strawberrys banana and little bit of chocolate...  absolutely yummy.  Great find and will difenetly try to make it back.More

Not a huge sit down area.  The Ice cream and some add ins...are spread out and frozen.  Then it is scraped up and rolled up. Portions are huge. 2 people probably could share 1.More

title: Best ice cream ever!

title: Unbelievable!

title: Yummy....
review: Mango was great.  Super fresh and worth the stop. My nee favorite place in china town for quick treat.

title: Awesome

title: Thai Rolled Ice Cream
review: This place was absolutely delicious. I truly enjoyed the selection that was offered. I had the mango strawberry ice cream. It has fresh fruit on top. The price was $7. The line was really long but moved very quickly.

title: Cool
review: It's a cool concept, great presentation, and friendly customers. The toppings are fresh and the lines move quickly.

title: Great Experience!
review: We absolutely loved the ice cream at the Legend Tasty House. This was the first time that we have had rolled ice cream. The presentation was amazing (see attached). The service was great with a quality product. We will definitely drop in next time we...More

review: A must-stop when is Chicago in Chinatown! This is the only place as far as I'm concerned to get rolled ice cream! This was a highlight of our trip during St Patrick's Day weekend.

title: AWESOME!!
review: The lines are worth it. The food here is a work of art, thin layers of hand-rolled, hand-flavored ice cream with delicious toppings that make it all the better. This place is like nothing I've ever experienced before. Don't miss it if you're nearby.

title: So Good
review: We decided to make a day of it in Chinatown. Ice cream is always on the menu for us. This place was busy, the line was out the door and down the street. It did move fast, and you get to see the workers create...More

review: I'm an ice cream fanatic so when I heard of this place in Chicago's Chinatown I just had to give it a try. I chose their green tea rolled ice cream and totally loved it! It was also interesting to see how they prepare it,really...More

title: Fun to watch and eat
review: All ice cream is made to order and you get to watch how they do it. It's pretty cool! I had the green tea rolled ice cream and unlike some other green tea ice cream I have had before, it had a nice mild taste....More

title: Thai ice cream
review: We had to try this ice cream after observing a huge lined that had formed outside and down the block to this shop. Returned a few days later to actually order the ice cream! Wow!!!!  One Mango and one Chocolate Latte! Deliciously smooth!! Definitely worth...More

review: The rolled ice cream is a new tasty treat.  They take the ice cream on a cold board, flatten it and roll it up in front of you. It is like Cold Stone Creamery where they mix the ice cream in front only they flatten...More

title: Best Ice Cream I've Had In A While
review: This place serves Thai Rolled Ice Cream. What that means is that they have cold plates that they pour liquid cream on, then they start churning it by hand until it turns into ice cream. Along the way they add toppings like bananas and Nutella....More

title: We Went Twice!
review: We were in Chicago for three days and had to go back for seconds it was so good! There was a long line the second time because it was a saturday but on Thursday there wasn't one. Even with the line though it went really...More

title: Tasty Treat
review: It was our first time here after having lunch in Chinatown on a Friday. We tried the Monkey Business (banana Nutella ice cream top with sliced bananas, whipped cream, sprinkles, and a chocolate pocky stick). The ice cream was super creamy and the flavor of...More

title: Cold treat on a hot day
review: Our family frequents Chinatown regularly, especially during summer to take advantage of the water taxi into downtown and the atmosphere of the neighborhood.  Our daughter saw the sidewalk ad for Thai rolled ice cream and it brought back memories of a recent trip to Thailand....More

title: Since 1950, the source of seafood you crave
review: Lawrence Schweig founded Lawrence's Fish & Shrimp in 1950. If there is a better source for fried seafood in Chicago, it hasn't been identified. Located at 2120 South Canal Street, Lawrence's offers signature shrimp, fried or boiled or smoked, with a big outdoor patio and...large private dock that is available to boaters on a Dock & Dine basis. The business is so popular that Lawrence's has expanded to locations at 3242 West 87th Street in the Westport Commons Shopping Center, at 850 West Superior, 50 South Mannheim Road in Hillside and 908 East Roosevelt Road in Lombard. On Canal Street, on the south bank of the Chicago River, north of Cermak, south of 18th Street, Lawrence's is open 24/7. Over the years, we have established a standing order, one pound of large wild caught Gulf shrimp brined and breaded using a family recipe with potato salad and macaroni salad and fish and chips, one pound of boneless, skinless wild caught Alaskan pollock fillets freshly breaded in house with tartar sauce. Don't forget the banana pudding for dessert.More

title: Great seafood! The best in Chicago!
review: Sunday evening, wasn‚Äôt positive they would be open or if I would be  the only customer.... pulled into the parking lot and it was a great crowd!!!  July 5 - Covid-19, no eat in and masks required inside. Can call in orders as well. Service...is to order but does not take long. There are outside tables to eat at too.   Fish sandwich and okra!!!! Excellent!  Hard choice over the shrimp or catfish so I‚Äôll have to go back soon. Had some salsa at home that went perfect with the fried okra.   I‚Äôve had the catfish before and it‚Äôs really good too.   The couple ahead of me didn‚Äôt have masks so they had to leave/no order. ‚ÄúWell, we won‚Äôt be back!‚Äù Their loss, the food is great and the employees are amazing. Don‚Äôt forget to tip. üòÅMore

title: Everything I come to Chicago
review: Everything I come to Chicago I stop here for the 1lbs fish and chips. There hot sauce pairs nicely with the fish. I but a bottle or two to take back home.

title: OFFICIAL
review: Really good shrimp really good fish really authentic hush puppies and the setting is like bring in a boat, the appearance and structure build i eat there all the time and I'm always happy it's the best seafood in the city i travel high and...low stores it sun for it .More

title: Just ok.
review: The menu prices are a bit too high.  The breaded 1lb shrimps are too small but price is high.  This is considered a fast food but you might want to order ahead. There is a large free parking lot and the restaurant is clean.  They...offer discounts on Tuesdays.More

title: Anytime a good time for fish
review: I enjoy the fish and chicken plus the banana pudding is excellent. The staff is friendly and the service is respectable but their a little stingy with the amount of food in your order.  Open 24 hours.

title: Food good...service needs lots of work.
review: From all the recommendations and hype this place got....I was very disappointed in this location.  The staff was beyond unprofessional. Front staff (order taker) talked more to the people standing around and staff then to myself and partner who was trying to place an order...(which meant I had to keep repeat myself). The kitchen staff doesn't know what they are doing why? would you cook everything that takes a few minutes to cook first (fries, shrimp) first and drop whole catfish which for them took over 15-30 minutes to cook last....so everything but the one piece of my meal is cold.  No plastic wear in the bag nor in site. Until I noticed the shirts and hair nets I thought they were paying customers... staff in the back corner either working, hanging out or just being unprofessional were cussing, yelling and for a second thought I was in a rap video.   The food was okay to me...corn fritters didn't have any corn, catfish really no seasoning but coconut shrimp we're very delicious. My partner didn't complain about anything but the temperature but after a 45 minute wait for what we got...he accepted it and he was rasied here, so may be use to bad services and cold food. Locals maybe use to this behavior but for an visitor....I don't plan to be back.More

title: It's all about shrimp
review: Our family has been coming to Lawrence's Fish & Shrimp since the 1950s, when my father took Wednesday afternoons off from his dental practice and took my brother and I to the movies. Afterward, it was our choice--Lawrence's Fish & Shrimp or a hamburger joint....Shrimp usually won, especially the large peeled a la shrimp cocktail and lightly breaded or French fried variety. Located at 2120 South Canal Street on Chicago's near South Side, Lawrence's has been satisfying seafood lovers since 1950. But shrimp is their speciality...large, breaded, coconut or popcorn. With fries and slaw. And cap it off with banana pudding or strawberry cheesecake. Wash it all down with a soft drink or lemonade. If you're in a mood for something other than shrimp--it's hard to imagine why--there are several tasty and healthy options, including cod, ocean perch, catfish, fish chips, clams, crab cakes, oysters and scallops. Chicken, too. How about a shrimp Po'Boy sandwich? Nothing fancy here. Order at the counter, pick it up when it's ready, find a table and enjoy a hot and fresh meal. Lawrence's has two other locations, 3242 West 87th Street and 9916 West Roosevelt Road in west suburban Westchester.More

title: Shrimp Fest
review: Wow ..... been wanting to come for years. Tried sampler with a beer .... coconut shrimp the best Going back fo more Today free boat ride to Navy Pier .... we are in

title: Very good breaded fish and shrimp
review: We read about this restaurant and decided to try it.   We placed our order for two combo plates of fried lightly breaded shrimp, breaded fish, and fries.   The fish, shrimp, and, fries were very good and In very generous servings.  It is a self-service restaurant...and you pick your mail up from the counter. Acrylic seating and tables but a very wholesome meal although a little on the pricey side.More

title: A Seafood Must Visit While In Chicago
review: Corn fritters, perch, chicken you can't go wrong. Open 24 hrs always has great customer service. Its pricey but worth it for seafood.

title: very good FRIED seafood
review: It has been a while since I last came here. The FRIED seafood is still very good. Just about everything is FRIED here. Slightly overpriced what you get. but overall the crab cakes were very good.

title: Delicious Fresh seafood

title: Ripped off
review: I paid $22.60 for this shrimp dinner and was a total rip off! Just look at what I got, don‚Äôt get me wrong the shrimp is good but not worth what I paid and for so little!

title: Love this place
review: My family and i have been going there for years love it !!! It never disappoints!!! And I like this location the most !! It's the original one !üòä

review: One of my coworkers brought in lunch from Lawrence‚Äôs, and I loved it. I had the fried shrimp and onion rings. Totally yummy. Everyone enjoyed their meals immensely. Can‚Äôt wait to have it again!

title: Yummmm
review: The coconut shrimp and their sauce is excellent!  I am going to tey yhe catfish next.  It look excellent.

title: Great Late Night Seafood
review: After hanging out with friends, we wanted real food and no fast food.  I am originally from Maryland so I know my seafood.  I was very much impressed with the fried catfish and shrimp.  My friends are originally from Chicago and this place was their...More

title: Grat Place
review: Great food! People have to visit this place. Warm and simple and very good food. We visited this place and we enjoy all the good service with a nice environment.

title: Great free stop for boaters
review: If you on the boat on Chicago river this is the best stop and I believe the closest one to downtown. The view on the river from here is awesome. Especially because of the old adjustable bridge with train trucks going trough it. Shrimps and...More

review: The sign says Lawrence's Shrimp and Fish. Fried shrimp, fried fish, fried chicken, fried oysters, fried scallops, fried, fried, fried.....yet amazingly there was a steady stream of customers. I actually liked their fried chicken best, but that's not saying a lot. The fried whole catfish...More

title: 24 hours
review: Love this late night spot.  Great food, always fresh and delicious. Great price. Best seafood spot in town. Better than goose island.

title: Fried fish  by the Chicago River canal  ,Chicago gems series
review: Here for early lunch.Plenty of parking and nice view.On the clean side.10 minute wait.Side dish is separately priced at $3.75 and desert runs between $3-5.This is standard fried fish,popcorn dtyle shrimp,you know...as in a cheat day.Is not greasy though.Crispy cod nuggets and ocean perch comes...More

title: Great Food
review: I went to the 87th & Kedzie location. They just happened to have a sale on shrimps Tuesday and they were great. The service seem fast for us, it is very clean with about a dozen tables to eat in.

title: Open 24 Hours A Day
review: Had a pound of the shrimp, pretty good. Can't wait to see what the rest of the menu has to offer. With open around the clock, you can easily stop anytime!

title: The best of the old time seafood restaurants
review: This is the best of the old time seafood restaurants that were located along the chicago river. Fish was caught in Lake Michigan and sold in these former shanties along the river. No longer a shanty but still not downtown.. Lawrence carries shrimp, fish, frog...More

title: The go to place 24 hrs a day
review: Great fried seafood with the specialty of the house being shrimp . Lawrence's has been on the corner of Canal and Cermak for what seems like forever. A facelift in the last few years has updated the decor but the food is still outstanding, and...More

title: Picking up a snack!
review: We went to Lawrence's to pick up something to snack on. We got shrimp and they were as usual Fantabulous!!! We also loved all of the new seating area outside. It's really nice. We will continue to enjoy the seafood there.

title: Too much Hype, not really Good.
review: I came here several Months ago for the 1st Time, despite being a Chicago Native(Dont Judge). I have to say, I was expecting much more. My experience started sour while making my order as I was told a ridiculous Total was due. When I reconfirmed...More

title: Best late, late night food around
review: Every year when we visit, we usually visit Lawrence's after a full night of drinking and I always get a pound of shrimp. Soooooo darn good. And, when we have the time, we will stop by during the day for some lunch. We hope Lawrence's...More

title: A Chicago mainstay near Chinatown
review: Shrimp is fantastic, perch is really good, jambalaya is amazing (but like 1000 degrees, let it cool). They've recently remodeled the outside and parking lot which gives it a more inviting, safe appeal. However, I'll stick to visiting during the day.  Price is a little...More

title: Haven't been here in years (we moved)..
review: ....but the food is the same as we remembered. Well fried and tasty. The cocktail and hot sauce were great on the shrimp and oysters. Catfish was awesome by itself. Mmmm.  They have done a nice renovation of this location since we were here last....More

title: Always Great
review: Been here numerous times over the past few years and we are never disappointed.  Seafood is perfectly breaded and fresh.  We stop here every time we are in town. Shrimp, scallops and oystersee are always hard to pick between.

title: Don't forget the hot sauce
review: I saw an advertisement for Lawrence's Fisheries on television and was hooked. They bragged about the fried shrimp with the thicker-style breading and the hot sauce. There are a lot of shrimp houses in Chicago, probably as many as there are in Sarasota, Florida, and...More

title: BEST SHRIMP EVER!  Open 24 hours
review: I absolutely loved this place!  The Shrimp was EXCELLENT!  THe best fried shrimp I've ever had and I loved the hot sauce!  The Shrimp was expensive but it was the best!  Will go there every time I'm in Chicago, and I love they are open...More

title: This place is a must if you want good shrimp.
review: I've been eating here since the 1970's it is by far Chicago's best shrimp. This is what I crave when I want shrimp. There is another place closer and lower priced and they are good  but I would go out of my way for Lawrence"s....More

title: oooh yeah!
review: I love fried seafood.  And this place delivers.  The fried scallops are so good! YUM!  there is also ample parking, so there's no reason not to go here.  Delicious!

title: Tasty and JUMBO shrimp
review: So here's the thing, the price is a little on the steep side, but it's worth it. I get a pound of fried shrimp and mm mmm mmmmm it's soooo good. This place gets crowded very fast, so I recommend going during the day. All...More

title: Hot day and good fish
review: My husband ordered steamed shrimp and I had the fish sandwich with mango sauce--they were both great and he hardly had to eat the rest of the day!  We could have stayed in side to eat, but chose outside near the canal thanks to the...More

title: Still good after all these years!
review: We decided to stop in and get a shrimp salad....fish/chips and fries. Salad was fresh and tasty...fish and chips fried nicely with good fries....don't forget your hot sauce and crackers!

title: Food is average
review: I have passed by Lawrence's Fisheries my entire adult life on the way to White Sox games and have always said that I want to try this place.   It looks like a Chicago institution.  Been around about 50 years or so !!!!!! So I finally...More

title: Deep fried and good
review: An institution and rightfully so.   Had the deep fried shrimp by the pound. Long wait but wow were they busy on a Saturday night.  Glad we had some.

title: Not fresh shrimp
review: It looked like a place that would be memorable but it disappointed us. It is winter in Chicago so maybe fresh shrimp cannot be had.  Inspired: the location on the river  Service: slow but friendly  Food: poor - shrimp were brown and mealy  Atmosphere: bustling...More

title: Food is above average, just too slow anymore
review: I have been going here for years.  The food (fried seafood) is always good and it is a very unique place that dates back to yesteryear.  There are not a lot of booths and most people take their food to go or just eat out...More

title: Very good late night food
review: My buddy and i ate here after 2 am after leaving the bars last weekend and enjoyed the food. The fried shrimp lived up to the hype. The fried chicken was also solid, as was their own hot sauce. The frog legs and ocean perch...More

title: Go for the SHRIMP
review: I don't know anybody, that doesn't know Lawrence's. I mean if they aren't from the area, then its understandable. My family has been customers at Lawrence's for years and we love the shrimp. I stick only to the shrimp, not to say that the other...More

title: Deep Fried Seafood!
review: I live in the suburbs and have been making this place a regular stop every time we make it into the city.  Usually 2 or 3 times a year.  You can't beat the quality and prices.

title: Great for Late Night Meals
review: If you are out in the wee hours of the morning and dont want fast food or breakfast, then this is the place for you. Located near China Town and not far from the Dan Ryan, the location is well placed. I had heard about...More

title: You HAVE to stop here!!
review: I'm from the South Side of Chicago and now live in Missouri. Any time my family or I go to Chicago, we stop at Lawrence's and get about 15lbs of shrimp to bring back for everybody. It's unlike any other shrimp you've ever had. They...More

review: We grabbed a bite to eat after doing the Chicago River Paddle/Kayak tour which launches right behind Lawrence's. If you like deep fried food and large portions then this is the place for you! The prices are very reasonable and the Half Order combo is...More

title: Deep-fried Paradise!
review: I popped in to Lawrence's Fisheries after enjoying the Blues Fest at Grant Park. They are expanding/remodeling and it was clean and bright inside. They have a parking lot & a boat dock. You can look at the photos of how it was back in...More

title: we eat here all the time!!!
review: I have been eating Lawrences shrimp and fish for 20 years. And it has always been excellent. Make sure to try everything on the menu. sometimes they have smoked fish and steamed lobster tails!!  Yum! My favorite place for fried seafood!!

title: Great late night, shrimp in a bag!
review: My family got me a pound of fried shrimp, delivered in a brown paper bag. The shrimp were huge and perfectly cooked. The restaurant has there own special hot sauce which was a sweet blend of spices.

title: Oh so Delicious
review: Great young staff. Delicious food open 24 hours. Fish and chips,  & shrimp! Their sauces is to die for. Now it our weekend spot!

title: Great shrimp.
review: The food is delicious.  My favorite is the shrimps.  I make sure whenever I go to Chicago that is one place I have to go.

title: Shrimp!
review: This place always has good fried shrimp.  I tried the clams and scallops the last time we were here and they were really good also.   There is always some drunk or homeless character hanging around outside begging for money or being a spectacle, which is...More

title: some of the best fried seafood ever!
review: a gem of a place on chicago's south side people from all walks of life come here you will see men in a three piece suit waiting for an order as well as kiddos in flip flops who have parked their bikes curbside to run...More

title: Lawrence fisheries
review: We took a cab here after a recommendation in our Everyman Guide Book,what a mistake. The cab driver asked if maybe we were overdressed in jeans and t shirts and we just laughed, then he did a loop in the car park to double check...More

title: Big Shrimp
review: I'm surprised this place hasnt got more reviews. It's been around for a long time. I have been going here for 20 years and I dont think the taste has changed. I stopped in there last night after a VIP meeting and grabbed me a...More
