review: i mean seriously....im in pilsen all the time...but im not that desperate....

title: The bomb, 24/7, 364 a year! Now they serve beer? Forget about it! Give me a 1lb of Shrimp and large Fries!
review: The bomb, 24/7, 364 a year! Now they serve beer? Forget about it! Give me a 1lb of Shrimp and large Fries!

title: FAST & EXTENSIVE CHINESE FOOD MENU
review: Great location for late evening and late night diners. I usually order take out and it's ready and packaged on arrival and before I get there. There is a section for rice dishes on their menu and I wish they would offer more choices.  The...dishes with eggplant were atrocious, they need to be paired with something different!!   Weiqiang Li should add to this RICE menu with dishes like chicken & broccoli, Hunan beef, Mongolian beef & more.More

title: Americans Are Second Class Here
review: If you are not Asian do not go here. Because your experience will be subpar compared to your Asian counterparts. Just left and wish I could give them ZERO Stars. I have never seen a place serve it‚Äôs cliental so unfairly. If you‚Äôre Asian, plastic...cups with Extra Ice no less, and complimentary Green Tea. If you‚Äôre American water will be served in old ass cups, and Tea must be purchased off drinks menu. First, I thought the clients were asking for it. Then I just kept seeing it happen over and over again. Asian client one type of service, Americans another. Asked for Steamed Dumplings, was served Shrimp filled dumplings. We don‚Äôt eat Shrimp, and told the waiter no seafood. Was charged anyway and they would not remove it from the bill. Icing on the cake and is what pushed me to write this review. A disgrace and cultural disservice. Instead of treating people equally this establishment serves its clients extremely poorly, unless you‚Äôre Asian.More

title: Tucked away no frills
review: Clean and tasty no frills Resturant  Egg drop soup was flavourful as was the spring roll. The most popular sweet beef was tasty and served on a sizzling plate.  If you‚Äôre looking for something tasty and simple relaxed Resturant chi cafe is certainly worth a...tasteMore

title: Chi Cafe for Authentic Chinese
review: Tucked in the Chinatown Square mall off of Archer, this is quite a hit with the locals, and we see why.  It has an expansive menu, with about 10 booths and two tables in the center. Lots of hustle and bustle with locals and tourist...alike vying for the waiters attention to order.  We ordered the squab, shrimp won ton soup, 2 rice dishes, chicken skewers, beef n turnips and fried bean curd - and every single one was really really good like  Hong Kong cooking should taste like.  With reasonable prices, quick service, we were happy to find this place.  And then you have the various dessert places all around to top off the meal!More

title: Best Late Night Option in Chicago!!
review: We got into our hotel in Chicago at 11pm and nothing was open around us.  We decided to order Chi Caf√© takeout, to be delivered.  Yelp said it would take 60mins, but it took about 25. It was amazing!  The delivery driver called when he...got downstairs and my husband went down to meet him. Delivery was beyond timely and friendly!  We ordered an abundance of food since we were going to be up all night working.  The egg rolls, egg drop soup, Singapore street noodles, chicken fried rice, and orange chicken were all amazing....and waaaaay too much food for us.  However, it hit the spot! It was hot and fresh! Couldn't have anticipated a better experience. Thank you Chi Caf√© for making the evening the best!More

title: late night spot
review: i like this place with extended hours, even 24-hr open on weekend. no parking validation, but its free to park after 10pm

title: Traditional
review: Quick service once we were seated. We ordered several dishes that were tasty - I had ordered a Lo Mein dish, I think they forgot about it and just served us a random dish towards the end of our meal. Overall, a good experience and...we left full!More

title: Late night eats
review: Long wait was worth it. We got out of our convention at Mccormick late  - after 10pm - then took an Uber to the Chi Cafe in china town. We were a bit confused at first because we were dropped off behind the building but...realized we walked around the front and into this beautiful alley way with all these wonderful shops and eateries!! Chi cafe was PACKED and we waited about a half hour at the door for a seat. It was a bit crowded and we had to manually write our name on the waiting list but it was worth the wait. I got a ginger bbq pork lo mein and crab rangoons. All i can say is.... friggin DELICIOUS. I wish I could seriously go back and eat this right now lol!! My husband got this wonderful sake beef dish on a hot sizzling plate and rice and it was fabulous too! Only con was that it was very very busy and we were there late on a Saturday but it was extremely worth it.   It was def a kind of hole in the wall joint with some super fabulous food!More

title: delicious inexpensive hong kong chinese styled breakfast, brunch or lunch place
review: we have a wonderful lunch, it was very tasty and filling. we ordered more than we could eat, and ended up taking some of it home.

title: Wonderful food
review: A wild choice of Cantonese food, everything was delicious. We had a great afternoon lunch. And the good thing is that place serve high quality food until 4 am. I will for sure go there again

title: week day and Sat lunch
review: good place to have lunch any day, sitting is plenty but the center portion is awkward if a small party, 1-2 persons. Serving is average, but efficient, Food is reasonably good, fresh and well cooked. Lots of items on menu with Cantonese dishes. Take out...More

title: Great food, bad chairs!
review: I used to come here all the time a few years ago when I went to college. I went back not too long ago and the whole place has been remodeled. Everything is as great as always except for some of the seats. They've put...More

title: Great, authentic, and excellent value
review: This location is in the newer Chinatown Square mall area rather than the old Wentworth Ave. main drag. It was easy to find, and though the seating was limited, we got right in for an early lunch, during which we were the only tourists in...More

title: Amazing...
review: I imagine that this is like eating in Hong Kong. We dined with a group that have eaten at Chi Cafe regularly. I left the ordering to them so I can't really say specifically what we had, but it was all so very good.

title: Amazing Food, Excellent Service
review: We have never been to this restaurant and it was amazing. Highly recommend this place. Cute little restaurant, Excellent food and great service.   Chicken Satay amazing Crab Rangoon amazing - the best I have ever had... Fried Rice Noodle & Beef with XO Sauce -...More

title: Great food at a great price
review: Good place to have some authentic Chinese food. The hot and sour soup was very nice and the beef with vegetables and rice was good too. Would come back!

title: Fast, fast, good food
review: In a hurry? No problem, they are super fast in getting the food out. This is one of our favorite/default fast food in Chinatown. Most items are really good and cheap. Try their salted fish fried rice, salt and pepper pork chops or scrambled egg...More

title: Business Lunch
review: Wow.  Six of us visited Chi Cafe during our conference at McCormick Place; we took a cab over.  We all sampled a variety of items from the menu and loved our selections.  The food was made to order, hot, and tasty.  The customer service was...More

title: Great prices!
review: My 13-year-old son wanted "authentic" Chinese food so we headed to Chinatown in search of dinner. He ordered something that was unavailable, so he substituted his choice with an appetizer and soup. I ordered an entree and appetizer. I was worried he wouldn't have enough...More

title: Best food at a decent price.
review: This cafe located in newer part of China Town offers great food at a great price. It offers casual dining and is open late and even some days 24 hours. Check out thier fruit smoothies they are delicious. Parking is plentiful and food is always...More

title: The best deal in town for Chinese food
review: The best casual place in town. Located in the newer part of old Chinatown, it offers very consistent experience. In two trips so far, not a single dish that missed the mark. Large and balanced menu, some of selections with pictures to help the selection...More

title: small portion; mediocre service
review: We ordered four items: beef noodle soup; pork liver congee; stir fried beef stripes with ginger-n-scallion; stir fired fish stomach with garlic chive flower.  Beef noodle soup was overpowered by the excessive bean paste, hence we did not even bother to finish the soup.  Also,...More

title: You have to know what to order
review: Authentic , good portions, nice atmosphere ..... They give you nice cup of tea. Food was good, but not my favorite. If you are looking for Chinese food. You'll probably be ok.

title: Great Stop in Chinatown
review: My current goal is to try more of the restaurants in Chinatown: I come down here all the time, but always end up going to the same places. My friend suggested Chi Cafe, and we were not disappointed! The food was great for the money:...More

title: Perfect for quick, tasty & inexpensive
review: Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for lunch.  Chinatown was crowded because of the Harvest Moon Festival.  We went to Chi Caf√© based on my cousin's recommendation.  We were glad to be seated right away and picked crispy garlic wings and chow mein noodles.  The...More

title: The best crab ragoon that I have ever had!
review: There is so much on the menu, it's hard to decide on what to get! I was told to to try the sizzling beef with sweet saki so I tried it and it came with rice on the side. I also got an eggroll, and...More

title: Perfect late-night spot in Chinatown!
review: Every city in United States should have a restaurant like this.   The Chi Cafe is run by professionals. The food they serve is very high-quality considering the late, late hour in which you can buy it.

title: Stopped in on an Impulse
review: Stopped in Thursday night when we had to stop near Chinatown.  WIfe, daugher and myself. What a wonderful surprise.  I had the Corn and Chicken soup.  DELICIOUS (so good, my wife got me another order today to go), and I had the Seafood and Pineapple...More

title: Get the Rangoon
review: Ordered late night delivery to my hotel from Chi Cafe a few weeks ago. My meal was moderately priced and delivered quickly (still warm).  I ordered the green-beans, which were slightly greasy and average at best, but the crab Rangoon (larger than most) was out...More

title: Good taste
review: we went there to have dinner with friends, the taste of the food is quite good, comparable to Hong Kong restaurant.

title: Casual and delicious
review: Cute cafe with casual dining. Lots of choices of entrees and drinks. I wish I lived in Chicago. I'd probably come all the time. I like that it opens so early.

title: Skip the appetizers.. Go for the soup..
review: We started our girls night out at Chi Cafe in the newer side of China Town. The decor is fresh and modern. We were able to get a table for 6 right away when we walked in, but there was a wait for those who...More

title: Don't know what happened
review: we have patronized this restaurant many times in past.  recently they were remodeled outside & inside.   unfortunately,  the food wasn't remodeled.  food was previously good. not sure what happened.  won ton noodle dish ordered was plain & bland.  no flavor.  the crispy garlic wings were...More

title: Use your noodle
review: The Chi Cafe might have a completely different vibe once their remodel is finished. We were there on the last night they were open for an expected two week job. The cafe is located in a two-story strip mall one block from the Red Line....More

title: My kind of joint delish & great value
review: This restaurant offers delish Chinese food for an amazing value. I was there at 5pm and there was no long wait but the place was packed.  Service was fast and efficient. Will go back in my next Chitown visit.

title: Atmosphere or Menu?
review: My husband took me dinner with the impression that I would enjoy because of the atmosphere and Lamb Dish. We were both very surprised. The food was good but we disappointed with the atmosphere.

title: Good to Try
review: Worst part about the restaurant is you cant find parking to get in...The food is good though, tried the orange chicken, it was spicy. Also tried the sizzling beef with black pepper sauce, that was actually really good! The portions are good. Would try again....More

title: Great food!
review: Went at lunch time..the service was quick.. I ordered the Orange chicken, it was delicious and the portion was large..my friend ordered tofu veggie soup (not the best) and the chicken broccoli..again the food was great and the portions large.. It was a great experience...More

title: The biggest menu of delicious food.
review: Take the water taxi.  Look for it on the main road.  Lots of restaurants there.  This is the best.  A very pleasant, informal, comfortable place.  Well-lit, nothing Chinesy about it.  No faky or gold on the walls. But, Whoa, the biggest menu anywhere, ever,  At...More

title: average lunch place
review: the food was ok, nothing to write home about.  we had the shredded pork with noodles.  The taste was just ok.  I don't think I would go back for awhile since there are so many restaurants to choose from in Chinatown.

title: Chinese in Chinatown
review: We've been here twice now and no disappointments. The food is served hot and fresh. The noodle dishes are very yummy. The sizzling beef is awesome. We had rice porridge for the first time ever and it was so good. This place is open very...More

title: Yummy
review: The food is pretty good.  Authentic Chinese food.  My favorites is the japanese tofu with king mushroom, clams with blackbean sauce, salt and pepper squid, and chu chow soup.  If you go for breakfast, they have different type of soups for like $2.75 and you...More

title: Get great Chinese food anytime!
review: Heard about this place from a friend and was not disappointed! Sometimes you just need good Chinese food in the middle of the night!  Our visit was at 1am on a Saturday night, the place was busy. However, we were able to get a table...More

title: I'm no expert, but I liked this
review: I'm no expert on any kind of Asian food, and frankly walked into this place because some other places serving dim sum had crazy-long waits on a Sunday morning.  However, everything we had in Chi Cafe was fresh, well-prepared, and cordially served.  Very pleasant meal,...More

title: Best Chinese food around...
review: This is the ONLY chinese restaurant I eat at ANYWHERE.  I stopped eating Chinese because most places are terrible.  This place is the real deal!

title: Authentic!
review: Oh so glad our Chicago friend recommended us trying this place! The only drawback is the parking. We couldn't find a safe place to park. I had to be dropped off to make my order to go. But we did enjoy all the goodness at...More

title: good enough!
review: I was craving for hong kong style food while in Chicago.  This is a pleasant find.  The restaurant opens 24 hours on Fridays and Saturdays.  We came late night around 10PM on a Saturday night.  The restaurant was almost full house.  There was no wait...More

title: Great Food
review: Reasonable prices, huge portions and a VERY friendly staff!  Made our lunch outting in Chinatown outstanding!

title: Real, authentic Chinese
review: Great place. Lots of unusual items, don't be afraid to be adventurous. My dining companion did all the ordering, everything was delicious and well prepared. This is not American-Chinese!

title: Classic
review: Very nice place in middle of Chinatown. In back of restaurant you can watch them make food . Stretching the noodles out and cooking everything . I had the oxtail soup , first time I‚Äôve had oxtail ( very tasty ) .  We also had...the house special soup and very tasty also . You can tell how fresh the noodles are , we tried both kinds and equally very good . I would definitely recommend going here .More

title: Delicious
review: A small authentic place in Chinatown, making different kinds of noodles. I loved their special  ‚Äúshaved noodles‚Äù.

title: Great Hand Pulling Noodles Soup
review: We were here and hungry for noodles soup. My husband ordered largest beef noodled soup, and the soup size was big, meat on the beef bone was tender, and noodles was chewey!   We also ordered the appetizer: black wood ears; it was spicy and flavourful!

title: Hand pulled noodles worth slurping
review: Kept calling Chinatown restaurant numbers at noon and Slurp Slurp was the first place to pickup...and I am glad they did.  I had a hankering for dumplings, and an 8 piece order of pork&dill (that I sent a-float in a pool of hot oil) hit...the spot...well filled pouches that were tender, not life-changing, but definitely tasty.  I was also excited to slurp some hand-pulled  noodles.  I tried the pork belly chow noodle to find the noodles long & springy...and the pork belly smokey and sweet. The dish also came with bok choy and tomatoes-more noodles than anything else, but that is what I came for...some slurping!  A tasty and satisfying portion & delicious with more hot oil;).   I'm already planning a return trip to Slurp Slurp to try some of their hand-pulled noodle soups...and some fresh shaved noodles as well.More

title: Best hand pulled noodle soup
review: We accidentally found this gem while attending the Chinese New Year parade.  The hand pulled noodle soup was just what we needed after standing outside in the cold.   The steamed buns are definitely a must try!  Everything was delicious and nicely seasoned.  Service was exceptional...and the staff friendly.  Highly recommend trying Slurp if your in the area. Will definitely go backMore

title: SLUUURP
review: I've been trying to find a restaurant as good as this one in Toronto, haven't found it. expecting to go this year again and try the new dishes that are shown on the pictures.  the service was really good. and the food is a must...if you are going to Chicago!More

title: Must visit!
review: Exceptional staff, super friendly, and helpful deciding on a dish. There was so much food i could not finish! Of course now I‚Äôm wishing i could have gone back for more!

title: LOVE
review: We LOVED the noodles here! The staff was very friendly, and the food was amazing! Definitely worth a stop. I wish were had come in hungrier so we could have ordered more!

title: Simply Amazing
review: The chive and pork dumplings taste exactly how my grandma used to make them! Amazing !! The pork belly noodle soup had great flavor too and the texture of the noodles was great as well.

title: Wonderful noodles
review: Never seen or tasted hand pulled noodles before. Absolutely amazing. Silky smooth noodles, tender beef melts in your mouth, wonderful broth. Loved this place.

title: Delicious
review: We got the hand pulled noodles - I had the oxtail soup, my daughter had their special, and my wife got stir-fried noodles.  They were all excellent.  Their broth is a bit salty for my taste, but the noodles are excellent and the ingredients were...More

title: Go and Go NOW
review: What a hidden gem in Chinatown Chicago.  Five of us all had great meals. Fresh and fast service.  Get the shaved noodles in any broth you like it is all good.  Getting hungry just writing this review and go hungry.  Big portions.  You can watch...More

title: Handpulled noodles!
review: We went to Chinatown with a different destination in mind, but in examining the various choices, we decided that Slurp Slurp provided the best combination of food choices and number of customers wanting to eat there.  The food was delicious, hot, and served promptly.  Pricing...More

title: Great Hand-Pulled Noodles
review: We really enjoyed our dinner at Slurp Slurp noodle house. My wife was especially impressed as she repeatedly exclaimed, "These are the best noodles that I have ever had!" She ordered the chicken stir fry noodles, and I ordered the beef brisket stir fry noodles....More

title: Excellent noodles!
review: This place is delicious! The hand pulled noodles, the bone broth, the dumplings, all excellent! Very authentic, flavorful cuisine.

title: 3.5 stars. Good noodles but limited selection
review: Freshly made noodles are always good. However there is a limited choice in terms of the meat added to the soup noodles. A lot of tripe and tendon, perhaps not suited to some people's tastes.I suspect the flavoring is also the same for most of...More

title: I'll be the bad guy here, I was little disappointed by the foods.
review: Having hand made noodle is not enough, they needs to be good.  Our noodles wasn't firm or chewy as many other places I have tried in the east and west coast. The meats were tough, the soup flavor was thin and lacks depth, both needs...More

title: One of the best hand-pulled noodles ever at reasonable prie
review: If you are craving for noodles, go to this hidden gem for hand-pulled noodles. I got the Slurp Slurp Special and it is just delicious with a generous portion of meat and bokchoy.  I shared a bowl of noodles and an appetizer with my friend...More

title: Changed!
review: This place had the best hand made dumplings!  But two weeks ago we went back and found that things have changed!   Authentic handmade Northern dumplings are supposed to have thinner skin at the top so that when the two sides come together, it is not...More

title: Variable quality dishes in a fast food setting
review: If you don't have a lot of time, don't want alcohol and don't want to spend much, the one page menu at this venue may be for you.  We were seated between the cash register and the bus stand with views of one of the...More

title: yum!
review: Chinatown has so many interesting restaurants ... I had a tough time deciding where to go. This restaurant was recommended by a passerby in Chinatown.  Although a small, unassuming place,  it has the best hand shaved noodle dishes.  I noticed most diners had the noodle...More

title: All About the Noodles
review: I ate here because I thought the name was cute ‚Äì don‚Äôt judge me!  Certain items on the menu have a ‚Äúslurp‚Äù logo next to their name.  Unfortunately no one could explain what exactly that meant ‚Äì strange.  Other than that, the menu was straight...More

title: Love this place!
review: I've eaten here several times pre- and post-pandemic and it's always amazing.  The owner is very personable and comes out herself to ensure everyone is enjoying the food.  The staff is always very attentive.

title: THEY DON‚ÄôT CARE ABOUT CUSTOMERS
review: This incident happened today. I have been an extremely happy customer for four years, until today. Don‚Äôt get me wrong - the food is great, its just some of the people who work there that are the problem.. My husband called to make a reservation...for today (we have always done this same EXACT thing EVERY single time we went previously  - many times) and was told that they do not take reservations the day of. I instantly asked why he didn‚Äôt say that we have always done this, so he called and tried again, only to be told the same thing. Then I called myself and got the same response. I told the lady that what she is saying is not true, as I have always been able to make one the day of. She told me that she doesn‚Äôt know who I talked to before, but that they don‚Äôt take reservations for the same day ever since they have been open. I simply told her that that‚Äôs a lie because I have always been able to do this, then she HUNG UP! I called right back, expecting her to answer again, but another girl answered. I immediately told her how rude it was of the lady I spoke with last to hang up on me and explained my situation. She gave me the same response. I told her I don‚Äôt understand how I have always been able to make a reservation the day of, when they have never made them? ü§î She then proceeded to tell me that it was the owner who I spoke with and that the owner says they have never taken reservations the day of. So I asked her, ‚Äúthat was the owner that I spoke with?! That is how the owner treats her customers? She hangs up on people?!‚Äù Then she told me that it was not the owner, but a hostess that I spoke with. So she literally lied to me, and I called her out about it. I then asked to speak with the owner or the manager, and she said that she just spoke with the owner and she told her they don‚Äôt take reservations day of. I said to her that she was lying again because how could she have just spoken with the owner if she was on the phone with me the whole time?! She then proceeded to lie that the owner was standing next to her and could hear our conversation (I did not hear anyone in the background) so I asked her to put the owner on the phone or at least to say say something out loud so that I know she is there. She then again went on about how she‚Äôs sorry, and that they don‚Äôt take reservations the day of. I told her that I will be writing a review and that I (unfortunately) will not be coming back ever again! I asked for her name and she said something like ‚ÄúNium‚Äù (maybe Nhung is the correct spelling - not sure) so I asked her to spell it for me and she kept going on with how she‚Äôs sorry, blah blah blah. I asked her again to spell her name, she refused to tell me, and then hung up. Needless to say, over something SO dumb, I will not be back. Any establishment that I bring business to (nonetheless bring friends and family to) that will willingly lie and treat the customer this way, doesn‚Äôt deserve my business!!!More

title: Go elsewhere
review: I visited this Saturday and originally planned to get barbecue, but I was told it would be an hour long wait. Thinking I‚Äôd have a shorter wait time, I headed downstairs to order some street food. I only ordered five pieces of chicken and two...corn dogs. An hour went by and I never received my food. I may as well have waited for the barbecue. I asked for a refund at that point, at which the cashier didn‚Äôt even apologize. The staff was extremely slow and didn‚Äôt show any signs of caring about the service they provided. It‚Äôs time they hire some employees that actually care about their job instead of standing around talking to each other.More

title: Celebrating birthday
review: Amazing food, waiter is very helpful in cooking the  meat.   Prompt service, must try the Korean pancake, the egg and corn cook around the grill is amazing.

title: Yum yum yum
review: I love this place.  It's a go to. Great for couples,  and even better with a group.  The pancakes to die for. Crispy, but light and fluffy inside. We usually wind up getting one of the BBQ meat combos. Always delish and high quality meat....But we have on occasion gotten some of the regular entrees. Also very yummy. And who doesn't love the plethra of sides. We recently took friends to the newish Duck Duck restaurant (underwhelmed). And all I could think was why didn't we go to Daebak. So much better!More

title: Great BBQ and KPop
review: If you like eating massive amounts of Korean BBQ amidst the sounds and sights (floor to ceiling video screen) of KPop, this is your place. The waitstaff sets you up cooking the BBQ on the oven embedded in your table. Take a large party and...you can sample everything on the menu. There are lots of pork and Beef choices. Other meats are limited but the chicken, mackerel and fried squid we tried were great. I enjoyed the atmosphere and my fellow patrons as much as the food.More

title: One of the best korean barbecues i have ever tried
review: The place does not accept online reservations for the same day so, either plan in advance or simply go there, they will tell you how long you have to wait and they can send an sms to confirm. A visit is totally worth. It is...easy to reach by foot from the red line stop Cermak-Chinatown and staff is friendly. Food is amazing and of a very high quality. We tried the beef combo and the waiter cooked everything for us and we had many small dide dishes accompanying the meet. Add some kimchi pancakes and you are settled. It is a little pricy when the alcoholuc beverages and everything sums up but it is worth the effortMore

title: Good food and excellent service
review: If you like Korean galbi (BBQ) this is the place. It is in Chinatown and is not a very big place but it is always packed with people enjoying their food. The food is delicious even though you don't get a whole lot of meat...for $30. If you are a bid eater, I recommend getting more than 1 order. The other food is good also. I recommend this place highly.More

title: Food Coma
review: Amazing and free top ups of side dishes. Don‚Äôt underestimate the portion sizes i.e. pancakes and tteokbokki!

title: Cool Experience
review: My first time here and it was a blast. Fast paced. Food coming as fast as we could eat it.  The staff was helpful with food choices and I was able to try many new items. It was really fun. I loved the soup

title: Authentic and reasonably priced
review: Exactly like in Korea! They even have more Soju flavours than most of the BBQ places in Korea. Price is ok, a combo for 4 is USD95, with drinks we paid about USD120. Probably on the more expensive side of the restaurants but absolutely worth...More

title: Love, love, love
review: Such good Korean BBQ! We ordered bibimbap and bulgogi and it was so good! Love their kimchi and soju selection as well. Would definitely recommend.

title: It's noisy busy and fun
review: Good service, they explain the menu and suggest what to get. They bring it to the table and take care of the BBQing so don't worry. Food is pretty good especially the marinated beef. It is pretty much in eat out so not for a...More

title: Great Food, Limited Beverage Options
review: We had a wonderful time, service was excellent, all food was tasty, good value for the amount we received. We only wished there were a few more options for cocktails and wine.

title: Korean bbq
review: We had large beef combo (good for 4 people) that alome cost 94.99, had seafood pancake, a soup and drinks which summed up to about 130 plus tip. Food is just alright for me. I say our husbands didnt get full from what we ordered....More

title: Must eat here bucket list
review: We have eaten here 8 times over the last two years, and will continue to eat here every time I am in Chicago! I have eaten real Korean BBQ in Korea and this place is as close as they get. The service is excellent, Kpop...More

title: An Experience
review: Dined at Daebak‚Äôs for my nieces birthday. Cool looking place in Chinatown (once you find it). The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly, took the time to explain the concept as well as continuously came around to check on us. We ordered the beef combo...More

title: A lot of fun with great healthy food and service
review: Love Korean BBQ, have had it in LA, London, SF, NYC, first time in Chicago.  It was very good.  My daughter and I are on a mission each month to try a different restaurant each month, so this time it was Korean BBQ.  The servers...More

title: Best Korean BBQ so far!
review: Table of six - We had a wonderful meal of various beef and pork BBQ dishes and accompanying garnishes. Services was very attentive and helped us through the various options, combos and dishes.  Love it!

title: Best korean in chicago
review: On a sunday night the wait in a restaurant isn't too sexy. And yet this lost treasure in chinatown does have its share of popularity. Yet the wait is not much for the quality of food.  The service is excellent and the many waiters will...More

title: JUST WOW!!
review: My first time eating at a Korean BBQ and I‚Äôm hooked!! Situated in Chinatown Square in Chicago. This is the place to go! Go up a flight of stairs and you walk into a very nice, stylish, clean space. Nathan our server took his time explaining every dish to me. He cooked the meat and came back several times to check on us. I can‚Äôt wait to go back.

title: Pretty darn good
review: We didn't go for the full on BBQ experience, wish we had.  Next time for sure. Just ordered individual entrees. All were delicious, will be back.

title: Bring a big appetite
review: Hidden on the second floor of the Chinatown square shopping center. Good sized portions. Crisp pickledvegetables along the 10-12 banchan dishes we got included 5-inch diameter thinly sliced Daikon radish. Lots of meat! Watching Cooking the side dishes of scrambled eggs and of corn cheese along the grill was novel, but I felt sorry for the dishwashers who have to clean the baked-on food. Pleasant servers. Very clean.

title: Unusual Cooking Experience
review: We tried out our 1st Korean BBQ. The place was located on the 2nd floor and was pretty spacious. The cooking part was cool to watch as the chef prepared the meat on the grill in the middle of the table. Each table had a little grill. For the combo we had about 10 or more different unusual items to try with the meat that they put in little saucers around the grill: seaweed, pickled radish and other stuff I couldn't pronounce. My husband was the taste tester for those, I stuck with the sesame oil and other dipping paste for the meat. Was a tad expensive for the combo, but filling. Had to walk it off with a stroll through China Town.

title: Wonderful experience!
review: Entrance is a little confusing - enter in mall not on the street. That being said, total experience was AMAZING! My group was the only European Americans when we arrived. That made us feel like it was an authentic experience. The three of us ordered the beef combo for 2 plus potstickers and special seafood pancake. With all the sides that came along with the meal, we were way more than satisfied. Everything was very tasty with new and different flavors for us.

title: Delicious Korean BBQ place in Chinatown, close to downtown of Chicago
review: Ordered various meat, ribs, and other parts and extra pork. You cook it in front of you and the friendly server is helping to cut and prepare just right for you. Many side dishes (ban-chan) with bowl of rice on top of BBQ meat. Located on the second floor to climb up stairs. The address is misleading, and it is better to look for the place from the Wentworth Avenue and Archer Street corner in the middle of small Chinese shops and restaurants. Paid parking lot is immediately next to the restaurant.

title: Great BBQ,,,,lots of Banchan
review: We didn't have reservations so we had to wait an hour, but it was worth it. We had a great server and liked our table. Both of us ordered BBQ which was served with lots of Banchan :) It was about $30 per person but with everything included, I'd say it was worth it. We would definitely go back. Actually, this was the only restaurant in Chicago that I actually enjoyed the food :/

title: Great food, friendly staff
review: Went with just a friend and myself for dinner. Ordered the pork bbq and included 4 cuts, cheese corn, bonchan and soup. The food was great and staff were helpful.

title: Delicious food and great ambient
review: What a great hidden gem in China townAmazing food and service great relaxing atmosphereOur first time here but definitely going back soonThe food was just delicious everything is very fresh and prepared in front of you on the table we got the beef combo and it was just amazing Anytime around China town you have to visit

title: Cool setup and delicious food
review: I watch korean dramas and so when we got to this place, it was exactly how I see it in my movies. There's air vents above every grill, there's delicious sou, and a huge screen with k pop songs on. It's not an all you can eat buffet, but for $89.99, we got 3 types of meat split between 6 girls. It was a really good portion and I think it was worth it. The quality of the meats were really good. That last piece of beef we got was melt in your mouth good. The servers are awesome. They come around to make sure your meats don't burn. Overall, this was our first korean bbq in Chicago and it was absolutely amazing!!!

title: Korean BBQ in Chinatown.
review: We've been checking this place out every time we go across the Chinatown mall to Cai Dim-Sum.  The first thing that you have to scope out is the ground floor entrance to the second floor restaurant.  Last night we tried it.  It is not the...More

title: The best Chinese food I have ever had!
review: It was a great experience. The place is nicely decorated. The food was just delicious! We didn't have to wait too long. 100%!

title: Great dimsum
review: We had dimsum for dinner. We had pork ribs, shrimp dumpling, lotus steamed rice, steamed pork wrapped in tofu and pork siopao. All of them are very good. Better than Phoenix, Minghin and Three Happiness.

title: Dim Sum waiting time: almost one hour, but worth it
review: We arrived in a Sunday noon, put our name in the book, 14 people before us. We waited outside of the restaurant first, then we moved inside because we thought when it got closer, we could be seated right away. Half hour passed, only 6...people in front of us, the bar seats got busy, we had to move more towards inside, some tables were done eating but still enjoyed chatting, since it‚Äôs a dim sum place you can‚Äôt blame them.  Finally we got our table, since we waited for so long, we ordered so much more food to justify out time, fortunately dishes were delicious and we knew the waitresses were trying their best, we witnessed the shortage of manpower during pandemic era, but happy to see them doing well.More

title: My best Dim Sum away from home!!!
review: It was on Monday, but this place was already crowded at opening hour!!! We did not wait much long! The foods were so good, tasty!!! It located right by the new section of the new Chinatown. You can walk to the Old main section in...distance. You can find plenty of foods and drinks in both sections. You will love it here!More

title: Great Dim Sum
review: Wanted a place with some outdoor seating and Dolo is a rare find for a Chinese restaurant. There is about 6 tables in a garden. A bonus was the great dim sum. Some of the best I've had. I also got a congee. I would...say that was more average. It lacked ingredients.More

title: Delish spicy rice
review: I enjoyed my spicy rice dish but sadly my sisters did not like their orders which is so disappointing. They had beef & chicken dishes and there was something not quite right about the dishes. Perhaps it was just their orders ....

title: Very Good
review: We came on Christmas Eve which may be a partial explanation for what seemed a very  confused service situation. Full bar, but no bartender so no mixed cocktails, for example. But all the service people tried to please on a busy night. Parking was quite...bad as it is in most of the Chinatown area. In general, the food was very good.  The Triple Delight was excellent. So was a beef and noodle dish.  We had a ginger and garlic chicken dish which was disappointing. The chicken seemed like cut up portions of chicken wings and the dish was just not very tasty unless you got a big biteful of ginger.  I'd like to come back for dim sum.More

title: Food In China Town
review: Flew in from Charlotte to do some eating did Greek, Pizza, & this place in Chinatown,  this is not on the main drag, this was the best asian food I have had. We ordered Appetizers of pork dumplings they were very good, then Wonton Soup...and Sweet and Sour Soup both excellent  most of the time lucky to get 1 or 2 wontons we had 4 in the small serving .  Then we shared Beef dish, Chicken with vegetables, Pork & vegetables, and Scallops with squid. Everything was great.  We thought they made a mistake because we ordered the small portions and what they brought seemed like a family dish, however no mistake. everyone was full and had plenty to take home for a second meal. 1-  come hungry 2-  brush up on Chinese they speak some english but ..... 3-  we were the only non Asian patrons so we knew we found the right place.    also prices very reasonable. note dont be in a rush food is prepared after order so give yourself some time to enjoy.More

title: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!
review: This restaurant was a huge disappointment!! Service is absolutely horrible and disgustingly rude!!! The wrong dish was brought to our table and when it was brought to our waiter's attention, he became furious and shouted "F**K YOU!"   We had a simple order of fried rice,...salt & pepper tofu, and baked chicken. The restaurant was not even busy and the mistake should have been handled differently. We felt uncomfortable and unwelcome because all of a sudden after the incident no one understood English or Chinese. There was no compensation for the incorrect dish being brought to our table except 4 small bowls of white rice (which was quite pathetic). This restaurant does not care to about their customers and I will never come back.More

title: Dim sum
review: Great for dim sum, i just wish they had more options available. The place was very clean. The service was pretty quick.

title: Wonderful food
review: Dolo has about the best dim sum in Chicago. It's a little off the beaten path but still in Chinatown but it does have parking. Service is sort of iffy sometimes but the dim sum is absolutely wonderful.

title: Average Dim Sum
review: Good but not great, I expected better based on Yelp reviews.  Food was average quality.  The chow fun, for example, completely lacked the smoky rich flavor that should crust and envelop the rice noodles and the sauce was bland.  Service midday Sunday seemed to be...More

title: Wonderful place in the middle of everything
review: We came in at the end of lunch on Chinese New Year and the place was jammed. Got a couple fo seats and the bar. Sampled different cocktails and a number of apps and rolls. Everything was good. Very authentic, sans the gweilo behind the...More

title: Good but greasy food
review: We had a good private room for party of 10 with 4 small children; good service.  But greasy, cheap meat in most dim sum offerings.

title: A definite must
review: This place has dethroned Ming Hin and Cai as my go to place in China Town, great seafood. You need to try the salty egg shrimp and Ginger onion chicken. Free parking, no validation needed, they have there own parking lot and did I mention...More

title: Delicious food + Dirty Bathroom = Average Rating
review: Food was once again excellent on our second visit.  Lobster in green onions and garlic was great as were Chinese broccoli with garlic sauce. Last time, we loved the unique flavor of the tea smoked shrimp which had far less oil than many other dishes....More

title: Dim Sum at Do-Lo restaurant
review: We ate sea food filled Dim Sum and chicken feet at this restaurant. it was very good. it was recommended by 4 locals we met while walking in China town.

title: Good food but misses the mark
review: Seven of us dined at Dolo on Sunday.   Could not track our reservation.  Fortunately we were early.  Food was good and in nice proportions.  Timing was ok.  Almost all arrived at once.  Table overwhelmed.  Service indifferent.  This is a recently built restaurant - the interior...More

title: Very good make to order dimsum
review: No push cart service here, which is not a bad thing.   Everything was good. Shrimp dumplings, fried beef noodles, congee, etc.  Particularly good was the thin flat rice noodles with fried dough.   And it is very cheap compared to downtown Chicago!!

title: Good dim sum
review: Good dim sum entrees like sui mai, shrimp dumpling, rice crepes, fried taro dumplings,  and steamed buns.  Place was nice when they first opened but cleanliness has decreased.  They need a good steam cleaning on their chairs, bathroom, and the bend on my teapot handle...More

title: Hit or miss food, poor service, loud music
review: I ordered the Sweet & Sour Pork, and got exactly what I expected, except for the fact that literally every piece of pork, was mostly bone. Not sure what went wrong in the preparation of my dish, but I could hardly eat any of it....More

title: The authentic Chinese restaurant that's good for non-Chinese too.....
review: Dolo is the Chinatown restaurant that you can include your non-Chinese friends for the authentic Chinese food experience.  This is a great place for dim sum.  While most people are looking for the cart experience, believe me, you'll get much better and fresher dim sum...More

title: Good, very unique food
review: Our table was close to the bar where one of the owners was working. He introduced himself and was great recommending things on the menu. The my meat and noddle dish was good, the meat had a weird chewiness to it so I did eat...More

title: Our go to dim sum place in Chicago
review: Whenever my friends and I visit. We order everything! Last time we were here we ordered for 6 people when there's only three of us.  The fried taro dim sum is my favorite. But anything on the menu is flavorful. You don't need to know...More

title: Dolo at dinner
review: The we tried their dim sum lunch menu some months ago, we promised ourselves we'd return to explore the dinner menu.  We finally got around to it.  When we walked in at 7 pm, the restaurant was 1/2 full.  It filled up a little later....More

title: Delicious, efficient, accommodating
review: Delicious food, incredible variety of them;  pleasant, accommodating staff who try to explain some dishes' ingredients; fast service; reservation time kept exactly (needed for a larger group); prices so,low it may be unbelievable tough true;  all around a fun delicious inexpensive dim sum.

title: clean restaurant (for the area)
review: Many of the restaurants in Chinatown feel and smell so dirty!  This one was the cleanest I walked into.  The servers were very good.  The food was good but a little greasy/heavy for me because I prefer to eat healthy.  The beans had a heavy...More

title: POOR HYGIENE
review: Never go to this restaurant unless you want to get sick! The faucet in the women's bathroom doesn't work - it just drips! When I told the waitress, she replied that they knew that and that it could not be fixed! Just imagine, how can...More

title: So many dim sum options!
review: Fast, friendly service. They refilled the water and tea regularly and cleared plates. We only tried the dim sum available until 4 pm and none of the regular entree menu items.   We loved the place, unfortunately too many of the dim sum that we ordered...More

title: OK Not Great
review: Decent dim sum, good service. Reasonably priced. But in our wonderful Chicago Chinatown this place just does not stand out. I do like their free parking! I'd go back, maybe.

title: The place was packed!
review: Thursday 1pm and it was pouring out.  We expected to find Dolo half full.  But no, we had to wait for a table to clear before we could be seated.  Fortunately that was only a few minutes.  Since this place is ranked among eater.com's 10...More

title: Chinatown New Favorite
review: I've been disappointed in Chinatown on multiple occasions and at multiple places.  DOLO did not disappoint.  The manager, Jason, came to our table and helped us pick out some good options and craft beers.  His selections were all winners.  Crab boil was fantastic and we...More

title: Excellent food and atmosphere
review: A little farther down Archer is this gem in Chinatown.   Relaxing atmosphere, attentive staff, and excellent food.  We really made the right choice venturing into Dolo.

title: Food Good, Service Awful
review: Went here with friends on a Sunday night early. Beautiful space, loud, crowded. The menu had professional pictures of all the dishes. The waiter was very rude demanding we order appetizers shortly after sitting down before our drinks. Even opened menu pointing at choices and...More

title: Dolo is a gogo!
review: Great good especially if they leave the plates in front of you long enough. Hot, tasty and fresh. Did a order or beef dishes.

title: Wow.  That was DimSum-thing amazing
review: This was my first DimSum experience and I do not know if it can be topped.  We had a private room for five of us with a lazy Susan.  Our friend (was born in Hong Kong) set this up and did all of the ordering....More

title: Decent Chinese Dim Sum Lunch
review: This review strictly on a dim sum lunch experience.  Never know about this place til I rec'd a Yelp review referral.   Appears this was average 4 star rated, so why not. They have their own park lot, but only for about 10 cars,  otherwise it'll...More

title: Seafood Heaven; Dim Sum were great too
review: Our first visit to Dolo to celebrate Monkey New Year a week early.  A rare find for a Chinatown restaurant with its own private parking. The trendy atmosphere was great and service was decent on this late Sunday afternoon.  Per friend's referral, we ordered $26.95...More

title: You know it's good when the locals eat there!
review: We decided to try Dolo's on a whim. I had heard that they had great Chinese food, so we went by there a few days ago. The atmosphere was very pleasant and the decorations were Chinese influenced but not gaudy. The menus were a little...More

title: Very good quality - but some issues to fix
review: If I were rating Dolo just on the quality of food, including superb preparation and high quality ingredients, I might give it a five.  But I have had two experiences there which cause me to bring it down. One is service - both times it...More

title: No better place for a wedding reception in Chinatown.
review: We held our wedding reception here. YiMing did a phenomenal job with everything from the menu to the service. For a party of 110 or less, there is no better place for a wedding reception in Chinatown. It's sleek & stylish, while still offering very...More

title: Well prepared steamed Pork Dumling
review: Dolo Restaurant serves tasty Hong Kong style dimsum & food. Special recommendation is the the Steamed Pork Dumling ("Siu Mai"-Chinese pronunciation), 4 pcs. in 1 order, wrap with a shrimp & fish roe on it. You will like it...  Stay away from the XO Sauce...More

title: Freshly made dim sum!
review: Seems like most people drive to this slightly out of the way place but it's well worth the walk down West Cermak.  If no one in your party speaks Cantonese, it might be a bit difficult but not a lot of English spoken here.  Menus...More

title: Really good food, but.....
review: Let me start with the positives: great food, great prices, large servings and very friendly service.  Negatives: while service was very friendly, it wasn't the most efficient. The previous review about the drinks was spot on. A person in our party ordered a cocktail from...More

title: Don't get a drink here
review: The workers didn't know where the beer was, even by looking at the menu. The cocktails are only available when a certain bartender is here. I gave up and asked for a Bacardi and soda. I had to point out where the Bacardi was, she...More

title: A Chinese place to visit
review: If you are in Chicago and you crave some authentic Chinese food, then here is the place. Crowdy a little but you will enjoy the food. I would give 5 stars but the appetizers can be better. Doesn't mean it is not good.

title: Excellent fresh Dim Sum and clean restaurant
review: I was walking in Chicago's Chinatown looking for lunch.  There were many establishments serving food but Dolo stood out from a distance.  The building looks new and well decorated.  The interior is very clean and trendy with a nice sized bar.  I instantly knew I...More

title: Chinatown treasure.
review: Fabulous mid-day Dim Sum and heaping portions some of the freshest, best prepared and reasonably priced ethnic food in Chinatown.  Did I forget to mention the warm, sophisticated, eye-pleasing  atmosphere?  With its exposed flagstone interior and lotus flower lighting, It's both couple and family friendly...More

title: Breakfast and dim sum
review: This place is our go to for dim sum. We even came here for breakfast at 9am. Unfortunately with Covid, they are not pushing around the carts. The ordering seems to have slowed them down.

title: I hate this place
review: I hate this place i will never come back- service was soooo longggg - i hate it- i came to the kitchen n threatened them if they don‚Äôt come in 5 minutes i will leave-

title: Dim sum
review: Great food every time. Service is terrible. I was thinking it was a cultural thing, but I see that they are unhappy people. The owner or manager barks orders at them. Maybe it is the way it is done in their homelands. If you have...time and are willing to put up with bad service, I still recommend it.More

title: Average fare
review: We went for a dim sum dinner having been advised this was the best in Chinatown.  It was good value of money, portions were big but the quality was average and inconsistent. The sticky rice and custard buns were tasty but the steamed dim sum...like the har gau, chiu chow dumplings, steamed buns were not very good, the skin on the dumplings was thick and not translucent.  Overall it was ok - we have had much better quality dim sum.More

title: Is there a dim sum factory somewhere?
review: MingHin is our go-to Chinese restaurant but Cai has been recommended several times so we gave it a try for a weekday lunch.  It's up a flight of stairs on the upper level of the Chinatown Square Mall.  It's a huge room, like a banquet...hall,  with many tables for 8. At 12:45pm the place was bustling and we had about a 5-minute wait for a 2-top.  They give you a menu w/ little photos of the dim sum on offer and this is why I wonder if there's a factory off-site producing them for multiple restaurants: the menu is very similar or maybe even identical to MingHin's and other Chinese restaurants we've eaten at.  After perusing the menu, we ordered 4 dim sum plates and an entree-size plate of seafood w/ mushrooms.  The entree was easily the best dish with shrimp, squid and pieces of scallop in addition to 3 kinds of mushrooms and celery (a lot), snow peas, scallion and carrot pieces.  My companion complained that it was not as flavorful as he would like but I enjoyed it.  The skinny fried egg rolls had a nasty rancid taste to them.  The "crystal dumplings w/ duck" were filled w/ shrimp instead of duck and had a gelatinous coating (taro?) that made them extremely difficult to eat as they kept sliding out of the chopsticks until I cut them with a spoon.  The siu mai were pretty good.       This was a serviceable spot and if you choose carefully you can get a good meal.  It's not in any way outstanding, though.  Service is efficient but not skilled; the clash of crockery being dumped into bins when they clear the tables is quite noticeable.More

title: DimSunday
review: first exp eating dim sum on Sunday and it was pretty wild.  people hanging from the rafters to eat dim sum here.  the service was not top notch but im sure the pure number of people in there had something to do with it.  I...liked the food and ate to stuffed!  had enough left over to take home and eat for dinner.More

title: Rude staffs, horrible food, long wait DONT COME HERE
review: Was expecting a lot since it was recommended on various websites but we were terribly disappointed. We were served by rude servers who wasn't polite at all. We waited really long for our food even though it was just small bites which we literally finished...one piece with 2 bites only. The dim sum was disastrous and shameful to be even called dim sum in a Chinatown area. I'm a Chinese here and I can attest that the food here is really bad and expensive too. Please do yourself a favor and not dine here and be upset with the meal like myself.More

title: Typical Sunday dim sum experience
review: Any Sunday in Chinatown, places like Cai are bustling with patrons, servers and food...its a scene. The food here is decent (various dumplings, shu mai, shrimp rolls, pot stickers) to very good (Peking duck), but the service is terribly uneven. You never knew when or...what food you ordered would show up next, and there were periods of time where we could not flag down a server. We ordered two sets of buns that never came, though we were told several times they were coming soon. In the end, it was pretty frustrating.More

title: Solid Dim Sum Place
review: If you want traditional Dim Sum check out Cai.  It's not exceptional, but the food, service, and pricing are all very good.  They have a nice variety of dim sum, and the place is plenty big, so you rarely have to wait for a table...(only on weekends and holidays do you have to wait).More

title: Best dim sum in Chicago
review: I had my mother‚Äôs 80th birthday there. Incredible food the best Peking duck ever!! The service was amazing!! I would never go anywhere else!

title: Very basic
review: Went for Dim Sum. Has a lot of room for improvement. Portions are large at the expense of quality. Need to hire someone with experience from Hong Kong.

title: Great Dim Sum in Large Restaurant
review: Its Dim Sum is one of the best compared to others in major Chinatowns around the US and Canada. The Dim Sum sizes were big, tasty and not too salty, just the right amount of salt. We also liked the big tables that gave us...More

title: Good Peking Duck
review: At lunchtime the place is packed & several customers were waiting to be seated. My husband & I were asked if we could share a table which we didn't mind because we were hungry. We ordered the peking duck which was cooked 2 ways--1 is...More

title: Best restaurant I've ever been to in Chinatown
review: Their seafood casseroles and softshell crabs are delicious. Their ingredients are also fresh.  Even the tea is fresh.   This place is also more affordable than Minghin.  Definitely eating here more in the future

title: One of the best !
review: The food taste very fresh, Taste great and is one of the best Chinese food restaurant we eat it.the service is fantastic, the waiters and waitresses are very friendly and prompt.  Highly recommended. Some of my favorites are sticky rice Shi Mia and shrimp rolls....More

title: Great lunch!!
review: Our friend brought us here after a tour of Chinatown. He ordered for us. We got ten different a la carte items. Everything was so good. We ate everything from shrimp rice to sweet biscuits. Then a mango tapioca pudding dish. I can‚Äôt wait to...More

title: nice place to go for traditional dim sum
review: The dim sum is very good and consistent, and a nice variety. It is a nice place to take guests or visitors to. Dim Sum is not cheap, expect to spend a few bucks more than usual

title: Continuing the Journey Down the China Grove
review: Has we entered Cai they were rated #2 in China town and surprisingly we were looking at their rating when we left and Cai was #1. What are the chances of that? Now if you want to know the reason why come here and taste...More

title: Great dim sun
review: A favorite in Chinatown for dim sum. It‚Äôs packed for a reason! We‚Äôve been eating here for years and will be back!

title: Dinner was not the best, pricey and for party of more than 6, 18% tax was added as tip!
review: We had dinner Sat Sept 30. Party of 19, we tried to order the best money can offer but were disappointed. Too pricey, and some of the dishes were tasteless. We ordered clam but it got mixed with noodles. Beef was tender but with mango...More

title: Great Little Dim Sum Place in Chicago Chinatown
review: Ordered 7 items for 3 people and the meal with tax and tip came to $35. We went early and were only the second party to be seated at 9:15am. The rice rolls (beef and shrimp) were yummy, as were the siu mai and beef...More

title: An Eye Opener

title: Feels like back to China
review: very authentic food and good prices! very much recommended! the decor is pretty much China too , but that makes it special

title: Great Great Food in Chicago's Chinatown-next time I'm getting the duck tongue
review: This authentic spot specializes in dim sum but they also have an extensive menu of other traditional and exotic Chinese dishes including duck tongue and other things I was not brave enough to try.

title: Worst place
review: One of the worst places I have ever visited!!! The food is horrible, the service is even worse- I was waiting for my order 34 minutes and they brought something not enough cooked- I just gave it backüò° and it was so expensive üòñüòñDon't go...More

title: Great Dim Sum!
review: There are a lot of places in Chinatown that serve dim sum, but this is one of the best we've tried. Dim Sum is available from 9 until 4 weekdays and from 8 to 4 weekends. There are no rolling carts; you make your selections...More

title: Authentic and Local
review: Firstly, we got a good "authentic vibe and feel" when we first came in. More discreet location and a good mix of busy-ness.  Secondly, most importantly, the 2-course Peking Duck dish was excellent, quick, well-cooked, flavourful and juicy.  Thirdly, quick and efficient. Tea immediately.   This...More

title: Awesome Cantonese Food
review: I have eaten there a few times there on several trips to Chicago. The food is authentic Cantonese and it's always excellent. The seafood is, of course, super fresh and the meats are all exceptional whether it's beef, pork, poultry or duck. The price is...More

title: Feels like China
review: They have an extensive menu that has some American Standards like General Chicken for the non-adventurous and Dim Som for the adventurer.  Dim Som is a menu of over 75 items that are small and meant to be eaten family style.  Be careful though, we...More

title: Fun family night and great food.
review: Two families with 5 kids go to Chinatown without a plan of where to eat. We walked around a shopping center on Archer(Chinatown Square), shopping for knick knacks, looking at expensive dried fish things. The stores in the shopping center are fantastic. The plaza is...More

title: Good dim sum
review: Great dim sum (some 70 dishes available) at a reasoable price.  Attentive staff, even helping me on their own cell phones to find a nearby Chinese printing company,  Highly recommendable though I was squished into a small four-table section because of preparations for a party,...More

title: Chinatown
review: Walking through Chinatown, it was very difficult to choose the place for dinner.  On the main drag through town, there were many little shops and diners.  We finally ended up on China Square.  Walking through the square, we found so many different eateries and many...More

title: Late Night Soup Night
review: The Restaurant is located upstairs in a Quaint quiet location: The Food was extremely Good! The staff was quick and efficient: There was a lot of Customer a Turnaround! What a Bang for The Buck! Great for Late Night Eating!

title: Good Dim Sum & Atmosphere
review: My daughter and I were in town for a college visit, and this was her first visit to Chinatown. We initially chose a different restaurant than Cai (didn't see Cai's Yelp listing), based on a Yelp review. However, when we arrived at the address, we...More

title: Week day lunch
review: Made to order dim sum.  You get to select QTY on a color picture coded check sheet.  Decent dim sum for us.  Bathrooms were decent too.

title: Made To Order Yum Cha
review: A friend recommended Cai and I'm very happy to have visited. The restaurant is a block away from the Chinatown Station (Red Line) so it's easy to get to and easy to find.   As expected, there was a 30 minute wait, but my friend and...More

title: Delicious eats
review: Cai is on the 2nd level of the China Town Square. It has very fast service and Dim Sum served all day. You may have other dishes if you like. Definitely try the chickens feet and congee.

title: excellent dim sum and dinner
review: Dim sum menu has pictures and there are 72 items.  Their dim sum is tasty and reasonable price compared to other major cities.  My favorite is #31 beef with mushroom rice noodle.  I also like # 3 shrimp dumpling and # 4 pork dumpling.   There...More

title: Authentic Cantonese tea house. DimSum
review: There is a parking lot right across the street, so parking is not much of a problem.   DimSum all have pictures on the menu so it is easy to order. All these are cooked to order so they are fresh.   Prices are reasonable.

title: Excellent dim sum dishes and good service
review: We visited this place several times in recent years for dim sum; and their services were always good.  The dim sum dishes were excellent and can compete with Phoenix.  What is lack in this establishment is great dinner dishes in general. The presentation is there...More

title: the food is up to standard
review: the dim sum is quite expensive, while the price of the dishes such as fried rice is reasonable, the taste is so far so good, up to standard, but not very outstanding one.

title: Surprisingly good service

title: Wonderful dim sum and regular menu dishes, great tea and service and the place is clean too.
review: This is one of my favorite dim sum places. It is definitely on par with Phoenix and has better tea and service.  The tea is the best I have ever had at a Chinese restaurant.  The dining area and even the rest rooms are clean...More

title: Just ok, slow service
review: We tried it out the dim sum one afternoon and it took 1:30 to have all 5 types brought up to the table, and they came one at a time. The food was good, but not excellent.  Not sure is worth the long wait.

title: Great Dim Sum
review: This place is nice and big. The service is very friendly, even if you don't speak any Chinese languages. More importantly the food is delicious and the bubble drinks are excellent.

title: Recommended

title: Dim Sum
review: First time experience, very very great food. All the food was great, but the duck was my all time favorite. Was very busy but that's ok, we was not in a hurry to go anywhere so have patience when going.

review: My husband and I ordered takeout from here: vegetable dumplings, chicken corn soup and kung pao chicken. The soup and kung pao had minimal amounts of chicken. The steamed dumplings were microwaved leftover dim sum made who knows when. They couldn't even microwave them correctly....More

title: Big place for Anglo tourists
review: Standard Chinese food of Ok quality, but nothing to write home about.  Has tolerable dim sum and usual Cantonese menu.

title: Strictly Dim Sum Review
review: by now,  i've come to the realization,   for dim sum on weekends,  you gotta get here by 10:30am the latest,  othewise, it'll be a decent wait.   i've discovered, you can call and get a reservation,  so that helps..........   service is decent,  but i only come...More

title: Busy place for Sunday Dim sum.  Slow service, go early so you don't have to wait for table.
review: Went for dim sum on a Sunday morning. We were lucky, walked in and got seated. Chose what we wanted on the printed colorful dim sum menu with pictures. And we waited for food to come. The dim sum came and was tasty and hot....More

title: Dim Sum Extravaganza but wash your hands

title: Poor Quality Ingredients and Below Average Food
review: I've frequented a few stops in Chinatown and this has been my least favorite restaurant.  I went to Cai for dim sum for lunch and was beyond disappointed.  The chicken was very poor quality (it had the texture of chicken feet, which is not what...More

title: horrible service-  ok food at best
review: The worst service I have encountered in years. We ate here on a Wednesday afternoon. It was a slow time at the restaurant only our party and one other table. We had some questions about items on the menu but two employees were unable to...More

title: Great food, a very Chinese place
review: This place reminded me of many places in China and Taiwan I'd been to. It is set up with a ton of round tables in wide open space. It is popular for Dim Sum, we were there at dinner, so it wasn't available then, but...More

review: The dim sum was really fresh and good. You get to pick from a menu vs. a cart so it seems to be cleaner.  However, the place is small, menu is limited, and the service is just mediocre.

review: Excellent food!  Our favorites were the potstickers, spareribs, sesame balls, pork dumplings and mango tapioca.  We didn't enjoy some items that had a rice noodle wrap (celery shrimp). It was very busy when we went!  Food came quickly and our waiter was very attentive.

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
review: I could not have been more disappointed with this restaurant. The Dim Sum was cold and tasteless, the wait was ridiculously long and the service was horrendous. The wait staff puts in the order and yet when they screwed up the order and my colleague...More

title: Good Dim Sum, but they charge extra for tea!
review: I have been going to Cai for a few years, and have always enjoyed the dim sum.  Service is typical Asian - hectic, alternating between slow and fast, but for the first time, I noticed that Cai charges for TEA.  Not a lot, maybe $.40...More

title: Incipit, flavorless, not good for Chinese food
review: Four of us tried their saut√© scallops, saut√© fish, lobster with green onion & ginger, and hollow stem vegetable.  All dishes were poorly done, flavorless, and basically incipit.  They may be slightly cheaper than Phoenix and Ming Hin, but are definitely not in the same...More

title: Good Dim Sum, but always packed on weekends
review: visited this restaurant on mother's day. arrived at 10:30am, didn't get seated til 11:30.   wait would've been even longer if we haven't agreed to get seated at a shared table (large table which are shared by 3 different parties). bit awkward w/strangers at your table,...More

title: Chaotic, crowded, and abysmal service.

title: Bad Service

title: Inconsistent!!
review: The Food was good at the grand opening..  The server talked like an emotionless robot, and the Dim Sum didn't tasted like Dim Sum at all.  Good Dim Sum should gives you the Wow factor effects.

title: Yummy Dim Sum!

title: Chinese New Year, New Chinese Restaurant Find!

title: Great Dim Sum in Chinatown
review: We have been coming to Cai in Chinatown for a few years and in my opinion, this is one of the better dim sum restaurants in Chicago.  Cai generally does not use steam carts, and you order with a menu that has pictures and descriptions,...More

review: Many Chinese restaurants also offer dim sum and sum of the best dim sum places are mediocre for  dinner. This place does fantastic dim sum. We tried several of the dishes and where able to pick specifically Hong Kong style for most. The dining space...More

title: Experience it--Dine in the round.

title: Bad servicesÔºåaverage food
review: Some dishes are good while some are lousy. I gave it 2 stars because we didn‚Äôt see any waitress or waiters smile to us or any other customers while we were there. they don‚Äôt have good services. Second, they are quite lousy in booking. We...More

title: Mediocre chinese food

title: good food, not good service, not honest
review: We went there for Saturday afternoon dim sum. Some dishes are good while some are not fresh. In general it has good food. I gave it 3 stars because two reasons. First, we didn‚Äôt see any waitress or waiters smile to us while we were...More

review: If you want authentic Dim Sum with a wide variety of flavors and a raucous atmosphere, CAI is your place.  The food is extremely tasty and extremely reasonable.  Service is a little slow especially on the weekend when it is crazy but it is worth...More

title: Amazingly Delicious!
review: I was more than satisfied with my dinner. Everything from the tea, soup, fried rice & my orange chicken were more delicious than anything I've ever tasted! This was well worth the trip! Large portions at a reasonable price. Perfect place for large groups, they...More

title: Excellent Chinese food in Chinatown
review: I enjoy taking friends to restaurants in Chicago; we had out of town guests from Vienna who are staying in Chicago for two weeks. To try something a bit different, we went to Chinatown for a late dim sum lunch.  I've been to Cai several...More

title: Dim sum done right
review: Cai has a large selection of dim sum items.  Service is good and quickly you are served high quality, authentic dim sum like in Hong Kong.  Price is reasonable.  We go frequently having lived in Hong Kong and liking this cuisine.

title: Dim sum to welcome the Chinese New Year

title: Dim Sum - Lots of Variety - Excellent Value
review: Brunch dim sum is one of my favorite meals and it is a joy at Chicago's Cai.  At some Chinese restaurants there can be a bit of a language barrier as the dim sum is offered by servers pushing carts and it may be hard...More

title: Authentic Chinese Dim Sum Dishes

title: Hong Kong style in Chicago at a very high level
review: Cai is a mostly Cantonese, Hong Kong style restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown. While there are better options in Chinatown for authentic Sichuan, Hunan, Shanghai, or even Yunnan cuisine, this is as good as it gets for true Cantonese. It is not "Americanized" Chinese cooking at...More

title: Dim sum
review: If your looking for a fancy dim sum place, this is it. The rice porridge with duck egg and mince pork was good. The egg custard bun was a sweet treat. We got a lot of food for a good price.

title: Dim sum in Chicago
review: Cai offers an authentic dim sum experience in Chicago's Chinatown. The baskets of freshly made succulent shrimp dumplings were divine. Should you order from the a la carte menu, I.e. Not dim sum, do expect sizeable portions.

title: Upscale Chinese restaurant at moderate prices
review: Have eaten here 3 times and found their food to be very good.  The service here is excellent.  The food is tasty. They have menu items like oxtail and salted fish with pork that we tried and found to be very tasty.  They also serve...More

title: Order the dumplings
review: We had some time before our flight so we wanted to explore Chinatown. This place had the best dumplings I‚Äôve ever had. They could easily be an entree. The bubble tea was very good as well. They had at least 100 different flavors.

title: So good,great tea to match
review: This gooey goodness is worth the long line and the caloric intake.We had Mango& Lychee freeze with tapioca.Go for it!

title: Not recommended for non meat eaters
review: We are recommended joy yee by our taxi driver ... we were staying round the corner so it was handy but struggled to find anything that suited our taste buds and we ordered 5 dishes - way too much but we ordered a handful of...veggie options to try. It maybe just didn‚Äôt suit what us Brits are used too for a Chinese meal but we left most of it. Can‚Äôt comment on meat dishes but for those on a meat free diet I would avoid it. Restaurant had a plastic canteen feel to it ... but staff were friendly. Oh and it wasn‚Äôt cheap !More

title: OVERRATED
review: Not real Asian cuisine, just Asian flavored food.  With that said, many dishes are tasty, and the portions are ample.  However,  they are now becoming over priced (used to be a bargain spot).

title: Plastic means junk food
review: I am saddened to report that their bubble tea is now served in junk plastic cups only. Over the last decade, we had no problem taking our carryout in the traditional paper boxes as they were accommodating in not handing us styrofoam. I was hoping...the next step would be removing styrofoam from their carryout, but it looks like the owners are moving backwards or there is some manager there that hates the planet or wants to brag about not recognizing climate change as a fact. It is such a shame. Joy Yee is now scratched from my list of places to dine as I cannot sit there in a room full of tables with trash service ware, knowing where it will end. Plus I really do not like sucking on plastic either. It is just bad flavor.More

title: Enjoyed It. Very Large Menu and Boba Too Chinatown Review
review: Very large menu. Large portions. Tasty and reasonably priced. Wished I could have ate more. Kids got bobas too. Clean environment and friendly. Would eat here again.

title: Homemade
review: We had a large group of about 14 on Christmas Day and ordered several dishes family style and they handled things efficiently. You could tell the crab ragoon was freshly hand made. Lots of choices. Orange Chicken was the best and the curried beans were...very interesting. They don't serve alcohol.More

title: BEST BRAIN FREEZE!
review: Recently remodeled, Luv  the improvements...Sleek! Any flavor combo you can come up with they will make, for less than $5 bucks. Best Fruit Smoothies!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Good food all time
review: We had been in Joy Yee several time in different cities. Food are average good and at the high standard.    Service is ok but no need to care about much. Their bubble tea is one of the best item there. Good price and size right.

title: We ate in and carried out two nights in a row...
review: One of my best friend's daughters swear by the cucumber salad and pad thai.  With excellent reason.  I took their suggestion and ordered their grandmother's favorite (a curried chick in coconut milk dish): heavenly.  We ordered carry-out and ate together in my hotel suite up...the street from their house the next night, too.More

title: Do yourself a favor and GO!
review: I went to Joy Yee Noodle when visiting Chicago recently, and it was DELICIOUS!!! I can't even begin to describe the yumminess. :)  I highly recommend getting a freeze or specialty drink to start with. While there, my group had chicken fried rice, pad Thai,...More

title: Best smoothies in Chicago - period.
review: Here's how you know it's great:  1) There is always a line - even in winter, 2) the number of smoothie options is way into the double digits, 3) in mid-afternoon on a Sunday, when they called my number is was #601.    There were so...More

title: Great Late Night Take out
review: You cant go wrong by ordering anything from this place! I just ordered Korean BBQ ribs and coconut curry (that actually comes in a whole coconut!) and a mango freeze with boba. This place has never disappointed me but their menu is so extensive that...More

title: I am being generous

title: Great food, not great delivery
review: I love their food - the fried rice is the best I have had, and I love the tofu dishes. Flavorful sauces and huge quantities-great stuff.  However-only four stars. I have been ordering from Joy Yees for years, and love their food. However, twice in...More

title: Wow what a smoothie selection!  The food is tasty too.
review: This place is a must try.  The have a huge variety of smoothies and food to choose from.  Large portions that can be shared and the you  receive your food very fast.

title: Authentic!
review: The food was very good and very authentic.  We had it to go so I can't comment on service except to say that the cash register girl answered all my questions with patience and a sweet manner.

title: Great Food with Great Friends
review: Great Food with big portion. Worth the price. It seems that everything I tried is delicious with exception of their Beef Pho. Which I describe as below average.

title: Plentiful and Well Prepared Pan Asian Food
