review: If I really think about it, I suppose that Joy Yee's food is average Chinese delivery. But it is near and dear to my heart and therefore gets a fourth star. Their delivery has saved many an overnight hospital shift. Because their menu is so...More

title: Huge Menu, lots of options, good food
review: The menu is massive.  They must offer 500 dishes.  That would usually scare me off but this place is good.  They cater to UIC students so in turn you get a lot of food for your $$$.  The appetizers are excellent and the main course...More

title: Awesome and cheap

title: Cheap eats with lots of options

title: fun for your group
review: lots of good choices, have been to several of the locations, they are uneven.  But in Chinatown they are a quick, delicious group place.  Lots of choices for a large group.  Not too expensive.

title: Best food ever!
review: The wait can be long because this place is sooo popular but it's worth the wait.  I have to stop here everytime I'm in Chicago. The food is amazing and not to mention the bubble teas. This place need to expand to other states!

title: Stop for the drinks!

review: Hundreds of menu items, large portions, reasonable prices.  Bubble teas too.  They do a pretty good job with things, but just don't expect it to be the absolute best you've ever had.

title: Korean bbq ribs

title: Great variety of Asian-fusion food and drinks
review: Joy Yee is a great place to try Asian-fusiuon cuisine because the menu is enormous and it covers everything from Western Favorites like Spring Rolls and Pineapple Shrimp to Exotic Vietnamese, Thai, Korean, Japanese and a ton of delicious noodle dishes.  Some particularly good items...More

title: Great Find

review: Menu is so large you can only read 1/3 in a single sitting. Food is great. Cheap. Bubble teas and drinks are the best. I cant have them anywhere else.

title: Good Dumplings
review: The pork soup dumplings is their specialty here and it was neat to watch the cook as she stuffed and made the dumplings by the window. The dumplings were really good with the flavorful broth inside the dumpling.  Be careful and use the spoon to...eat the dumpling since the broth is hot and you don‚Äôt want to lose the broth.  Make sure the broth has cool down before popping it in your mouth.   We also ordered the Sizzling Teriyaki Chicken and the Pancakes. The food was very good.  Service is not fast but fair. Again I have to comment that one has to overlook the cleanliness of the bathrooms if you wish to patronize the restaurants in this area.More

title: The food is okay, but service will make me never come back again!
review: The food is okay but the service will make me never come back again. The bill was presented. We make the bill around up to $60 and the waitress come back & asked us we never receive this much tips, normally is from 15%-18% tips....I‚Äôve been to many restaurants in Chicago and Chinatown in Chicago, no one ever asked us to add more tips directly like this ever. Tips show how good the service we received. No one will force us to give from how much to how much. I‚Äôm sorry this is my first & last time ever Hing Kee!More

title: Good place for a decent asian soup dumpling
review: Chose this place to eat the night we arrived into Chicago as I was looking online for good asian soup dumpling restaurants and Hing Kee showed up on multiple lists. The restaurant itself is quite small as it's situated in Chinatown Square. I wasn't familiar...with Chinatown so I didn't know that it was a smaller restaurant which made it a little awkward for us to try and fit my 7 month old's stroller into the restaurant. I'm disabled and we had taken the red line all the way from our hotel so there was no way I could have just carried her and left the stroller at the hotel.   Other than that the menu was easy to understand but quantity of dumplings in each order wasn't indicated (it's 8). I ordered the chicken soup dumpling and the shanghai style soup dumpling with pork and I split each with my friend. My husband got the sizzling teriyaki beef. The dumplings like I stated in the title were decent, not overly amazing but not horrible either. I'm accustomed to Din Tai Fung soup dumplings which are the gold standard for soup dumplings so I'm probably just picky. My husband said the sizzling teriyaki beef was good but despite the fact that it was quite hot temperature wise it tasted like it could have been cooked longer but it was enjoyable and there was no food left on our plates by the end of the night.More

title: Delicious affordable food
review: Got the recommendation from Chicago Eater, and I have to agree it was great food. I ordered the soup filled dumplings with pork (xiaolongbao), very tasty. Had another dish with fried rice and sea food, and fried octopus. All very good, complemented with a lychee...honey drink which was very generous for 4.50$. Would definitely go back here.More

title: Great choice
review: We had one shot at eating at Chinatown and picked this place so my daughter could have soup dumplings.  The three of us ordered a lot of different things and everything was delicious.  Highly recommended.

title: A little different for Chinatown, go here, delicious
review: A really delicious stop in the food mall in Chinatown.  Went on Sunday, small local place.  Very local, always good when the restaurant is filled with Chinese people!  The baby octopus was a cold dish, very tasty, Szechwan string beans are a must!!

title: One of my favorites
review: This is my go-to place for Chinese food in Chicago. The soup dumplings are amazing. The soup and noodles are all solid and price is great. Will be back soon!

title: very good noodles, dumplings & sushi
review: We had some very good noodles, dumplings, rice casserole, & sushi platter. The service is decent and the total bill was very reasonable.

title: Amazing sushi and soup!
review: My father-in-law and I came for a business trip and spent sometime here in Chicago! This place is definitely a gem in the middle of china town! I got the spicy salmon roll and my father-in-law got the tom yum soup! If you like seafood...and spicy this is the spot! Highly recommend!More

title: Great pork soup dumpling!
review: We were in Chinatown after sight seeing most of the day. I literally knew nothing about Hing Kee restaurant but just decided to stop when i saw they had steam dumplings. I had no idea how good the soup dumplings were going to be. Omg!...They are little dumplings of heaven. They are steamed in a bamboo steamer. The dumplings have hot soup in the middle with a meaty filling. The soup has great flavor as well as the pork filling. I really loved the food. There are a few negatives: the waitress was not very helpful with the menu. I am not sure if she understood english that well. Also not as friendly as when i have went to other chinese resturants. I still  recommend the restaurant and would go back.More

title: Real Chinese food
review: We ate here twice during our short stay in Chicago and everything was delicious. We used to live in China and the dishes did not differ from what we used to eat there. The menu is really extensive, includes both Chinese and English, and has...More

title: Awesome sushi and dumplings
review: Tucked away in a corner of Chinatown, this was an awesome discovery. Just walked in seeing the crowd inside. A fellow foodie suggested the dumplings. and they were so different and tasty. We had the Pork dumplings, Tuna Sushi and Tomyum soup. The Tomyum soup...More

title: All you can eat Hot Pot
review: 16.99 all you can eat hot pot. Beef, lamp, seafood, differnt types of vegetiables. The price is good for all you can eat and the food is freah. No time limit on hot pot as some places have two hours limit on all you can...More

title: Great lunch!
review: Ordered dumplings, pot stickers and volcano roll. All delicious. Did have to wait for the dumplings but other food served pretty quickly. Very friendly and prices were reasonable.

title: Don't bother unless your local
review: Sat there 15 minutes without anyone waiting on us while the couple that came in at the same time had ordered and got their food. Ended up leaving and I think they were happy not to have to wait on us.

title: Great place for Soup dumplings

title: Yummy Asian BYOB spot in China Town

title: Great food

title: Great Xiao Long Bao

title: Horrible Service

review: They serve hot pots, xiao Lo bao, sushi, shanghai dishes etc. all the food was acceptable, not good or bad just average, like the xiao lo bao is soupy but the skin was mushy and the meat was too rough with texture.   I don't expect...More

title: Dumplings in ChinaTown
review: The soup dumplings were great.  You can watch the ladies make them.  Tuna Roll was good and came quickly.  The hot tea was complimentary.

title: Great dumplings

title: Tasty Cheap Eats
review: Started off with salt/pepper/garlic chicken wings,  which were crispy tasty.  Then,  had the housemade special pho &  handmade seafood noodle bowls.  seafood bowls was good.  pho could've been better. service was quick & efficient.

title: Great Chinese option
review: Great cheap option if you are craving for some simple Chinese food in Chicago. This is not a place you go for ambience, but service was efficient and food was good. My hand-pulled noodles soup with pork & mushroom dumplings was very gratifying, and the...More

title: Great crispy wings,  but Noodle bowl not too good.
review: Lunch was our visit recently.  Order were Special Pho noodle bowls & chicken wings apps. The wings were hot & delicious,  The Pho was not too good.   Soup base tasted very oily.  Service was decent.

title: Chinatown restaurant with lots of choices
review: A group of us were celebrating my dad's 80th birthday and he wanted to go here for lunch.  He loves the Chinatown restaurants but didn't feel like Dim Sum this time, so we planned to come here. The place is known for it's variety of...More

title: Our Favorite Asian Restaurant In Chicago
review: When we visit Chicago, this is our first stop.  Lots of choices, flavors deliver and food quality is better than other places we tried in the area.  THE PLACE - Tucked away in the the new Chinatown area.  Decor is simple and plain.  Dishes, chop...More

title: Asian food
review: This restaurant offers both northern and southern style Chinese food.  It specializes in noodles and soup dumplings.  Sushi and sashimi is also available.  Hing Kee is our usual choice for noodles.  The beef stew is good.  The soup dumpling is the best in Chinatown.  Noodles...More

title: Quick & Hot
review: Our food came out extremely quickly. It was super hot & freshly made. The menu is quite large with many options for food (sushi, fresh noodles, soups..) & beverage (boba, shakes, coffees, etc). I ordered the sliced beef over rice. I had thought it would...More

title: Noodles dishes decent
review: nice tasting seafood noodle dishes, at very reasonable prices are the reason to hit this place.  the crispy wings weren't too shabby either.  two noodles dishes and appetizer only cost $ 22.

title: Authentic Asian food, at a reasonable price.
review: Chinese food is what this place does best. This isn't fancy, high cuisine - this is straight comfort food for those that grew up on Chinese food. Don't fear - they have Shanghainese dishes, along with Hong Kong style noodles, and Szechuan dishes. Despite the...More

title: Good noodle and dumplings, lack of service, second floor dinning room stuffy.
review: Went for lunch on Sunday with family. First floor dinning room was full and instructed to go to second floor dinning room. To get to the second floor dinning room you have to use the outside public stairs. You cannot go from first floor to...More

title: Clean. Authentic. Good Food
review: This place is known for its handmade noodles.  There are a variety of lunch (handmade noodle) specials which you can get for less than $10 (average: $7.50).  It is a big filling bowl and on harsh Chicago winters like this, this is a great little...More

title: Decent cuisine
review: Authentic menu. Good noodle varieties. Decent Shanghai soup dumplings. Excellent scallion pancakes. Poor service.

title: A Slow Start for Very Good Xiao Long Bao and Sushi
review: I love Xiao Long Bao.  My wife loves sushi (sashimi).  We both love Hing Kee because they serve both.  We arrived early on a Friday.  The sign on the door says that they are open from 11:00am but this time can not be trusted.  The...More

title: Excellent Noddle and Dumpling
review: I think this is my favorite noodle and dumpling place in Chinatown. Please understand I specifically say noodle and dumpling. This place has house-made noodle and Steam dumpling, which are very very good with reasonable price (noodle around $8 and Steam Dumplings are $7-9). We...More

review: Restaurant is located in the Chinatown Square Mall area of Chicago Chinatown.  Handmade noodles are made fresh on site in different styles.  Dumplings are also made fresh. There are a variety of soup combinations with meats and vegetables.  I prefer the simple soup with shrimp...More

title: Rude owner/service
review: This place has decent food but the service help was so utterly lousy. The main waiter was not bad but the woman who helped was incredibly rude.  She acted like she did us a favor and that it was ruining her day that we were...More

review: With three menus...I can understand why some people my get confused as to what is good vs. what is great.  HInt 1 - ASK THE SERVER...WHAT IS YOUR SPECIALTY?  WHAT IS YOUR FAVORITE DISH HERE?  The response may be these three: 1) Shanghai SteylSoup Dumpling...More

title: Restaurant

title: Small portions
review: I and my wife decided to give it a try for this noodle store, and was amazed to find a huge menu with variety of Chinese food and rich Japanese sushi. We decided on two soup noodles as a start, after all, that's what they...More

title: Very good
review: Their menu is huge!  I had the Calamari and my wife had the shortribs and both were very good.  If we make it back to Chinatown in Chicago we will most certainly have lunch here again!

title: Hand pulled ramen...yum.
review: Shanghai dumplings, salt and peeper squid and ramen...can't ask for much more at one place. The service was good, food yummy and watching the guy make the noodles was one of the coolest things we've seen in a long time. Well worth the ride from...More

title: More show than substance... Entirely unimpressive
review: As a all noodle soup lover, I was eager to try the restaurant.  The restaurant provides the only noodle making show in Chinatown.  Although the chef is not very good [as you can compare with some phenomenal chef on YouTube], he is the only "show"...More

title: Always excellent Beijing duck plate !
review: Not the first time .. and not the last time to visit this restaurant  ! Always excellent Beijing Duck plate = amazing taste and very well presented ! Found this time a table outside for outdoor dining. It was great . Don‚Äôt change please the...recipe and the service.More

title: Open early for BBQ and Breakfast
review: I can't believe this BBQ place opens first thing in the morning. Got squid, roast pork, and soy chicken for takeout. Excellent!

title: ok
review: we just bought take away, no people dining in the restaurant, maybe due to COVID, although it have seats to allow people to dining inside.  The food is quite delicious, not sure if the price is reasonable, as we didn't compare with others.

title: More than satisfying
review: Reasonably priced lunch.  Nothing fancy, which perfectly fine.   Quick and not fussy.   I believe it would rate as the best fast food HK style BBQ in Chicago Chinatown.

title: Pork Belly Craving
review: Wanted to eat their pork belly and the chicken, for the first time. Entering the place, you feel like they are all eyes on you, I wonder if they thought we were going to rob them.  I am a disbled old woman, I use a...walker. Maybe it was that. Any how, I bought the pork belly and a whole chicken. Crispy dkin, well seasoned porkbelly that melted in your mouth. The chicken was really flavorful. We ordered to go, and it is too bad we don't live near by, I would est it weekly.More

title: Good Restaurant with Authentic Chinese Taste
review: Good Restaurant with Authentic Chinese Taste, the did a good job. The taste is authentic and it didnt take a long time for them to prepare and serve. Recommended!

title: Just stick with BBQ
review: Before this trip to Chicago, my colleague from Hong Kong greatly recommended this place.  After taking subway for an hour, I arrived at the restaurant at 3:40 pm, right before its lunch service ended (4 pm).    Instead of giving me the lunch special menu, I...received a regular menu at first.  Upon my request, I was able to order lunch special takeouts.    Their pricing was not consistent between their website (cheaper) and actual menu (more expensive).   I ordered two lunch specials (Singapore noodle and spicy chicken) and a small three-meat BBQ plate.  The two specials turned out to be most ordinary in terms of taste and portion size. (Need to avoid Singapore noodle!!)    I must say the BBQ plate was the only dish I would recommend and my 35-buck meal was not quite satisfactory after all.More

title: Just back from 16 years in China
review: And it's just as good on this little joint add it is in the middle kingdom, all I wish is they had the ÁôΩÈÖíüç∂

title: BBQ Duck
review: I've only gotten the BBQ Duck and chicken feet to go. All were well prepared and the service was fine.

title: Dining with the king
review: You don't come to BBQ King for a trendy environment or impeccable service, you come for the Peking Duck, Roasted Duck, Roasted Pork, Soy Chicken, BBQ Pork, BBQ Spareribs, and other Roast Meats. It's hard to find authentic Peking Duck, but you certainly find it...here.  Being that they are a full-service restaurant that offers a variety of delicious Chinese dishes in addition to BBQ at a very reasonable price.  I ordered a Roasted Duck, BBQ Pork, Chicken Livers, Yang Chow Fried Rice, and Chicken Corn Soup.  All very delicious.   I usually order their Meats to-go which are sold by the pound or by half Duck.  Although the shop doesn't look great, the food is consistently good.  If you're pressed for time and want something quick and cheap this is the place to go.More

title: Delicious inexpensive duck
review: If you're a fan of duck, this is the place to be. It's delicious, and a whole duck only costs just over $20.

title: sat lunch
review: Frequent visitor to this place, has elapse for a while, returned and noticed new menu with some specialty lunch items. Few very attractive, choose one with eggplant; waitress said it will take at least 30 min to prepare, needs to soak eggplant till soft for...More

title: Good value
review: I was feeling hungry so I thought I'll take a walk across from my hotel.  Found this place lots of people ordering takeaway so I looked at the menu, I wanted to eat in tonight. So I ordered the half BBQ duck.  It was great...More

title: Delicious Food
review: We got the sweet and sour pork as well as the shrimp with lobster sauce.  Portions are generous.  Prices seem fair. Typical atmosphere of most the smaller eateries in Chinatown....not the most appealing, bathrooms a little rundown but, hey, as long as the food is...More

title: lunch weekend and week days
review: this is my go to place for lunch either on Sat or any week days, good selections of food items, BBQ or any types of Chinese dishes, always friendly services, quick order and delivery, never had bad experience, clean place, newly decorated

title: It is not typical BBQ, it is a type of Chinese local food/snacks - it's good!
review: Been there twice. Love it. Good taste, good amount. Typical southern China local food. The youtiao is not the best - and you should try ones from northern China.

title: Come for the Peking Duck
review: BBQ King House is reputed to be one of the two best restaurants for Peking Duck in Chicago, and the reputation is well earned.  The duck skin is crisp and flavorful, with sweet steamed buns, hoisin sauce and scallions.  The "basic" duck dinner ($33.00) comes...More

title: Disapointed...but maybe it was me?
review: We asked for a recommendation from the locals and they gave us this place. We are from Los Angeles and New York City - so we thought we had a pretty descent gauge of what was good. I can say that this was exceptionally authentic...More

title: Average BBQ
review: I love char siu and roasted duck, eat them in Hong Kong, NYC, Singapore anywhere's that good and I find this place is average at best. The meat doesn't have that heavenly roasted flavor, missing the honey sauce and after few days the BBQ is...More

title: Peking Duck
review: Peking Duck for 4 was incredible.  The duck was delicious, well prepared and fresh.  The rest of the accompaniments were just as good.  A meal for 4 for 33 bucks in Chicago is a steal and one of the better meals I've had in Chicago...More

title: Great lunch, real Chinese menu
review: I eat Chinese from time to time but it's always the American version with the same 25 lunch specials.  This time, on a visit to Chicago, I decided to try this well-regarded restaurant and I'm really glad that I did.  First good sign was that...More

title: Go elsewhere.
review: I ordered the roast duck and salted duck carry out and found when I got home both were not fresh, had no real taste, and made me nauseous.  This is the second time I tried this restaurant, and both times I had a bad experience,...More

title: China town
review: Average experience. Food was alright . The hot and sour soup was average , as was the kung pow shrimp . They do have a good menu selection and the service was good . If I didn't feel like being brave and exploring on my...More

title: Good food, reasonable prices, casual atmosphere
review: We recently went with friends to BBQ King, as they wanted us to try their Peking duck. Our friends ordered for everyone and there was plenty of food served family style. Everything was fresh and tasty. The tofu, cooked to perfection, the duck, juicy. The...More

title: Yummy
review: There's certainly a reason why people flock here for their BBQ duck.  It is delicious and we would certainly go back.

title: Roast duck, pig &...
review: Average roast duck, pig & some other to go items. Nothing special for fine diner eating over different cities around the world. But if you are new to Chinese food, this is a palce to start with.

title: Overrated Restaurant

title: Horrible!!!
review: We stopped for a nice american/chinese eat and the food was terrible! The service was horrible, no one ever stopped at our table and the workers were rude! I would not recommend ever eating here!

title: Decent cheap eats

title: Horrible food and service

title: So many other places to choose...
review: So disappointing...  The food was very greasy, table was dirty, bathroom was so filthy and the waitress was unfriendly. Sorry, I'm not one to leave many negative reviews, but I really don't have anything good to say.  The waitress never came to our table unless...More

title: Delicious lunch box

title: Tons of great food for a bargain!

title: great value and food for the price
review: the Peking duck special is $33 and provides 3 courses and enough food for 4 people.  we added some nice special fried rice and noodles and the total with soft drinks was on $60. You can byob as they don't service alcohol so that is...More

title: Delicious!
review: Definitely the most authentic and amazing Chinese BBQ house I have visited since Hong Kong. The BBQ duck and pork was made just right and at a decent price too. Will be coming back. Their milk tea is good as well.

title: Great barbecue

title: Best Chinese Ever!

title: Roast duck, bbq pork and steamed chicken!
review: Never ate in the restaurant but always get duck, chicken or pork that's hanging in the window!   Very speedy service!

title: Excellent Barbeque Duck
review: The Barbeque Duck here is the specialty of the house, and it is superb. Served with excellent, delicate little buns, it is a nice alternative to the usual Peking Duck pancakes. Other dishes on the menu are also very good, though not perhaps as imaginative...More

title: Excellent BBQ Duck
review: This place has excellent BBQ duck over rice for $4.95.  In addition, you get a bowl of soup with your meal.  The duck is very tasty and among the best I have eaten.

title: Buy the Whole Duck

title: Yummy roast duck
review: Yummy roast duck

title: Extra fire in your bowl
review: They have a very good selection of authentic Vietnamese dishes the PHO is awesome.  They warn you it‚Äôs going to be hot and it is. You can get it extra hot and that is awesome!!!!

title: Disappointed
review: Lemon chicken not fresh bad taste. Soup was served lukewarm. Hong Kong chicken was non descript. Prices are cheap but you get what you pay for. Hard to believe bit can make it in Chinatown. Many better options.

title: Great food
review: Cheap and authentic Asian cuisine. Go with and empty stomach cause the portion are huge and the price is very inexpensive. Pot stickers and crab Rangoon‚Äôs are amazing.

review: We had a family meal here on a colder spring day. The pho was plentiful. Our favorite was the orange chicken. It is a very popular place. The seating is crowded. The service was very mediocre. But glad we tried it.

title: Lunch
review: Clean and fast service. One of the best pho in Chinatown. We both had pho with different types of beef. Flavorful soup. The  tripe was a bit chewy. Other cuts of beef and tendon were very good. Price was reasonable.

title: Pho sure!
review: Third time, have enjoyed each time and am glad to see the place pretty full Sunday afternoon at 3:30p. Not a lot of help out front but service was prompt enough. And a Self serve ‚Äúto go‚Äù container was supplied in an efficient manner when...requested. No obnoxious music this time just conversation among guests in a packed house. I will look forward to trying something other than pho next time and perhaps just take the pho to go! üòäMore

title: less than mediocre food, not very fresh or authentic
review: The tofu pad thai had way too much overly-oily sauce, and the sauce lacked a balance of flavour (it just tasted super sweet and like it had MSG) which made it gluggy and heavy and the noodles were drowned/soggy in it. It also didn't come...with peanuts or fresh corriander - not very authentic. Also it didn't have many/any vegetables included as they wanted to charge extra for veg! My friend had fresh spring rolls which were mostly lettuce inside - what a rip-off. My other friend had a miso soup, that was fine.  Another friend had a tom kha soup which also lacked any flavour and was way too sweet (no balance and no sign of that authentic sweet/sour blend of flavurs), it also just had loads of onions and large pieces of tomatoe in it, which also imbalanced the soup as a whole and made it unpleasant to eat. All in all very disappointing and I won't be going back. Service people were lovely but I don't know what the cooks are doing in the kitchen - obviously not tasting their food - maybe they've never tasted authentic Thai or Vietnamese food or they're just lazy/cheap??More

title: Good and cheap Vietnam food!
review: Good and cheap Vietnam food! The food is served very fast, and there are many ppl in the restaurant at 5pm.

title: Delish! Will go back!
review: Lots of places to choose from on Saturday night we picked the one that just had a bunch of people just leave after enjoying their meal - all with smiles, Laughter and take away boxes.  We also left with smiles as our taste buds were...happy and our bellies very full.  Nice selection of options on the menu including thai menu and miso soup besides their delicious pho and bun. Which we opted for our usual favorites and were not disappointed. Fast, friendly and delicious.More

title: lunch in Chinatown
review: Food was very good.  Place was small and very busy.  People standing by the door waiting for a table.  I had a Banh Mi (Vietnamese sandwich) and my parents shared a noodle soup (quite large bowl).  Price was inexpensive (sandwich was 4.95 the large soup...7.95).  Service was okay.  Place was clean for Chinatown.More

title: Good and Well Priced
review: The menu being (also) in English and showing the prices made this Old Chinatown eatery very appealing to my teenager and myself. We got there at a good time, it seems because there were several tables to choose from. Later, just as we were finishing...More

title: Worth the stroll down S. Wentworth!
review: I had lunch here today, and I believe the place is better than some of the reviews. It may not be perfect, but it's a great casual place, with prices to match the atmosphere. The ice coffee was great and my lunch was a vermicelli...More

title: Great treat in Chinatown
review: We had a great lunch here. Lot of locals which I see as a good sign. They have a large menu, good service, and affordable prices.

title: Quick eat
review: This is was our first time in this place. It is busy, but people eat quickly and leave right away. Pho was very good. Noodle salad with crab cake was also good.. Spring rolls could use a little bit more shrimp/crab sticks (it was very-...More

title: My Favorite Caesar Salad
review: Homemade noodles on top of a delicious salad?  This place is the best!  Delicious soups and pastas.  But I always come back for this salad.  Make sure to order extra garlic bread!

title: Mixed experience
review: They must have two different chicks to explain our two different experiences. The first time the pho was great with a tasty broth and plenty of filings. At our second visit however it tasted like dishwasher water. We couldn't even eat half of it.  Moreover...More

title: A busy spot, but WHY?????
review: Uninspired food and terrible service.  Why is this place so busy?  Maybe it is the low prices.  It certainly can't be the food, which is at the level of cafeteria food if they have cafeterias in Vietnam.  The shrimp, which were supposed to be grilled...More

title: Pleasant lunch stop in Chinatown
review: While walking around Chinatown shopping I asked some young ladies where they would go for lunch. They recommended The Noodle. The waitress and hostess very very pleasant and made some menu recommendations. My waitress even talked me out of the 'Salted Plum' drink. I had...More

title: Chinatown Vietnamese
review: My friend and I ordered a lot of food - the Cajun shrimp app, the spring rolls, a cucumber and tomato salad, a beef dish and seafood and rice. The Cajun shrimp and the spring rolls were fine, but the entrees were a little lacking....More

title: Food was okay service was terrible.
review: I visited China town for the first time, and came to this restaurant because of its high ratings. The food was okay, and affordable but the service was awful. Our waitress was welcoming but we only saw her once. The staff was not helpful at...More

title: Now Called The Noodle
review: Great Pho - Service is good and broth has excellent umami or soul.  Portions are generous.  Seating clean and room to move around.

title: Great Pho
review: Now located at 2336 S Wentworth  Great size portions and fast service. Excellent umami or depth of flavors in the broth  I recommend it

title: Good gamble
review: My family and I were in chinatown for the first time and were unsure what to expect.  The service was a little pokey but the food did not disappoint.

title: Best noodles ever!
review: The food was fresh and wonderful even with our fussy children. Recommend the Shrimp Kung Pao and Curry. Ordered a Mango Tango and Oreo cookie milkshake. The resteruant was clean but no restroom. Once you walk past the rougher part of Chinatown it was worth...More

title: eat here every time we visit china town
review: they have some of the most authentic food in the area.  There bowls of pho are outstanding, and huge. Pad thai is best in the area, and its hard to find someone to make it just right.  they really use fresh ingredients, and they have...More

title: Yummy Thai Cuisine in Chinatown
review: We went on a cold, sunny day after Christmas to Chinatown. We found this small Thai restaurant that was very nicely decorated and clean inside. The food was yummy and HUGE portions. We could have easily shared 2 entrees for the four of us. This...More

title: Be sure to ask for the small pho!
review: Traditional pho served in a very good restaurant.  I have had pho from Vietnam to Manila and all points headed the other way.  This was very good.  The prices may have been a little steep and the spring rolls were just OK, but when I...More

title: Good spot for pho
review: There should be nothing exceptional about Pho, it just has to taste as real Pho like it does in Saigon street kitchen. And it did.

title: Price is OK, but the food is really not that good.
review: I went there for its reputation, but a bit disappointed. The price is OK, but the food is really not that good. Ironically, though the shop has its name called noodles,  I feel that appetizer like shumai is good, while noodles is just bad.

title: The Twilight Noodle
review: As soon as I walked into The Noodle it was strange.  It seemed somewhat busy. The decor was nice & inviting. There were only 2 servers & a girl that was cleaning the dirty tables. We couldn't figure out whether or not we had to...More

title: Great Variety
review: Service and attention was fast.  This restaurant is located towards the end of Chinatown, ad is an easy walk from the CTA.  A great break if you are looking for something different. The Noodle Vietnamese Cuisine is always busy and the waiters will take their...More

title: The Noodle Vietnamese Cuisine
review: This review, like one of the reviews below, is for The Noodle Thai Cuisine Restaurant in Chinatown, Chicago. It is very good, although the service is somewhat slow and the servers could be a lot more friendly. I had the fresh lemon drink, which was...More

title: Good Pho, nice value.
review: Best Pho in Chicago. Nice eatery. My family loves this place. Good menu. They recommendations for beginners and not beginners. Try the spring rolls too. Very good.

title: Large Portions, Great Price!
review: My husband and I were staying in Chinatown for Vacation. I really was craving some sort of noodle pasta dish so of course I went to The Noodle! I was in for a big treat. I purchased the Beef Pho with Brisket and Steak, size...More

title: Excellent Pho
review: I hope I am reviewing the correct restaurant in this review.  The address where Noodle Vietnamese Cuisine is located is 2336 S. Wentworth Avenue and the restaurant that is pictured is NOT the Noodle Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant.  I have included their website on this review...More

title: Save your money
review: We went into The Noodle at about  3 PM. The place was full of people. We sat there for about five minutes before getting a menu. It took another ten minutes before the waitress came to get our order. I ordered beef Pho with tendons...More

title: great food
review: The Crab Rangoon is delicious! The service was pretty fast. The restaurant is pretty small and the staff is not all that friendly but the food is really great.

title: Good service and tasty pad thai
review: I popped into this Vietnamese restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown. As I am vegetarian I checked the menu and couldn't see anything without meat so I asked the waitress. She pointed out the no meat pho but told me it was served with a beef broth....More

title: Worth a try
review: Their pad thai was a little sweet and the pho was a little oily, but everything else was good! It was clean, service was fast, we were seated immediately, and prices were very reasonable.

title: Pho of value
review: Wonderful, hearty Vietnamese pho (soup) and tasty sandwiches. Value can't be beat. I stop there everytime im in Chinatown.

title: Probably My Favorite Place to Eat
review: The decore is nothing to write home about, nor is the service.  But the tables are clean and the food is out of this world.  I would rather go to The Noodle for beef spring rolls and a bowl of pho than eat at any...More

title: Basic vietnamese. Good pho, and good prices. Nothing outstanding, except for the size of the portions. Order a small...
review: Basic vietnamese. Good pho, and good prices. Nothing outstanding, except for the size of the portions. Order a small pho, it's enormous, and you can take the rest home.

title: soooo goood!!!
review: omg. what a great place. came here with family. it was Friday at 830pm and it was packed which was promising for how good the food would be and we were not disappointed. to make things easier we ordered a family dinner style 8 for...3 but substituted the sweet and sour pork with salt and pepper pork. the servers were awesome and worked their patooties off.. omg. everything was so good. feel like we need someone to roll us out in wheelchairs. highly recommend this place!!More

title: Great Food, Helpful Service on Chicago  Chinatown Main Boulevard
review: An unfancy but clean restaurant, many Chinese couples and groups choose to eat here, acrive takeout business, so rely upon these locals who know where to go. Seafood specialties, creative and some exotic, served up as if at home. Very helpful and friendly staff, bilingual...Chinese-English menu, staff happy to assist and explain. Modest prices.More

title: Terrible!!!!
review: The food is delicious but the service is the terrible you can. The food  service late more one hour and the waitress attended to the other people than us.

title: Great Experience
review: I always challenge my stepson to give us a great experience when we visit Chicago. He met the challenge! His friend joined us who selected our food choices and we loved everything offered! Authentic experience!

title: A hidden gem, excellent food -- and very nice people.
review: I am an adventurous Chinese diner and like to find places that offer exotic ingredients and yet prepare the basics very well. In Chicago recently for a conference, I had two windows of time, one dinner and one lunch. As McCormick place is a culinary...desert and Chinatown is nearby, I looked up what were the top 10 places in Chinatown and Golden Bull came up. That rating is correct: a nice but unassuming place that serves outstanding food and exotic ingredients if that's for you. They probably aren't exotic to Chinese people but readers will know what I mean. For example, for dinner I had a whole frog in yellow chives (they warned me about the bones) and fried pigeon and for lunch, something more conventional, a steamed farmer's chicken in a lotus leaf and fabulous baby clams in black bean sauce. Both served with perfect steamed rice. The staff recognized I was by myself and were very sweet; when I came back the next day, they greeted me like an old friend; pretty good for Chinatown where warm greetings and friendliness aren't always the norms. It's good value for the money and the menu is extensive with anything from Cantonese noodles to egg foo yung in the old style and Singapore noodles in the new -- and everything in between. Golden Bull is both a destination and the type of place you'd love to find if at some big conference at McCormick Place. I was so glad I went.More

title: Delicious Dinner
review: We visited for the first time based on a relative‚Äôs recommendation and we were not disappointed.  This restaurant was busy that weekend night but service kept up with the crowds and orders.    We ordered a number of dishes and all were deliciously good.  A complimentary...cup of a rich broth with beef and radish kicked off our dinner.    The pork chops were lightly coated and fried with a sweet red sauce.  The chow fun was smoky, tender beef and right amount of sauce on the noodles.  The surf clams were amazing especially the broth that was infused with ginger, clam and vermicelli rice noodles.  The fish and tofu was also very tasty.  A complimentary bowl of red bean dessert was served at the end.   Overall price was very reasonable for the size of the dishes and quality of our dinner.  Will definitely come back.More

title: Never Never Never
review: Horrible experience we ever had in our lives! We have been regular there. Yesterday we went there for my sister‚Äôs birthday. We ordered the family dinner along with a few dishes. We ordered the hot pot before everything else because it would the a long...time. It came out last! We also ordered Boof Noodle which they never put in the order. We had a twin lobsters but it came out with shells only. Cannot find any meat at all. We suspected that they saved the shells from other customers left on the dish to re-cook it to make it another ‚Äúnew‚Äù dish! Cannot believe that! The Salt and Pepper Ribs had nothing but bones! There was not any meat attached to the bones itself!  When we brought it to the owner‚Äôs attention, she said there was nothing she can do about it and asked us to pay cash for it. Really? She has the nerve to even say that! My sister was so pissed that she confronted her! She finally gave a 10% discount which it did not justify her attitude and bad service!  After last night‚Äôs dinner, we swear that we will never go back again! Never!More

title: The dinner for three was a feast for two.
review: Met a college buddy from Purdue for the fist time I had seen him since his wedding in Chicago 20 years ago. The food was perfect for some great conversation. His in-laws own a Chinese food restaurant in the burbs and he has been coming...to the Golden Bull for years. It was a great choice.More

title: Wonderful!
review: We were in Chicago‚Äô s Chinatown for the first time, and found this listed in a city guide. We were early for dinner, and were the only customers when we arrived. We were seated at a large table (4  adults + 1 child) with a...large lazy Susan in the middle. What a good idea, especially if sharing dishes! Menu items came in small or large portion options. All of the food we ordered was excellent. Sauces were light but flavorful, veggies were fresh, menu selection seemed more varied than usual. Servers were cheerful & helpful, prices very reasonable. A great find, just a short half block walk from the Main Street in Chinatown.More

title: Unpretentious and delicious.
review: We arrived for an early dinner at about 5:30. We were the only table but as time passed place became busy. (Many Chinese families, too.)Resttaurant is small but comfortable. Servers were friendly and able to address all questions regarding items on menu. You can order...small or large portion for each item. As family, we chose to order several of the small orders to share. There was plenty for all and the food was delicious. Delicately flavored. Not the run of the mill Chinese food we find in most other places. Fairly priced, too. I would certainly return.More

title: Delicious and reasonably peiced
review: We found some new intriguing options on this menu, and everything we ordered was very tasty, and the veggies were nice and fresh. We stuck to the ‚Äúsmall‚Äù plates and it was plenty to share, since we ordered several - and kept the bill small!

title: zhen de (authentic) Cantonese dining
review: This is a small restaurant between the older and newer sections of Chicago Chinatown. I looked in on the way to lao sze chuan and decided I would try it the  next evening. When I stopped in I was told to bring my own alcoholic...More

title: One of my favorite restaurants in Chinatown
review: I‚Äôve been dining here for the last few years & the food is fantastic!!  Authentic Chinese food including lobster, crab legs and soft shell crab.

title: Excellent traditional Cantonese cuisine in Chicago's Chinatown.
review: This is not the place if you are limited to "tourist" Chinese like sweet and sour this or that, chop suey, and moo shu pork.  Come here if you want real Cantonese dishes prepared properly the way the Toishan speaking people from Guangdong are accustomed...More

title: Authentic
review: In town to meet some old friends, they asked locals where we could get good Chinese food.  The consensus was we had to check out the Golden Bull.  The place appeared to be full of locals as they seemed to know the wait staff when...More

title: Delicious
review: We choose this restaurant because of Trip Advisor and as always it was right!! The food was A+ along with service. Did not have the hustle and bustle of the other over crowded restaurant's which made it more enjoyable. We will return.

title: Open late and great!
review: We got into town a bit late on a Thursday night. I'm vegan and my partner is an omnivore, so we were searching Chinatown for a place that was open at 12am and had food we could both eat.The Golden Bull has a large menu...More

title: The best taste chinesse food in Chicago !!!
review: The service is not to good. We want touse rounded table and they say that these tables are for 6 people and we were only 4. ???? Nobody use the round table during our stay at the restaurant.

title: 2 blocks from Chinatown Red Line subway stop
review: While waiting for the walk signal, we asked a couple locals what restaurant they liked in Chinatown.  They immediately said "the Golden Bull."  It was very authentic.  The portions were much larger than we expected, so ended up taking some back to our hotel.

title: Great Cantonese Food
review: After 2 days of eating at disappointing Chinatown restaurants that other reviewers said were great, I finally found a Cantonese restaurant that was spot on.  Had the Seafood noodles and Short Ribs with Honey and both were amazingly good.  The small sizes were more than...More

title: Wonderful unknown BWOB Chinese Restaurant in Chinatown
review: I have been researching Chicago BYOB Restaurants recently, and finally found an excellent Chinese candidate.,  Excellent food, and a  lovely warm helpful group of employees. No corkage fees, and a large creative menu.  Four visits now, have proven worthy of this positive review.

title: Wow factor
review: I have been to many Chinese Restaurant in Chicagoland,  try it, tasted it, even walked out of.  Golden Bull Restaurant has not disappointed me yet.

title: A decent Cantonese restaurant
review: Golden Bull is an average, decent Cantonese restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown. The kitchen prepares a very wide range of Cantonese dishes well enough, though not as freshly or imaginatively as Phoenix or Cai or Go-4-Food, perhaps the best Cantonese kitchens in the area. Beef and Chinese Broccoli Chow Fun had good, firm noodles, but the beef was bland and the broccoli a bit overcooked. Many dishes struck me as a bit over-salted. Again, nothing was bad, all was acceptable, but nothing was memorably good either. Odd hours -- only open for lunch on weekends and Mondays. Other days they open at 3PM. But they are open very late (until 2AM).

title: I'm Bullish!
review: The remodeling is complete and the place looks so classy now. From vinyl tile floors and dinette sets to carpet and nice furniture.But go there for the authentic dishes with high on taste and flavor. Cumin lamb, sliced conch w/chives, deep fried smelts, and whole steamed fish are slam dunk winners. Prices are cheat you fair too!

title: Drink review only
review: This review is only based on their fresh fruit smoothies ~ wow da bomb. So busy here. Did not eat here but saw affordable slushies before we left so had to try n get validation for parking too if you spend up to $15. Wow...so good especially their honeydew boba. You can mix 2 fruits. I got strawberry banana to be safe but it was good. Mango was yummy with lychee. Avocado mango tastes like a Cali roll lol but good. Love how they use fresh fruit. You can watch the lady make them too. Best price in the whole Chinatown too. 3.75 plus 50cents for add in like boba. No other place charged that little for boba. Can't beat that. And it's a big drink. Others charging way too much. $1 for boba add-in? I wanna eat here 1 day. Food looks big n good too! Such a great refreshing end to our Chinatown trip!More

title: Real Hong Kong Food Without Going to Hong Kong!
review: When I eat here I remember that I am saving the price of an airline ticket to Hong Kong!  The lobster special is fantastic!  The clams in black bean sauce are so authentic!  The beef and pan-fried rice noodles are great!  The "Hong Sue" red...braised tofu is so excellent!  Almost everything is authentic.  The sad exception is the strange pink sauce on the baked pork chop rice.  If you want to really experience Hong Kong food, this is it!  Moreover, the ambiance is really so Hong Kong small eatery!More

title: Inexpensive, great Chinese food
review: This is a great place to eat, inexpensive with great food. I don‚Äôt know much about Chinese food, but I know what I like. I‚Äôm also a picky eater, but left well fed at a more than decent price. Plan to eat here again when...I visit family in Chinatown!More

title: Delicious food
review: Nice place to eat. Not too expensive. We enjoyed our meal. Good location. Anything they serve are delicious. I want to come back here again.

title: The Real Deal BUT NOISY
review: This place has good meals, authentic Chinese, value for money and good service (well, let's be honest, as good as Chinese food staff can be).  The Lunch specials and the high tea specials -- you can't go wrong with these.  The ambiance is .... authentic....It has that dirty-ish chinese vibe -- which admittedly is not to every one's tolerance but it puts you right in the heart of China while you're in the restaurant.  I can't stand the noise though.  You literally cannot have any decent conversation when it's full.  I wish they could fix the acoustics somehow ...More

title: Like the best of Hong Kong
review: Noisy, even frenetic, this is like a great neighborhood Hong Kong Restaurant. The kitchen is Cantonese but the Sichuan dishes are authentic too. Service can be chaotic but this is first rate food. We were the only Caucasians in the place. I have been told...that this is the favorite of residents is Chinatown. I can believe it.More

title: bad service
review: once when we came in, the staff serving us has a "black" face, i.e. no smile, rude look, we went there for late lunch, but as already over 2:30pm, there should be afternoon tea set menu, but the staff won't give you this unless you...ask them for this menu, because they want you to order more expensive items rather than the cheaper tea men; then when we want to make order, the staff said busy, and not taking care of our needs until after several minutes, but at that time, just only a few customers, many of the tables are empty, so really don't know how "busy" they are; moreover, it stated that there will be a parking coupon issued for customer, however, when we pay the bill, they said it's under $15, so no coupon unless we pay $1 to buy the coupon, but it doesn't state that we need to consume at least $15 in order to get the parking coupon, however, I see the customers on the other table, they ask for more coupons, and the staff willing to give it to them without hesitation, may be these customers come very often (while we are not), so the staff treat them more friendly. The food is ok, but the service is very bad, I am a Hong Kong person, and I have been to several restaurants in Chicago China town, their food's taste are generally up to standard, so why not choose the one with better service? So I will not go to this restaurant again! As the food quality are similar, I would certainly go to another one with better service next time!More

title: Excellent Chinese dining
review: Was wandering around Chinatown - read a couple reviews on TripAdvisor - thought about one place, then I asked a local shopkeeper where he would take his family for lunch.  He suggested My Place.  It is small - and crowded because all the local chinese...business people and families were eating there. Then you know it is good food.  Not much for decor, but the food was excellent. I would go again.More

title: very good inexpensive chinese food
review: The places serves some very good inexpensive chinese food, that is worth coming back for. The food is very consistent and you see a lot of repeat customers.

title: Cheap and good food!
review: Ambiance is ok.Food is good and price is reasonable.  I greatly recommend this place. You get your money's worth.

title: GREAT CHINESE FOOD!!
review: I had general tso's shrimp with stir fried chicken, she had Chef special Combination Ramen both were excellent.  Started with crab rangoon and pot stickers also very good.  The place was full of locals all talking Chinese at once.

title: Yummy Cuisine
review: The Decor was Great: Great Place for Asian Cuisine: Friendly Staff Very attentive: Definitely a Bang for The Buck! Noodles and Won Ton Soup were Delicious: Very Tender Pork Chops: Great Food Selection!

title: Cheap eats
review: My Place is a budget restaurant on the first floor of the China Town Square. The have a very savory dish of 2 Lobsters for $25. They make up for the lack of ambience with the quality of food. Definitely try the congee.

title: Tasty
review: This place was packed with Asian families for dinner, so I knew it would be good ‚Äì and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed.  I ordered the congee followed by beef with XO sauce.  Both were delicious and filling.  Despite being busy, my meal was still served in...More

title: good different
review: ordered two plate combos; kung pao chicken and general tso chicken. The fried rice has a different taste than we're use to here in Houston, Texas. It was a good different. The combos came with an egg roll. The restaurant was conveniently located a few...More

title: two lobsters for $25, a real deal
review: tired of doing restaurant.com on this Father's Day, so my wife and I decided to try a new joint.  My Place's two lobsters for $24.99 lured us in, and the garlic ginger style is prepared pretty decent, and the lobster feast was quite enjoyable.  Although...More

title: Amazing place!
review: Amazing place! One of our favorites. Love the ox tendon in chili sauce as a cool appetizer with plenty of spiciness. Their morning glory and dan Dan noodles are also incredible.

title: Absolyely Great Shezuan
review: THis is the real deal. Located in Chinatown is serves authentic Shezuan food. The menu is many pages and must have 3 or 400 dishes. One of our paerty want less psice and had the moo shu pork. Great also. The fatty pork spicy style...was outstanding. Close to pain but so good. Service was ok. Prices are on the low side. Will go back for the other 395 items.More

title: This is what I would came to Chicago for
review: Went there couple years ago, was soooo impressed, as I could not find any Chinese restaurant as good as this one in NY or entire US i‚Äôve Been. Was excited and looking forward to Chicago because I could come here again. Still very good, authentic...Sichuan food. But saltier, and waitress speaks Cantonese, which is kind of strange as i‚Äôm Not in a Cantonese restaurant. I think still worth going if you are in town but I started to wonder if I should have tried others, I still think Chicago has the best Sichuan food in all of US.More

title: Among Chicago‚Äôs finest Sichuan choices
review: Chicago now has a number of truly authentic Sichaun restaurants and this is in the top tier. A huge menu including fabulous hot pots, stir fried dishes, casseroles, everything you would want. Ingredients are fresh, never taste like they have been sitting around, and every...dish seems prepared thoughtfully, with flavors balanced. They do not hold back on the spicy level, but neither does it overwhelm.More

title: Very Good But Not Because Bourdain Said So
review: Sze Chuan Cuisine in Chicago's Chinatown appears to have a really authentic menu. We didn't go because Anthony Bourdain had been there. I've been to other restaurants he visited and raved about and I hated them. I find that his tastes do not coincide with...mine. We went because our daughters had been there and loved it. I've eaten in many Szechuan restaurants which offer more Ameticanized cuisine. This place had a crowd of over 95% Chinese patrons. That says something. The menu is in Chinese with titles of dishes in English with photos. The wait staff speak little or very poor English. The menu is dominated by Szechuan hot pots and dry pots. Our table had fried green beans as an appetizer which were awesome, pork noodle soup, beef noodle soup and a beef brisket hot pot. The portions were huge. The dishes we had were excellent. My only complaint about the food is that the soups did not contain as much meat as I would have expected. The broth and noodles were outstanding. The hot pot was mouth watering. The service was fair. It was a little hard to be understood and the sevice was a little slow. Overall, it was very good and I would go back.More

title: Mapo Dofu
review: Had to go there to try the Mapo Dofu. Anthony Bourdain ate it there on ‚ÄòParts Unknown‚Äô (Rip) and it was a much anticipated trip. Very large portion. Could not eat it all. Very rich, fragrant, spicy, and fresh. Authentic Szechuan. Highly recommended. If I...return, I will try the double-cooked pork.More

title: Decent sichuan food
review: Ok, this is not the best Sichuan food I have ever had.  It was good, but not great...that having been said, good Sichuan food is pretty awesome.  We ordered the crawfish special, lo mein and twice cooked pork.  The lo mein was blah.  The crawfish...was spicy, but did not have enough of the numbing element.  The twice cooked pork was great.  If I lived in Chicago I would come back every now and then.More

title: YUM!  So good, so spicy
review: So let's get this bit out of the way - this place was on an episode of Bourdain (and that's where I first heard of it, and why I went).  The food was excellent - the mapo tofu was some of the best I've ever...had and I would be happy to eat it all the time.  The service was very good as long as you're not expecting the staff to be obsequious - that's an American style restaurant thing from what I've seen all over the world, and they don't do it here.  The menu is huge and has a ton of things to pick from.  We also had an order of spring rolls and steam buns for the less adventurous folks at the table and they were both fine but I wanted everything spicy.More

title: We had high hopes but it was a let down..
review: We tend to go back to our usual spots in China town because we are familiar with the place and the good food. This restaurant was highly recommended but very disappointing. Upon entering the restaurant we stood at the front an waited for a table...or at lease someone to greet us, we were ignored. No sense of urgency to welcome your customers, it took more than a few minutes and this was very early in the evening. When we finally got a table our server was nice but lacked experience, very sad. Some of the food was good while others was not. I would suggest the chilled pork belly with garlic sauce, also the ground pork with glass noodles-very flavorful, and the tempura walnut shrimp-very good. We also tried the pork dumplings with chili sauce-very bland, pass on the chicken corn soup: stick with the egg drop or hot and sour. Towards the end of our meal we had to ask for our check, service was an issue with that it was a let down for our experience.More

title: Amazing Ma Po Tofu
review: Great aesthetic, easy to find in Chinatown, the food was all incredible and well priced. The Ma Po Tofu was some of the best I've ever had. Staff was a little standoffish.

title: Amazing meal
review: I usually write restaurant reviews with a reasonable knowledge of what I've ordered and eaten.  This was an exception.  We went with a wedding party of eight people, and arrived after a bunch of dishes had been ordered, including 5 or 6 fish, beef, chicken...More

title: I expected better.
review: This place was recommended but I wasn't that impressed.  I enjoy spicy food so we went to get some authentic spices.  The food was okay (and came out at weird times, the main dish first, then appetizer, etc.)  The spice was pretty good but the...More

title: Go elsewhere for better authentic Szechuan cuisine
review: Came here and hoping to experience the same kind of authentic Szechuan cuisine I've had in New York, but it was a disappointment in general. First, the fish fillet in a spicy oil was not served with fish fillet, but a whole fish with bones...More

title: Good food
review: I think I had really high expectations because our friend said this was the best place yet. I thought it was just okay. Definitely good value for the food though.

title: Authentic
review: I've been living in China 4 years, when coming to US I've been craving real chinese food all the time, esp sichuan food. This restaurant is really great, serving authentic sichuan dishes and some american chinese Classics too. A must here for me are 'dan...More

title: Tasty tasty tasty
review: My second time here and it will not be my last.   Great selection large portions good service.  I tried spicy dumplings - great, chef lamb with nice fresh celantro.  All the vegtable dishes were great too.   The smell and taste are so fragrant that it...More

title: Finally - genuine Szechuan style food
review: This is one of my favorite Chicago Chinatown restaurants.  This is about as genuine Szechuan cuisine as you get outside of Chengdu .  The Ma Po Tofu has that buzz flavor that I haven't tasted in the US before.  Their Hot and Sour soup is...More

title: Ring of Fire
review: My fianc√© and I have been looking forward to trying this place out as we love spicy food and it did not disappoint. We had the Szechuan dumplings, wild mushroom salad, Mongolian beef, and the spicy pork ribs. GET THE DUMPLINGS. The Mongolian beef is...More

title: Spicy and Good
review: We had a great (and spicy) experience eating her.  We had Dan Dan Noodles, Ma Po Tofu and Eggplant with Garlic Sauce.  The flavors were wonderful and the spice level was perfect for me-I like some spice but not over the top.  I couldn't stop...More

title: Good spicy food
review: If you have an appetite for good spicy food, the is the place. 85% of the menu contains between 1 to 4 chilli symbols to signify the degree of spiciness.  We had the non-spicy pot stickers, yang chou fried rice (contain tiny pieces of spam!)...More

title: Authentic cuisine - almost all the patrons were Chinese
review: I had a tree fungus dish that was awesome. Nothing american about this place - nice atmosphere - great food.  If you are a foodie go here!

title: Clueless in Chicago
review: We arrived precisely at 9:25, after calling...Restaurant advertises it is open until 10:00 p.m.  We are greeted and seated..no problem, except we are told to order now as the kitchen will be closing at 9:35.  We left immediately. I am a chef, and fully understand...More

title: authentic
review: Authentic but most dishes has the peppery OIL taste in its liquid stew, giving the same taste to almost all the dishes. Very limited vegetable dishes available.

title: One of the best sze chuan in town
review: This place is quite authentic, I would say that it's hands down one of the best Sze Chuan restaurants in town. Much much better than Tony's

title: Superb Sichuan Restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown
review: Along with Tony Hu's Lau Sichuan and Yang Ban Cai, this stands as one of Chicago's genuinely superb Sichuan cuisine experiences. The menu is broad and varied, the Sichuan dishes are authentically spicy (but never to the extent of overshadowing the other flavors), the hot...More

title: Very AuthenticÔºÅ
review: Very authentic Chinese food. That's the spicy I'm looking for! Even you are not a spicy lover, you can still enjoy a wonderful meal!

title: Most authentic Sichuan Cuisine in Chicago!
review: We went to this place because one of our friends living around Chinatown had recommended it to be the most authentic Sichuan cuisine. We wanted really spicy food, and ordered about 5-6 dishes for 4 people. It was fantastic. I would recommend the ËüπÈªÑË±ÜËÖê (Egg...More

title: Another superb Sichuan restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown
review: It was Tony Hu, when he opened Lao Sichuan in 1997, who began a revolution in Chicago's Chinatown. By serving genuine, authentic Sichuan cuisine - virtually identical to what you would eat in Chengdu - he changed our expectations for authenticity in Chinatown, and raised...More

title: China Meets Mexico
review: It's Chinese cuisine but with a Mexican flair. Ingredients of Cilantro and jalapeno pepperare common. We tried several dishes and appetizers and all were delicious. String beanwith peas and pork on lettuce is to die for. Lamb with Cilantro, superb. Mango pudding for desert is a must.It'is small and it's BYOB.

title: The best bubble tea
review: I had a taro bubble tea here, and after walking around in the heat all day, it was rapturous. My friends had a matcha drink and a smoothie that were also awesome. I recommend the lemongrass fried chicken wings as well. Delicious!

title: Great Avocado Ice Cream
review: The cashier was confused about making change for $10, but the I still highly recommend trying it. They were out of bubble tea, but the rolled ice cream was really good! I highly recommend the avocado ice cream.

title: Lunch
review: Great combinations plate items with lots of choices, a la carte dishes, and other items are available as well, different type of dinning experience, drinks are unique and lots of choice, taste good as well, food tastes are fusion between Taiwanese and American, not too many places has that type of cooking in Chinatown, price point is right, but not cheap eat compare to other similar place in the area, good service, plenty of seating, upstairs area is available when downstairs is full. Most dining experience were good, not a single poor or bad experience, as been there numerous times

title: Good Food Good Value
review: Saint's Alp has been my favorite through the years (from old location to new). The place is spanking clean and well lighted, modern interiors, and the service is good. The food choices are excellent, the food is fresh and well-cooked. For lunch they have really good value lunch sets. It includes either a hot drink or soup of the day (choice) plus your selection of main course. They have very good Bubble tea options as well. During the summer they open an convenience window where you can order the cold drinks outside and do not have to crowd inside the restaurant. HIGHLY recommended.

title: Climbing an Alp in Chinatown
review: After a morning meeting, I went solo to Chicago's Chinatown at W. Cermark Rd and S. Archer Avenue. After I went around the Chinatown Library, I walked through a large plaza where there were the 12 animal statutes depicting the character and personality of a person born in that animal year.It was very learning experience after reading these plates. There were rows and rows of shops, cafes, and restaurants, full of choices! After numerous of climbing steps,there were many people, tourists, and locals walking around. Stores and shops were full of people.Since I was both tired and hungry, I checked out Saint's Alp's. The caf√© is small, but clean and modern with a 2nd floor. I didnt wait long and then I went in. I was promptly served with menu and ice water. I checked the menu. Its a Taiwan fused with Japanese and Chinese influences on the cuisines. There were numerous set lunch and dinner meals.I ordered a set seafood lunch. A glass of bobo green tea pearl went with my a small bow of tofu, rice and vegetables, and a small bowl of seafood (fish, calamari, shrimp, etc.). I leisurely finished my lunch and was very satisfied with the food and services.The bill came and it was extremely reasonable! If one is ever in Chicago Chinatown, try climbing to Saint's Alp Tea House Caf√©. Cant go wrong!

title: Great Drinks
review: I love the atmosphere of this place. It is comfortable and enjoyable. The food is pretty good, though not the best. The rice bowl options are the best, and are cheaply priced. The smoothies and teas are the best though, and are a must order if you go there.

title: Good Chinese cuisine
review: This is another good restaurant in Chicago's Chinatown. The fish fillet with cilantro soup was something I have not seen elsewhere. Delicate broth with plenty of fish chunks and cilantro leaves. Spicy group pork and eggplant in XO sauce was rich in flavors and quite spicy, as requested. As a contrast we got a delicate stir fry beef with Chinese okra and tree ears. It was excellent. Some things on menu here that I have not seen elsewhere.

title: Weird Name Good Foos
review: This place has nothing to do with religious figures or Swiss mountains. The name is a very bad translation of the original Taiwanese restaurant which pays homage to a local deity. At least that's what one website said when I looked it up. Anyway, this restaurant is an Asian tea shop specializing in boba teas and small plate appetizers. It's a great place for people to hang out. The food is decent. The drinks are amazing and the atmosphere is relaxed. I like their teas and fruit smoothies. My favorite is the passion fruit with nata. We also like their fried season fish and their take on chicken nuggets which has basil fried into the batter. This place has become a current favorite.

title: Good food and excellent tea
review: It is a small place but cozy and the food is alright. It is the tea that had my husband raving about and from a coffee drinker, that is a compliment. They have a variety of flavors to choose from but the mango and peach are very good.Pricewise, it is reasonable especially the combo meals. Check out the beef stew with noodles, and the Taiwanese chicken chop -my kids loved them.

title: OK but so far not great
review: My wife and I had lunch specials--orange chicken and a beef+noodle dish. Both were listed as "hot." Neither was hot at all. The orange chicken, while well done (crisp & hot) was extremely sweet. People seem to go here for various drinks, which I can't...More

title: Our favorite spot in China Town
review: We're always happy to come back and find  this place. They just moved from archer Avenue to a new location 200 feet away in the Chinese Plaza. The new location is smaller and has two floors. The food is similar although they have a shorter...More

title: Milk tea!
review: Legit cold and hot milk tea varieties, but a little on the pricier end. The bubbles in the bubble tea drinks are not the best, but okay. Food is nothing to write home about either, but Saint's Alp's ability to furnish good drinks will always...More

title: Great Cantonese Cafe
review: This is my go-to place for noodle and rice dishes for lunch. Lunch special is cheap and very tasty, run around $7 including drinks. Their KuPau Chicken is awesome, so is the still snack. Also free WiFi and speak English. Definitely should check out for...More

title: Tasty Tea
review: Refreshing tea choices and well priced food choices.  Very friendly service.  Have patronized several times.  Basic fast food decor but don't be fooled by simplicity.  Tasty and an attractive price point.

title: Sane prices and good value.
review: It's been difficult to get decent prices for Chinese food in the Loop. A great backup if you're visiting Chinatown.

title: Just OK
review: This restuarant is just ok. Food is blend, but service is better. Not recommendable. For the price compared to the quality, this is not good.

title: Best Milk Tea!
review: I love this place! I've been coming here since my Taiwanese friend has introduced this place to me since my college years at UIC. I love this place for their warm milk teas. The food is great too! I love the enoki mushroom and fatty...More

title: Someday I will eat here, but until then I will continue to get my milk tea with tapioca here!
review: They don't have a large bubble tea menu here like many other places close by, but I think they have some of the best! I get the black tea milk tea with tapioca and it is just perfect!

title: Very good place in the authentic tradition of a quick eat Chinese place
review: This is an interesting place in Chicago's Chinatown.  Next to the best dim sum in Chicago is this little eatery featuring noodles and authentic Chinese light eats at incredibly low prices.  The "samosa" is actually curried meat in a pastry made of egg roll skin,...More

title: Food is amazing! Service isn't so great.
review: I was born in Chicago but raised in Wisconsin. I don't know the local eateries as well as a local would but while visiting on business, my associates suggested coming here for lunch. I'm a huge fan of Chinatown and its restaurants. This place is...More

title: Food was good and service was quick.
review: We have eaten here twice now while in Chinatown.  Walking in - the place strikes you as more of a fast food type restaurant atmosphere, but the food was home cooked type.  Lunch prices were good for a family on a limited budget.  It is...More

title: Fun experience in Chinatown, average food
review: This is a cute little restaurant with a very authentic Asian atmosphere. As I recall, it's a Hong Kong-based chain, so it's fun to go here in Chicago. The menu is quite extensive with Japanese, Chinese, and Taiwanese options. The prices were very good, and...More

title: Not many people there, the food & drink there are just so so.
review: Not many people there, the food & drink there are just so so.

title: Wet helpful, very affordable
review: Wet helpful, very affordable and delicious!! Would recommend if in the area   . Had a variety of food.

title: Surprise good
review: We came by accident. Nobody expected much because we are very picky especially Chinese food. The food was OK and we all finish very quickly. Nice service.

title: Not pretty but authentic and delicious!
review: We like hole in the wall spots with great, authentic food. The outside and inside of this place isn‚Äôt pretty. The walls are dirty and the tables are a little greasy but the food was amazing, authentic, and not a repeat of the food court...at the mall. The employees were super nice and attentive. The walls are plastered with local awards and news articles about this place! We tried the duck and beef satay with rice noodles. They validate parking with a $10 purchase.More

title: GREAT FOOD!
review: Not a nice place, came in and went to use the restroom ‚Ä¶. sketchy so was a little afraid but the food was awesome! So good !!

title: Real Chinese Food, not american Chinese
review: This is a small real Chinese restaurant.  We were one of the few Caucasians in this establishment and we were treated with great respect and service.  The food was very good and it was not your average Asian food you obtain in most Chinese restaurants....It was real healthy and extremely tasty.More

title: Terrible Service
review: Possibly the worst service I have ever received.   Stood at the counter for 10 minutes while being watched by the the owners. They waited until the counter girl came back from the kitchen.  Surely it would be quicker to take order from patrons instead of...just sitting down and watching the customers from the seats  The food was OK. $3.50 for a chicken chop suey. Big portion, couldn't finish itMore

title: Dump. Outstanding Food.
review: Dim sum made to order‚Äî hot and fresh and really good! We also got egg foo yung‚Äî Huge portion!!! The been with noodles was outstanding. All the vegetables in all the dishes were perfectly cooked. Oh, and extremely reasonable prices.  Highly recommended! Avoid bathroom if...you can. Fast service.  Again: highly recommended!More

title: Not bad, but had really hoped for more
review: My wife and I took her elderly mother to Chinatown recently to see what had changed (good and bad) in the 30+ years since any of us had been there. I'd done some research ahead of time on places to eat but, like the dunderhead...I can be sometimes, I forgot to bring the list along on the trip, so after we arrived and parked (yes, we found a spot - a miracle!) and went up and down Wentworth and Cermak looking to see if anything rang any bells in my head, we walked by Three Happiness, saw the Zagat/other local reviews and decided, "what the heck". The place is pretty time-worn, but it was packed with Sunday revelers and folks on the whole looked happy, so we attacked the menu and, after being told that two of the items we wanted were "out" (it was just before noon that day), we ordered several dishes (two types of appetizers, hot/sour soup, veggie egg foo young, shrimp with broccoli and noodles, etc.) that sounded like they'd make us happy. Soon after ordering, the nice man came back and said that one of the appetizers we'd ordered was also "out", so we chose another (stuffed green peppers) and drank some tea while watching the Bears on a nearby TV. The appetizers came out and were met with mixed reviews (not sure exactly what the peppers were stuffed with - it looked like minced shrimp - but the texture was a bit slimy). Soon after, the shrimp dish arrived and it was pretty good, loaded with decent-sized shrimps and Chinese broccoli. Then the EFY arrived - three large patties - along with what was perhaps the gloppiest gravy we'd ever seen. By itself, it was just OK, but adding a bit of hot sauce improved that dish 100%. It was only then, after the mains showed up, that I got my hot/sour soup - a generous bowl, pretty nicely made. So, I'm not sure exactly what to make of this place. Some things were fair, some weird, some better-than-good, and the prices were reasonable, but with so many other highly-rated places nearby, I'm pretty sure I wouldn't go back. Also, the men's bathroom was very small and pretty grungy. We did walk around the neighborhood (the nearby riverfront park and pagoda were just beautiful) and found a Tous Les Jours bakery nearby, so after some great pastries and tea there, we ended the afternoon in a pretty good mood.More

title: Never Again
review: My family and I have been coming to Three Happiness for over 25 years. The food has always been hot and fresh. The service quick and friendly. But for some reason, this visit was different. We arrived at 11:15 a.m. We ordered about 8 dim...sum dishes. No rice was brought to the table like in years past. The first dish was served at 11:45 a.m. Let me just cite that everyone around us, who came in after, was served before us. Sitting for 45 minutes watching other parties being served ther hot bowls of rice was more than frustrating because, of all things, rice is cooked in great quantities. When we asked the hostess if she could check on our order, she didn't even flinch. She looked at us as if we were the inconvenience, but she's had that smug look on her face for many years. When we inquired about our order a second time, it was apparently my fault for the delay in our order because I ordered egg drop soup, which was not dim sum. This explanation was not acceptable, as I have ordered soup with dim sum every time with no delay of other dishes for the past 16 years. When we asked a third time, our shrimp toast, my absolute favorite, was burned to a crisp. They sent a message that for some reason, we would not receive service. We asked if we did something wrong. Then we asked if they would rather us leave and they didn't hesitate to say yes. There were 5 of us, 2 women and 3 children.
