review: Agree with other reviewers who state that service can be rough. We had a couple of delicious dishes here for lunch. Flavorful Mongolian beef and spicy squid. We saw another patron having hot pot, which was on special (all-you-can-eat for $18 with unlimited dim sum). We were quite envious at all the good food but really weren't that hungry. However, 1 of the four dishes we ordered to go was wrong, and another one was missing. I'm not sure whether it's always this disorganized. It seemed that there were many waiters there. I probably would give them another chance.

title: THEY DO NOT HONOR RESERVATIONS!!!!
review: I made a reservation for 12. When we arrived, the hostess looked at me blankly and said, "it's Chinese New Year." She never said, "there's no we we're going to be able to seat you." So my 11 family members and I, including my 8-months pregnant cousin and her 3-year-old, clustered on the stairway waiting for our table to open up. When it finally did, it turned out that another party, who had said they had made a reservation, was waiting patiently. The hostess then consulted a man (the manager?) who, despite having told the other party minutes ago that he was giving the table to us because we had arrived first, looked at his little pad and said to me, you're not on the list. Despite the fact that I had a reservation confirmation on my phone, it was clear that they weren't going to honor our reservation so we left.

title: 57 minute carryout...
review: I realize that some restaurants prefer the patrons to dine in rather than carry out.  But, all Chinese restaurants in Chicago's Chinatown is quite efficient and diligent in catering to the patrons who needs to have their menu selection 'to go'.  Not so at Lao...More

title: Authentic and Delicious
review: You want to come to this restaurant in Chinatown's lively pedestrian mall for the food and not for the cleanliness or the interior design. The last are tolerable at best, but the food is delicious! The Northern style pancakes are supposedly one of the signature...More

title: Couldn't rate the food because we never got it.
review: When we walked in I felt a little out of place. As everyone there turned to stare at us. Upon ordering we waited 20 minutes. While waiting everyone that came after us was served first. Finally the waitress came up to tell us they had...More

title: Great food at a great price
review: We were on a driving trip to Chicago and stopped here in Chicago's Chinatown on our way in and also on our way out of the city.  It is a quick taxi ride or drive from downtown Chicago and there is also an El stop....More

title: Great food
review: Very tasty,  real Chinese/healthy food. We enjoyed the food here. Veg soup. Chicken and beef dishes. Friendly service. Worth a visit

title: Excellent food
review: Great service,  food was delicious.  Staff very efficient and friendly.  Loved the food. Very healthy,  really tasty.  Well worth the price, which I think was very reasonable.

title: Excellent real Chinese
review: Traveling around the country I am always on the lookout for Chinese restaurants that offer the real deal - not that touristy, Western influenced sweet & sour, moo shu, egg foo young, chop suey, Chung King imposter Chinese.  If in Chicago take the Red Line...to the Cermak-Chinatown station and exit to the West.  Cross South Wentworth and at South Archer enter the Chinatown Square Plaza.  There you will find Lee Wing Wah across the aisle from American Metro Bank.  Lots of comfortable seating and a big menu.  Good, efficient service (the staff speaks English, Cantonese and Mandarin).  I had the fish fillets with ong choy (a Chinese vegetable somewhat similar to spinch) - generous portion.  For an appetizer try the chicken wings or the fried shrimp.  Their West Lake beef soup or seafood and tofu soup are excellent choices.  Large selection of poultry (chicken, duck or quail), beef, pork and seafood dishes.  My favs are the steamed chicken with mushrooms, steamed salted fish with pork patty, honey walnut shrimp, stir fried clams in black bean sauce, beef with foo gwah (bitter melon - only true Chinese eat this!), salted frog legs, Hong Kong style quail, oyster with ginger and shallots, and the beef stew or casserole.   You can also get a wide assortment of chow mein, chow fun and fried rice.  For those in the know, try the Chinese porridge (many varieties) or congee.  Be sure to ask for the  Chinese "donut" or "yaw jow gwuy" to go with the porridge. Hot tea is the customary beverage with Chinese cuisine but if you want something cool, they offer a wide assortment of fresh fruit smoothies.  They also offer set menus for larger groups or if you rather they select your meal.  But going a la carte is best.  Open everyday for lunch and dinner with a take out service.   If you need a late night meal, they are open to 10 pm.More

title: Good Chinese food
review: Went here during a recent trip to Chicago and the food was very good on a cold day. Ordered the kung pao chicken which was very tasty. Everyone was happy with what they ordered.

title: Went on Labor Day Sunday, very busy, big mistake
review: Order 2 dishes to go-beef chow fun and peking style pork chop , both were disappointing !! Both dishes were tasteless lacking basic seasoning. I guess I should not go there when they are busy! This time the food really really su..! Waste of money...and time! Will not be back for a long long long time.   This place was good before before it was sold to the current owner. Bring the previous owner back he knew how to run Lee Wing Wah.More

title: good causal authentic Chinese food
review: We decide to stop by here, since the other places were packed. The decor has been upgraded. The food is still good as we remembered it. All of the dishes we had were good, the only issue was the fried salt & pepper smelts were...not fried at high enough of a temperature.More

title: Get the Salt and Pepper Seafood
review: I love seafood and it is hard to find inexpensive seafood in Chicago. This restaurant located in Chinatown has excellent seafood and is reasonably priced. We are particularly fond of the salt and pepper seafood (smelts, shrimp and squid).  Super fresh and tasty - big...enough for 2 people to share. Their garlic pea shoots and soft shell crab are also delicious.  The wine selections are limited.  So we grab a bottle and bring it with. Corkage fee is $10.  There is a decent liquor store located one block away.   I have just about quit eating shrimp because I find it tasteless. The shrimp here is outstanding- you can eat it shell and all.    They validate parking for the lot on Wentworth or you can take the CTA red line and get off at Cermak.More

title: weekend working lunch
review: Poor experience ever, there for lunch but brought work with me to do, slow in taking orders, not so friendly waitress and noisy, kept walking by to see progress, or maybe want to clear table as early as possible, place was not crowded and no...one was waiting anyway, come by often but never ask if something else I need or how I am doing? When finished, quick call for the bill, almost immediately deliver on that! wish the lunch was deliver as quick as that too. Want to pay with credit, waiter looked at credit card funny, appeared unusual, took over a min to tell me there is a min charge to use credit card. Spoke in broken English, he probably was not sure which language I speak and want to make sure I understood, I cannot use credit card to pay. Paid cash finally, don't want to deal with them, gave extra for tips and left. Don't think they had said thank you; but don't care at that point.More

title: Good authentic Chinese food
review: We come here January and decided to come again late Feb because of the great authentic chinese food and prompt service.  They have set menu for different amount of people which is a great bargain we order that for 6 and it come with a...dish of ginger onion lobster.  The restaurant was packed when we first arrived, but most left after we order so we have a pleasant dinning time.  We have come to this restaurant over 10 years and the food is always good and large portion.  Rice, soup, and tea is complemented.  Highly recommended this restaurant to any chinese food lover.More

title: I give it a 0 if I could
review: Wow. This was the worst restaurant experience I think we‚Äôve ever had. Granted we went the day of Chinese parade, it took over an hour to get our food, even though others around us, who came in AFTER us, got theirs. When we were still...missing a few dishes, the waitress told us she canceled them because it took so long!! She didn‚Äôt even offer replacements or substitute. Are you kidding? So we were starving and inky got half our food. NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN. There are so many other wonderful restaurants in Chinatown. SKIP THIS ONEMore

title: Good for an after bar meal late night on the weekends
review: Service isn't great but the good is good and it's open late. The price is very reasonable and the smoothies are fantastic.

title: Good Chinese Dinner
review: Lee Wing Wah has good authentic Chinese food. We have come here for many years. Food is tasty and reasonable priced.  Our favorite is the Walnut Shrimp. We also like their steamed Pike fish and Beijing Pork Chop. It does get crowded on the weekends.

title: Returning From Vacation To Tired To Cook
review: Nice place - there are a lot of choices on the menu and the restaurant was not too crowded. We had the Chicken and Corn Soup, Sweet and Sour Fish, and Shrimp Fried Rice. The service was very friendly and the portions were generous and...More

title: Good Food, Dirty Dishes
review: Went to Lee Wing Wah for the first time today and was pleasantly surprised. The Hot & Sour Soup was exellent with a great spice kick. The Chicken with Vegatables had a smooth dark gravy that was very tasty.  The only issue I had was,...More

title: Awesome
review: Stopped for lunch one Saturday then came back again on Sunday the crab rangoons are awesome so is the sweet n sour chicken... Enjoyed it, the place could use a facelift tho...

title: Food was decent
review: The food was alright, its the service that was really iffy. The cokes they gave us were hot, so we had to get cups with ice. The cokes were in the back and one of the cans had a bit of dirt on it. May...More

title: Best Authentic Chinese Food in China Town
review: We have been going to this restaurant since 2000. Most of the time we are the only non- Chinese patrons in the restaurant which means that the locals know this place serves authenic home type cooking. This restaurant ranks well above other neighboring Chinatown restaurants....More

title: Decent Food,  Decor really needs makeover
review: Patronized this place about 7pm, after the Chgo Auto Show.... Not too packed, but understandable considering it was freezing out.....Food, price and service a  4 on scale of 5.......Main problem I have is the decor and especially washroom,  which really need a good scrub down.

title: Great for groups!  Wonderful fish!
review: I brought my youth group to Chinatown and just planned to find a place when there.  There were 25 of us.  I stopped in to inquire, and they already knew we were looking for a place for our group and said they'd be happy to...More

title: Time for my first ever 1* review :-(
review: My first ever 1* review :-( Please stay away from this place, there is absolutely no reason to eat at this horrible 'restaurant'. So many other amazing choices in Chinatown! Had 2 appetizers (both dry and had no taste), 3 entrees - all were horrible,...More

title: The place to eat Chinese
review: A friend and I ate at Lee Ling Wah twice whilst in Chicago. On both occasions the food quality and quantity were outstanding.  We had the Salt and Spicy Squid as well as a dish called General ........... ( can't remember the remaining  part of...More

title: Great portions of food
review: The food is good and I always take some home because they serve so much! It's all good! Fast service too.

title: Made First Visit to Chinatown Delightful
review: My wife and I took the Yellow river taxi from downtown Chicago to Chinatown - a day after their annual Chinatown celebration. We arrived at the Chinese marketplace without any advice on what's good or not so good. There are so many restaurants to choose...More

title: Dinner for two is good and enough portion for 3 people
review: Try the dinner-for-two.  This include half a chicken, a fish+veg dish and a plate of deep fried shrimp.  This is reasonably priced and delicious. Very good indeed.  I understand that some reviews complain about the service, well, do you want good food+price or good service?

title: Good food and value. Service needs improvement.
review: The food is good and dishes are huge but there is really no service to speak of. I have been to Lee Wing Wah many time. Salt and pepper shrimp is really good! Peking style pork chop is a hit or miss, sometimes there was...More

title: Adequate Portion
review: I am single traveler and looking to find real Chinese restaurant. It was my first rice dishes in a week during my stay in Chicago. The portion is great, and the taste is normal like other Chinese restaurant that I usually ordered back to home...More

title: Very Good Cantonese Style
review: Having lived in Shanghai for a year and a half, I got used to authentic Chinese. It is very difficult for me to get re-adjusted to the Chinese food prepared for American tastes that is so prevalent in most of the U.S. I gave this...More

title: Bad costumer Service
review: This is the worst Chinese restaurant that we've ever been !So Crap!.Bad costumer service.She gave us an attitude,when were leaving,she yelled at us because she wanted more tips.We never go back to this restaurant. this Place is dirty,old and the awful meal. My Advice to...More

title: Better Luck Somewhere Else!
review: The service was terrible. I have never had a server tell me not to order something from the menu without offering a suggestion. Not to mention, what was actually ordered was not what was served for three different plates. Her descriptions of the plates were...More

title: Good Solid Cantonese
review: After a night out, we stopped in at Lee Wing Wah for a late dinner.   We got exactly what we were looking for, solid good Cantonese food.   It's not flashy and does need some remodeling, but you typically don't go for the decor when going...More

title: Don't miss the Spicy.salty shrimp
review: Salty spicy shrimpand oysters with bean/cilantro sauce were just terrific !!!!  Very family oriented, but good for anyone.

title: The best restaurant in china town.  This is where you go in china town when you know your stuff instead of going to the...
review: The best restaurant in china town.  This is where you go in china town when you know your stuff instead of going to the more famous trendy places.  If you like duck the taro duck is a must!

title: great family restaurant
review: great family restaurant
